{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"New! Bookmark links to your Wakelet collections directly from Microsoft Teams","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/new-bookmark-links-to-your-wakelet-collections-directly-from/ba-p/1358080","description":"<P>Since the launch of the Wakelet app for Microsoft Teams last summer, we’ve heard many great stories of how people have been using the app to help craft experiences. Wakelet allows people to easily save, organize and share content from across the web—and educators, especially in these challenging times, have used the integration as powerful tool for their remote learning toolkit.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Building off this momentum, we are excited to announce a new capability in the Wakelet app in Teams, where you can now bookmark links from your Teams channel by saving them directly into your Wakelet Collections!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Whether you are an educator gathering resources for your students or a marketing team sharing research content, it’s now easier to save and share content from your conversations in Teams. With just a few clicks, bookmark sources from within your channel so they are accessible in your Wakelet profile.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Stay engaged in discussions, while simultaneously ensuring no important links get lost.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture1.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/188728iF375D9FB8EAA9403/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Picture1.png\" alt=\"Picture1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Need help with bookmarking links? Follow these simple steps:</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>1. See a link you want to bookmark?</STRONG></P>\n<P>When you want to bookmark a link in your Teams channel, click on the three dots ‘...’ on the top right of the message bar and a dropdown will appear. Click on More actions, which will start a new drop down – and then click <EM><STRONG>Save to Wakelet</STRONG></EM>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>2. Login to Wakelet</STRONG></P>\n<P>A pop-up inviting you to login to your Wakelet profile or sign-up to Wakelet will appear. Once you’ve logged-in, you’ll see a list of links previously sent to your Teams Channel. You can select one, multiple or all the links and save them directly into your Wakelet profile.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>3. Save links to your collections</STRONG></P>\n<P>You’ll then be able to access your Wakelet Collections and Group Collections. Select the collection you wish to save the link or links into. You can also create a brand-new collection and save the links into it. Give the link a title and add it straight into your collection.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We are excited to see all the different ways people can use Wakelet and Teams to collaborate and build collections together!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Ready to get started?</STRONG></P>\n<P>If you haven’t already, install <A href=\"https://appsource.microsoft.com/en-us/product/office/WA200000165?tab=Overview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Wakelet for Microsoft Teams</A> today!</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 05 May 2020 15:00:00 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/188728iF375D9FB8EAA9403/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"51f0aaf9ee0c6b06dc0baad30538c23f","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn44@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-56-42-821_6443a571c17938f6.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":562,"sourceBytes":273339,"destBytes":28864,"author":"Jun_Pak","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/188728iF375D9FB8EAA9403/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn44@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-56-42-821_6443a571c17938f6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401921},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Top 10 keyboard shortcuts to make you a Microsoft Teams super user","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/top-10-keyboard-shortcuts-to-make-you-a-microsoft-teams-super/ba-p/1384428","description":"<P>With more <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2020/04/30/2-years-digital-transformation-2-months/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">people on Teams than ever</A>, you may be wondering how to become an even <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/how-to-become-a-microsoft-teams-super-user-insider-tips-from-the/ba-p/284811\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">bigger super user</A>. We asked the Teams team to share their favorite keyboard shortcuts that help them stay efficient. Check out the top 10 shortcuts for meetings, chatting, and navigation below!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">When you are in a meeting</FONT></STRONG></P>\n<P>We want to make sure your focus is on the meeting content rather than figuring out how to share your screen. Below are some shortcuts to make it easy for you to switch your camera on or off and quickly mute yourself if there is any background noise. This will help your meetings run more smoothly.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>1. <STRONG>Ctrl + shift + M</STRONG> – Mute/unmute yourself</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture1.png\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191136iF60E3BD6561B3317/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"Picture1.png\" alt=\"Picture1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>2. <STRONG>Ctrl + shift + O</STRONG> – Turn on/off your camera</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture2.png\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191137iDC92F58DEF6F5121/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"Picture2.png\" alt=\"Picture2.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"2\"><EM>*The Images were taken with the new modern meeting experience which will be rolling out soon. These commands will still work in your current interface.</EM></FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">When you are chatting and collaborating</FONT></STRONG></P>\n<P>We want to make it easy for you work with your colleagues. These shortcuts will help you move between your chats, teams, and calls, and search of information quickly.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>6. <STRONG>Ctrl + 1+ 2 + 3</STRONG> – Navigate up and down the left navigation rail. (i.e. Ctrl + 1 = Activity feed; Ctrl +2 = Chat; Ctrl + 3 = Teams etc.)</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture7.png\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191149i29C738E5B08337B8/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"Picture7.png\" alt=\"Picture7.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>7. <STRONG>Ctrl + E</STRONG> – Quick access to the search bar at the top of Teams.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture8.png\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191150i66E5B961A5D96728/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"Picture8.png\" alt=\"Picture8.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>8.<STRONG> Ctrl + /&nbsp;</STRONG>–&nbsp; See all of the commands that you can use to easily navigate to different locations, access content, or set your status.&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Screenshot (25).png\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191408i24EB07218308A8E9/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"Screenshot (25).png\" alt=\"Screenshot (25).png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">When you want to express emotion</FONT></STRONG></P>\n<P>We want to make it easy for you to share your emotions through Teams. If you can’t find the right emoji in our emoji library below the message box, here is a shortcut to find many more!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>9. <STRONG>:word</STRONG> – Type a colon “:” immediately followed by a word to discover additional emojis (e.g. :person or :apple)</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture10.png\" style=\"width: 364px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191153i983F2BAD74BD8DBB/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"Picture10.png\" alt=\"Picture10.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Interested in other shortcuts?</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>10. 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Skype for Business Online to Be Retired in 2021","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/skype-for-business-online-to-be-retired-in-2021/ba-p/777833","description":"<P>Today we’re announcing that Skype for Business Online will be retired on July 31, 2021. This post provides details on the retirement plan, a brief explanation of why we’re making this announcement now, and a summary of what we’re doing to help customers migrate to Teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>What is the Skype for Business Retirement plan?</STRONG></P>\n<P>Skype for Business Online will be retired on July 31, 2021, and after that date the service will no longer be accessible. Between now and then, current Skype for Business Online customers will experience no change in service, and they’ll be able to continue to add new users as needed. However, starting September 1, 2019, we will onboard all new Office 365 customers directly to Teams for chat, meetings, and calling. Please note that the Skype Consumer service and Skype for Business Server will both be unaffected by this announcement.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Why are we making this announcement now?</STRONG></P>\n<P>In 2017 we launched Microsoft Teams as “the hub for teamwork” in Microsoft 365. Teams combines chat, video, calling, and document collaboration into a single, integrated app – and enables an entirely new way of working. Over the last two years, we’ve worked closely with customers to refine Teams, and we now feel we’re at the point that we can confidently recommend it as an upgrade to all Skype for Business Online customers. Customers who have already made the move tell us that Teams not only has helped them improve collaboration generally, it has also provided a rare opportunity to rethink the way work gets done in their organizations. Using Teams, companies across the world are becoming more agile, shortening cycle times, improving the efficiency of key workflows, and cutting out unnecessary overhead. Teams isn’t just an upgrade for Skype for Business Online, it’s a powerful tool that opens the door to an entirely new way of doing business. But don’t take our word for it! Learn more about the potential benefits of Teams for your organization with the recently published Forrester white paper “<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2019/04/Total-Economic-Impact-Microsoft-Teams.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Total Economic Impact of Microsoft Teams</A>.”</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>What is Microsoft doing to help customers migrate to Teams?</STRONG><BR />For all of the benefits of moving to Teams, we recognize that the migration will require time and effort – and we’re here to help.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>First, we’re making product investments to address feature requests from current Skype for Business Online customers, including:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Dynamic 911</STRONG>. A feature of Microsoft Teams Phone System, Dynamic E911 automatically uses the caller’s current location to route to a Public Safety Answering Point (PSAP) call center operated by the local government.&nbsp; Dynamic E911 will be delivered in Teams for the United States by the end of this calendar year.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Shorter Retention Periods</STRONG>. New retention period options will allow customers to limit channel and chat retention periods to as short as 1 day and ensure that when data is deleted it is removed from all permanent storage locations in the Teams service.&nbsp; Shorter Retention Periods will be available in Teams by the end of this calendar year.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Teams and Skype Consumer Interop</STRONG>. Interop between Teams and Skype Consumer will allow users on the two services to communicate using both chat and calling.&nbsp; Teams and Skype Consumer Interop will be available in Teams in the first quarter of calendar year 2020.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Contact Center Integration and Compliance Recording</STRONG>. At Inspire earlier this month we announced Teams partnerships with Five9, Genesys, and NICE to enable Contact Center solutions – and with ASC, NICE, and Verint to provide Compliance Recording.&nbsp;&nbsp; We’re also working with other Skype for Business Online certified partners to bring other Contact Center and Compliance Recording solutions to market for Teams.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>And when you’re ready to get started, we offer <A href=\"https://aka.ms/SkypeToTeams\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">a comprehensive set of technical guidance and planning resources</A>, including a proven success framework, best practices, planning documents, <A href=\"https://aka.ms/TeamsLiveTraining\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">free instructor-led training</A>, and <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/FastTrack\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">FastTrack</A> onboarding assistance for eligible subscriptions.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Since its introduction in 2014, Skype for Business has been a valuable tool for millions of people around the world.&nbsp; By combining instant messaging, calling, and video into a single app, the product established an exciting, new vision for business communications.&nbsp; Microsoft Teams is the next chapter in that vision, and with today’s news we’re not only announcing the retirement of the Skype for Business Online service, we’re also communicating our confidence in Teams.&nbsp; After more than two years in market, Teams is ready for our most demanding customers – and we’re convinced that you're going to love it! &nbsp;If you’re a current Skype for Business Online customer, start planning your migration today.&nbsp; We’re committed to helping you every step of the way, and we can’t wait for you to experience the new way to work.&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 30 Jul 2019 15:00:00 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"f5ba75b3a231d537810313847c1a466a","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"James Skay","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401929},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"List Search: Search and share items from a SharePoint List within a chat","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/list-search-search-and-share-items-from-a-sharepoint-list-within/ba-p/796228","description":"<P style=\"text-align: center; tab-stops: 175.5pt;\" align=\"center\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>A little background..</STRONG></P>\n<P>It’s no secret that humans love lists. Lists are simple. Lists are everywhere. A bucket list, a grocery list or a to-do list in personal lives; and lists to track customer issues, software bugs or job candidates in our work lives. They scratch the itch our brains have for categorization and processing information. As a <A href=\"https://www.newyorker.com/tech/annals-of-technology/a-list-of-reasons-why-our-brains-love-lists\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">New Yorker journalist puts it</A> – processing information in list form feels - “a bit like sipping green juice instead of munching on a bundle of kale”.</P>\n<P>But lists themselves can become overwhelming especially when the number of items in the list and people collaborating on the list becomes larger – two things which are unavoidable in the modern workplace.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>The challenge</STRONG></P>\n<P>That is what was happening internally amongst the Teams engineering team, and we decided - as per usual - to scratch our own itch first <img class=\"lia-deferred-image lia-image-emoji\" src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/html/images/emoticons/smile_40x40.gif\" alt=\":smile:\" title=\":smile:\" /> and that is how this List Search app template was born.</P>\n<P>As of mid-2019, <A href=\"https://www.zdnet.com/article/microsoft-says-teams-now-has-13-million-daily-active-users/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">more than 13 million users across 500,000 organizations used Teams</A>. This exponential growth made the lives of Teams team (we know.. we know) hard to stay on top of customer asks. The team had created SharePoint list to manage high level customer asks and issues.</P>\n<P>The data in this list was uber-important to almost everyone – from PMs who would write feature specifications based on asks, to developers who would take the context and turn them into actual features, to finally ‘Customer PMs’ who would work with customers to ensure their rollout is successful and meets the needs of each customer. However, collaborating on individual list items was cumbersome.</P>\n<P>Feedback came from everywhere and folks needed access to data quickly. Often, we’d see posts from people wanting to speak about a particular customer issue and having a discussion around it but getting stuck at knowing which folks to @mention in their post and we’d end up with so many posts like below, with much time spent finding the right information let alone acting on it.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-left\" image-alt=\"Capture.PNG\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/126278iB037F03FAD86CC2F/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"Capture.PNG\" alt=\"Capture.PNG\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>The solution</STRONG></P>\n<P>That’s when listening to our own internal customers we decided to work on the List Search app template. What if all these people could self-help and get unblocked? What if, while writing a post about the customer issue, they could search and share the relevant information from within the context of the chat box itself? And that’s what we did.</P>\n<P>So now, folks can get to the crux of the matter faster and have more productive conversations. After running a pilot internally we’re happy to bring this app template to you so you can also enable such experiences within your organization.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"ContosoListSearch.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/126281i05CEE0F25BBE3D67/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"ContosoListSearch.gif\" alt=\"ContosoListSearch.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Finally, the beauty of this <A href=\"http://www.aka.ms/TeamsAppTemplates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">app template</A> is that it is not restricted to bringing customer list data contextually into a chat context – it works with literally any business context put on a SharePoint list.</P>\n<P>For example, each organization has its fair share of obscure acronyms that often trip even the veterans let alone new employees. While acronyms can’t be done away with, they <I>can</I> be made more accessible to everyone by re-skinning this ‘List Search’ app template to a ‘Glossary Search App’.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"dilbert.png\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/126282i28821DFB1B389096/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"dilbert.png\" alt=\"dilbert.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;Source: <A href=\"https://dilbert.com/strip/1994-05-18\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">dilbert.com</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN>A&nbsp;few&nbsp;other&nbsp;examples include software bug tracking&nbsp;and&nbsp;SKU lookup where having a conversation around individual items within the list often becomes&nbsp;contextual.</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN><STRONG>How to enable List Search in your organization ..</STRONG></SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN>So, go on - give this app template a try and let us know what list scenario you made more contextual for your users. It should take you less than 20 minutes to set up and it requires no coding! </SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN>Follow this </SPAN><A href=\"https://github.com/OfficeDev/microsoft-teams-list-search-app\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">LINK</A><SPAN> to get started today.</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN>You can also check out other cool app templates at this <A href=\"https://www.aka.ms/teamsapptemplates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">LINK</A>.</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN>We are always all ears on new app template ideas or feedback on current ones. Please share your feedback and thoughts </SPAN><A href=\"https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=v4j5cvGGr0GRqy180BHbR2_7qFm_lcZAr4eqEhnLsZ9UMVZGT1lCT0FXUDdZMUM0RkpBS1BESTAwWC4u\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here.</A></P>\n<P><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>Other cool Teams App Templates to try<SPAN>:</SPAN></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-Teams-Blog/Icebreaker-Bot-Assisted-happenstance-to-strengthen-your-company/ba-p/722552\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Icebreaker App Template - The bot that Microsoft Teams uses to break silos and create a culture or trust and collaboration.</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.geekwire.com/2019/microsoft-teams-new-icebreaker-bot-pairs-co-workers-random-get-know/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Geekwire's coverage of Icebreaker App Template</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-Teams-Blog/A-Simple-Trick-to-Drive-Employee-Connections-in-Your-Next/ba-p/782735\" target=\"_self\">Unique use of Microsoft Ready brings our sales, marketing, services, and technical fields together to connect, collaborate, and celebrate as One Microsoft community. This is Microsoft’s way of making sure the diverse employee base across continents can leverage each other’s perspectives and upskill in the process. Handling such a huge contingent comes with its own set of challenges.</P>\n<P><BR />For each attendee, the schedule is packed with learning sessions and labs. As a result, meeting people outside of their immediate work groups becomes a challenge. This year, the Customer Success Ready organizing team decided to do something new. <BR />Kim Cowman, Senior Community and Events Manager, in charge of planning Ready for Customer Success was looking for ways to help attendees make the most of their trip – when she thought of an interesting idea. <BR />She had collaborated with her peers earlier to run an experiment for an internal community using a Teams bot and wondered if the same bot could also be used drive viral engagement for the conference attendees in her community. The idea was simple - create a Teams Team and install the bot to the team. Every Monday at 10AM this bot will randomly pair each team member for a meetup. What’s even better – it will suggest times that are free for both parties (all thanks to Office 365 AI chops).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"IcebreakerScheduling1.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/125171i9A4804E7A7636CED/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IcebreakerScheduling1.gif\" alt=\"IcebreakerScheduling1.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Kim worked with her conference organizing committee peers to deploy a version of that bot for the Customer Success Ready conference attendees. They figured it’d be great to have the attendees be paired up every day, given they were there for only a week and wanted to meet as many people as possible. What was so cool about this bot was that creating a custom version of it was a few minutes worth of work and didn’t require a developer!<BR />Monday morning Kim and team were nervously watching the team to see if people would engage and like the experiment. To their joy, the floodgates opened. The team was buzzing with activity. Throughout the week there were posts like below drumming up excitement.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Heba icebreaker.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/125172iD5DF6BEC00734DFF/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Heba icebreaker.png\" alt=\"Heba icebreaker.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>Heba Yacout, Customer Success Manager traveled all the way from United Arab Emirates to meet her colleagues from the world over. Here’s what Heba had to say about Icebreaker bot:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"padding-left: 30px;\"><EM>“I learned about this experiment when I was added to the team. It took me a few seconds to learn how it all worked and once I did, it was a phenomenal way to meet more colleagues. I met with folks from so many countries and learned so much. Icebreaker super-charged my experience at Ready!” </EM></P>\n<P style=\"padding-left: 30px;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Byron Rader, GM for Customer Success Modern Workplace heard about the experiment and was pleasantly surprised to see the engagement it was driving for the attendees. He recommended Kim to make it constant for all future offsites.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-left\" image-alt=\"Byron headshot.jpg\" style=\"width: 133px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/125173iEAFE0B4188060C1A/image-size/small?v=1.0&amp;px=200\" title=\"Byron headshot.jpg\" alt=\"Byron headshot.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P><EM><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\" color=\"#0b0117\">“This is how modern conferences work. Tools such as Icebreaker empower employees to connect and learn from each other in modern ways. It helps people expand their sphere of influence beyond their immediate circle. I’m so happy we did this and happier that we are making it easily accessible to all of our customers!”</FONT>&nbsp;</EM></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>If you’d like to use Icebreaker for your internal employee communities, conferences or new employees all you need is Teams!</P>\n<P>Give this bot a try today at: <A href=\"http://www.aka.ms/TeamsAppTemplates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">www.aka.ms/TeamsAppTemplates</A> and look for <A href=\"https://github.com/OfficeDev/microsoft-teams-icebreaker-app/wiki/Deployment-guide\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Icebreaker</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Do share your feedback <A href=\"https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=v4j5cvGGr0GRqy180BHbR2_7qFm_lcZAr4eqEhnLsZ9UMVZGT1lCT0FXUDdZMUM0RkpBS1BESTAwWC4u\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A> and ideas on other useful tools you’d like to see.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><EM><STRONG>Also read:</STRONG> </EM></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://www.geekwire.com/2019/microsoft-teams-new-icebreaker-bot-pairs-co-workers-random-get-know/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Geekwire's coverage on Icebreaker Bot</A></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-Teams-Blog/Icebreaker-Bot-Assisted-happenstance-to-strengthen-your-company/ba-p/722552\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">How the idea of Icebreaker bot came about</A></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/samples/app-templates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Other cool Teams apps like Icebreaker that you can try for free</A></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 01 Aug 2019 22:56:56 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/125171i9A4804E7A7636CED/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"879e3b3d85d06e5392e4930fc2badc99","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn40@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-56-49-459_a52cebdc17a200f5.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":709,"sourceBytes":480196,"destBytes":229314,"author":"NidhiShandilya","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/125171i9A4804E7A7636CED/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn40@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-56-49-459_a52cebdc17a200f5.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/125172iD5DF6BEC00734DFF/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn16@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-57-48-512_49b138d11e9467e0.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/125173iEAFE0B4188060C1A/image-size/small?v=1.0&px=200":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn4@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-57-03-569_9fe8fb198eca97c5.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401929},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"What’s New in Microsoft Teams | January 2020","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/what-s-new-in-microsoft-teams-january-2020/ba-p/1141831","description":"<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Happy new year! Our resolution at Microsoft Teams is to keep delivering a delightful experience to our customers <img class=\"lia-deferred-image lia-image-emoji\" src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/html/images/emoticons/happyface_40x40.gif\" alt=\":happyface:\" title=\":happyface:\" />. We started the year at <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/industry/events/microsoft-at-nrf-2020?activetab=pillars:primaryr5\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">National Retail Federation (NRF)</A>, where Teams continued to shine as a platform with tailored capabilities to connect everyone in your company, from the C-suite to the firstline. Check out 10 ways shift workers can use Teams <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/10-ways-shift-workers-can-use-teams/ba-p/1102194\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>. <BR /></FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Here are the new features, experiences and resources that came to Microsoft Teams in January 2020. <BR /></FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: Chat &amp; Collaboration</FONT></STRONG> <BR /><STRONG>Improve communication transparency with <U>read receipts</U></STRONG><BR />Do you often wonder if your teammates saw the message you sent them? Read receipts in private chats allow senders to know when their message was read by the recipient. Read receipts are powerful, because they also allow the recipient to communicate implicitly that they are not ignoring the sender, they may just be busy and haven’t gotten a chance to read their message. Read receipts can be a great tool but may not be for everyone – learn more about turning them on and off <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/use-read-receipts-for-messages-in-teams-533f2334-32ef-424b-8d56-ed30e019f856\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>. <BR /></FONT></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"read receipts.png\" style=\"width: 583px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/168231iF3F2E9CCE2FEFD45/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"read receipts.png\" alt=\"read receipts.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>The “Colleague joined Teams” notification lets you know who is new to Teams</STRONG> <BR />Welcome to the team! You can now connect with new team members faster and welcome them to the team. You will receive a notification in your activity feed when a new colleague joins Teams for the first time. Send them a GIF to say hello! <BR /></FONT></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Hello Bear.gif\" style=\"width: 410px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/168228i3A5167C4B68867D9/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Hello Bear.gif\" alt=\"Hello Bear.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: Meetings &amp; Calling</FONT></STRONG> <BR /><STRONG>Voice Administration— New workload in the Teams Admin Center</STRONG><BR />As a part of our ongoing process to provide IT admins more visibility into additional workloads, Voice Administration has been added as a workload in the Teams Admin Center. This means that Microsoft Calling Plan customers will be able to search, acquire, and assign phone numbers to users. Admins will also be able to set the emergency addresses for those end-users. Additionally, customers will be able to create / test / manage custom dial plans, configure Dynamic Emergency Calling, and use improved configuration for Auto Attendants and Call Queues.</FONT></P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><BR /><STRONG>ThinkSmart View joins Microsoft Teams phones</STRONG><BR />Welcome to the family! Lenovo announced new additions to its ThinkSmart portfolio, designed to transform business communications. ThinkSmart View allows users to manage their audio and video calls through a dedicated desktop device. Users can simply join meetings with one-touch and use the device in portrait or landscape layout to suit their preference. For security, the device has a camera shutter and a microphone mute switch. These will become available for customers in March 2020. Learn more <A href=\"https://news.lenovo.com/pressroom/press-releases/interconnected-lenovo-thinksmart-devices-driving-new-smart-office-ces/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.&nbsp;</FONT></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"thinksmart3.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/168233i8446CE7DFADB32BE/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"thinksmart3.png\" alt=\"thinksmart3.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Poly announces the CCX range of Teams phones</STRONG><BR />Meet the Poly CCX Series, a range of native Teams phones to helps users to transform the way they communicate. The series offers a range models to choose from, starting with the CCX400 and up to the CCX600. Allowing you to personalize yours with a headset that suits your style, or the traditional handset.&nbsp; The choice is yours. Learn more about Teams devices <A href=\"https://products.office.com/en-us/microsoft-teams/across-devices\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>. </FONT></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"poly1.png\" style=\"width: 561px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/168229iF512335BCDFF55DA/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"poly1.png\" alt=\"poly1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: Admin</FONT></STRONG> <BR /><STRONG>Microsoft Teams will be installed with Office 365 ProPlus for customers on the semi-annual channel</STRONG> <BR />We are continuing to make it easier for our customers to access Teams on their desktop. The desktop Teams client will be downloaded by default for <STRONG>existing</STRONG> users with Office 365 ProPlus, Microsoft 365 Business, and Microsoft 365 Business Premium apps for customers on the <STRONG>semi-annual channel</STRONG>. With this change your users will no longer need to do a separate installation of Microsoft Teams. Learn more about Teams deployment processes for new and existing installations of Office 365 ProPlus <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/teams-install\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: Developers</FONT></STRONG><BR /></FONT></P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Cloud Communications APIs are now available</STRONG> <BR />The last piece of the puzzle is here! The last API to enable partners to develop contact solutions is now available. This month the MS Graph Cloud Communications APIs became available, enabling calling + online meetings capabilities. The full package now includes: </FONT></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">MS Graph <A href=\"https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/blogs/microsoft-graph-cloud-communications-apis-are-now-generally-available/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Cloud Communications APIs</A></FONT></LI>\n<LI><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">MS Graph <A href=\"https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/blogs/microsoft-graph-presence-apis-are-now-available-in-public-preview/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Presence</A></FONT></LI>\n<LI><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Phone System <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/direct-routing-plan\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Direct Routing</A></FONT></LI>\n</UL>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: Teams for Education</FONT></STRONG> <BR /><STRONG>Learn more about student performance with <U>Class Insights</U></STRONG><BR />We’re so excited to introduce Class Insights, a new experience for educators that will help them gain insight into student performance. Educators can add the new Class Insights tab to their class team and see average grades, on-time assignments, average return time, and conversation activity for their class over time. Class Insights gives teachers a single view to observe individual student and class performance.&nbsp; </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><BR />With this student data right at your fingertips, your school will be able to make even more informed decisions about curriculum, pacing, and student engagement. For more information on Class Insights, click <A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/163add4f-997d-4a01-91de-2846fe4e99bc\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>! <BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Average-Grade-ClassInsights_v2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/168221i8060680634A27E39/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Average-Grade-ClassInsights_v2.png\" alt=\"Average-Grade-ClassInsights_v2.png\" /></span></DIV>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Conversations-ClassInsights_v2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/168232iC453AC4834DCD801/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Conversations-ClassInsights_v2.png\" alt=\"Conversations-ClassInsights_v2.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><BR /><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: GCC</FONT> </STRONG><BR /><STRONG>Website Tab in GCC High and DOD</STRONG><BR />Users in the GCC High and DOD tenants can now add a website tab in Teams. Leveraging this tab, users will have the ability to pin URLs as well as SharePoint links etc. for easy access to their content. By default, this feature is released as “turned off”. Please work with your IT admin to begin using the feature.</FONT></P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><BR /><STRONG>3rd Party Apps In GCC</STRONG><BR />GCC customers can now use 3rd party apps in Microsoft Teams - check out the <A href=\"https://appsource.microsoft.com/en-us/marketplace/apps?src=wnblogmar2018&amp;product=teams\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">library</A> to see if apps you already use and love are available to integrate. Note that by default, access to 3rd party apps is turned off. In addition, apps need to be vetted for regulatory, security and policy compliance by your organization before they can be enabled for users to access. Please work with your IT admin to make your preferred apps available for use. 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"What’s New in Microsoft Teams | September 2019","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/what-s-new-in-microsoft-teams-september-2019/ba-p/881539","description":"<P>Many of us are heading back to school or returning to work after a relaxing Summer break; but while you may have been on vacation, momentum in Teams has not slowed down! We are excited to share a ton of new features that have come to Microsoft Teams in the past month of September, from improvements to the calling experience to new, intuitive ways to filter your chats.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>What’s New: Chat &amp; Collaboration</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>Filter through your chats</STRONG></P>\n<P>Having many simultaneous conversations is the norm in today’s work and social culture but can make finding the right thread at the right time difficult. The new filters added in <STRONG>Chat</STRONG> and <STRONG>Teams </STRONG>help you filter more than just your activity. In chat, type a person’s name to filter for every group, meeting, or one-on-one chat you have with them. Then select <STRONG>More</STRONG> options to add more filters – like unread messages. Or type a keyword to filter by group chats that have names. Similarly, filter your teams list by typing a keyword to find a specific team or channel by name.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"filter.png\" style=\"width: 503px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/134040i0F307284D72BD4FA/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"filter.png\" alt=\"filter.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Turn down the noise in channels</STRONG></P>\n<P>Shh! I need to concentrate. Now, just like in chat, you can mute a conversation in a channel. Alternatively, when you want to follow a conversation in a channel you’ve hidden from your list, all you need to do is turn on notifications. You’ll get notified of any activity on that specific conversation, but not the entire channel activity.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>To access the notification settings for a conversation, go to the original post and select <STRONG>More options &gt; Turn off notifications/Turn on notifications</STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"notifications.png\" style=\"width: 370px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/134041iF4F3AA66FE2A5CC7/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"notifications.png\" alt=\"notifications.png\" /></span></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>What’s New: Calling </STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>Never miss a phone call with <U>Secondary Ringer</U> </STRONG></P>\n<P>Many Teams users wear headsets during their working day to keep their hands free and take phone calls. With secondary ringer functionality, those wearing plugged in headsets will still be able to hear an incoming call ring their computer. This is a crucial feature that helps Teams users to not miss any incoming calls.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Enhancements to <U>Cloud Voicemail</U> &nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P>Several updates have come this month to improving your Cloud Voicemail experience. First, users will now be able to directly transfer a call to Cloud Voicemail. And several enhancements enable end users to directly configure features themselves in the Teams settings options, including: configuring call answer rules, choosing the greeting language, customizing the TTS for the standard greeting and the ‘out of office’ greeting, and choosing when you want your ‘out of office’ greeting to be played. Learn more <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/set-up-phone-system-voicemail\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A> about setting up Cloud Voicemail and configuring your settings.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Know who is calling, even when they are not a Teams user using <U>reverse number look up</U></STRONG></P>\n<P>“Hello?” Vs. “Hello!” We are all used to “caller ID”, where we are shown the identity of our caller before we answer the phone. But if you receive a call in Teams from a PSTN Caller, how do you know who is trying to reach you? Now, when a user receives a call, Teams will display the PSTN Caller’s name based on Azure Active Directory data and/or the Telco provided display name. Available now on the desktop, and coming soon to Teams mobile.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Chrome now has calling! </STRONG></P>\n<P>If you’re using Teams on the web, you can now add Google Chrome to your list of browsers that support making calls from your web browser. If you’re on Chrome, try it out today. Go to <STRONG>Calls </STRONG>on the left side of Teams, or type <STRONG>/call </STRONG>in the command bar at the very top of Teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Phone System updates for Microsoft 365 GCC (Government Community Cloud)</STRONG></P>\n<P>Several updates have made their way to Microsoft 365 GCC this month! New capabilities include: Call Handling Enhancements, Teams Calling improvements for VOIP users, Group Call Pickup (GCP), phone number blocking, Multiparty Calling without Conference License, Call Park (CP), and Shared Line Appearance (SLA). Together, these features represent a significant milestone in how calls are handled by Microsoft Teams for GCC users. Learn more <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/here-s-what-you-get-with-phone-system\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>What’s New: Meetings </STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>Meet Now. No invite required. </STRONG></P>\n<P>Not all meetings can be scheduled in advance; some happen spontaneously. The “Meet Now” feature on desktop allows you to skip the invitation and instead go straight into a new meeting. All you need to do is go to Calendar on the left side of Teams, then select Meet now in the top right corner and add the people to the meeting. No calendar, no scheduling, no fuss. Learn more <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Video-Create-instant-meetings-with-Meet-now-26e06837-853d-4df1-a729-06bf700d4ecf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"meet now.png\" style=\"width: 450px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/134042i90396BC13EBEF3EB/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"meet now.png\" alt=\"meet now.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Customize your meeting layout by <U>pinning a meeting participant</U> </STRONG></P>\n<P>The default layout for Teams meetings highlight meeting participants in a traditional 2x2 layout, with the most active speakers taking priority.&nbsp; Now with “pin” you can choose which meeting attendees are shown in your own personal view.&nbsp; Right-click on a meeting participant and select “pin” (or unpin) to create your own custom layout of meeting participants.&nbsp; Note that this view is your own and does not impact other meeting participants.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"pin meeting participant.png\" style=\"width: 549px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/134043iB6F48D95248A181A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"pin meeting participant.png\" alt=\"pin meeting participant.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Never miss a meeting with <U>“missed meeting-add” notifications</U></STRONG></P>\n<P>We all miss phone calls occasionally and when we do, we receive a notification that lets us know who was trying to call. But what if someone tries to add us to a meeting, and we miss the notification? Now you will see a notification in your Teams activity feed to notify that someone tried to add you to a meeting, and if the meeting is still going on you can join directly from there.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"missed meeting-add.jpg\" style=\"width: 608px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/134044i1F990CC86E320FDC/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"missed meeting-add.jpg\" alt=\"missed meeting-add.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><U>Light-weight meeting join</U> experience for Internet Explorer, Safari, and Firefox </STRONG></P>\n<P>While the best Teams Meetings experiences happen in the Teams application and supported Edge and Chrome browsers, there are times when meeting participant’s machines may not meet these requirements.&nbsp; With new light-weight meeting join capabilities, users can jump right into a Teams Meeting in Internet Explorer 11, Safari, and Firefox browsers and participate in the meeting.&nbsp; Meeting audio is delivered via <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/audio-conferencing-in-office-365\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Audio Conferencing</A>, so meeting organizers will need the respective license.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 03 Oct 2019 15:35:58 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"An inclusive meeting experience for everyone in any room with Microsoft Teams Rooms","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/an-inclusive-meeting-experience-for-everyone-in-any-room-with/ba-p/805877","description":"<P>In today’s modern workplace, teams come together from around the world to get things done. Microsoft Teams Rooms helps those teams keep everyone engaged and creates an inclusive experience for people in the room and remote viewers. <STRONG>Today’s update</STRONG> of the Microsoft Teams Rooms app brings a new content camera feature that enables users to intelligently include a traditional whiteboard into their Teams meeting. Powered by Artificial Intelligence in the Microsoft cloud, a dedicated content camera intelligently detects, crops and frames the in-room whiteboard and shares its content with remote meeting participants. Even when a presenter moves in front of the whiteboard remote participants will be able to see the content right through them.<BR /><BR /><FONT size=\"5\">Work like you are in one place, with Microsoft Teams Rooms</FONT></P>\n<P><LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1XvgH2rNpmk\" align=\"center\" size=\"large\" width=\"600\" height=\"338\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/1XvgH2rNpmk/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO><BR /><FONT size=\"5\"><BR /></FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Content camera with intelligent capture</STRONG></FONT><BR />The room user experience is simple: during a meeting, a presenter uses the console to select the Content Camera and from there the app can intelligently detect, crop. and frame the whiteboard. Content drawn on the board is shared with remote meeting participants.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"1.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/127156i1713831E32763966/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"1.png\" alt=\"Start content camera in the room\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Start content camera in the room</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Remote attendees get a clear view of the whiteboard even when a presenter moves around in front of it, which makes the presentation easier to follow and keeps everyone engaged.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"WB1.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/127154i5FBF87BA8AB2C695/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"WB1.png\" alt=\"Remote attendee view\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Remote attendee view</span></span><BR /><BR /><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Easy to Deploy</FONT></STRONG><BR />IT Admins can add a certified content camera (using a USB 2.0 cable or extender) to a free USB port in the Microsoft Teams Rooms system. After the content camera is connected to the Microsoft Teams Rooms, the admin can select the respective camera for content input in the app’s Device Settings menu.&nbsp; You can find more details on the setup here: <A href=\"https://aka.ms/contentcameraguide\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">https://aka.ms/contentcameraguide</A>.<BR /><BR />A select set of <STRONG>Logitech</STRONG> and <STRONG>Crestron</STRONG> cameras are certified and available on the Teams devices showcase*. You can add a content camera to your existing Microsoft Teams Room<A title=\"Content Cameras\" href=\"https://products.office.com/en-ww/microsoft-teams/across-devices/devices/category?devicetype=3&amp;filterIds=78&amp;page=1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">(list here)**</A>.<BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"cameras.JPG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/127155iD47C674A16756B2A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"cameras.JPG\" alt=\"Supported content cameras\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Supported content cameras</span></span><BR /><EM>*Additional cameras will get added to this list over time.</EM><BR /><EM>** The update for Surface based Microsoft Teams Room devices will start to rollout in the next few weeks.</EM><BR /><BR />Microsoft partners offer mounting systems that allow camera placement in your meeting spaces that gives the best results for whiteboard capture. The Logitech and Crestron camera and mount bundles are the first available, others will follow soon&nbsp;<A title=\"Camera Bundles\" href=\"https://products.office.com/en-ww/microsoft-teams/across-devices/devices/category?devicetype=73&amp;filterIds=83&amp;page=1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">(Link to bundles)</A><BR /><BR /><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Introducing solutions for special spaces with certified DSPs and ceiling tiles</FONT></STRONG><BR />We are also pleased to announce that our certification now includes DSPs (digital signal processor) and Ceiling tiles, a more flexible option for customer rooms. Solutions from industry leaders such as <STRONG>Sennheiser</STRONG>, <STRONG>Crestron</STRONG> and <STRONG>Biamp</STRONG> will soon be available through your AV Integrator channels and on the Microsoft Teams Devices Showcase in the US and Canada.</P>\n<P>With a combination of a Microsoft Teams Room, a DSP, one or more ceiling tiles or mics, and a range of powerful cameras, you will also be able to cover diverse space types such as large meeting rooms, multi-purpose rooms (MPRs) and auditoriums, all with a consistent user experience across the full spectrum of spaces.<BR /><BR provide great meeting and call experiences for your conference rooms.<BR /><BR />Logitech Tap is now available globally as pre-configured small, medium, and large meeting room solutions with everything you need for video meetings with Microsoft Teams Rooms</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Crestron</STRONG> released a set of products including their newly certified Crestron UCC160-T Integrator Kit camera.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Yealink</STRONG> expanded their portfolio with their new MVC-500 and MVC-800 Microsoft Teams Rooms bundles that now support the Yealink wireless USB dongle-based projection fully integrated with their Microsoft Teams Rooms systems.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Sennheiser</STRONG> successfully completed the SP30 speakerphone Microsoft Teams certification for Microsoft Teams Rooms.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Jabra</STRONG> today is releasing the Jabra PanaCast, a plug-and-play camera Certified for Microsoft Teams, designed to improve meetings in huddle rooms using three 13-megapixel cameras and patented real-time video stitching to give a full panoramic 180° view so users can enjoy a natural, inclusive human perspective, with no blind spots.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>These Schacht","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/127156i1713831E32763966/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn32@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-56-42-605_17532bed392e6426.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/127154i5FBF87BA8AB2C695/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn56@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-57-27-855_166c71ca591114df.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/127155iD47C674A16756B2A/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn42@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-58-10-493_3e9e6ce972829bf9.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/127157i2FA15B1BE7E19108/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn71@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-57-03-857_d95c62302f0d027b.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/127158iC98A68845BA3B852/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn36@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-57-15-215_da881569563edcbb.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/127159i5A7389615E8A6B6D/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn92@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-57-33-726_26c15bc2a3a88977.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401929},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Meetings First brings Microsoft Teams meetings to Skype for Business Server customers","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/meetings-first-brings-microsoft-teams-meetings-to-skype-for/ba-p/828340","description":"<P>Today we are pleased to announce the general availability of Meetings First for Microsoft Teams.&nbsp;&nbsp; Designed for Skype for Business Server customers who want the innovative meetings experience available today in Teams, Meetings First is a configuration mode that allows organizations to continue to use Skype for Business Server for their chat and enterprise voice needs, but move their meetings workload to the cloud.&nbsp; This blog post provides details on this new configuration, implementation considerations, capabilities it provides, and the value received from hosting your meetings in Teams.</P>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_1.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/129024i2B46054C897A6EFA/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_1.png\" alt=\"Skype for Business and Microsoft Teams clients\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Skype for Business and Microsoft Teams clients</span></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>What is Meetings First?</STRONG></P>\n<P>Meetings First is a not a product or feature of Teams, but rather a configuration that leverages capabilities and features of Skype for Business and Teams to provide a tailored coexistence experience.&nbsp; In Meetings First, users schedule and meet in Teams while continuing to use Skype for Business for chat, calling, and presence.&nbsp; There is no overlap of modalities between Teams and Skype for Business.&nbsp; Chat, calling, and presence are on in Skype for Business and off in Teams.&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>Who should consider Meetings First?</STRONG></P>\n<P>Meetings First was designed for organizations who require the enterprise voice workloads of Skype for Business Server but want a superior meetings experience with Microsoft Teams.&nbsp; Any version of Skype for Business Server is supported, though more recent clients will have a better coexistence experience.&nbsp; In addition, organizations need to be licensed for Teams, including Audio Conferencing if PSTN dial-in/dial-out functionality is required.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Capabilities in Meetings First</STRONG></P>\n<P>The Meetings First configuration brings together the following capabilities in Microsoft Teams and Skype for Business Server:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Meetings Migration Service: Meetings organized by the user will be migrated to the cloud and converted to Teams meetings as the user is promoted to Meetings First (requires Exchange Online).</LI>\n<LI>Streamlined user experience in Teams, centered on Teams meetings and teams and channels (which can, optionally, be hidden using the App Permissions policy); Teams private chat, calling, and self-presence are not exposed in Meetings First, enabling the deployment and adoption effort to fully focus on meetings.</LI>\n<LI>“Better Together” with Teams and Skype for Business:\n<UL>\n<LI>Automatic hold: When in a meeting in Teams, getting in a call in Skype for Business will place the Teams meeting on hold, and vice-versa. This prevents users from having their private calls overheard by the meetings participants.</LI>\n<LI>Presence reconciliation: Activity in Teams is reflected in the user’s presence, which is the Skype for Business presence since chat and calling are in Skype for Business. Specifically, when Meetings First users are in a Teams meeting, their presence will be updated to reflect that. When they present their screen, their presence will be updated to show Do Not Disturb (based on their settings in Skype for Business).</LI>\n<LI>USB device HID control reconciliation: The HID controls are honored by Teams while in Teams meetings and by Skype for Business in all other circumstances.</LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>Why host your meetings with Microsoft Teams?</STRONG></P>\n<P>Meetings are more crucial now than ever before and are very different than in days past.&nbsp; With people spending nearly 80% of their time in collaborative work, meetings play an essential role in the way we connect.&nbsp; Teams meetings bring people together to meet and collaborate in new ways.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Leveraging the power of the Microsoft Cloud for security, AI and cognitive services, Teams transforms the entire meeting experience, bringing value before, during, and after a meeting.&nbsp; And Teams meetings are infused with AI, making them more innovative and inclusive.&nbsp; Whether offering insights, capturing action items, or transcribing meeting notes, AI in Teams aims to make your meetings more productive.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Get started today</STRONG></P>\n<P>We are pleased to offer our Skype for Business Server customers the opportunity to move their meetings workload to Teams.&nbsp;&nbsp;For additional information on how to get started today, check out our <A href=\"https://aka.ms/MeetingsFirst\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Meetings First</A> support article.&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 30 Aug 2019 16:01:39 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/129024i2B46054C897A6EFA/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"cf1d519c8b04f949241937361c00c841","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn51@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-56-43-622_e962522f02d40eca.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":666,"sourceBytes":288856,"destBytes":34794,"author":"James
