2020","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/new-capabilities-for-teams-management-july-2020/ba-p/1530282","description":"<P>New management features and capability improvements for Microsoft Teams rolled out in July.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Device management enhancements in the Teams Admin Center to manage your Teams devices in one location</STRONG></P>\n<P>This month we introduced <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/one-place-to-manage-all-your-teams-devices/ba-p/1527766\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">new capabilities for device management in the Teams Admin center</A>, enabling customers to manage their <STRONG>Teams devices from one location</STRONG>, now including <STRONG>Microsoft Teams Rooms</STRONG>. Advancements include simplified devices setup, new granular device management capabilities, improvements across bulk management tasks with better tagging, troubleshooting and health monitoring of devices, as well as the ability to delegate these responsibilities to external partners. Find out more details in the <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/one-place-to-manage-all-your-teams-devices/ba-p/1527766\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Device management new capabilities</A> blog.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>App configuration in Team Admin center</STRONG></P>\n<P>App configuration is now available in Teams Admin Center for Teams and Microsoft apps. This new manageability experience enables you to configure App specific settings that will streamline your management tasks and enable simple customization of apps to the organization needs.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>For example, the Praise app (an app that allows users to call out the great work of a teammate or co-worker) in Microsoft Teams, now allows for customization of badges that reflect your company's values and culture, all while leveraging tools you are already familiar with.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"praise.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209098i5E751343FC372DB7/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"praise.gif\" alt=\"praise.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Advisor for Teams is now in GA (General Availability)</STRONG></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/use-advisor-teams-roll-out#:~:text=Use%20Advisor%20for%20Teams%20to%20help%20you%20roll,Tenant%20assessment.%20...%204%20Frequently%20asked%20questions.%20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Advisor for Teams</A> is a new onboarding tool to help you plan the best possible Teams deployment in your organization. Advisor offers a customized recommend plan for you to streamline the roll out of all the Teams workloads, including messaging, meetings, calling as well as Skype for Business upgrade workloads.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We have learned that organizations who use this tool increase their deployment velocity by 300%.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"advisor for Teams.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209100i4DFA335B291A364A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"advisor for Teams.gif\" alt=\"advisor for Teams.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Enhancements for Teams life cycle:</FONT></STRONG></P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><STRONG>Support for sensitivity labels&nbsp;</STRONG>- To ensure secure collaboration in a scalable way with <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-security-and/general-availability-microsoft-information-protection/ba-p/1497769\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Information Protection Sensitivity Labels</A> now can be applied to teams created within the Teams Admin Center, allowing for the consistent application of policies across your M365 environment.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">In addition, you can now associate a sensitivity label with policies related to privacy, external user membership, as well as unmanaged device access.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">The first step to securing sensitive content in teams, sites and groups is to create sensitivity labels with policies. For example, you can create a sensitivity label called “Confidential” and specify that any team, site, or group created with this label will be private. This means that a team or site owner cannot add users external to the organization and unmanaged devices will be allowed web access only.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"LabelsInAction Teams.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209101i7A188AA3C8D28E38/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"LabelsInAction Teams.gif\" alt=\"LabelsInAction Teams.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><STRONG>Filtering in Teams summary table</STRONG> -&nbsp;To simplify your work, we are enhancing the tooling across all list tables within Team Admin Center. This means when filtering large data sets as the Teams, you will now find the information you need much more quickly. The Teams summary table is the place where you can view &amp; manage all the Teams configured in the tenant. Currently available for filtering name &amp; classification and will be extended to include more filtering fields in the future.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">App Lifecycle Announcements</FONT></STRONG><BR />We are constantly looking for ways to streamline the process of developing, validating, publishing, and managing custom apps in Teams, including the increased automation for the app lifecycle process.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We are excited to announce the following new capabilities to ensure that users can more easily leverage the key business apps they use every day inside of Microsoft Teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><STRONG>Custom apps Submission to Approval </STRONG>- Building an app is just the beginning of the journey for app developers. Now developers and admins will enjoy a streamlined custom app submission process and enhanced app management capabilities – providing a connected experience through the development, publishing, and end user discovery process. You will now be able to submit Teams apps through any of these clients and trusted sources (e.g.: Visual Studio Code, Power Virtual Agents, Power Apps and more) via our App Submission Microsoft Graph API – streamlining the process of submitting apps directly to the Teams Admin Center for IT admins to review and approve.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><STRONG>Custom app publishing</STRONG> - You will be able to leverage a streamlined process to manage - review, approve and publish custom apps directly from the Teams Admin Center. These apps will be automatically available on the Teams Admin Center with no need to manually upload them. An admin can view the custom apps publishing status, manifest details, and update their status from ‘submitting’ to ‘publishing’ so that end users will be able to access those apps.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/Teams/custom%20app%20publishing.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><STRONG>Install app to a team from Teams Admin Center</STRONG> - To create a customized, more productive environment for the users, you can now install an app for any team in your organization.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"install app.png\" style=\"width: 800px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209103i5F497CF981AD21B4/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"install app.png\" alt=\"install app.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><STRONG>Application monetization and bringing the purchase to Team Admin Center </STRONG>- A new third-party subscription purchase experience will enable you to view and purchase subscriptions associated with the 3rd party Teams apps. You can view app licensing status and link to purchase the app all within the Teams Admin Center.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><BR />This new subscription purchase experience will enable you to view and purchase subscriptions associated with the third-party Teams apps. Now you purchase licenses right within the Teams Admin Center. Where you can see offers, plans and pricing information, it is also integrated with Microsoft AppSource to purchase licenses and with Microsoft 365 admin center to manage and renew licenses over time.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"application monetization.png\" style=\"width: 933px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209104i8E648F6ACF9DC1CF/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"application monetization.png\" alt=\"application monetization.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Policy Management Announcements</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>Enhancement on assign policies to your users in Microsoft Teams - package batch assignments are now GA</STRONG></P>\n<P>To help IT administrators assign policies, based on the organizational needs, we introduce the Bulk assignment of policies.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><BR /><STRONG>PowerShell module</STRONG> now supports:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Policy assignment to O365 groups</LI>\n<LI>Batch assignment of policies (up to 5K users)</LI>\n<LI>Batch assignment of policy packages (up to 5K users)</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>A New Audio and Video Policy - Changes in Incoming IP video policy</STRONG></P>\n<P>To help you better manage bandwidth, we are updating meeting policies to allow you more control over using IP video in your Teams meetings. While the current capability can only prevent outgoing video, we are extending the policy to also allow you to prevent both outgoing and incoming video as needed. You can update the new policies in the meeting policies:</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"meeting policies.jpg\" style=\"width: 800px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209109i1DF9A7AD1CBB42F1/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"meeting policies.jpg\" alt=\"meeting policies.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>As we strive to build the best end user and administrator experiences, we continue to ask for your continued input on what is important to you and your users.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Have an idea for a feature or functionality missing from Teams? Please be sure to add or upvote it on the <A href=\"https://microsoftteams.uservoice.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Teams UserVoice page</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We look forward to hearing from you!</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 31 Jul 2020 22:45:52 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209098i5E751343FC372DB7/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"a9c795c030da86f4d1db11f497bffce9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn24@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-56-43-114_5ec72935bb9756eb.webp","destWidth":998,"destHeight":624,"sourceBytes":89442,"destBytes":53144,"author":"MicrosoftTeamsTeam","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209098i5E751343FC372DB7/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn24@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-56-43-114_5ec72935bb9756eb.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209100i4DFA335B291A364A/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn48@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-58-26-066_b144258b83670dd7.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209101i7A188AA3C8D28E38/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn86@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-59-21-668_55080d499ebc6010.webp","https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/Teams/custom%20app%20publishing.gif":null,"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209103i5F497CF981AD21B4/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn16@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-04-885_10365eb79a597809.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209104i8E648F6ACF9DC1CF/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn56@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-57-52-155_bac2f665d69c51a2.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209109i1DF9A7AD1CBB42F1/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn95@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-57-06-396_3e7b028055b997e4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401918},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Microsoft announces RealWear integration for Teams","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/microsoft-announces-realwear-integration-for-teams/ba-p/1233202","description":"<P class=\"lia-align-left\">Following our recent article on \"<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/what-s-new-in-microsoft-teams-3rd-anniversary-edition/ba-p/1234871\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">whats new In Teams</A>\", we are excited to announce Microsoft’s partnership with RealWear, maker of ruggedized head-mounted wearable <EM>devices</EM> that support digital transformation in industrial environments such as manufacturing, utilities, wind power and oil &amp; gas.&nbsp;This partnership brings together RealWear devices&nbsp;and Microsoft Teams for the Firstline Workers to deliver a purpose-built experience for field service in safety-critical environments.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"HMT-1 and HMT -1Z1.png\" style=\"width: 575px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177483i56C37256FC7CBF8F/image-dimensions/575x340?v=1.0\" width=\"575\" height=\"340\" title=\"HMT-1 and HMT -1Z1.png\" alt=\"HMT-1 and HMT -1Z1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-left\"><EM><FONT size=\"1 2 3 4 5 6 7\">Image of both RealWear devices HMT-1 and HMT-1Z1</FONT></EM></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-left\">Many field service tasks by firstline workers need them to be 100% hands-free and yet collaborate remotely with an expert for a more efficient repair or fix. RealWear’s voice-operated Android platform integrated with Teams allows field workers to video call with remote experts and show what they see and hear in real-time. This accelerates the time to resolve issues and reduces the risk of expensive downtime, which is especially helpful given current travel restrictions.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"MS_TEAMS-RealWear-WORKFLOW.jpg\" style=\"width: 660px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177493i741FB493866049E7/image-dimensions/660x187?v=1.0\" width=\"660\" height=\"187\" title=\"MS_TEAMS-RealWear-WORKFLOW.jpg\" alt=\"MS_TEAMS-RealWear-WORKFLOW.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-left\"><FONT size=\"1 2 3 4 5 6 7\"><EM>Image shows the work flow between Firstline worker and Remote Expert</EM></FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-left\">Microsoft Teams on RealWear is built on the same secure &amp; compliant services that power Teams across Desktop, Mobile or Room Systems – meaning Field Workers &amp; Remote Experts no longer need separate applications or logins for remote assistance. For organizations that use Teams for communication and RealWear hands-free devices for Field Service, this means a reduced management overhead for IT Admins while delivering a simpler experience for remote experts &amp; field workers.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"experience.png\" style=\"width: 585px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177488i87087AB42FEFFD66/image-dimensions/585x236?v=1.0\" width=\"585\" height=\"236\" title=\"experience.png\" alt=\"experience.png\" /></span></P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-left\"><EM><FONT size=\"1 2 3 4 5 6 7\">Image show the view experience&nbsp;on the RealWear device</FONT></EM></P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-left\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-left\">RealWear offers an eyepiece that is an adjustable micro-display that appears like a 7\" tablet, for very clear viewing.&nbsp; This allows the field worker to share what they are seeing with remote experts at various locations. RealWear also offers workers voice commands in 12 languages, allowing users to simply navigate Teams using only their voice.&nbsp; Even in high noise environments. For insights into how this experience looks like, take a look at the following <A href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3BE0Kjw7v50&amp;feature=emb_title\" target=\"_self\">demo video</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"helmet.png\" style=\"width: 631px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177489i44ABD6BF3BE5DD07/image-dimensions/631x324?v=1.0\" width=\"631\" height=\"324\" title=\"helmet.png\" alt=\"helmet.png\" /></span></P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-left\"><FONT size=\"1 2 3 4 5 6 7\"><EM>Image of the HMT-1 and three key features</EM></FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>HMT-1</STRONG> and <STRONG>HMT-1Z1</STRONG>&nbsp;features:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>100% Hands Free</LI>\n<LI>Unmatched noise cancelling</LI>\n<LI>PPE compatible – clips onto Hard hats, ball caps, bump caps, and a variety of accessories</LI>\n<LI>Battery that lasts an entire shift</LI>\n<LI>Outdoor display</LI>\n<LI>Water resistant</LI>\n<LI>Dust tight</LI>\n<LI>Shock Resistant</LI>\n<LI>Built rugged</LI>\n<LI>Intrinsically safe – <STRONG>ATEX Zone 1</STRONG> and <STRONG>CSA C1/D1</STRONG>&nbsp;\n<UL>\n<LI>Available in the <STRONG>HMT-1Z1</STRONG> only</LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n</UL>\n<P class=\"lia-align-justify\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-justify\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-justify\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"HMT-1 HMT1Z1.png\" style=\"width: 613px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177576i9E1595351064E6BD/image-dimensions/613x105?v=1.0\" width=\"613\" height=\"105\" title=\"HMT-1 HMT1Z1.png\" alt=\"HMT-1 HMT1Z1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-left\"><FONT size=\"1 2 3 4 5 6 7\"><EM>Image of both RealWear models - HMT-1 and HMT-1Z1</EM></FONT></P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-left\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-left\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-left\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-align-left\">Microsoft Teams on RealWear will be available later this year. For more information and where to buy visit&nbsp;<A href=\"https://realwear.com/solutions/microsoft-teams/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more about Teams on RealWear</A>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 19 Mar 2020 17:35:55 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177483i56C37256FC7CBF8F/image-dimensions/575x340?v=1.0","linkMd5":"eda7fadd80b13aba77370267bdca12ea","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn56@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-56-44-078_655cf7c4972d9887.webp","destWidth":575,"destHeight":340,"sourceBytes":148196,"destBytes":28742,"author":"Duncan Barnes","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177483i56C37256FC7CBF8F/image-dimensions/575x340?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn56@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-56-44-078_655cf7c4972d9887.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177493i741FB493866049E7/image-dimensions/660x187?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn28@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-49-676_8fe708e662760445.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177488i87087AB42FEFFD66/image-dimensions/585x236?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn64@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-38-493_e493d2c7eaa959b7.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177489i44ABD6BF3BE5DD07/image-dimensions/631x324?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn76@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-04-252_af0527df2273b403.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177576i9E1595351064E6BD/image-dimensions/613x105?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn84@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-57-11-607_7027106beba334d5.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401923},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Why wait? The top 10 things you need to know about upgrading from Skype to Teams","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/why-wait-the-top-10-things-you-need-to-know-about-upgrading-from/ba-p/1180961","description":"<H1>Skype for Business versus Microsoft Teams</H1>\n<P>While it might be tempting to wait for a deadline, there’s less and less reason to postpone the upgrade to Teams. Microsoft Teams gives brings capabilities that your users already enjoy with Skype, like messaging, calling, managing contacts, or hosting online meetings, but it goes beyond to deliver all of this in a single hub for teamwork that can connect to your favorite apps and enhance productivity. Of course, some of the biggest differences between Skype and Teams are under the covers. Teams is built on a modern platform for audio and video and uses the latest cloud infrastructure on Azure for optimized global coverage, which brings several performance and networking benefits. For example, meetings get started faster and user ratings show that call quality in Teams.<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN> <SPAN>For an IT Admin this means you can expect fewer helpdesk calls related to meeting experiences and calling.&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN></P>\n<P>Also, because Teams is cloud-native, it benefits from ongoing innovation such as whiteboard sharing, background blur and in-line translation, which allow for a more inclusive collaboration experience. Best of all for you in IT, we give you a comprehensive admin experience for day to management, security and compliance. We covered more on this in previous Essentials episodes at <A href=\"https://aka.ms/microsoftteamsforit\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">aka.ms/MicrosoftTeamsForIT</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><LI-VIDEO width=\"600\" height=\"338\" size=\"large\" vid=\"https://youtu.be/1HKWEq_uyYU\" align=\"center\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/1HKWEq_uyYU/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO></P>\n<H1>Choosing your path to Microsoft Teams</H1>\n<P>Another good reason to start your upgrade to Teams now is that whether you are coming from Skype for Business Online or Skype for Business Server on-premises, with or without Enterprise voice, we have a number of robust options to help in your journey to Teams. If you follow our guidance as you make the transition, you trust that no user will miss a chat message and meetings will always be accessible either from Skype or Teams. Here are some pointers on the top things to get started:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>1. You may not need to do anything at all:&nbsp;</STRONG><SPAN><BR /></SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN>For smaller organizations that do not have hybrid or on-premises dependencies and are using Skype for Business Online only, Microsoft offers an automated upgrade for your Office 365 tenant. We will notify you in advance in the message center and via email if your tenant has been selected for this automated upgrade. This is a great benefit if you don’t have dedicated IT staff. Learn more about this at <A href=\"https://aka.ms/TeamsAutomaticUpgrade\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">aka.ms/TeamsAutomaticUpgrade</A>. </SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>2. Upgrading from Skype to Teams is more than just a technical upgrade: </STRONG><STRONG><SPAN><BR /></SPAN></STRONG>Aside from specific architectural considerations, the rate at which users adopt Teams will impact your timeline and influence the success of your upgrade the most. Managing change across your users is imperative to any successful adoption strategy. Your roll out team needs extend beyond IT to incorporate the right sponsors and stakeholders such as executive sponsors; a project lead to help instigate and keep track of training and roll-out milestones; and various champions that can share user feedback. We explain this in more detail in our video.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>3. Microsoft Teams comes with built-in upgrade options and interoperability:&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><SPAN>This applies whether you are coming from Skype for Business Online, Skype for Business Server on-premises, have a hybrid configuration, or have an enterprise voice plan. </SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN><STRONG style=\"box-sizing: border-box; color: #333333; font-family: &amp;quot; segoeui&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;lato&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;helvetica neue&amp;quot;,helvetica,arial,sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: bold; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\">4. </STRONG></SPAN><STRONG>We allow you to incrementally get your organization on board: <BR /></STRONG>Skype and Teams can coexist during your upgrade. This way, while you gradually onboard users or groups of users to Teams, you have flexibility to ensure the pre-requisites are in place with SharePoint, OneDrive, Exchange, Azure AD synchronization, and network optimization requirements.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"box-sizing: border-box; color: #333333; font-family: &amp;quot; segoeui&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;lato&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;helvetica neue&amp;quot;,helvetica,arial,sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\"><STRONG style=\"box-sizing: border-box; color: #333333; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: bold; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\">5. </STRONG></SPAN><STRONG>There are two main upgrade paths to choose from:</STRONG></P>\n<OL>\n<LI>The first path has <STRONG><EM>overlapping capabilities</EM></STRONG> across Skype and Teams and is enabled with “Islands mode”. This is our recommended path to start with. Note that by default, this will be the coexistence mode for your tenant. Because chat, meetings, and VoIP calling are available in both clients, your users can get familiar with Teams while still being able to access all the features from Skype at the same time.</LI>\n<LI>The second path is where you can pick <STRONG><EM>select capabilities</EM></STRONG> selecting from two interoperability modes. <STRONG><EM>“Skype for Business with Teams Collab and Meetings” </EM></STRONG>mode, also known as our \"meetings-first approach\", allows to have chat and calls initiated and received in Skype while scheduling and collaboration capabilities are handled by Teams. Otherwise, you can keep chats, calls and meetings in Skype while collaboration capabilities remain unique to Teams with team conversations, file sharing, and co-authoring enabled with <STRONG><EM>“Skype for Business with Teams Collab” </EM></STRONG>mode.</LI>\n<LI>Once your organization is ready, you can turn on <STRONG>Teams only mode</STRONG>, which means all incoming calls and chats land in the Teams client. In fact, if you have PSTN calling configured, users will receive all incoming voice calls in Teams, and PSTN connectivity is enabled with a calling pad that lights up in Teams.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"box-sizing: border-box; color: #333333; font-family: &amp;quot; segoeui&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;lato&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;helvetica neue&amp;quot;,helvetica,arial,sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\"><STRONG style=\"box-sizing: border-box; color: #333333; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: bold; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\">6. </STRONG></SPAN><STRONG>You can mix and match your coexistence modes:</STRONG></P>\n<P>Modes can be set organization-wide or for specific users in the Teams Admin Center or using PowerShell. You’ll want to use PowerShell if you have a large number of users that you want to assign specific modes to, and we have a range of cmdlets that enable you to perform bulk actions, such as setting modes with or without user notifications. This allows you for example to have subsets of users still on Skype for Business with select capabilities, or on overlapping capabilities, or just Teams only based on the upgrade strategy for your organization.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>7. A hybrid configuration is required if you are coming from Skype for Business Server on-premises:</STRONG></P>\n<P>User accounts in Skype for Business Server need to also be present in Skype for Business Online for interoperability with Teams to work. If you are already using Office 365, you probably have this in place already. Also, a hybrid configuration with Skype for Business Online needs to be in place to ensure that chat and calling traffic between Skype and Teams is automatically transferred via our gateway service. You’ll need to use PowerShell for that, and you can learn more about the steps at <A href=\"https://aka.ms/TeamsSfBHybrid\" target=\"_self\">aka.ms/TeamsSfBHybrid</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>8. There are two voice options to enable integration between your PSTN or Voice over IP services:</STRONG></P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">• A Microsoft calling plan: If you are using a phone system and a Microsoft calling plan where Microsoft provides your phone numbers directly, once you enable Teams only mode traffic is routed to Teams automatically, or<BR />• Direct Routing, which can be configured in a few ways.. If you have an on-premises Session Border Controller device that connects directly with your PSTN trunk line from your telecommunications provider or ISP, you’ll need to route the connection to your Microsoft 365 tenant. Or, if your Direct Routing is done off-site by your telecommunications provider via their Session Border Controller, you will need to work with them to direct PSTN traffic to your Microsoft 365 tenant.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>9. There are tools to help you to track organizational readiness:</STRONG></P>\n<P>You can track Microsoft Teams usage in your environment with built-in usage reports and dashboards available in both the Microsoft 365 admin center and the Teams Admin Center. We also recommend circling back with your onboarding team and conducting regular end-user surveys using Advisor for Teams. This will help you to capture user feedback and sentiment and ensure you have a comprehensive perspective on the readiness of your organization to upgrade to Teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>10. Your users’ contacts and upcoming meetings can also be upgraded to Teams:</STRONG></P>\n<P>The migration of your data and meetings, like interop, for the most part happens behind the scenes. There are options to automatically upgrade upcoming Skype for Business meetings across all your users’ calendars to Teams.</P>\n<P><BR />If you want to learn more, I encourage you to watch our <A href=\"https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fyoutu.be%2FmQL2i2yyoHE&amp;data=02%7C01%7CNydia.Cavazos%40microsoft.com%7C63660ab138cc4c1d244208d7bcbcced2%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637185391419316189&amp;sdata=HpJ%2FCZL0Z%2F1mf8TpmheOiE4RbwM%2FhE%2BlhIQw1VL5cY0%3D&amp;reserved=0\" target=\"_blank\">Skype to Teams Upgrade Tutorial.</A> Also keep checking back to <A href=\"https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DMfDB7VenWuA%26list%3DPLXtHYVsvn_b_JeDjgD5XdkyHTDXdYgPGn&amp;data=02%7C01%7CNydia.Cavazos%40microsoft.com%7C63660ab138cc4c1d244208d7bcbcced2%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637185391419316189&amp;sdata=krSrmqx7Xj2hrIdqFBrjHMkNMIsR3g%2BBcI4NwDgCARE%3D&amp;reserved=0\" target=\"_blank\">aka.ms/MicrosoftTeamsforIT</A> for our next Essentials show on best practices for getting your organization to adopt Teams broadly. Check out additional resources at aka.ms/SkypeToTeams and our instructor-led workshops at <A href=\"https://aka.ms/SkypeToTeamsPlanning\" target=\"_self\">aka.ms/SkypeToTeamsPlanning</A>. Lastly, stay tuned and keep watching our full series at <A style=\"background-color: transparent; box-sizing: border-box; color: #146cac; font-family: &amp;quot; segoeui&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;lato&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;helvetica neue&amp;quot;,helvetica,arial,sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: underline; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;\" href=\"https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DMfDB7VenWuA%26list%3DPLXtHYVsvn_b_JeDjgD5XdkyHTDXdYgPGn&amp;data=02%7C01%7CNydia.Cavazos%40microsoft.com%7C63660ab138cc4c1d244208d7bcbcced2%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637185391419316189&amp;sdata=krSrmqx7Xj2hrIdqFBrjHMkNMIsR3g%2BBcI4NwDgCARE%3D&amp;reserved=0\" target=\"_blank\">aka.ms/MicrosoftTeamsforIT</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><LI-VIDEO width=\"600\" height=\"338\" size=\"large\" vid=\"https://youtu.be/mQL2i2yyoHE\" align=\"center\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/mQL2i2yyoHE/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO></P>\n<P><BR />Thanks and happy upgrading! <BR />Nydia (connect on LinkedIn at:&nbsp;<FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/nydia-cavazos/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">https://www.linkedin.com/in/nydia-cavazos/</A>)</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 02 Mar 2020 23:04:45 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"ef713848b3535245db1bc5e8fc25149c","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Nydia Cavazos","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401925},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Whiteboarding and Brainstorming in Microsoft Teams","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/whiteboarding-and-brainstorming-in-microsoft-teams/ba-p/1353554","description":"<P>Most projects have a cycle – from initial idea or problem, to solution design, implementation, and completion. In the solution design phase, getting to the best outcome requires keeping an open mind, getting feedback as broadly as you can, and then systematically evaluating and iterating towards the best solution. Towards this end, bringing stakeholders together into a room to brainstorm, sketch ideas, or do sticky-note exercises to gather feedback can be useful for getting a bigger picture. In a remote working environment, many software tools can provide similar support, with the additional benefits of being digital – and that includes being connected with conversations and closely available within Microsoft Teams. As you tackle projects in a remote working environment, experiment with different tools to collect and operationalize ideas, brainstorming, and feedback.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Start up a quick whiteboard</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Sometimes teams need a space to go back and forth and share ideas – and you need a free-form space to draw and ideate. A digital whiteboard can deliver that experience, coupled with the ability to save and share your drawings forever. Microsoft Whiteboard can provide whiteboard services within meetings. Additional applications can provide specialized whiteboard features and spaces for idea visualization.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>InVision offers platform for design and development teams to collect ideas, prototype digital experiences, streamline handoffs, and share feedback – including a free whiteboarding experience in Teams known as Freehand. With <A href=\"https://appsource.microsoft.com/en-US/product/office/wa104381362?tab=overview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Freehand</A>, you can replicate the feel of a marker on a whiteboard for fast ideation or create something more polished with simple shape selection, color, and alignment tools – all of which make it easy for anyone to contribute, no matter their drawing talent. Everything in Freehand is shared in real-time, meaning multiple team members can draw and add images simultaneously. This makes it a great space to bring the team together, even when you are far apart.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"1.png\" style=\"width: 930px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/188269i7708699059F0AE51/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"1.png\" alt=\"Freehand by InVision helps with whiteboard and brainstorming\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Freehand by InVision helps with whiteboard and brainstorming</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><A href=\"https://appsource.microsoft.com/product/office/WA104381626?tab=Overview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">MURAL</A> is another whiteboarding application integrated within Microsoft Teams that enables visual collaboration through digital sticky notes, drawings, and diagrams. You can create new murals or bring existing ones into your Teams workspace as a Tab, where they appear alongside your team’s Conversations and Files. Then, you can contribute and edit directly inside of the Channel to enable seamless collaboration. All activity in your murals and rooms is passed along through notifications. Using Messaging Extensions, you can quickly find the MURAL <A href=\"http://mural.co/templates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">templates</A> you need to run your design sprints, agile sprints, and sprint planning sessions.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"2.png\" style=\"width: 930px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/188271iDE7E91F4E4E2A759/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"2.png\" alt=\"2.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Finally, <A href=\"https://appsource.microsoft.com/product/office/WA104382058\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Klaxoon</A> provides a full suite of collaborative tools to make meetings, workshops, project reviews or training sessions more engaging and efficient. Their Brainstorm activity offers a two-dimensional space for teams to add collaboration tools and artifacts. Within this Klaxoon space, you can add and connect images, text, drawing and media – but also live polls, word clouds, and visualizations in one collaborative location. Ideas become flexible notes you can move around – and when it is time to further categorize ideas, Klaxoon can change its view to allow for seamless categorizing and bucketing. Templates are also available to help users get started more easily.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"3.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/188276i309C981CAD699650/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"3.png\" alt=\"3.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Visualizing the Idea</FONT></STRONG></P>\n<P>Just as there is tremendous diversity in communication styles, there are lots of ways to organize and collaborate on brainstorms. One such tool is mind maps – designing networks of ideas in a more spatial manner. <A href=\"https://appsource.microsoft.com/product/office/WA104381116\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">MindMeister</A> has long focused on providing a way to create mind-maps: interconnected diagrams and hierarchies of ideas, pulled together onto one canvas. Thoughts around a topic can be quickly broken down into a set of categories, and tasks for executing on those ideas can also be surfaced. MindMeister can also be used natively within Microsoft Teams through its app.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"4.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/188277i8B60EB2C818672C5/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"4.png\" alt=\"A MindMeister hierarchy of concepts\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">A MindMeister hierarchy of concepts</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>No matter your collaboration style – whether it’s free form drawing connecting to broader prototypes, using sticky notes to group ideas, or creating a visual hierarchy in the form of a mind-map, you can connect these styles to broader collaboration through Microsoft Teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Learn more!</FONT></STRONG></P>\n<P>If you would like to learn how to better use apps in Teams to enhance remote work, see our remote work Teams apps site with more use cases and ideas, and take advantage of the free virtual training events each week.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>For Teams end-users:</STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Check out our guide to <A href=\"https://aka.ms/teamsappguide\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">remote work apps</A></LI>\n<LI>Join a live, instructor-led training session called “<A style=\"font-family: inherit; background-color: #ffffff;\" href=\"https://aka.ms/LearnTeamsApps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn to Use Apps in Microsoft Teams</A><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">.” We’ll show you how to find, install, and leverage the full functionality of some of our most popular apps.</SPAN></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG>For Teams Admins:</STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Join our <A href=\"https://microsoftteams.eventbuilder.com/ChalkTalksApps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Chalk Talk series</A>, where members of Teams engineering walk through the security, deployment, and management of third-party integrations.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 04 May 2020 15:00:00 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/188269i7708699059F0AE51/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"b4c70cc5d4536bada7b9b86e97cf6716","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn12@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-56-44-171_97b6f706ffb96b6e.webp","destWidth":930,"destHeight":562,"sourceBytes":252880,"destBytes":22816,"author":"Mike Ammerlaan","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/188269i7708699059F0AE51/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn12@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-56-44-171_97b6f706ffb96b6e.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/188271iDE7E91F4E4E2A759/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn40@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-51-329_6674ee2a434e3919.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/188276i309C981CAD699650/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn31@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-57-06-913_276a1a72d4f87a29.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/188277i8B60EB2C818672C5/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn88@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-56-483_e00c1de64e32f18c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401921},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"What’s New in Microsoft Teams | Build Edition 2020","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/what-s-new-in-microsoft-teams-build-edition-2020/ba-p/1394224","description":"<P>\n Microsoft Teams has seen \n <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2020/04/30/2-years-digital-transformation-2-months/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  tremendous growth\n </A>, with more people on Teams than ever. Today at Build, we are \n <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2020/05/19/microsoft-teams-fluid-framework-new-microsoft-365/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  announcing many new capabilities in Microsoft Teams\n </A> to continue to provide a rich canvas for developers to build, engage, and transform workflows. This allows Teams to address the full app development journey. Read on to see what is new!\n</P> \n<DIV id=\"buildpublish\">\n &nbsp;\n</DIV> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/what-s-new-in-microsoft-teams-build-edition-2020/ba-p/1394224#buildpublish\" target=\"_self\">\n   <STRONG>\n    Making it easier to build and publish apps\n   </STRONG>\n  </A>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/what-s-new-in-microsoft-teams-build-edition-2020/ba-p/1394224#manage\" target=\"_self\">\n   <STRONG>\n    Improving IT Admins’ ability to manage apps\n   </STRONG>\n  </A>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/what-s-new-in-microsoft-teams-build-edition-2020/ba-p/1394224#experience\" target=\"_self\">\n   <STRONG>\n    Enhancing end users’ experience\n   </STRONG>\n  </A>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/what-s-new-in-microsoft-teams-build-edition-2020/ba-p/1394224#external\" target=\"_self\">\n   <STRONG>\n    Using Teams to connect with external audiences\n   </STRONG>\n  </A>\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <U>\n  <STRONG>\n   <FONT size=\"5\">\n    Making it easier to build and publish apps&nbsp;\n   </FONT>\n  </STRONG>\n </U>\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Visual Studio and Visual Studio Code Extension for Teams\n </STRONG>\n <BR />With the new Visual Studio and Visual Studio Code Teams extension, developers can use the power and familiarity of these tools to quickly build project scaffolding, configure features, create app package manifest and setup hosting, validate app package manifest, and start the app publishing process (for yourself, to your organization’s catalog, or to the Teams app store). Visual Studio Code extension is now available in \n <A href=\"https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=TeamsDevApp.ms-teams-vscode-extension\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  public preview\n </A>. Visual Studio extension coming soon!\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"VSC (2).jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/193059i518604490BEC7A6A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"VSC (2).jpg\" alt=\"VSC (2).jpg\" /></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Bringing low-code bots to Teams, with Power Virtual Agents\n </STRONG>\n <BR />We are partnering with the newest component of the \n <A href=\"https://aka.ms/Teams-PowerPlatform_Build2020\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Power Platform\n </A> – Power Virtual Agents, which is a low-code chatbot platform. There are a number of new features that are rolling out over the coming months that will make it easier to create and manage low-code chatbots from within Teams and more streamlined for end users to use Power Virtual Agents bots in Teams. These new features are:\n</P> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  <STRONG>\n   Bot Template:\n  </STRONG> \n  <A href=\"https://aka.ms/PVATeamsFAQBot_blog\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   FAQ bot template\n  </A> available in GitHub\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <STRONG>\n   Single sign-on:\n  </STRONG> Power Virtual Agents bots will be available, removing the need for users to sign in again when using a Power Virtual Agents bot in Teams\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n <IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Microsoft%20Teams/200518%20PVA%20blog%20chat.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" />\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Simplified Power Apps and Power Virtual Agents “Add to Teams”\n </STRONG> \n <BR />We are introducing a new streamlined approach for adding custom solutions to Teams from Power Apps and Power Virtual Agents. Coming soon, Power Apps makers will be able to click a single “Add to Teams” button in Power Apps, which will push the app to the Teams app store. Similarly, the process of adding low-code bots from Power Virtual Agents will be simplified, so developers can spend more time building and less time deploying.\n</P> \n<P>\n <IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/PowerAppsOneClickAddtoTeams.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" />\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Enhanced workflow automation with Power Automate + Teams\n </STRONG>\n <BR />There are several new Power Automate triggers and actions built specifically for Teams to unlock custom message extensions, allow for automated @mentioning, and provide a customized bot experience. Additionally, to make the process of building automation even easier and more relevant, we are rolling out new business process scenario templates built for Teams. When users create a new flow, they will see these templates when they select the “Create from Template option.”\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Power Automate triggers-actions.png\" style=\"width: 357px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192175iFE1B8F82798939F7/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"Power Automate triggers-actions.png\" alt=\"Power Automate triggers-actions.png\" /></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  New Shifts + Power Automate actions\n </STRONG>\n <BR />There are new actions available via Power Automate so that developers can take information from Shifts and create customized workflows with other apps or perform operations at scale. For example, gathering insights from Shifts such as requests or schedule details and then using this information in other app workflows. Learn more \n <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/connectors/teams/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  here\n </A>.\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Power Automate in Shifts.png\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192176iDA42F2B3D87338DF/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"Power Automate in Shifts.png\" alt=\"Power Automate in Shifts.png\" /></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Improved Power BI sharing to Teams\n </STRONG>\n <BR />To help organizations lead data-driven conversations, we have made it even easier to share Power BI reports to Teams – simply select the report to share and click the new “Share to Teams” button in Power BI. You’ll be prompted to select the user or channel to send the report to, which will automatically be posted to the conversation.\n</P> \n<P>\n <IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/PowerBIsharetoTeams2.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" />\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Additionally, users can now copy individual charts in a Power BI report, and when they are pasted to a Teams conversation, the chat will include a rich thumbnail preview of the chart, as well as an adaptive card allowing users to take actions on that chart.\n</P> \n<P>\n <IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/PowerBIShareChartElement.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" />\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Activity feed notifications for apps\n </STRONG> \n <BR />Coming soon to beta, the new activity feed notifications via the Microsoft Graph API gives you a new and simpler way to send app notifications to users across devices. You’ll enjoy the ability to customize and control the notification experience – everything from the notification structure, to what is surfaced to the user after they click the notification.\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"4.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192245i72E0943F6E9CC46F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"4.png\" alt=\"4.png\" /></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Granular Permissions\n </STRONG> \n <BR />We’re pleased to announce the general availability of \n <STRONG>\n  24 new granular permissions for the Teams Graph APIs\n </STRONG> – giving developers more flexibility and granularity. With granular permissions, developers can now narrow the app’s access and scope to team data as opposed to all team data.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Mobile device capability for apps\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<P>\n Developers will soon be able to connect native mobile device capabilities to their apps, such as camera, location and microphone, empowering developers to extend their Teams user experience to meet specific needs.\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Device permissions screen.png\" style=\"width: 185px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/203893i7A536A07CAEECF9C/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"Device permissions screen.png\" alt=\"Device permissions screen.png\" /></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  New Microsoft Graph APIs for subscribing to notifications for new app messages\n </STRONG>\n <BR />Using the Microsoft Graph API, we’ve provided developers capabilities to create subscriptions for different event types, such as new/edited/delete messages, replies, reactions, as well as to all or specific channels and chat threads – allowing apps to refresh when new content is available. These are great for development of data loss prevention (DLP) and safety apps. Learn more on subscription APIs \n <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/api/subscription-post-subscriptions?view=graph-rest-beta&amp;tabs=http\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  here\n </A>. This is currently in beta.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  New Teams Graph APIs in v1.0\n </STRONG> \n <BR />Coming soon, we have some new Teams Graph APIs coming to the v1.0 endpoint that you’ll be able to explore soon. You’ll soon be able to take advantage of capabilities including sending channel messages and replies (including attachments), finding the general channel without assuming it’s titled general, and lastly finding the SharePoint folder for a channel without assuming folder has same name as channel itself.&nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n These APIs, combined with other \n <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/teams-concept-overview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Teams\n </A> and \n <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/cloud-communications-concept-overview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Cloud Communications\n </A> APIs support our new Connected Contact Center and Compliance Recording ISV partner certification programs. Learn more about our \n <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/MicrosoftTeams/teams-contact-center\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  contact center\n </A> and \n <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/teams-recording-policy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  compliance recording\n </A> integrations, including the current group of partners that are ready to engage customers for each solution area.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Graph APIs for Shifts\n </STRONG> \n <BR />\n <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/api/resources/shift?view=graph-rest-1.0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  APIs\n </A> give developers the flexibility to customize the Shifts experience, making it extensible to integrate with any other external workforce management, including their own custom workforce management systems (small businesses). Bringing together a workforce management system and Teams enables customers to leverage logic on the backend, and make Teams the user-friendly, front-end experience. Learn more \n <A href=\"https://github.com/OfficeDev/Microsoft-Teams-Shifts-WFM-Connectors/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  here\n </A>. This is generally available today.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  App Studio Update (v1.4.0)\n </STRONG>\n <BR />With the latest update (v1.4.0), App Studio now has new enhancements such as, support for app manifest schema 1.6, “advanced section” in app details to easily support advanced features, app package validation tool to run tests that extend outside the basic schema validation, and better error handling with bot framework connection with user guidance on how to perform same actions in the bot framework web portal. This is generally available today.\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"App Studio.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192200i8368FCF601CDAE9E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"App Studio.jpg\" alt=\"App Studio.jpg\" /></span>\n</P> \n<DIV id=\"manage\">\n &nbsp;\n</DIV> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <U>\n  <STRONG>\n   <FONT size=\"5\">\n    Improving IT Admins’ ability to manage apps\n   </FONT>\n  </STRONG>\n </U>\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Streamlined process to manage apps\n </STRONG>\n <BR />IT admins will be able to leverage a streamlined process to manage - review, approve &amp; publish custom apps directly from the Teams Admin Center.\n</P> \n<P>\n <IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/Build_Cut2_v4.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" />\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  New 3rd party subscription purchase experience\n </STRONG> \n <BR />A new 3rd-party subscription purchase experience will enable IT admins to view and purchase subscriptions associated with the 3rd party Teams apps. IT admins can purchase licenses and later pin the app to targeted employees right from within the Teams Admin Center.\n <BR />\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"In-product purchase MERGE x2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192216i459921E6B7D03DA9/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"In-product purchase MERGE x2.png\" alt=\"Teams Admin Center view with catalog of apps and purchase subscription status\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Teams Admin Center view with catalog of apps and purchase subscription status</span></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"pre-purchase - single Zoho group x2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192218i16BC56571893EE85/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"pre-purchase - single Zoho group x2.png\" alt=\"App purchase view within Teams Admin Center\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">App purchase view within Teams Admin Center</span></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Grant Consent to Graph API Permissions\n </STRONG>\n <BR />IT admins will be able to grant consent to Graph API permissions on behalf of the entire tenant for the permissions an app is requesting such as reading information stored in a team or sending an email on behalf of users, be able to see granular permissions and provide resource-specific consent with the ability to install an app to a specific team\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  New controls to enhance the Teams app discoverability experience\n </STRONG> \n <BR />New controls will empower administrators to tailor and enhance the Teams app discoverability experience by installing it for individual users in the overflow menu. IT admins can also surface relevant apps to end users by creating Templates in Teams that come with installed apps in addition to a pre-defined channel structure.\n</P> \n<DIV id=\"experience\">\n &nbsp;\n</DIV> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <U>\n  <STRONG>\n   <FONT size=\"5\">\n    Enhancing end users’ experience\n   </FONT>\n  </STRONG>\n </U> \n <BR />\n <STRONG>\n  Pop-out apps\n </STRONG>\n <BR />Coming later this year, end users will be able to ‘pop-out’ personal apps. Users will be able to open separate windows for their apps so they can work while easily accessing their team chats to continue to collaborate. Simply right-click on an app to see the pop out option.\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"MultiWindow-May.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192215i05D9D405D2E99189/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"MultiWindow-May.png\" alt=\"MultiWindow-May.png\" /></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Templates in Teams\n </STRONG>\n <BR />Creating a new team? Now you can get started even faster with a variety of templates for common team types. Options will include event management, crisis response, hospital ward and bank branch, just to name a few. Each template comes with pre-defined channels, apps, and guidance on how to utilize and customize it, helping you get the most out of Teams. IT professionals can also create new custom templates for their organization, allowing them to standardize team structures, surface relevant apps and scale best practices. Templates in Teams will roll out in the next few months and appear automatically. Check out the \n <A href=\"https://aka.ms/teamtemplatesblog\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  deep dive blog\n </A> to learn more.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/TemplatesInTeams.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" />\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Microsoft Lists in Teams\n </STRONG> \n <BR />Microsoft Lists is coming to Teams! Microsoft Lists helps you track information and organize work. List are simple, smart, and flexible, so you can stay on top of what matters most to your team. Track issues, assets, routines, contacts, inventory and more using customizable views and smart rules and alerts to keep everyone in sync. With ready-made templates, you will be able to quickly start lists online, on our new mobile app, and directly from within Microsoft Teams. To learn more, visit the new \n <A href=\"https://aka.ms/MSLists\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Microsoft Lists resource center\n </A> and get first looks at the \n <A href=\"https://aka.ms/MSLists/demo-video\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Microsoft Lists product demo video\n </A>.\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Lists-plus-Teams_Create-list.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192206i3659C5479A6D9D17/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Lists-plus-Teams_Create-list.png\" alt=\"Create a new list directly inside Teams or bring in one that already exists in Microsoft 365.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Create a new list directly inside Teams or bring in one that already exists in Microsoft 365.</span></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Event-Itinerary-list_in-Microsoft-Teams.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192207iD6EDCCE21481F27C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Event-Itinerary-list_in-Microsoft-Teams.png\" alt=\"You can create, share, and track list all from within Microsoft Teams.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">You can create, share, and track list all from within Microsoft Teams.</span></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Contextual Search in Microsoft Teams\n </STRONG>\n <BR />Find information faster with contextual search in Microsoft Teams. Users will have the ability to search for content in a specific channel or chat by pressing \n <STRONG>\n  CTRL + F\n </STRONG>. Search results will only contain messages and files found in the selected chat or channel. This feature is coming soon.\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"contextual search.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192208i21AD0D4CCE76330C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"contextual search.png\" alt=\"contextual search.png\" /></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Azure Active Directory Single Sign-On (SSO)\n </STRONG>\n <BR />End users will soon be able to enjoy the benefits of Azure Active Directory Single Sign-On (SSO) for supported Teams apps on both desktop and mobile. After they’re signed into Teams, end users won’t have to sign in again on apps that integrate with single sign-on. Developers will also enjoy a simplified authentication process through a single API call. We’ll roll out with tabs in general availability soon, followed by bots later this year.\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Teams + Azure Active Directory.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192237iF304BF9D2227F506/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Teams + Azure Active Directory.png\" alt=\"Teams + Azure Active Directory.png\" /></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Azure Active Directory Conditional Access\n </STRONG> \n <BR />Coming soon, this capability will enable end users to run apps and tabs even if their IT admin has set up conditional access policies requiring the use of a trusted device. Website tabs on Windows that use Azure AD will automatically sign you in and support device-specific conditional access policies.\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"conditional access.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192239iC88CFFF900B650CD/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"conditional access.png\" alt=\"conditional access.png\" /></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Resource-Specific Consent\n </STRONG> \n <BR />This capability will empower Team owners to install an app for their specific team and restrict the app’s scope and access to data to only that one team. This allows team owners to make decisions versus needing the global IT admin to provision access. This is coming soon to preview.\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"resource-specific consent.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192240iB5B102BE4AC9EE48/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"resource-specific consent.png\" alt=\"resource-specific consent.png\" /></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  More powerful Adaptive Cards for Teams\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<P>\n Develop a richer and more customizable experience using Adaptive Cards 1.2 in Teams on desktop and mobile. Highly requested features such as @mentions support within cards, allow the ability to direct a user’s attention to cards that are relevant to them – providing you an enhanced notification and engagement capability for your app. RichText Blocks allow you greater flexibility in designing the look and feel of the cards. These are available in general availability and ready for you to explore today.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Adaptive Cards with incoming webhooks are another highly requested Teams features. Full support for Adaptive Cards, including support for bot framework cards (hero, profile, lists, and more) will be available in preview coming soon.\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"adaptivecards1.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192879iE45CC52273DF6850/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"adaptivecards1.png\" alt=\"@ mentions in adaptive cards\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">@ mentions in adaptive cards</span></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"adaptivecards2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192880iE0548529634FCEDB/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"adaptivecards2.png\" alt=\"RichText Block and flexibility in design in adaptive cards\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">RichText Block and flexibility in design in adaptive cards</span></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  Messaging actions for mobile\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<P>\n Coming soon, we will have message action support for mobile will be coming soon to preview. Message actions can be triggered directly from a message and can be used to enable scenarios such as creating tasks or work items following a discussion within a chat or channel.\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"mobile 111.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192881iB1B169B3A0CFB839/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"mobile 111.png\" alt=\"mobile 111.png\" /></span>\n</P> \n<DIV id=\"external\">\n &nbsp;\n</DIV> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <U>\n  <STRONG>\n   <FONT size=\"5\">\n    Using Teams to Connect with External Audiences\n   </FONT>\n  </STRONG>\n </U>\n <BR />\n <STRONG>\n  Schedule virtual appointments with Bookings in Teams\n </STRONG> \n <BR />Teams, which enables HIPAA compliance and is HITRUST certified, will now allow organizations to schedule, manage and conduct business-to-consumer meetings, through the new Bookings app integration. Organizations can now manage multiple departments and staff in a single scheduling experience and can easily schedule virtual appointments with external attendees, such as healthcare virtual visits with patients, job candidate interviews, customer service appointments in retail, and student office hours. In addition, with the Microsoft Graph API organizations can integrate both scheduling and meeting-join links into their unique workflows and existing applications like electronic health records systems in healthcare.\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"bookings app in teams.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192246i40EA36699BCC0523/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"bookings app in teams.png\" alt=\"bookings app in teams.png\" /></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  <FONT size=\"5\">\n   NDI for Teams and Skype TX Interoperability\n  </FONT> \n </STRONG>\n <BR />Broadcast events and studio productions from a virtual stage in Teams! We are introducing New Network Device Interface (NDI) support and Skype TX interoperability for Microsoft Teams, which offers a more advanced set of production options for public or private customized, high-scale broadcasts. Coming soon, NDI for Microsoft Teams transforms a Teams meeting into a virtual stage by converting each participant's video into a discrete video source that can be used in the production tool of your choice, OBS, Wirecast, Xsplit, StreamLabs and many more. This functionality enables you to use Teams meetings in other ways, including hosting a professional broadcast.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Meanwhile new interoperability of Teams with Skype TX devices—the devices commonly used in broadcast production today—enables production teams to connect in 1:1 calls for interviews and newscasts with professional capabilities including caller queuing and connection quality management.\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"NDI.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192243iAD5DA0B6A1C73585/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"NDI.png\" alt=\"Customize broadcasts with NDI for Teams\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Customize broadcasts with NDI for Teams</span></span>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n To see many of these new capabilities in action with demonstrations, check out our Microsoft Mechanics video: \n <A href=\"https://youtu.be/_IVOV3G8mZ4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Microsoft Teams updates | May
