07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Microsoft Teams Devices for Shared Spaces July and August Update","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/microsoft-teams-devices-for-shared-spaces-july-and-august-update/ba-p/1604833","description":"<P>To enable powerful meeting experiences across the hybrid workplace, we’ve been working to deliver new features and experiences across our shared space devices. Updates for these device experiences are available now on the Windows store - Microsoft Teams Rooms app version 4.5.37.0, collaboration bar app version 1.0.94.2020062501, and Surface Hub version 0.2020.84.1970.</P>\n<P><BR />Included below are additional details for new experiences enabled through these app releases:</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>Coordinated Meetings for Microsoft Teams Rooms and Surface Hub</STRONG><BR />With Coordinated Meetings, people can drive inclusive, collaborative meeting experiences between remote and in-person attendees like never before. Now, users can leverage the power of both Microsoft Teams Room and Surface Hub devices in the same meeting, through a coordinated experience. Using proximity or one-touch join, both devices join the meeting simultaneously with Teams Rooms running audio and video, while Surface Hub is automatically muted to avoid any distracting feedback. During the meeting, users can maximize screen real estate by using the front of room display to show attendees in the meeting gallery, while the Surface Hub is used to show content or to conduct a collaborative whiteboarding session. With the whiteboard experience on Surface Hub and Microsoft Whiteboard in Teams, people can draw and ink together on the same savable canvas, no matter their location. For more information on how to enable this coordinated meeting experience, read our <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/rooms/coordinated-meetings\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">guidance</A>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Surface Hub and Microsoft Teams Rooms.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213829iAA87AE1AA2DBAAF1/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Surface Hub and Microsoft Teams Rooms.png\" alt=\"Coordinated meetings with Surface Hub and Microsoft Teams Rooms\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Coordinated meetings with Surface Hub and Microsoft Teams Rooms</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Pin attendees on Surface Hub</STRONG><BR />Control the view in-room attendees see on the Surface Hub with the pin feature. Like the Teams meeting experience on the PC, users can pin a participant’s video to the gallery view, holding the view in place regardless of who is talking. This feature will begin rolling out later this month. <BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Microsoft Teams video meeting.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213833i47CC3823695F4BB0/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Microsoft Teams video meeting.png\" alt=\"Microsoft Teams video meeting on a Surface Hub featuring a pinned video\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Microsoft Teams video meeting on a Surface Hub featuring a pinned video</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Proximity-based meeting join, now available for Surface Hub</STRONG><BR />The simplicity of proximity-based meeting join for Microsoft Teams Rooms is now available on Surface Hub. Using proximity join, a person’s laptop or mobile device can be used to identify a nearby, available Surface Hub and add it to the meeting from the pre-join screen. The personal device will automatically join the meeting in content-only mode with mics and speakers muted, allowing the Surface Hub to provide audio and video for the meeting, without echo or feedback. By default, an invite to the meeting will appear on the device. However, customers can change the settings on the Surface Hub to enable auto accept.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Microsoft Teams pre-join screen.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213835i87EA8ACFBB42D526/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Microsoft Teams pre-join screen.png\" alt=\"Microsoft Teams pre-join screen with Surface Hub available as another join option\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Microsoft Teams pre-join screen with Surface Hub available as another join option</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Live captions are now available for collaboration bars</STRONG><BR />Live captions make meetings more inclusive by providing an alternative way for attendees to follow along and engage in the conversation. For people in noisy environments or with different levels of language proficiency, live captions can people follow along more easily. To turn on live captions, click on the option located in the navigation bar.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Microsoft Teams meeting live captioning.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213838iCD268BD835A67AD7/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Microsoft Teams meeting live captioning.png\" alt=\"Microsoft Teams video meeting featuring live captioning\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Microsoft Teams video meeting featuring live captioning</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Switch to video gallery when content is present</STRONG><BR />Microsoft Teams Rooms and collaboration bars can now switch to the video gallery layout, even when content is being shared by a remote participant or locally using HDMI ingest. This functionality is available to all Teams Rooms devices configured with a single display (TV or projector) in the room. This layout is useful for moments when customers want to focus on participants in the meeting or for room configurations with always-on external devices connected via HDMI Ingest. We look forward to delivering additional layouts in the future.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Changle layout on Teams console.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213841i4E6338199B02F331/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Changle layout on Teams console.png\" alt=\"Change layout selection window on the Microsoft Teams console\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Change layout selection window on the Microsoft Teams console</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Raise hand support for Microsoft Teams Rooms, collaboration bar, and Surface Hub</STRONG><BR />We <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/what-s-new-in-microsoft-teams-june-2020/ba-p/1489142\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">announced</A> the Raise Hand feature for Teams desktop in June, and are excited to announce that it is now available on Teams Rooms, collaboration bar, and Surface Hub. During a meeting, participants can raise a virtual hand to let people know they want to contribute without interrupting the conversation. To engage this feature, just tap Raise Hand in the meeting controls. Meeting participants will see a notification on the display and the console, that a hand is raised. Once the participant is done speaking, they can tap on the control again to lower their hand.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Raise Hand in Teams.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213844iF15CEA57B6001912/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Raise Hand in Teams.png\" alt=\"Raise Hand view on the Microsoft Teams Rooms console (left) and on the Surface Hub (right)\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Raise Hand view on the Microsoft Teams Rooms console (left) and on the Surface Hub (right)</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Adjust default volume for in-room speakers</STRONG><BR />Microsoft Teams Rooms support a wide variety of audio peripherals that can be used across all space sizes. This ability to customize based on spatial needs requires better control over default volume levels for audio devices. Device administrators can now set the default volume level for conferencing and default speaker from the Teams Rooms settings.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Settings view for default volume in Teams Rooms.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213845i936EBDCB06DC15A0/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Settings view for default volume in Teams Rooms.png\" alt=\"Settings view for adjusting the default volume for Teams Rooms devices\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Settings view for adjusting the default volume for Teams Rooms devices</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Manage Teams Devices from Teams Admin Center</STRONG><BR />Microsoft Teams recently rolled out expanded device management capabilities within the Teams Admin Center. Customers will now be able to manage their Teams Rooms in the same place as their collaboration bars and Teams phones. Additionally, we added new features enabling IT admins to simplify, customize, and automate Teams device management. Admins can now perform all the device management tasks, including enrollment, inventory management, software updates, and inspecting device health from a single location. For customers who rely on partners for device management, they can now delegate administration directly through the Partner Center, while ensuring secure authorized device access. Read through our recent <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/one-place-to-manage-all-your-teams-devices/ba-p/1527766\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">blog post</A> for more details on these announcements, and for information on how to begin managing devices through Teams Admin Center, <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/devices/device-management\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">click here</A>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Admin Center Rooms devices.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213846iA192A0054E76E348/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Admin Center Rooms devices.png\" alt=\"Teams Admin Center console featuring Teams Rooms devices\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Teams Admin Center console featuring Teams Rooms devices</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Manage Microsoft Teams settings on Surface Hub via XML file</STRONG><BR />Customers can now manage Microsoft Teams settings on a Surface Hub using Windows Configuration Designer or Microsoft Intune in Microsoft Endpoint Manager. Now Surface Hub customers can find and manage their Teams settings in one place. <A title=\"Learn more\" href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/rooms/surface-hub-manage-config\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more</A></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sat, 22 Aug 2020 00:16:48 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213829iAA87AE1AA2DBAAF1/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"ad1445a1bdd885be9afd59037caa2a13","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn80@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-56-43-411_e87dc1d9c94cb93f.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":562,"sourceBytes":417049,"destBytes":45682,"author":"MicrosoftTeamsTeam","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213829iAA87AE1AA2DBAAF1/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn80@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-56-43-411_e87dc1d9c94cb93f.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213833i47CC3823695F4BB0/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn76@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-57-06-250_44d7667bc4499ecc.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213835i87EA8ACFBB42D526/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn76@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-57-11-467_b86b6620a245ee01.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213838iCD268BD835A67AD7/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn35@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-07-089_c496fd41476adb69.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213841i4E6338199B02F331/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn34@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-58-09-012_b0362127c4c45830.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213844iF15CEA57B6001912/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn27@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-57-31-357_7b4d6550c5407b37.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/213845i936EBDCB06DC15A0/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn64@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-57-07-855_a8413d61db2391aa.webp","https://techc 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"9 tips for having the best online meeting experience with Microsoft Teams","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/9-tips-for-having-the-best-online-meeting-experience-with/ba-p/1218884","description":"<P>Over the last few weeks we have seen a large increase in the number of people conducting Microsoft Teams meetings as they move to <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2020/03/10/staying-productive-while-working-remotely-with-microsoft-teams/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">remote work arrangements</A>. Whether you are brand new to the tool, or conduct all of your meetings on Teams, we want to provide you tips on how to have the best online meetings experience.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"4\"><STRONG>#1 Connect online with people inside and outside your org</STRONG></FONT><BR />With Teams, you can host online meetings with people both inside and outside of your organization. The next time you <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/invite-people-to-a-meeting-in-teams-4bc5981c-446e-4e93-866a-d757466b556a\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">schedule a meeting</A> in either Teams or Microsoft Outlook, simply include the email address of your external guests and Teams will take care of the rest—including sending an email invitation complete with instructions on how to join your online meeting. Your meeting guest can click on the link, enter their name, and join the meeting from their browser—all without having to install a plug-in or download the Teams client.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"1-connect-with-people-inside-and-outside-your-org.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/176076i1434B163D679770F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"1-connect-with-people-inside-and-outside-your-org.png\" alt=\"Microsoft Teams web join experience\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Microsoft Teams web join experience</span></span></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"4\"><STRONG>#2 Enable everyone to participate with dial-in capabilities</STRONG></FONT><BR />Designed for participants who are on the go, don’t have access to the internet, or prefer to dial into a meeting, make sure meetings are inclusive. Users who are enabled for Audio Conferencing will automatically see dial-in instructions added to their Teams <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/add-a-dial-in-number-for-a-meeting-in-teams-7c33e972-e5a2-4b32-aabd-09c0c5f18424\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">meeting invitations</A>. Clicking on the dial-in number from a cell phone will automatically launch the phone dialer, dial the number, and even enter the conference bridge. Gone are the days of having to memorize numbers!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"2-enable-everyone-to-participate-with-dial-in-capabilities.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/176083i6DB364B752BBEC91/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"2-enable-everyone-to-participate-with-dial-in-capabilities.png\" alt=\"Teams user interface showing the meeting details, including Audio Conferencing dial-in information\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Teams user interface showing the meeting details, including Audio Conferencing dial-in information</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"4\"><STRONG>#3 Stay in control of your meeting</STRONG></FONT><BR />Teams provides the meeting organizer with many options when it comes to defining the <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Change-participant-settings-for-a-Teams-meeting-53261366-dbd5-45f9-aae9-a70e6354f88e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">roles and permissions</A> for online meeting participants. For example, you can choose to enable a meeting lobby, which lets the organizer define when and who is admitted into the meeting. You can also designate who can present, mute attendees, and start/stop recordings, just to name a few.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"3-stay-in-control-of-your-meeting.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/176088i1D78C1F15E241CB0/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"3-stay-in-control-of-your-meeting.png\" alt=\"Meeting options user interface showing roles and permission available\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Meeting options user interface showing roles and permission available</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"4\"><STRONG>#4 Hold face-to-face conversations with video</STRONG></FONT><BR />If you can’t meet in person, meeting online with video is the next best thing. Encourage everyone in your Teams meeting to turn on their video. Turn on <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Blur-your-background-in-a-Teams-meeting-f77a2381-443a-499d-825e-509a140f4780\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">background blur</A> to keep the focus on you instead of what’s behind you.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"4-hold-face-to-face-conversations-with-video.gif\" style=\"width: 900px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/176091i9BC90E6D89442618/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"4-hold-face-to-face-conversations-with-video.gif\" alt=\"Teams UI showing meeting attendee toggling background blur while joining a meeting\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Teams UI showing meeting attendee toggling background blur while joining a meeting</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"4\"><STRONG>#5 Share only what you need</STRONG></FONT><BR />When <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/share-content-in-a-meeting-in-teams-fcc2bf59-aecd-4481-8f99-ce55dd836ce8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">sharing content</A> in Teams meetings, you control what others can see. You can decide whether you need to show your entire desktop, or just a specific window. If someone is sharing their desktop or an application, you can request the presenter to give you control.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"5-share-only-what-you-need.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/176089i91A2706C41B8DC7A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"5-share-only-what-you-need.png\" alt=\"Teams user interface showing presentation capabilities in the sharing tray\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Teams user interface showing presentation capabilities in the sharing tray</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"4\"><STRONG>#6 Everyone contributes with digital ink</STRONG></FONT><BR />Just because everyone is not in the same room doesn’t mean you can’t brainstorm on a whiteboard. <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/use-whiteboard-in-microsoft-teams-7a6e7218-e9dc-4ccc-89aa-b1a0bb9c31ee?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Whiteboard</A> is integrated with every Teams meeting, enabling meeting participant to join in with touch—or their mouse—and contribute with digital ink. Whiteboard sessions are saved as part of every meeting and available for future use and reference.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"6-everyone-contributes-with-digital-ink.gif\" style=\"width: 703px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/176090iAD75A462533D6C4C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"6-everyone-contributes-with-digital-ink.gif\" alt=\"Sharing a Microsoft Whiteboard within Teams\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Sharing a Microsoft Whiteboard within Teams</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"4\"><STRONG>#7 Don’t miss the meeting, even if you missed the meeting</STRONG></FONT><BR />Whether running a few minutes late, or double-booked with a fire drill, there’s a good chance that someone will miss the meeting. Instead of bringing them up-to-speed in another meeting, simply <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Record-a-meeting-in-Teams-34dfbe7f-b07d-4a27-b4c6-de62f1348c24\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">record your Teams meeting</A>. Not only is the recorded meeting stored in the cloud—and a link provided in the meeting chat—but participants can search the meeting transcript and jump to the point in time of the meeting where it was mentioned.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"7-don’t-miss-the-meeting,-even-if-you-missed-the-meeting.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/176092i36C668BB5C0A1B25/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"7-don’t-miss-the-meeting,-even-if-you-missed-the-meeting.gif\" alt=\"Teams meeting recording playback showing searching a transcript and jumping to the point in the meeting when referenced\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Teams meeting recording playback showing searching a transcript and jumping to the point in the meeting when referenced</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"4\"><STRONG>#8 Follow along with meeting captions</STRONG></FONT><BR />Encourage your meeting participants to turn on <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Use-live-captions-in-a-Teams-meeting-4be2d304-f675-4b57-8347-cbd000a21260\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">live captions</A> and read subtitles in real-time. This is a game changing feature for those who are hard of hearing, have different levels of language proficiency, or are connecting from a loud location. Live captions is currently available in English for users located in the United States.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"8-follow-along-with-meeting-captions.gif\" style=\"width: 850px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/176094iBB38A4A439C7636C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"8-follow-along-with-meeting-captions.gif\" alt=\"Teams interface showing how to turn on live captions in a meeting\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Teams interface showing how to turn on live captions in a meeting</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"4\"><STRONG>#9 Be seen and heard clearly</STRONG></FONT><BR />Microsoft offers a <A href=\"https://aka.ms/teamsdevices\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">full portfolio of Teams-certified devices</A> to ensure you look and sound your best with high quality video and audio. Connect and start your meetings with just one touch and choose where and how you want to work with devices designed for any space and working style.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"9-be-seen-and-heard-clearly.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/176108iAF58DC1B65DA502E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"9-be-seen-and-heard-clearly.png\" alt=\"Person sitting in an open space environment wearing a Teams-certified headset while attending an online meeting\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Person sitting in an open space environment wearing a Teams-certified headset while attending an online meeting</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>For additional information on how to elevate your Teams meetings experience, read <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/get-the-most-from-your-meetings-with-microsoft-teams/ba-p/907594\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Get the most from your meetings with Microsoft Teams</A> where I break down the components of meetings and suggest ways in which you can make them more effective.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 10 Skay","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/176076i1434B163D679770F/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn60@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-56-42-466_047fc10a3b19b28c.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/176083i6DB364B752BBEC91/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn47@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-57-51-387_f3cdc4db34f14894.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/176088i1D78C1F15E241CB0/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn40@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-07-122_49c087dbd51df58b.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/176091i9BC90E6D89442618/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn79@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-36-742_14f6fd7745cdbe6a.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/176089i91A2706C41B8DC7A/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn8@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-57-21-215_226acce7d6b3ca30.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/176090iAD75A462533D6C4C/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn72@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-57-50-401_53a657fe2563a639.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/176092i36C668BB5C0A1B25/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn4@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-57-24-216_c56adfc438cd5b4a.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/176094iBB38A4A439C7636C/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn88@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-14-945_59e484f08f5c9eb9.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/176108iAF58DC1B65DA502E/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn80@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-57-09-555_d6a1513a21b2dcde.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401924},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Engage your employees using the Incentives App in Teams","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/engage-your-employees-using-the-incentives-app-in-teams/ba-p/1339421","description":"<P>Are you looking to incentivize behaviors you want to encourage as part of organizational change management strategy? Incentives App template for Teams lets you gamify Adoption &amp; Change management activities.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>You might be asking why we are talking about gamification with regards to organizational change management. When rolled out properly, gamification could provide a structure to your users for the new skills they need to learn. Any new process or system rollout requires employees to unlearn some old behaviors and learn new behaviors and skills, but the traditional rollout and training activities gives them the perception that a change is being forced upon them. Gamification gives them the control to make those behavior changes at their pace. A sense of “competition” with their peers keeps them engaged and motivated.</P>\n<P><BR />The ability to be recognized for their achievements (however big or small) is universal. The recognition may be a position on the leaderboard, small monetary rewards (gift cards, free coffee, etc.), or perhaps lunch with a dynamic leader of the organization. <STRONG>Incentives Power App</STRONG> can be used for rewarding employees for learning new skills to be more productive, which ultimately impacts the entire organization.</P>\n<P><BR />We are happy to share that we have rolled out an <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/samples/app-templates#incentives-app\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Incentives Power Apps based template</A> that allows management and tracking of incentives to encourage employee participation in desired activities. As with all the other <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/samples/app-templates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">app templates</A>, this is an open-source production-ready app template that can be deployed quickly to complement your adoption and change management activities.</P>\n<P><BR />Using the Incentives app template in Microsoft Teams, admins can establish adoption activities with points, assign points for completion, create rewards, and specify required eligibility point levels for rewards.&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"1_Incentives_CreateNewIncentiveCode.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/186729i5D8E5761F1DE3EE4/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"1_Incentives_CreateNewIncentiveCode.gif\" alt=\"1_Incentives_CreateNewIncentiveCode.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Employees can use the app to view their accumulated points, track their position on a leaderboard, and upon reaching eligibility, request and claim rewards.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"2_Incentives_CollectPoints.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/186730i29692AD593EA3D66/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"2_Incentives_CollectPoints.gif\" alt=\"2_Incentives_CollectPoints.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>As an example, let’s say you use this for rolling out Microsoft Teams within your organization. You can create activities like “Attend a local roadshow”, “Join a live event (townhall) about the upcoming changes”, “Attend a training session on effective meetings in Teams” and so on… On completion of each activity users can collect points and compete for a position on the leaderboard.</P>\n<P><BR />I used MS Teams rollout as an example but as you have envisioned by now, the same app could be leveraged for coordinating any other system or process change like a new HR system, switching to new project management templates or perhaps as part of your go-green initiatives. Key is to remember this is a tool that can be used to setup the activities and behaviors you want to encourage. Don’t forget to provide the right level of motivation (leaderboard, physical gifts, recognition amongst executives etc.) for your employees.</P>\n<P><BR />The app is built using Power App with SharePoint as the backend. All ofAll the activity and rewards configuration is stored in SharePoint lists. The “Admin” view within the app provides the ability for program owners to setup the activities and rewards directly from within the App. Since this is built using our no-code/low-code Power Platform, it lends itself really well to branding or functional changes.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>The App draws its inspiration from the <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/power-platform-phil-barnett/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Engagement App</A> built to support the transformation program and get employees excited about the changes at Europe’s largest managed medicine services provider.</STRONG> A big shoutout to Phil Barnett (Account Technology Strategist) for building the initial prototype of this app for Nova Healthcare.</P>\n<P><BR /><FONT color=\"#333333\"><FONT size=\"4\"><EM>“The NOVA Engagement PowerApp is one of the first fruits of that partnership and has proved very popular with colleagues. It’s a great tool to help increase engagement at an exciting time for our business.”</EM> </FONT></FONT><BR /><STRONG>- Darryn Gibson, Chief Executive Officer of Healthcare at Home</STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Test drive the app template <A href=\"https://github.com/OfficeDev/microsoft-teams-apps-incentives\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A> and check out the full catalog of production ready app templates <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/samples/app-templates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><BR />We would love to hear how you plan to leverage this App within your organization and look forward to your feedback!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Also read: <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/create-and-award-digital-publicly-verifiable-badges-in-teams/ba-p/1307507\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Create and award digital publicly verifiable badges in Teams</A></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 27 Apr 2020 15:00:00 we are seeing an increased need to streamline the work experience and help prioritize what is important. Following our <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/?p=234677&amp;preview=1&amp;_ppp=193dd65c50\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">recent blog</A><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG>on Teams product news, we are excited to announce our newest device innovation, Microsoft Teams displays, a category of all-in-one dedicated Teams devices featuring an ambient touchscreen, and a hands-free experience powered by Cortana.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We brought Microsoft Teams phones to market about 3 years ago and have seen an accelerated expansion of devices, presenting a wide selection of devices for customers to choose from. Today, we are reimagining the personal workspace with Microsoft Teams displays by integrating the Teams collaboration and communication experience into your home and workplace with high fidelity audio and video.</P>\n<P><LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://youtu.be/Fpxud22iE0E\" align=\"center\" size=\"large\" width=\"600\" height=\"338\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/Fpxud22iE0E/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">1. All-in-one dedicated Teams devices</FONT></STRONG><BR />Microsoft Teams displays bring together your favorite Teams features: chat, meetings, calls, calendar, and files into a single device, promoting human connection in the remote workplace. With Teams displays, you can enjoy a high-quality microphone, camera, and speakers (or Bluetooth headset) for a reliable calling and meeting experience.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Formfactor w PC.png\" style=\"width: 900px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/204640iB7C7F9C1CF17180E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Formfactor w PC.png\" alt=\"Dedicated Teams devices like Bluetooth headsets (left) and displays (center) create a more reliable calling and meeting experience.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Dedicated Teams devices like Bluetooth headsets (left) and displays (center) create a more reliable calling and meeting experience.</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>2. Glanceable ambient personalizable displays</STRONG> </FONT><BR />Microsoft Teams displays help you stay on top of your busy work with always-on displays highlighting important activities and notifications and removing distractions from your primary work device. Also, you can personalize your Microsoft Teams displays by changing your wallpaper and additional personalization options will become available.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Microsoft Teams Displays2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/203593i3D222D88875FB383/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Microsoft Teams Displays2.png\" alt=\"Microsoft Teams displays can be personalized to include wallpapers and highligh important activities and notifications.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Microsoft Teams displays can be personalized to include wallpapers and highligh important activities and notifications.</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">3. Hands-free voice assistance with Cortana</FONT></STRONG><BR />Microsoft Teams displays allow you to speak in natural language to effortlessly join and present in meetings, dictate replies to a Teams chat, and more. You can make requests to Cortana like \"What is on my calendar today?\", \"Share this document with Megan\", \"Join my next meeting\", “Add Joe to this meeting\", \"Present the quarterly review deck\".</P>\n<P><VIDEO autoplay=\"autoplay\" loop=\"loop\" muted=\"\" width=\"950\" height=\"475\">\n<SOURCE src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/Teams/CortanaNEWUICompressed.mp4\n\" type=\"video/mp4\"></SOURCE></VIDEO></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>4. Better together with your PC</STRONG> </FONT><BR />Microsoft Teams displays seamlessly integrate with your PC to bring a companion experience that allows for seamless cross-device interaction. You can easily lock and unlock both devices from your connected PC, open files or messages then easily transition to your PC, and join meetings from either device with a distributed meeting experience across both devices.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Better Together.png\" style=\"width: 900px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/204641i70FBA3D6D7B28667/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Better Together.png\" alt=\"Using Microsoft Teams displays allows for a distributed meeting experience across devices.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Using Microsoft Teams displays allows for a distributed meeting experience across devices.</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>5. Enterprise privacy, security, and compliance</STRONG> </FONT><BR />Microsoft Teams displays ensure user's privacy and meets enterprise-grade security and compliance in several ways:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>With a camera shutter and microphone mute switch, users can feel assured that your conversations and video will remain private.</LI>\n<LI>IT admins can securely manage, update, and monitor Microsoft Teams displays through the Teams admin portal.</LI>\n<LI>Users will securely sign in with their enterprise Azure Active Directory credentials.</LI>\n<LI>Voice assistance experiences are delivered using <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/misc/cortana-integration?view=o365-worldwide\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Cortana enterprise-grade services</A> that meet Microsoft 365 privacy, security and compliance commitments.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"MicrosoftTeams-image (10) (1).png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/204293i2B79E79BA2CD450C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"MicrosoftTeams-image (10) (1).png\" alt=\"MicrosoftTeams-image (10) (1).png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>With Cortana built-in, the <A href=\"https://www.lenovo.com/us/en/virtual-reality-and-smart-devices/smart-office/thinksmart/Lenovo-CD-18781/p/ZZISZSCCD03?cid=us:sem|se|msn|TFSM1Q12YF|nx_lenovo+all+products_dsa|all+products|lenovo.com%2Fus%2Fen%2F|b|291341335|1267736979876999|dat-2331033370375915:loc-190|dsa|mixed&amp;ef_id=:G:s&amp;s_kwcid=AL!4030!3!!b!!o!!lenovo.com%2Fus%2Fen%2F!291341335!1267736979876999&amp;msclkid=351c5ef411c11fca9acc001520ae1d74\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Lenovo ThinkSmart View</A> will be the first Microsoft Teams display to market, with Yealink also delivering one of the first devices in this category. 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"What’s New in Microsoft Teams | June 2020","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/what-s-new-in-microsoft-teams-june-2020/ba-p/1489142","description":"<P><FONT color=\"#000000\">Microsoft Teams continues to evolve to be the hub for teamwork and we're excited to share new functionality that helps people do their best work. We have new meetings, calling, devices, chat and collaboration, IT admin, and industry features this month! Check out our new capabilities below.</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: Meetings, Calling, &amp; Devices</FONT></STRONG></P>\n<P><FONT color=\"#000000\">We are transforming the meetings experience in Teams to include new features, settings, and devices to create a better experience, allowing you to get the most out of your meetings and achieve more together.</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Large gallery view</STRONG><BR />Being able to see all of your colleagues’ faces at the same time makes a big difference in engagement and connection. <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2020/06/15/helping-teachers-students-microsoft-teams/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Coming to preview this month</A> with general availability coming soon, large gallery view expands the Teams grid view to 7×7, which will accommodate up to 49 participants at once on a single screen.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"65412_TEAMS_DYNAMIC_STAGE_7x7_SURFACE_v04_1400px (1) (1).png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/201066i36A9995E5C348ABD/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"65412_TEAMS_DYNAMIC_STAGE_7x7_SURFACE_v04_1400px (1) (1).png\" alt=\"Large gallery view in Microsoft Teams meetings showing 49 participants at once on a single screen.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Large gallery view in Microsoft Teams meetings showing 49 participants at once on a single screen.</span></span><BR /><BR /></P>\n<P><STRONG>Virtual Breakout Rooms</STRONG><BR /><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2020/06/15/helping-teachers-students-microsoft-teams/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Announced earlier this month</A>, Breakout Rooms allow meeting organizers to split their Teams meeting participants into small groups to assist ideation, brainstorming, learning, and discussions. Teams facilitates this by assigning participants into a requested number of rooms—whether automatically directing people or prompting them to join. Organizers can jump in between meetings on their own—or when requested by a participant—, provide announcements to the individual rooms, and recall everyone back to the meeting at any time. Any collaboration and coauthoring done during the breakout can be shared back to the larger meeting once everyone is back together. Breakout Rooms will be delivered later this calendar year.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Multi-Window for Meetings &amp; Calling</STRONG><BR />Multi-window experiences are coming to Teams meetings and calling. You will have the ability to pop out meetings and calling into separate windows to help them optimize their workflow. These experiences can be turned on directly within Teams for PC and Mac clients.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"multi-window-meeting.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/202420i7D7B1F0D6380B48D/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"multi-window-meeting.png\" alt=\"Multi-window capability coming to Microsoft Teams meetings and calling.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Multi-window capability coming to Microsoft Teams meetings and calling.</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Teams meeting attendee limit increases to 300 participants</STRONG><BR />To help meet rapidly changing communication and meeting needs, we are increasing the maximum number of participants allowed in a Teams meeting to 300. This is generally available today.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New experience for launching instant channel meetings</STRONG><BR />Meet Now buttons in Teams channels will have a new home. You will soon find them in the Channel header where you can easily find and launch a channel meeting.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"channel_meetings_dither.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/201852i2DD084D009AD8E17/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"channel_meetings_dither.jpg\" alt=\"Meet Now buttons can now be found on the right side of a Channel header in Microsoft Teams.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Meet Now buttons can now be found on the right side of a Channel header in Microsoft Teams.</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>PSTN participant phone numbers masked from external users</STRONG><BR />For customers with Audio Conferencing enabled for Teams meetings, PSTN participants’ phone numbers will be masked to all users who have joined from outside of your organization. This feature is rolling out soon for PC, Mac, web, and mobile clients.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"2.1.png\" style=\"width: 200px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/201223iA5C3E3A3311FFD86/image-size/small?v=1.0&amp;px=200\" title=\"2.1.png\" alt=\"PSTN participant phone numbers are masked with asterisks to users outside of your organization.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">PSTN participant phone numbers are masked with asterisks to users outside of your organization.</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Safe Transfer</STRONG><BR />You will now be able to transfer a call safely to any other user in your organization. Safely means that if the target user does not answer the call, it will ring back to the transferrer. The person transferring the call must be a Teams user. The person the call is being transferred to must be either a Teams or Skype for Business user in the same tenant or in a federated tenant. This is used commonly used by reception, administrators, operators, and anyone who might be delegate for another user.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New Session Border Controllers (SBC) certified for use with Microsoft Teams Calling</STRONG><BR />The popularity of Direct Routing to connect PSTN services to Teams has been amazing. One of the key ingredients are Session Border Controllers. Customers have always asked for more certified SBC options as part of their Direct Routing deployment. We are excited that Cisco and Avaya will join our certification list. To learn more about Direct Routing deployment and certified Session Border Controllers, please read our <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/direct-routing-border-controllers\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">documentation</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P data-unlink=\"true\"><STRONG>Bose announces new Microsoft Teams peripheral</STRONG> <BR />We welcome Bose to the Teams peripheral family with the addition of Bose Noise Cancelling Headphones 700 UC, now certified for Microsoft Teams! Bose’s new over-the-ear headphones not only lets users enjoy their meetings without distractions but also allows them to have a high-quality meeting experience whether you are at home, outside, or at work. With a USB Bluetooth adaptor and a Teams Button that lets users launch Teams to join meetings or check voice mails, NC700UC Teams certified headphones allow users to have reliable and instantaneous connection to Teams. Bose’s new Teams certified headphones will become available in August, 2020. You can learn more <A href=\"https://pro.bose.com/en_us/products/conferencing/headphones/noise-cancelling-headphones-700-conferencing.html?mc=25_PN_UC_GM_00__MicrosoftBlog700s\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"3.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Bose Noise Cancelling Headphones 700 UC</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New capabilities on Microsoft Teams phones</STRONG><BR />This month, we are excited to release <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/new-capabilities-on-microsoft-teams-phones-l-june-2020/ba-p/1496457\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">new features and capabilities</A> on Microsoft Teams phones including People app and raise hands to improve parity with your Teams desktop experience.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><EM><STRONG>People app</STRONG></EM> to easily organize your contacts by creating and managing contact groups.</P>\n<P shows contacts in an organized way.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The People app on Microsoft Teams phones shows contacts in an organized way.</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><EM><STRONG>Live captions</STRONG></EM> to see real time captions in meetings (Live Captions is currently a preview feature in Microsoft Teams and available in English (US) for now).</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><BR /><EM><STRONG>Raise hand</STRONG></EM> to let people know you want to contribute without interrupting the conversation.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><BR /><EM><STRONG>Lock/Unlock with your PC</STRONG></EM> to enable a coordinated and seamless lock and unlock experience between your Teams phone and your PC. To learn more about how to set up this feature, click <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/new-capabilities-on-microsoft-teams-phones-l-june-2020/ba-p/1496457\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"5.6.png\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/201219iAD79A7E9C9E1D0C1/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"5.6.png\" alt=\"The lock and unlock experience between your Teams phone and your PC.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The lock and unlock experience between your Teams phone and your PC.</span></span></P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><BR /><EM><STRONG>One click call transfer</STRONG> </EM>so you can easily transfer your calls to your frequent contacts with a single touch.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><BR /><EM><STRONG>Teams and Skype interoperability</STRONG></EM> – Last month, we <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/teams-and-skype-inter-op-now-available/ba-p/1469083\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">announced this capability</A> on Teams; by end of June, users will be able to make and receive audio and video calls from Skype for Consumer (SFC) through Microsoft Teams phones</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New Teams features available for Surface Hub</STRONG><BR />The latest Surface Hub app update <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/surface-hub/hub-teams-app\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">0.2020.13201.0</A>, is now available through the Windows Store. This update delivers several highly requested features to the Teams experience on Surface Hub.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>3x3 gallery view: view up to nine meeting participants simultaneously in full screen mode,<BR />in the new 3x3 video grid</LI>\n<LI>External user search: Through the “Meet Now” feature on Surface Hub, you can now search and initiate 1:1 calls with federated Teams or Skype for Business users</LI>\n<LI>Incoming PSTN calls: in addition to making outgoing PSTN calls through Teams, Surface Hub you can now receive incoming PSTN calls</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>This update is available to both Surface Hub and Surface Hub 2S.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Scheduled meetings coming to the free version of Teams</STRONG> <BR /><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/microsoft-teams/free?ms.officeurl=teamsfree&amp;rtc=1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Teams free</A> users can now schedule meetings and send out invitations in advance! You will have the option of either copying the meeting link to send or you can send the meeting invite via your Outlook or Google calendar. Currently, there is no time limit on meetings in the free version of Teams.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Free meetings GIF.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/201853i2A57F25DBFB430E3/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Free meetings GIF.gif\" alt=\"Microsoft Teams free users can schedule meetings and send out invitations via your Outlook calendar.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Microsoft Teams free users can schedule meetings and send out invitations via your Outlook calendar.</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>What’s New: Chat &amp; Collaboration</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><FONT color=\"#000000\">We added new chat and collaboration capabilities to keep teams connected at all times, no matter where they're working from.&nbsp;</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Teams Mobile On-Demand Chat Translation</STRONG><BR />Inline message translation ensures that everyone has a voice and facilitate global collaboration. With a simple click, people who speak different languages can fluidly communicate with one another by translating posts in channels and chat. On-Demand Chat Translation has already been available on desktop and web, and now will be available on iOS.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Priority notifications</STRONG><BR />Originally announced in June 2019, <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/article/mark-a-message-as-important-or-urgent-in-teams-ea99d5b6-1317-4550-8d75-86ff14cd4462\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">priority notifications</A> for Microsoft Teams grants you the ability to continually send notifications that repeat every two minutes for up to 20 minutes on all messages marked as urgent. Priority notifications had been made available as a promotion to all Teams customers* until the second half of 2020.</P>\n<P><BR />Effective immediately, we have ended this promotion and made priority notifications available to all Teams customers* as a basic capability. Users will now be able to send and receive unlimited urgent messages with priority notification. Learn more about <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/messaging-policies-in-teams\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">managing priority notifications</A>.</P>\n<P><BR /><FONT size=\"2\"><EM>*Priority notifications are not currently available for GCC, GCC High, or DoD customers, however this is on the <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=Microsoft%20Teams&amp;searchterms=priority%2Cnotifications\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft 365 Roadmap</A> for next month.</EM></FONT></P>\n<P><FONT size=\"2\"><EM><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"7.png\" style=\"width: 533px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/201103i97A9201E984E1210/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"7.png\" alt=\"Priority notifications can be found in the message actions tray.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Priority notifications can be found in the message actions tray.</span></span></EM></FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Pulse Survey Templates</STRONG><BR />During this time, many companies are working remotely and need to collect information from their employee base while planning for their eventual return to the office. We have designed several Microsoft Forms templates for sentiment, employee issues, challenges, and health status surveys and more. These surveys can then be deployed via Teams channels. Learn more <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-forms-blog/what-s-new-in-microsoft-forms-integrations-may-june-2020/ba-p/1472356\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>. To get started, click <A href=\"https://c3web.trafficmanager.net/topic/4ebf181b-9a0d-4921-a477-5954e94cfa04\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>What’s New: IT Admin</STRONG> </FONT><BR />The Teams Power Shell improvements will enhance IT admins experience with significant performance and resilience improvements in the modules and simplified access to their required Cmdlets with improved clarity on the Cmdlets scope.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Teams Power Shell (PS) modules improvements</STRONG></P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><STRONG>Moving Teams Beta module to production gallery</STRONG> <BR />Centralize all the Teams management modules in the same production module. Moving the Beta module that hosted on PostTestGallery into the same Team Power Shell production module on PSGallery, (PSGallery is the standard home for all Teams management Cmdlets in Power Shell). The Team Beta module will be tagged with “Preview” name. This improvement provides a simplified IT admin experience through:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">Easier access to required Cmdlets, when bringing the module into one common place. For example, ‘manage Private Channels’ in Teams, is a required Cmdlets that was resided in a Teams beta module and is moved to be handy in the production gallery.</LI>\n<LI class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">Faster time to GA - The Cmdlets are more discoverable and treated with the full processes that go into a Public Preview release.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><BR /><STRONG>Refined technical documentation set</STRONG> <BR />Based on IT Admins’ feedback we have refreshed and updated all Teams Power Shell documentation, making it easier to discover what’s in production vs. preview and shipping release notes for each release.</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>For more information please link to the <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-powershell-overview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Teams Power Shell overview page</A>.</STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Developer &amp; Platform</STRONG></FONT><BR />We are announcing incoming webhooks for adaptive cards in Teams to continue to provide a rich canvas for developers to build, engage, and transform workflows.</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>Incoming Webhooks for Adaptive Cards</STRONG><BR />We are excited to announce that incoming webhooks in Teams now support Adaptive Cards and is generally available! Developers will now be able to take advantage of the rich and flexible capabilities within Adaptive Cards to send content via incoming webhooks in Teams from their web service. This feature has been one of the most desired asks in UserVoice by our Teams developer community over the past two years, and we are excited to finally deliver this. For more details, please see our technical blog post <A href=\"https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-teams/blogs/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"adaptive card.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/201214i24716B38DE1B194F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"adaptive card.png\" alt=\"Incoming webhooks in Microsoft Teams now support Adaptive Cards.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Incoming webhooks in Microsoft Teams now support Adaptive Cards.</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Teams for Education</STRONG></FONT><BR />We continue to implement new ways for Teams to support student engagement and professional development.</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>Class Insights</STRONG><BR />Class Insights enables educators to see and understand student engagement using intelligent data analytics. You can see grades and track engagement in meetings, communications and assignments from the whole class or an individual student. Generally available, with a new and improved dashboard to drive student outcomes will be coming in the fall.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"8.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/201215i8BC92AE37C64DE42/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"8.jpg\" alt=\"Class Insights dashboard in Microsoft Teams allows educators to use intelligent data analytics to understand student engagement.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Class Insights dashboard in Microsoft Teams allows educators to use intelligent data analytics to understand student engagement.</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>To see the <STRONG>latest 20+ updates for Teams for Education</STRONG> check out <A href=\"http://aka.ms/TeamsUpdatesJune2020\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">aka.ms/TeamsUpdatesJune2020</A>. Here are the new capabilities for GCC customers.</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>Live captions in Teams meetings</STRONG><BR />This enables meeting participants to view live captions during a Teams meeting. Supported spoken languages in this release is English (EN-US). This is currently available for GCC customers on desktop and does not yet include GCC High and DoD environments.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Enable organizers to change lobby settings for PSTN meeting participants</STRONG> <BR />Any user who schedules a Microsoft Teams meeting will now see a separate setting to control the lobby for PSTN participants in the Meeting Options page of a given meeting. This will be available for GCC customers.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Announce when PSTN participants join/leave the meeting</STRONG> <BR />Any user who schedules a Teams meeting will now see a new setting in Meeting Options page of a meeting to control the announcement sound when a PSTN/dial-in participant joins or leaves the meeting. This will be available for GCC customers.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Shifts in Teams now available for GCC customers</STRONG><BR />Shifts in Microsoft Teams will enable GCC customers to transform schedule management for their Firstline Workforce.
