07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Introducing Microsoft Call Quality Power BI Connector (aka CQD Power BI Connector)","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/introducing-microsoft-call-quality-power-bi-connector-aka-cqd/ba-p/1236863","description":"<P>For many years, our IT Admins have asked us to enable them to build their own call quality/reliability reports.&nbsp; We are happy to share that you are now empowered to build your own reports, powered by <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/introducing-the-advanced-call-quality-dashboard/ba-p/972586\" target=\"_self\">Advanced Call Quality Dashboard</A> data.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"CQD8.png\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/178004i68AA2A7986F5C5E2/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"CQD8.png\" alt=\"CQD8.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><A title=\"https://github.com/microsoftdocs/officedocs-skypeforbusiness/blob/live/teams/downloads/cqd-power-bi-query-templates.zip?raw=true\" href=\"https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/OfficeDocs-SkypeForBusiness/blob/live/Teams/downloads/CQD-Power-BI-query-templates.zip?raw=true\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><SPAN style=\"font-family: 'Segoe UI',sans-serif;\">Download Microsoft Call Quality Power BI Connector</SPAN></A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;<STRONG><BR />Microsoft Call Quality Power BI Connector Installation</STRONG></P>\n<P>The process for installing a custom connector and adjusting security to enable use of the connector is described in detail in the <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/desktop-connector-extensibility\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Power BI documentation</A>. For the sake of simplicity though, a quick explanation is provided below:</P>\n<OL>\n<LI>Check to see if your computer already has a <EM>[Documents]\\Power BI Desktop\\Custom Connectors</EM>&nbsp;folder. If not, create this folder.<SUP>1</SUP></LI>\n<LI>Download the connector file (either a <EM>*.mez</EM> or <EM>*.pqx</EM> file) and place it in the <EM>Custom Connectors</EM> directory.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>If the connector file is a <EM>*.mez</EM> file, </STRONG>you will also need to adjust your security settings as described in the <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/desktop-connector-extensibility#data-extension-security\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">custom connector setup documentation</A>.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P>If a new version of the Microsoft Call Quality Power BI Connector is released, simply replace the old connector file in the <EM>Custom Connectors</EM> directory with the new file.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Microsoft Call Quality Power BI Connector Setup</STRONG></P>\n<P>In order to build a report and run queries, you will first need to connect to the CQD data source. Follow the steps below in order to connect:</P>\n<OL>\n<LI>In the Home tab of Power BI Desktop, click on <EM>Get Data</EM>.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"CQD1.PNG\" style=\"width: 263px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/178007i463F5D15547B1B0F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"CQD1.PNG\" alt=\"CQD1.PNG\" /></span></P>\n<OL start=\"2\">\n<LI>The <EM>Get Data</EM> window should appear at this point. Navigate to <EM>Online Services</EM>, then select <EM>Microsoft Call Quality (Beta)</EM> and hit <EM>Connect</EM>.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"CQD2.png\" style=\"width: 470px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/178008i497CFE376A76C6DC/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"CQD2.png\" alt=\"CQD2.png\" /></span></P>\n<OL start=\"3\">\n<LI>You will be prompted to login next. Use the same credentials that you use for CQD.<SUP>2</SUP></LI>\n<LI>The next prompt will give you the option between two <EM>Data Connectivity modes</EM>. Select <EM>DirectQuery</EM> and hit <EM>OK</EM>.</LI>\n<LI>Finally, you will be given a final prompt showing you the entire data model for CQD. No data will be visible at this point, only the data model for CQD. Select <EM>Load</EM> to complete the setup process.</LI>\n<LI>At this point, Power BI will load the data model onto the right side of the window. The page will remain otherwise blank, and no queries will be loaded by default. Proceed to <STRONG>Building Queries</STRONG> below in order to build a query and return data.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P>If any of the steps during this setup process were not completely clear, a more detailed explanation of the process can be found <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/desktop-quickstart-connect-to-data\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Building Queries using Microsoft Call Quality Power BI Connector</STRONG></P>\n<P>Once setup is complete, you should see the names of several hundred dimensions and measures load in the <EM>Fields </EM>pane. Constructing actual queries from here is simple, just select the dimensions and measures you want for your query, then drag and drop them onto the page. Here’s a more detailed explanation, with a simple example:</P>\n<OL>\n<LI>Select the visualization you want to use from the <EM>Visualizations</EM> pane. A blank version of that visualization should appear on the page. For the purposes of this example, we will be using the <EM>Table</EM> visualization.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"CQD3.PNG\" style=\"width: 186px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/178009iF0A50F355000E2AE/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"CQD3.PNG\" alt=\"CQD3.PNG\" /></span></P>\n<OL start=\"2\">\n<LI>Determine which dimensions and measures (denoted by an aggregation symbol by their name) you wish to use for your query, then manually select them and drag them onto the black visualization. Alternately, drag them onto the <EM>Values</EM> field beneath the visualization options.</LI>\n</OL>\n<DIV id=\"tinyMceEditorSiunie Sutjahjo_8\" class=\"mceNonEditable lia-copypaste-placeholder\">&nbsp;</DIV>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><STRONG>Important Note: </STRONG>Call Quality Dashboard requires a measure for any query to run. Failure to add a measure to a query will cause that query to fail.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<OL start=\"3\">\n<LI>Next, select any dimensions you want to filter on and drag them to the <EM>Filters on this visual </EM>field in the <EM>Filters</EM> pane. The Microsoft Call Quality Power BI Connector currently supports <EM>Basic filtering</EM> (select values from a list of possible dimension values), <EM>Advanced filtering</EM> (manually specify values and operands to filter on, similar to Advanced CQD), and <EM>Relative date filtering</EM> (only available for the <EM>End Time</EM> and <EM>Start Time</EM> dimensions). Filtering according to <EM>Top N</EM> is not supported by CQD.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"CQD5.PNG\" style=\"width: 201px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/178011i3570564143132777/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"CQD5.PNG\" alt=\"CQD5.PNG\" /></span></P>\n<OL start=\"4\">\n<LI>Finally, select the <EM>Format</EM> tab within the <EM>Visualizations</EM> pane to style and format your query.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Note: </STRONG>CQD queries require at least one measure in order to run. If your query does not load, double check that you have included a measure in the query.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Creating a Drill-through Report</STRONG></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/desktop-drillthrough\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Drillthrough in Power BI</A> allows you to create focused reports that you can quickly filter using the values of other reports as context. Once you know how to create your first query with the Microsoft Call Quality Power BI Connector, creating a drillthrough is even simpler.</P>\n<OL>\n<LI>Create another page for the focused report, and then add your queries to that page.</LI>\n<LI>Select the dimension you want to use as a drillthrough filter and drag them onto the <EM>Drillthrough </EM>field under on the <EM>Visualizations </EM>pane.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"CQD6.PNG\" style=\"width: 188px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/178012i540A6404B639D2B0/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"CQD6.PNG\" alt=\"CQD6.PNG\" /></span></P>\n<OL start=\"3\">\n<LI><STRONG>That’s it! </STRONG>Any other query on another page that uses that dimension can now drillthrough to that page, automatically applying the drillthrough dimension’s value as a filter.<BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"CQD7.PNG\" style=\"width: 366px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/178235i770E116BD735F108/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"CQD7.PNG\" alt=\"CQD7.PNG\" /></span></LI>\n</OL>\n<P>Unlike Advanced CQD, Power BI supports non-sequential drill-through. As long as a query includes the necessary dimension, it can drill-through to any other page.</P>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>Limitations</STRONG></P>\n<P>Despite making use of Power BI, not all Power BI functionality is support by the Microsoft Call Quality Power BI Connector, either as a result of limitations on CQD data model (such as non existent data) or on DirectQuery connectors in general. The list below notes some of the Connector’s more noteworthy limitations, but this list should not be considered exhaustive:</P>\n<OL>\n<LI><STRONG>Calculated Columns – </STRONG>DirectQuery connectors in general have limited support for calculated columns in Power BI. While some calculated columns may work with the Connector, these should be considered exceptions. As a general rule, calculated columns will not function.</LI>\n</OL>\n<OL start=\"2\">\n<LI><STRONG>Aggregations – </STRONG>The CQD data model is built on a cube model, meaning that aggregations are already supported in the form of measures. Attempting to manually add aggregations to different dimensions or changing the aggregation type of a measure will not work with the Connector, and it will generally result in an error.</LI>\n</OL>\n<OL start=\"3\">\n<LI><STRONG>Custom Visuals – </STRONG>While the Microsoft Call Quality Power BI Connector does work with a range of custom visuals, we are unable to guarantee compatibility with all custom visuals. Many custom visuals rely on the use of calculated columns or imported data, neither or which are supported by DirectQuery connectors.</LI>\n</OL>\n<OL start=\"4\">\n<LI><STRONG>Referencing Cached Data – </STRONG>Power BI currently does not support referencing cached data from a DirectQuery connector in any way. Any attempt to reference the results of a query will result in a new query.</LI>\n</OL>\n<OL start=\"5\">\n<LI><STRONG>Relative Data Filtering – </STRONG>Is supported in the Call Quality Power BI Connector, but only with the <EM>Start Time</EM> and <EM>End Time</EM> dimensions. Although the <EM>Date</EM> dimension may be the obvious choice for relative date filtering, <EM>Date</EM> is not stored as a date time object and thus does not support relative date filtering in Power BI.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P>Please note, although the Connector is in preview, these limitations are unlikely to change with the final release of the Connector. Most of these issues are either restrictions to DirectQuery connector design in Power BI or fundamental to the design of the CQD data model.</P>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>Error Codes</STRONG></P>\n<P>Because the Microsoft Call Quality Power BI Connector is less restricted than the browser app in terms of kinds of queries you can construct, you may occasionally encounter a number of errors while building your queries. In the event that you receive an error message of the type “CQDError. RunQuery – Query Execution Error”, reference the list below with the ErrorType number provided in order to troubleshoot the possible issue with the query. The following are the most common Error Type codes you may encounter with the CQD Power BI Connector:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>ErrorType 1 - Query Structure Error: </STRONG>A query structure error is typically caused by the Connector failing to build a properly formatted query. This happens most often when using unsupported functionality, as specified in the Limitations above. Double check that you are not using any calculated columns or custom visuals for that query.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>ErrorType 2 - Query Building Error: </STRONG>A query building error is caused by the Call Quality Power BI Connector being unable to properly parse the query you are attempting to build. This happens most often when using unsupported functionality, as specified in the Limitations above. Double check that you are not using any calculated columns or custom visuals for that query.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>ErrorType 5 - Execution Timeout: </STRONG>The query has reached the maximum possible runtime before timing out. Try adding more filters to the query in order to limit its scope. Narrowing the data range is often the most effective way to achieve this.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>ErrorType 7 - No Measurements Error: </STRONG>CQD queries require a measure in order to function. Double check that your query includes measure. Measures in the Call Quality Power BI Connector are denoted by the aggregation (sum) symbol before their name.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>If you encounter any additional errors outside of this scope, please notify the CQD team so that we can help troubleshoot the issue and update the documentation as appropriate.</P>\n<H3 id=\"best-practice\">Best practice</H3>\n<P>Call Quality connector queries should be designed with drillthrough functionality in mind. Instead of trying to load all the data at once, and then slicing down with filters, start with broader, low-cardinality queries and drill down to high-cardinality queries. For instance, when attempting to diagnose which subnets contribute most to quality issues, it's helpful to first identify those regions and countries which contribute to the problem, then drill down to the subnets in that region or country. The Call Quality connector templates have been designed in this manner in order to act as an example.</P>\n<P><STRONG>Other useful best practice links:&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/guidance/power-bi-optimization\" target=\"_blank\">https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/guidance/power-bi-optimization</A> <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/guidance/directquery-model-guidance\" target=\"_blank\">https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/guidance/directquery-model-guidance</A>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2 id=\"frequently-asked-questions\">Frequently asked questions</H2>\n<H3 id=\"why-does-the-connector-seem-slower-compared-to-advanced-cqd-in-the-browser-what-can-i-do-to-improve-performance\">Why does the connector seem slower compared to Advanced CQD in the browser? What can I do to improve performance?</H3>\n<P>Query performance for the various templates is actually the same in both the browser and in the connector. Just like any other standalone app, Power BI adds its authentication and rendering time to our performance. In addition, the difference comes in the number of concurrent queries being run. Because the in-browser version of CQD had less well-developed and information-dense visualization options, most of our reports were limited to loading 2-3 queries at a time. On the other hand, the connector templates often display 20+ concurrent queries. If you wish to build reports that are just as responsive as the older ones you were used to, try creating reports with no more than 2-3 queries per tab.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Footnotes</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG><SUP>1 </SUP></STRONG>Certain processes and apps (e.g. OneDrive) may cause your Documents root folder to change; make sure that the <EM>Power BI Desktop\\Custom Connectors</EM> directory is placed inside of the current root folder Documents folder.</P>\n<P><STRONG><SUP>2 </SUP></STRONG>The login credentials you use for CQD <EM>do not</EM> need to be the same credentials you use for logging into the Power BI Desktop app itself.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"1\">Copyright 2020 Microsoft Corporation</FONT></P>\n<P><FONT size=\"1\">Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of this software and associated documentation files (the \"Software\"), to deal in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:</FONT></P>\n<P><FONT size=\"1\">The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all copies or substantial portions of the Software.</FONT></P>\n<P><FONT size=\"1\">THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED \"AS IS\", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Automate teams provisioning with the Request-a-team app template","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/automate-teams-provisioning-with-the-request-a-team-app-template/ba-p/1390964","description":"<P>We have heard your feedback and are aware that enterprise and departmental leaders are working to enhance productivity and collaboration, especially across remote workforces. Microsoft Teams plays a critical role in doing this. Therefore, to support and promote strategically focused Teams enablement, we are pleased to announce the newest app template: Request-a-team.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Request-a-team provides a framework that automates the provisioning process based on core teams and channel options which are relevant to optimizing usage. This enables faster response time for team requests and offers a wealth of personalization options for organizations to implement repeatable best practices on team collaboration.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Easy to use request forms encourage and enable reuse of best practices</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>The Request-a-team app template leverages a Power Apps application to surface easy-to-complete forms for the collection of information such as business justification, access scope, and ownership. End users can create teams from scratch, reuse existing internal teams, and/or take advantage of publicly available templates published by Microsoft.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"1.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191888iC773758C9FF2AD6B/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"1.png\" alt=\"Figure 1 Landing Screen for team requests\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 1 Landing Screen for team requests</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"2.2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192088i50B980CC86D74653/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"2.2.png\" alt=\"Figure 2 Set privacy in the first step of the wizard\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 2 Set privacy in the first step of the wizard</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"4.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191896i5608CBC342BFECAB/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"4.png\" alt=\"Figure 3 Check availability of desired name and add additional detail to expose value\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 3 Check availability of desired name and add additional detail to expose value</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"3.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191895iDB6D663730166DEC/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"3.png\" alt=\"Figure 4 Follow best practices in ownership and enable member population up-front\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 4 Follow best practices in ownership and enable member population up-front</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"5.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191897i8164E9A821C5AD25/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"5.png\" alt=\"Figure 5 Review inputs to ensure accuracy prior to submission\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 5 Review inputs to ensure accuracy prior to submission</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Actionable dashboards and adaptive cards keep everyone in the know</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Once requests are submitted, it is important to keep track of progress and to respond to those requests as approvers. The Request-a-team app template offers list dashboards (shown below) and <A href=\"https://adaptivecards.io/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">adaptive cards</A> to keep everyone abreast of changes. Approvers may respond to requests either from the Approve requests tab (only visible by approvers), or within preferred channels where they can easily respond using an adaptive card. These dashboards include an extra bonus feature for cloning an existing request and give approvers an alternate place to approve/deny requests.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"UserRequests.PNG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191898iCDDAAAC539EAF4E5/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"UserRequests.PNG\" alt=\"Figure 6 List dashboard showing previous requests\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 6 List dashboard showing previous requests</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"UserApprovals.PNG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191899iD37606E145E94A5C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"UserApprovals.PNG\" alt=\"Figure 7 List dashboard showing Approve requests tab (for approvers)\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 7 List dashboard showing Approve requests tab (for approvers)</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"adaptiveCard.PNG\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191900i2064FF4A24C342CE/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"adaptiveCard.PNG\" alt=\"Figure 8 Adaptive card targeted to approver's channel\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 8 Adaptive card targeted to approver's channel</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Enable teams to hit the ground running with strategic templates</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Reuse is important to scaling knowledge across the enterprise, thus Teams has always supported building teams from templates. Teams templates are pre-built definitions of a team's structure designed around a business need or project (learn more <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoftteams/get-started-with-teams-templates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>). So, we have included this option in the Request-a-team app template in order to facilitate building teams from pre-existing internal Teams instances as well.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"9.png\" style=\"width: 298px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191901i995DF8AA5B3C77A5/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"9.png\" alt=\"9.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Haven’t had time to create reusable templates? No worries! Take advantage of the many tried and tested publicly released templates by Microsoft! Learn the purpose and description of each Microsoft template directly in the app by selecting one from the dropdown and checking out the description on the right.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"templates1.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191902i402CE13120BD7B9E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"templates1.png\" alt=\"Figure 10 List of publicly available Microsoft templates\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 10 List of publicly available Microsoft templates</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Envision, Execute, and Enable</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>We are sure you will be delighted to discover the value of the new Request-a-team app template! This new template will empower remote workers to plan new teams based on learned best practices, to execute powerful Teams instances for productivity and collaboration, and to enable employees of all levels and skill sets to get the most out of the Microsoft Teams experience! We look forward to hearing your feedback soon.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<DIV>Learn more about Microsoft Teams&nbsp;app templates <A tabindex=\"-1\" title=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoftteams/platform/samples/app-templates\" href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoftteams/platform/samples/app-templates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">here</A>.</DIV>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 18 May 2020 23:34:54 1_01f0289b3e2f05b3.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191902i402CE13120BD7B9E/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn92@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-10-165_bde700cce497c6e6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401921},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Microsoft Teams launches United Arab Emirates Data Residency","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/microsoft-teams-launches-united-arab-emirates-data-residency/ba-p/980330","description":"<P>Microsoft Teams will provide data residency for the United Arab Emirates (UAE) starting November 1, 2019. This means that all new Microsoft Teams customers in the UAE will have data for conversations and chat stored at rest in the UAE. New customers are the Office 365 tenants that are provisioned after the date of launch stated above or customers who have not yet used the Teams service prior to the date of launch.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Teams data residency in the UAE, as well as our other Office 365 data residency commitments in the data-centers located in the UAE, help regulated organizations – such as banking, public sector, government, and healthcare, – onboard to Teams and Office 365 while complying with their data residency requirements.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Where your Teams data is stored</STRONG></P>\n<P>Your Teams data is stored differently depending on the content type. Please watch the&nbsp;<A href=\"https://channel9.msdn.com/Events/Ignite/Microsoft-Ignite-Orlando-2017/BRK3071\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Ignite Breakout session on Microsoft Teams architecture for an in-depth discussion.</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Core Teams customer data</STRONG>: If a customer provisions its tenant in Australia, Canada, the European Union, France, India, Japan, South Africa, South Korea, the United Kingdom, the United Arab Emirates or the United States (US), Microsoft will store the following customer data at rest only within that location: (1) Microsoft Teams chats, team and channel conversations, images, voicemail messages, and contacts, (2) SharePoint Online site content and the files stored within that site, and (3) files uploaded to OneDrive for Business.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><STRONG>Chat, channel messages, team structure:</STRONG>&nbsp;Every team in Microsoft Teams is backed by an Office 365 Group and its SharePoint site and Exchange mailbox. Private chats (including group chats), messages sent as part of a conversation in a channel, and the structure of teams and channels are stored in a chat service running in Azure. The data is also stored in a hidden folder in the user and group mailboxes to enable&nbsp;<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-Teams-Blog/Top-Features-of-Microsoft-Teams-amp-Information-Protection-in/ba-p/63046\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Information Protection features</A>.</LI>\n<LI style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><STRONG>Voicemail and Contacts:</STRONG>&nbsp;Voicemails are stored in Exchange. Contacts are stored in Exchange-based cloud data store. Exchange and the Exchange-based cloud store already provide data residency in each of the worldwide datacenter geos. For all teams, customers voicemail and contacts are stored in-country for Australia, Canada, France, South Africa, India, Japan, UK, South Korea, the UAE, and the US. For all other countries, files are stored in the US, Europe, or Asia-Pacific location based on tenant affinity.</LI>\n<LI style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><STRONG>Images and Media:</STRONG>&nbsp;Media used in chats (except for Giphy GIFs which are not stored but are a reference link to the original Giphy service URL – Giphy is a non-Microsoft service) is stored in an Azure-based media service that is deployed to the same locations as the chat service.</LI>\n<LI style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><STRONG>Files</STRONG>: Files (including OneNote and Wiki) that somebody shares in a channel are stored in the team’s SharePoint site. Files shared in a private chat or a chat during a meeting or call are uploaded and stored in the OneDrive for the Business account of the user who shares the file. Exchange, SharePoint, and OneDrive already provide data residency in each of the worldwide datacenter geos. So, for existing customers, all files, OneNote notebooks, Teams wiki content, and mailboxes that are part of the Teams experience are already stored in the location based on your tenant affinity. Files are stored in-country for Australia, Canada, France, South Africa, India, Japan, UK, South Korea and the UAE. For all other countries, files are stored in the US, Europe, or Asia Pacific location based on tenant affinity.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>This rollout furthers the in-country data residency capabilities of Microsoft Teams. As of this release, the Microsoft Teams services described above store data at rest in the following locations:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><STRONG>New!</STRONG> United Arab Emirates datacenters in Abu Dhabi and Dubai.</LI>\n<LI style=\"font-weight: 400;\">South Africa datacenters in Johannesburg and Cape Town</LI>\n<LI style=\"font-weight: 400;\">France: datacenters in Marseille and Paris</LI>\n<LI style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Australia: datacenters in New South Wales and Victoria</LI>\n<LI style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Japan: datacenters in Tokyo(Saitama) and Osaka</LI>\n<LI style=\"font-weight: 400;\">APAC [Asia Pacific]: datacenters in Singapore and Hong Kong</LI>\n<LI style=\"font-weight: 400;\">EMEA [Europe, Middle East, and Asia]: datacenters in Dublin &amp; Amsterdam</LI>\n<LI style=\"font-weight: 400;\">AMER [Americas – North, and South]: datacenters in Bay, CA and Boydton, VA</LI>\n<LI style=\"font-weight: 400;\">UK: datacenters in Cardiff and London</LI>\n<LI style=\"font-weight: 400;\">India: datacenters in Chennai and Pune</LI>\n<LI style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Canada: datacenters in Quebec City and Toronto</LI>\n<LI style=\"font-weight: 400;\">South Korea: datacenters in Seoul and Busan</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>Please note that customers that allow users to store files with a third-party storage provider are dependent on the storage location of those services and should, therefore, review the location of data at rest for those services separately.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<OL>\n<LI style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><STRONG>Tabs:&nbsp;</STRONG>Tabs allow users to pin information from apps and services to a channel. Thus, it varies by type of the tab where the data is stored. The tab itself does not store any data. For example, a SharePoint tab will store data based on where the SharePoint site collection was provisioned. A tab that includes information from a partner will store the data directly in the system used by the partner and only present a view of it.</LI>\n<LI style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><STRONG>Other partner apps:</STRONG>&nbsp;Microsoft does not provide any data residency support for apps and services from partners that you might be using within the Microsoft Teams experience. Please review information from those solutions directly to learn about where their data is being stored.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P>We will continue to roll out Microsoft Teams to more local datacenters aligned with the Office 365 data residency strategy.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>FAQ</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>Which workloads inside Teams provide data residency in the United Arab Emirates?</STRONG></P>\n<P>Exchange Online and SharePoint Online provide data residency in the United Arab Emirates. Please see the&nbsp;<A href=\"https://products.office.com/where-is-your-data-located?geo=All\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">datacenter maps</A>&nbsp;for more information about the location of data at rest for more Office 365 services and for all our geos in the world.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Where exactly in the United Arab Emirates is this data stored?</STRONG></P>\n<P>Teams chat and media data will be stored in the UAE Central and UAE North Azure datacenters located in Abu Dhabi and Dubai respectively.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>What does this mean for new customers in the United Arab Emirates?</STRONG></P>\n<P>From November 4, 2019 (“Launch Date”), customers from the United Arab Emirates who have never previously logged into Microsoft Teams (i.e., no user in their tenant has ever accessed teams.microsoft.com or signed into any Teams client app) will have data residency in the UAE.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>What does this mean for existing customers in the United Arab Emirates?</STRONG></P>\n<P>Customers who are already using Teams will continue to have data residency for their content stored at rest in the EMEA location.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>If I have more questions, who should I talk to?</STRONG></P>\n<P>Please do not hesitate to contact your Account Team or&nbsp;<A href=\"https://fasttrack.microsoft.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">FastTrack</A>&nbsp;if you have more questions about Teams deployments and how the availability of data residency in the UAE affects your timelines to deploy. Based on your requirements, they will recommend the best approach for you.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Thanks again for your time in reading this and for all the support you’ve shown towards Microsoft Teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Ken Hardy</P>\n<P>Principal PM Manager, Microsoft Teams</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 12 Nov 2019 17:49:50 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"db3cf1df197e8518c33540bb01b5a053","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Ken_Hardy","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401927},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Empower your employees to capture customer feedback in Microsoft Teams","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/empower-your-employees-to-capture-customer-feedback-in-microsoft/ba-p/1374523","description":"<P><FONT size=\"4\"><EM>Use the insights for course correction &amp; future innovation</EM></FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Customer feedback is vital to ensure you and your organization are building products and services that meet the right need. It helps organizations build and refine product strategy and focus their energies on innovation that addresses a need or a challenge. The importance of customer feedback cannot be overstated and yet there aren’t many businesses that capture this feedback systematically.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Wouldn’t it be awesome if you could capture actionable feedback in real time when the customer was in your store and understand what they liked or didn’t like? Would it be helpful if you could capture feedback from a passenger that rode the 5 PM train to get home or the person that walked into your store looking for a laptop but left without making a purchase? And who better to capture that feedback than your Firstline staff that works directly with your customers? Your Firstline workers – retail associates in your organization, service technicians, flight crew members, guest services etc. – are the backbone of your organization and the voice of your customer. With almost 80% of the global workforce comprised of Firstline workers, that is a huge untapped resource that can be leveraged to glean insights that can help grow your business.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The new <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/samples/app-templates#associate-insights-app\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Associate Insights App template</A> for Microsoft Teams helps you empower your employees to capture customer opinion &amp; sentiment quickly and securely. Built using our low-code/no-code Power Platform, this app offers an easy way for your Firstline staff to capture customer feedback. The collected data can be shared with your Executives &amp; strategy teams for product or service improvements so you can focus on the right thing – delighting your customers and providing them with an exceptional experience.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>As a Teams Admin, you can pin this app for everyone to Teams App bar using <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/teams-app-setup-policies\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Setup policies</A> or set it up to show as a Tab in your store Team. This gives your workers an easy access to the app. Built with your Firstline workers in mind, the app has a mobile friendly layout. Once they complete their customer transaction or at the end of their shift, the app allows them to capture key customer feedback quickly.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"1.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/190124i1D6982327BA94C96/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"1.png\" alt=\"1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The app uses SharePoint as the backend. While the out-of-box experience is more retail-store centric, it is easy to update the labels by updating the <A href=\"https://github.com/OfficeDev/microsoft-teams-apps-associateinsights/wiki/Deployment-guide#1-appconfigurations-sharepoint-list\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">configuration list</A> to fit other scenarios like capturing passenger feedback in a transportation industry or patient feedback for a healthcare organization. Since this is built using our low-code/no-code Power Platform, it lends itself well to branding or functional changes.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>All feedback collected is stored in SharePoint lists which can be exported for further analysis. A <A href=\"https://github.com/OfficeDev/microsoft-teams-apps-associateinsights/wiki/Deployment-guide#step-6-set-up-power-bi-report-to-analyse-insights-from-the-app-optional\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Power BI dashboard</A>, included as part of the solution, helps you slice and dice the data and gain valuable insights.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"2.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/190126iCDE4F4E2540FDDCE/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"2.jpg\" alt=\"2.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The App draws its inspiration from the “Nightly Notes” App in use at 85+ Microsoft’s retail stores across US to capture customer feedback and sentiment. Built by Voice of Customer and Operations team at Microsoft Stores, it provides an opportunity to gain deep customer insights by tapping into the direct connection of 3500+ retail associates with our customers. A big shoutout to Gopal Ravi and Jeff Gvillo, from the Microsoft Store team, for bringing this app to life.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><EM>“Prior to this app, the process of capturing customer feedback was email-based. This app has allowed us to identify customer trends and sentiments in a scalable way and provide a feedback loop to our HQ team to act quickly.”</EM></P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><STRONG><EM>- Gopal Ravi, Business Analyst, Microsoft Store Team</EM></STRONG></P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Keep in mind that the process is only as good as the data collected. And remember to close the loop with your staff. The process works only if your staff knows that the feedback is being acted upon. So, work with your staff and train them appropriately on data collection and overcommunicate on insights collected and actions taken.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>As with all the other <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/samples/app-templates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">app templates</A>, this is an open-source production-ready app template that can be deployed as-is quickly or rebranded and adapted to meet your business needs easily.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Test drive the app template <A href=\"https://github.com/OfficeDev/microsoft-teams-apps-associateinsights\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A> and check out the full catalog of production ready app templates <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/samples/app-templates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We would love to hear how you plan to leverage this app within your organization and look forward to your feedback!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 11 May 2020 15:00:00 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Four more reasons to love apps in Microsoft Teams","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/four-more-reasons-to-love-apps-in-microsoft-teams/ba-p/1119114","description":"<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Microsoft Teams can help you streamline your productivity tasks and critical business processes when you integrate your apps and workflows – whether that’s tracking student grades, re-stocking supplies, or giving employees the tools and resources they need to manage their careers.&nbsp; We are constantly working to improve the apps experience – from finding the right app to making it readily accessible when you need it –&nbsp; and are excited to share four more reasons to love apps in Teams!</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">1.&nbsp;Easily find the apps you need</FONT></STRONG><BR />Thanks to the integrated search in the app store flyout, it has never been easier to find the exact app that you’re looking for.&nbsp; When you click the “…” on the Teams app bar, you’ll see a grid of apps and can simply type the app name that you’re looking for into the search bar.&nbsp; You can also search apps that support <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/messaging-extensions/what-are-messaging-extensions\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">messaging extensions</A> by clicking the “…” in the message bar , and searching for your app - only those apps that support message extensions will appear here.&nbsp; <BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Microsoft Teams/1. App flyout window.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"980\" /></P>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">2.&nbsp;Feel confident about adding the right apps</FONT></STRONG><BR />Choosing the right app to use shouldn’t be a stressful process – there are a few important details that you want to know before deciding to add that app.&nbsp; The updated app install flow provides app data connection details, privacy and permissions, rich visual screenshots of the app, how it can be used in Teams, and much more – all from the \"add” screen for that app, which is made available anywhere you can add an app in Teams (for example in the app store, or by clicking the “+” at the top of a channel).<BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Microsoft Teams/2. App install v2.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"980\" /></P>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">3.&nbsp;Effortlessly add apps</FONT></STRONG><BR />Now that you’ve added that app that you can’t live without, you may want to use it in multiple places in Teams without having to go through the process of finding it again and again.&nbsp; Fortunately, when you add an app in Teams, that app can be easily added anywhere you work.&nbsp; Just add it once (from the app store, for example) and you’ll then find that app available to pin to the top of channels or chats, as well as on the “…” on your Teams app bar.</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Of course, you still have full control over which apps are added, and where.<BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Microsoft Teams/3. Add anywhere v3.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"980\" />\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">4.&nbsp;Readily access your personal apps</FONT></STRONG><BR />Pinning apps to relevant channels or chats is a great way to rally a team around a particular app.&nbsp; But personal apps don’t neatly align to a particular channel or chat, so you will soon be able to pin these personal apps right (well, actually left <img class=\"lia-deferred-image lia-image-emoji\" src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/html/images/emoticons/smile_40x40.gif\" alt=\":smile:\" title=\":smile:\" />) where you can readily access them – on the Teams app bar.&nbsp; Simply find the app, right-click the icon, and select “pin”.&nbsp; Even after you navigate away, the app icon will remain so you can easily return to it.&nbsp; </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">This feature is in addition to the Teams Admin’s ability to establish tenant-wide policies for the apps that appear on everyone’s Teams app bar.&nbsp; <BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Microsoft Teams/4. User pinning - app experience blog.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"980\" />\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><FONT size=\"4\"><STRONG>Start streamlining your work by bringing your apps into Teams</STRONG></FONT><BR />Check out the <A href=\"https://appsource.microsoft.com/en-us/marketplace/apps?src=wnblogmar2018&amp;product=teams\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Teams apps catalog</A>!&nbsp; There’s a good chance the apps that you already use and love are available.&nbsp; Or build your own custom apps with the help of the low-code app development tool <A href=\"https://powerapps.microsoft.com/en-us/?&amp;ef_id=CjwKCAiAob3vBRAUEiwAIbs5TpTS6UlOoe6dUiF7Zf72PWFvzSVFO8XkraLnCBa5qdGcqR-Cjyk2bxoCWukQAvD_BwE:G:s&amp;OCID=AID2000569_SEM_Mk3A5uzn&amp;MarinID=sMk3A5uzn_394665485978_power%20apps%20microsoft_e_c__75418093387_aud-605528610642:kwd-420130136053_\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Power Apps</A> and <A href=\"https://aka.ms/powerappsteams_whitepaper\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">bring them into Teams</A>.&nbsp; </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n</DIV>\n</DIV>\n</DIV>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 22 Jan 2020 00:55:22 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"59053f37920475bd22e5c82efe6c22cb","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Pete_Daderko","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Microsoft Teams/1.
