User pinning - app experience blog.gif":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401925},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Drive effective meetings with Teams apps while working remote","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/drive-effective-meetings-with-teams-apps-while-working-remote/ba-p/1445824","description":"<P>Over the past few months, we’ve seen tremendous transformations take place as companies adapt to remote work environments. One key trend has been the rise of virtual meetings, as companies look to maintain their rhythm of business and keep human connections while working remote. However, as the volume of meetings increase, teams face challenges with management, efficacy, and engagement. To overcome some of these challenges, we’ll highlight a few popular Teams app integrations that can help you drive effective meetings while working remote.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Streamline agenda preparation and meeting management</FONT></STRONG><BR />Effective meetings require more than corralling a group together to discuss – it requires thoughtfulness around agenda preparation, clarity on objectives, and defined sets of action items. An easy path to plan a successful meeting is to consider apps that streamline the agenda preparation and meeting management process.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>SoapBox</STRONG> simplifies the agenda preparation and management process by allowing teams to build, collaborate, and action team meeting agendas without leaving their workspace in Teams. Using its bot and tabs, teams have a single integrated workspace where they can build agenda items, capture meeting minutes, and monitor resolution of action items – removing the administrative hurdles typically experienced with meeting management.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"soap2.gif\" style=\"width: 640px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/197046iDF94C0352CF346B7/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"soap2.gif\" alt=\"soap2.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Collaborate with shared meeting agendas</STRONG><BR />Build agendas collaboratively by adding items to a shared agenda – reinforcing teamwork and helping ensure each attendee is fully aligned and aware of the scope and objectives of the meeting. You can also access an inventory of suggested agenda items that can be used as a supplement. Teams notifications are surfaced each time agenda items are added, closed, and reminders are sent for upcoming meetings to ensure accountability across the team.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Manage your meetings, capture minutes, and assign action items</STRONG> <BR />As your meeting gets underway, tick off agenda items as you cover them, so that you know what items remain outstanding. Any agenda items not covered automatically roll over into your next meeting in the series, as needed. You can also capture meeting minutes and action items from within the app, so that team members have a central repository in Teams to access.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Access AI-powered insights from the conversations you’re having with your team</STRONG><BR />Using machine learning, SoapBox can decipher the topics you’re discussing most (and least) frequently across all your meetings. Based on your meeting insights, it will serve up suggested questions and reading materials that will help you better prepare and balance future meetings.</P>\n<P><BR />Learn more about <A href=\"https://soapboxhq.com/integrations/microsoft-teams\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SoapBox for Teams</A> and its offering plans and how it can help you plan and manage effective meetings!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Increase engagement and human connection with visual communication</STRONG></FONT><BR />Keeping your teams engaged and connected can be a struggle – especially with a screen taking the place of a person. <STRONG>Prezi Video</STRONG> helps address these challenges by letting you overlay your visuals directly on screen next to you, making meetings engaging and bringing back the human connection element that’s missing in remote work. By putting you and your content together on the same screen – you create a natural, human interaction with your audience and make the meeting more impactful.</P>\n<P><LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_S8ZxxCFcg8&amp;feature=emb_title\" align=\"center\" size=\"large\" width=\"600\" height=\"338\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/_S8ZxxCFcg8/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Maintaining the human connection with your team</STRONG><BR />Meetings are effective when attendees are engaged and have a connection with the presenter. When you remove that engagement by speaking behind material, you lose that human connection and begin to lose your audience’s full attention. With Prezi Video, you strengthen that connection with your team by keeping you and your content together on the same screen for a powerful presentation experience. Attendees remain engaged throughout the live video meeting and can engage in real-time collaboration – creating an effective presentation experience for the entire team.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Send useful pre-recorded, asynchronous updates</STRONG> <BR />When live meetings aren’t needed or aren’t feasible, you can create a quick video update to share directly in your Teams channel, helping your team stay up to date without interrupting their workflow with asynchronous communication. Easy integration of your must-have information and graphics into your video screen means that team members can share and discuss key data at a time that works best for them.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Balance time and productivity</STRONG><BR />Without requiring a designer, you can create stunning videos with pre-made templates and high-quality images available on Prezi Video and save precious meeting time for more impactful discussions or even cancel a meeting entirely by sending a video and having the discussion in your team's channel instead, saving everyone time.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Learn more about <A href=\"https://prezi.com/video/works-with/ms-teams-business/?utm_medium=social&amp;utm_source=partner&amp;utm_campaign=microsoft-teams-integration&amp;utm_content=pv-msteams-bus-landing-page\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Prezi Video for Teams</A> to get started for free and see how it can help you create powerful visual communications!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Energize your meetings with interactive challenges</FONT></STRONG><BR />Sometimes meetings just need a jolt to keep attendees engaged. Consider introducing short interactive challenges in the middle of a meeting to inject some energy. <STRONG>Kahoot!</STRONG> is a game-based learning platform that makes it easy to create, share, and play learning challenges (kahoots). Whether it’s business-focused or for fun, you can gamify the meeting experience to increase attention and engagement. With its recent integration with Teams, meeting hosts can present live kahoots during meetings or assign self-paced challenges after meetings.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Kahoot MS Teams.gif\" style=\"width: 600px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/197047i72100EAD54567E66/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Kahoot MS Teams.gif\" alt=\"Kahoot MS Teams.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Launch a live challenge in your Teams meeting</STRONG><BR />Host live kahoots during a meeting to keep your attendees engaged and energized. Whether you’re looking to kick off the meeting with an ice breaker, facilitating Q&amp;A, or gathering feedback – you can quickly access your kahoots within Teams and share your screen to allow participants to join. You can also import your PowerPoint slides into your kahoot to gamify your existing presentations. Increase engagement and run the entire experience from the Kahoot! app within Teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Assign a self-paced challenge in your Teams channel for your attendees</STRONG><BR />Reinforce discussion points by assigning a challenge to attendees after a meeting, which can be accessed directly from Teams. They’ll receive automated reminders to complete and you’ll be able to leverage an interactive experience to drive home key points that you want them to remember.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Results and Reporting</STRONG><BR />If you’d like to view data from the challenge, a report will be linked directly from the podium for the host to review – allowing you can see how your attendees have performed and to measure their level of engagement. Reports for live games hosted within Teams are available by logging into your account on the kahoot website.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Learn more about <A href=\"https://appsource.microsoft.com/en-us/product/office/WA200001538?tab=Overview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Kahoot! for Teams</A> and their offerings and how it can help you create live games in your presentations!</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>Learn more!</STRONG></P>\n<P>If you’d like to learn how to better use apps in Teams to enhance remote work, see our <A href=\"https://aka.ms/teamsrwapps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">remote work Teams apps site</A> with more use cases and ideas, and take advantage of the free virtual training events each week.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>For Teams end-users:</STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Check out our guide to <A href=\"https://aka.ms/teamsappguide\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">remote work apps</A></LI>\n<LI>Join a live, instructor-led training session called “<A href=\"https://aka.ms/LearnTeamsApps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn to Use Apps in Microsoft Teams</A>.” We’ll show you how to find, install, and leverage the full functionality of some of our most popular apps.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>For Teams Admins:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Join our <A href=\"https://microsoftteams.eventbuilder.com/ChalkTalksApps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Chalk Talk series</A>, where members of Teams engineering walk through the security, deployment, and management of third-party integrations.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 23 Jun 2020 15:00:00 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/197046iDF94C0352CF346B7/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"17de4bb9c9eab3b16043076b383824b6","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn59@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-57-01-407_e9a9e27942e24873.webp","destWidth":640,"destHeight":360,"sourceBytes":9790181,"destBytes":1752852,"author":"MicrosoftTeamsTeam","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/197046iDF94C0352CF346B7/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn59@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-57-01-407_e9a9e27942e24873.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/197047i72100EAD54567E66/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn64@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-58-09-650_c614e592e0b0b72d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401929},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"How to get the most from Together mode","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/how-to-get-the-most-from-together-mode/ba-p/1509496","description":"<P>Together mode is a new option in Microsoft Teams, Microsoft’s premier app for teamwork and team connection. You’ve probably seen it by now; everyone is united in a virtual space as if in a theater instead of being separated in boxes.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>On one level, Together mode is a simple approach to making meetings feel better during the pandemic, however there’s also a deeper level that touches on our latest scientific understandings of cognition, social perception, and communication.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Together mode has a unique look, but it also has a unique feel. People typically become more relaxed, more attentive to one another, more playful, and yet more focused on shared goals. The design offers unique benefits: less fatigue from frequent video meetings, better sense of connection with others, and more effective meetings.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Here are my thoughts on how to get the most of Together mode.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"MicrosoftTeams-image (8).png\" style=\"width: 557px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/204963iAB3CB6691D4EC01E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"MicrosoftTeams-image (8).png\" alt=\"MicrosoftTeams-image (8).png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">When to use it:</FONT></STRONG></P>\n<P>The initial design has been optimized to help people during the pandemic. For now, Together mode is ideal when each person is in front of a webcam in a different location. We are exploring how the design can evolve to support conference rooms and other situations.&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Together mode is especially well-suited to calls in which multiple people will speak; we find that it’s easier and more comfortable for people to find moments to enter a conversation.</LI>\n<LI>Together mode helps when you must go to a lot of video meetings. Most users report less meeting fatigue.</LI>\n<LI>Together mode is helpful when a group might have trouble staying attentive, for instance in education settings.</LI>\n<LI>Together mode supports presenters who need to “read the room” or get energy from attendees.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>When to not use it:</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>If you need to show physical content in your environment, such as a physical whiteboard, then Together mode is not the best choice right now, because it only brings you, not your environment, into the shared space.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The first version of Together mode isn’t optimized to share the screen with PowerPoint presentations. If a PowerPoint presentation is the main event and will take up the entire time of a meeting, Together mode might not be helpful.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Works best when users are not walking around or otherwise moving the camera or screen during the session. It looks weird, like you’re jumping around in your seat.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Together mode is more engaging than a typical video chat, and therefore more distracting from potentially unsafe tasks like driving. You might think, why even bother urging people not to video chat while driving? I wish I could say that I never see people trying to do it! Don’t, please.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The initial release of Together mode supports up to 49 people at a time optimally. Together mode might still be the best choice for a meeting with more than 49 participants, but that will depend on many details about how the meeting is conducted. Best practices for large meetings in Together mode are still emerging.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>An itsy-bitsy introduction to the science behind Together mode:</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>People in Together mode know where others are in a shared virtual space. That means your brain can keep track of what other people are signaling or emoting in a natural way, relying on social/spatial perception; people can intuitively signal each other nonverbally. In a grid, you don’t know where other people are on the screen, relative to you, from their point of view, so natural glances and other subtle cues are impossible.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Together mode creates a shared space in which people are not separated by barriers. Being in overlapping space can lead to silly behavior, as when people “high five”, but there is also a significant benefit. People pay attention to each other more and can gain a better sense of a shared stake in the situation and a shared journey. Constructive behavior signals a level of commitment that isn’t signaled when goofy behavior isn’t even possible.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Together mode creates a usable illusion that the eye contact problem has been mitigated. (Eye contact is a classic problem in video conferencing; people appear to be looking in the wrong direction.) The illusion is based on the unique geometry; everyone is looking at the whole group through a big virtual mirror. The geometry feels natural, yet it turns out that the human brain isn’t great at tracking where someone else is looking within it. Once direct eye contact errors become hard to detect, people intuitively position themselves to look as if they are reacting to one another appropriately.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Best Practices for using Together mode:</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>It might seem strange to see yourself in the group at first, but that is what allows for the improved understanding of interpersonal signals. Don’t turn off your camera! For example, being a teacher seated with your students might look odd at first, but you’ll probably find that you understand the students better and they pay more attention to you when everyone can see the attention signals passing between all present.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>While the initial release works best when everyone has the camera turned on, we are working to support voice only participants at an equal level as well as all types of ability.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>But what if you’re shy, and prefer to leave the camera off? I’m often shy too. I ask you to keep an open mind and experiment at whatever pace is comfortable. In our early research, we are seeing people leave the camera on more often in Together mode than in traditional grid designs, and they report that the experience was pleasant. One thing to keep in mind is that when people become more able to interact expressively, then appearance matters proportionately less. If people are paying more attention to what you say and indicate non-verbally, then they’re paying less attention to how you look.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>When a group tries Together mode for the first time, or even when someone sees a picture of it for the first time, the first reactions are often light-hearted. Would playfulness get in the way of people understanding that there are important benefits to the design? After all, Teams is for productivity. It isn’t Xbox.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>After observing and analyzing many sessions, I’ve come to a new opinion. Playfulness is not a waste of time, even for adults. It is not a bug in human nature, but rather a fine-tuned process crafted over deep evolutionary time that transcends species. It is how we learn to interact with new people, how we build trust and comfort, and how we investigate our environment (consider Together mode as a new part of our environment.) I have stopped trying to get newbie groups to get right to business. Instead I wait for them to get initial, playful reactions out of their systems, and then meetings go wonderfully. It’s not that simple, actually; I sometimes still chastise them during the playful phase because it’s fun to watch people rebel against my exhortations.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>What about the physical setup: the monitors, cameras, and so on?</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Together mode works fine if you’re sloppy about where the camera, screens, and windows are placed, but here are some tips on how to get the most out of it.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The feature shows you how you present to others, and how you interact with them. People might see your head turn subtly to respond to them, for instance. If you put Together mode in a little window off to the side on a big monitor, then people will see you looking to that side a lot, which can look out of place; that means that they will not get as much in the way of appropriate head turning cues from you. Therefore, Together mode works best if the window containing it is placed straight ahead, in front of you, and takes up all or most of your screen.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Together mode works great on big monitors. I love using it on a Surface Studio. Some people have built up impressive multi-monitor setups for working from home. If you’re one of those people, please place the Together mode window on the same screen where the camera is centered and try to put boring content on your other screens during your meeting. If you look over to the side at a different monitor a lot, it can look a little off. If you want to track mail or text chat during a session, try placing the Together mode window at the top of the screen, centered under the camera, with other windows below it. Then people will see you looking down instead of to the side, which works better.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Together mode works best on a screen that is at least as big as a tablet; it is not optimized for phones right now, although they can work if you prop them up to face you at a head-on angle and aren’t moved around during the meeting. If you use a phone, please try to get the phone and you positioned so that other people can see you looking straight ahead, into the camera, through the duration of the meeting. Once again: much better if the phone is stationary.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Best if the camera is centered, which is true for almost all built-in cameras on laptops and PCs. Together mode looks bigger on tablets when the tablet is positioned horizontally, but then the camera is often off to the side, depending on the tablet’s design, so you might want to position your tablet vertically. Then the view will be smaller, but you won’t be seen looking to the side as much,</P>\n<P>The first release of Together mode doesn’t have a reserved seating feature, so if you leave the meeting, you might come back in a different seat, which will disorient other people who thought they knew where to find you. This might not sound important, but the process of spatial/social perception is not entirely conscious, so the disruption can be jarring. Please try to stay in the call the whole time instead of dipping in and out. The design of Together mode will evolve - as will these tips - as new use scenarios are supported.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Because people intuitively adjust themselves to look like they fit well in the virtual space, you might find that you can use Together mode to trick yourself into having better posture. Just tilt the camera - or the camera+screen, if they are the same device – up a little. Then you might find that you raise your frame to look properly seated in Together mode.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We are learning a lot from customers about how to make meetings more engaging and effective; we have many more ideas. We would love for you to try out the first release of Together Mode and let us know what you think to help us shape what comes next. We are in this together.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>I know I speak for the many people at Microsoft who have contributed to Together mode when I say we hope you find increased well-being and productivity as you use the new Teams, and maybe even a little fun during difficult times.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>-Jaron Lanier</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 13 Jul 2020 04:56:33 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/204963iAB3CB6691D4EC01E/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"881bbb591d930a2b9ca388ffd50564de","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn91@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-56-43-921_e0f2c367a5c02ac6.webp","destWidth":557,"destHeight":367,"sourceBytes":394060,"destBytes":26802,"author":"JaronLanier","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/204963iAB3CB6691D4EC01E/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn91@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-56-43-921_e0f2c367a5c02ac6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401919},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"What’s New in Microsoft Teams | April 2020","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/what-s-new-in-microsoft-teams-april-2020/ba-p/1347929","description":"<P>As businesses and schools around the world prioritize remote work for the safety and well-being of their employees and students, Microsoft Teams is playing a critical role in helping them stay connected through video meetings, calls, and chats. Today, we are excited to introduce new meetings capabilities, IT administration controls and so much more to further the experience for our customers. Read on to see what’s new in April.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: Meetings &amp; Calling</FONT> </STRONG><BR /><STRONG>Increase in the number of simultaneous videos in Teams meetings</STRONG> <BR />Virtual face to face conversations are the new normal for remote working, and now more than ever it’s important to feel connected with those you are meeting. We are increasing the number of participants who can be viewed simultaneously on the Teams meeting stage from 4 to 9. This new experience optimizes for attendees who have enabled video and places the remaining audio-only participants below the meeting stage. To provide a high audio and video quality experience, the layout will adapt, based on the user bandwidth and alter the number of videos shown to provide the best meeting experience.&nbsp; This feature has started to roll out. If you don't see it yet, please sit tight as it is a staged rollout and can take up to a couple weeks to reach everyone.&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/Teams/3by3group.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Raise Hands</STRONG> <BR />Excuse me! The new “raise hands” feature in Teams allows meeting attendees to identify that they wish to speak, making it easier to actively participate in large meetings. Everyone will see a visual cue on the attendee—as well as in the participant list that prioritizes who raised their hand first—and can give them the room to participate in the conversation at hand. We expect this feature to start rolling out early next week.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"3x3 raise hands.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187651iF81E48CEE440635D/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"3x3 raise hands.png\" alt=\"3x3 raise hands.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Background effects</STRONG> <BR />Keep the focus on you—not what’s behind you! We are building upon the heavily popular video background blur feature in Teams meetings with background effects. This new feature in Teams allows meetings attendees to customize their video background from a list of pre-selected images. This feature is generally available. We will continue to iterate and enhance this new feature to include the ability for users to upload their own custom images in mid-May.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/Teams/Background-Effects.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Background Blur for iOS</STRONG> <BR />Keep the focus on you and not what’s behind you on your mobile device! We are excited to bring this frequently utilized feature from the desktop to your iPhones and iPads. Rolling out now.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"blur%20ios.gif\" style=\"width: 183px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187656i3DA57BAC9C109CC6/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"blur%20ios.gif\" alt=\"blur%20ios.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Live captions in iOS and Android</STRONG> <BR />Whether hard of hearing, have different levels of language proficiency, or are connecting from a loud location, live captions allows meeting participants to follow along and read what is said during Teams meetings. Live captions is now available on iOS and Android mobile devices in English.</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>Microsoft 365 Live Event Limit Increases</STRONG> <BR />To help customers meet rapidly changing communication needs, Microsoft 365 live events will temporarily raise default limits until July 1, 2020 for live events hosted in Teams, Stream, and Yammer. The following increases will begin rolling out next week:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Attendee limit: events can support up to 20,000 attendees</LI>\n<LI>Concurrent events:  50 events can be hosted simultaneously across a tenant</LI>\n<LI>Event duration:  event length has been increased to 16 hours per broadcast</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>Additionally, we recently announced support for up to 100,000 event attendees partnership with the <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-stream-blog/attendee-limit-increase-for-live-events-hosted-with-microsoft/ba-p/1265948\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Live Events Assistance Program</A>.  <BR /><BR /><STRONG>Share system audio in Teams live events</STRONG> <BR />With share system audio in live events, your attendees will hear the audio of the content that you are sharing on your screen. This feature works just like share system audio in Teams meetings, and is great for sharing audio and video experiences with your attendees. This feature is only available for presenter and producers in a live event joining from the Windows desktop Teams client.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"live evetns.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187657iA677ABAA689620D2/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"live evetns.png\" alt=\"live evetns.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>End the meeting for all participants</STRONG> <BR />Meeting organizers are now able to end the meeting with a push of a button. Within the meeting control bar, only meeting organizers will see an item that says \"end meeting.” All participants exit the meeting when the organizer selects this button. A great example of a relevant scenario is in education: in some situations, class meetings should not continue after class is over without teacher supervision. </P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"end meeting.png\" style=\"width: 656px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187658iF83B82F779DF0B7A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"end meeting.png\" alt=\"end meeting.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>1:1 Call Recording</STRONG> <BR />Now you can easily record your 1:1 calls in Teams just as you already can for meetings. Simply select the option to record and call participants will be notified on their screen that a recording has begun! Learn more <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Record-a-meeting-in-Teams-34dfbe7f-b07d-4a27-b4c6-de62f1348c24\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: IT Admin</FONT></STRONG> <BR /><STRONG>Introducing the new Meetings Dashboard</STRONG> <BR />The new <STRONG>Meetings dashboard</STRONG> in the Microsoft Teams admin center helps you ensure users have the best experience possible during meetings and calls by providing you insights into usage, user feedback, network health, meeting details, devices, and more from a single place. Leveraging Power BI capabilities, this interactive dashboard allows you to filter information by dimensions such as day, countries, and platform allowing you quickly identify areas of improvement and drill down to uncover the root cause of poor experiences. And because it built using our industry leading analytics platform, you have ability to join meeting data with other datasets such as faculty directory for student attendance in remote learning. <BR /><BR />For customers that may have unique needs or more targeted requirements, we will soon make a <STRONG>call record API</STRONG> generally available to allow customers and partners to export Teams meetings and calls data for further analysis.</P>\n<P><BR />The new meetings dashboard is coming to Teams soon.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Meetings Dashboard.JPG\" style=\"width: 907px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/188059iC1AA406868AA3703/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Meetings Dashboard.JPG\" alt=\"Meetings Dashboard.JPG\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Improve voice quality with local media optimization for direct routing</STRONG> <BR /><STRONG>Local Media Optimization</STRONG> for Direct Routing improves voice quality by keeping media streams local within the boundaries of corporate networks. It also supports streams between Teams and SBCs even if they are behind corporate firewalls not visible to Microsoft directly. This local streaming improves security and performance for Teams Calling. Learn more <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/local-media-optimization-direct-routing-now-available-muravlyannikov/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><BR />These quality improvements are available in product now.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Control profile picture settings on Teams</STRONG> <BR />The Teams web and desktop experiences now recognize the <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/module/exchange/client-access/set-owamailboxpolicy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Outlook on the web mailbox policy</A> setting that controls whether users can change their profile pictures. Admins can configure this policy setting to promote a safer work or school environment by preventing inappropriate content from being used in profile pictures.</P>\n<P><BR />This policy setting is currently rolling out.</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>Get insights into Teams app usage in your environment</STRONG> <BR />The New App analytics and reports experience will provide administrators insights into usage of Teams apps in their environment allowing them to manage risk and make informed decisions. Admins will soon be able to see each app in their tenant, their type, and how many users and teams are actively using the app. This is a great complement to our robust capabilities to <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/manage-apps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">confidently manage your Teams apps</A> including the app catalog, which allows you to view detailed information about each app in your tenant. Additionally, app policies and settings allows admins to manage permissions, define how apps are displayed in the Teams experience, and control availability of custom apps.</P>\n<P><BR />This management experience is coming to Teams soon.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"management analytics.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187644iDEE60A85BD521619/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"management analytics.png\" alt=\"management analytics.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Easily assign a policy to a large group of users</STRONG> <BR />Microsoft Teams offers a robust set of policies to empower administrators with controls to tailor the Teams experience to users. <STRONG>Batch policy assignment</STRONG> allows administrators to streamline the process of assigning policies or <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/manage-policy-packages\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">policy packages</A> to a large group of users. The New-CsBatchPolicyAssignmentOperation cmdlet lets you submit a batch of users and a policy that you want to assign using one PowerShell command line to perform the action. A batch can contain up to 20,000 users and admins can specify users by their object Id, user principal name (UPN), Session Initiation Protocol address, or email address. Learn more about policy assignment in Teams <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/assign-policies#assign-a-policy-to-a-batch-of-users\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"batch policy assignment.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187643iBE67A7F55B1C74D0/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"batch policy assignment.png\" alt=\"batch policy assignment.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New Meeting Controls</STRONG> <BR />Read on to learn about new meetings controls we have introduced to make it easier for you and your users to manage your Teams meetings!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Default lobby setting</STRONG> – We changed the default Teams policy to make external users wait in the lobby before joining a Teams meeting to ensure than only the right people are in the meeting. This policy change will only impact those tenants who have not modified the default meetings policy.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Default lobby settings.png\" style=\"width: 805px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187646i59DED89FBE7305B5/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Default lobby settings.png\" alt=\"Default lobby settings.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Lobby settings for PSTN participants</STRONG> – Any user who schedules a Microsoft Teams meeting will now see a separate setting to control the lobby for Audio Conferencing (PSTN) participants in the Meeting Options page of a given meeting. Additionally, they will also see a new option to control the announcement sound when a PSTN/dial-in participant joins or leaves the meeting.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"lobby settings for PSTN.png\" style=\"width: 576px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187648i56B52CA039B29692/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"lobby settings for PSTN.png\" alt=\"lobby settings for PSTN.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: Chat &amp; Collaboration</FONT> </STRONG><BR /><STRONG>The Yammer app for Microsoft Teams is now available!</STRONG> <BR />The new Yammer App for Microsoft Teams brings a fully interactive Yammer experience into the hub for teamwork, helping you stay connected to what’s happening across your organization, and engage and connect with your communities directly within Microsoft Teams. Watch live events, share announcements, pin conversations, and mark best answers just as you would in Yammer. No more toggling between apps or confusion about where to chat – simply add and pin the Yammer app to the navigation rail and start discovering communities, knowledge, and conversations right alongside your projects, chat, and meetings. It’s Yammer— in Teams. Learn more <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/yammer-blog/the-yammer-app-for-microsoft-teams-is-now-available/ba-p/1320286\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/Teams/Yammer%20in%20teams.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Acknowledge exceptional efforts and mindset</STRONG> <BR />Despite challenging times and situations, people across organizations are going above and beyond to help our communities. To show appreciation of their efforts, we’ve released three new badges (courage, optimism and inclusive) in <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/send-praise-to-people-50f26b47-565f-40fe-8642-5ca2a5ed261e?ui=en-us&amp;rs=en-us&amp;ad=us\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Praise</A>, to celebrate those who are truly making a difference. Start using these badges <STRONG>today</STRONG>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"praise.png\" style=\"width: 505px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187672i944A365685FC007B/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"praise.png\" alt=\"praise.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Channel cross-post editing</STRONG> <BR />Do you need to updated information that you posted across multiple channels? Channel cross posting now supports editing a message after it has been posted. Additionally, you can add or remove channels to reach a wider audience or have a focused conversation.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: Developers</FONT></STRONG> <BR /><STRONG>Additional Power Automate triggers for Teams</STRONG> <BR />Streamline routine tasks in Microsoft Teams with two new Power Automate triggers. Trigger actions when a new teammate joins - whether that's creating a welcome message or sharing onboarding materials. Users will also be able to create custom message actions with the \"for a selected message\" trigger. Users can build flows directly in Teams using these new triggers, even if they trigger actions outside of Teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Compliance recording partner solutions for Microsoft Teams&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P>Whether working on-site or remotely, companies in regulated industries are required to maintain certain protocols; including automatically recording all communications by regulated employees. With Teams' compliance recording integrations, those companies can do just that, whether those interactions occur within or outside of Teams, while also being able to archive and analyze them.&nbsp;<BR />These solutions are sold and enabled by our partners ASC, Nice, Numonix and Verint who are ready to engage customers now.&nbsp;</P>\n<P><BR /><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>What’s New: Teams for Education</STRONG> </FONT><BR /><STRONG>Teams meetings for remote learning</STRONG> <BR />Despite school closures, educators can still connect with and support students by using Microsoft Teams meetings for class sessions, office hours, and more. Here is the latest guidance on how to maximize learning and keep students safe in Teams meetings.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Get the latest on which Teams meetings features to use now and what is coming soon from this webinar <A href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W-La0cigkqg&amp;feature=youtu.be\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</LI>\n<LI>Set up a Microsoft Teams meeting for your online classroom directly from within Canvas, Blackboard, Schoology, and other LMSs. Learn how with this <A href=\"https://educationblog.microsoft.com/en-us/2020/03/microsoft-teams-meeting-creation-now-available-in-canvas-blackboard-schoology-brightspace-and-itslearning/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">guidance</A>.</LI>\n<LI>Keep students safe in Teams meetings with these <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/keeping-students-safe-while-using-meetings-in-teams-for-distance-learning-f00fa399-0473-4d31-ab72-644c137e11c8?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US#ID0EBBAAA=For_educators\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">helpful guidelines</A>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Live events for A1 faculty licenses</STRONG> <BR />Starting early May, Microsoft Teams live events host capabilities will be available to education users with a Microsoft Office 365 A1 faculty license, at no extra cost. That means users with A1 faculty licenses, which is free to accredited educational institutions, can host and broadcast live events. In early May, live events will be automatically enabled for users with an A1 faculty license and automatically disabled on July 1, 2020.</P>\n<P><BR />Here is a <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-live-events/what-are-teams-live-events\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">technical overview</A> and <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/get-started-with-microsoft-teams-live-events-d077fec2-a058-483e-9ab5-1494afda578a\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">how-to guide</A> to learn more about Microsoft Teams live events.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: Government</FONT> </STRONG><BR /><STRONG>Private Channels now available in GCC</STRONG> <BR />Limit which team members can see the conversation and content within a particular channel. You can right-size channel participation and exposure without having to create discrete teams to limit visibility. Private channels in GCCH and DoD are coming soon.<BR /><BR /><STRONG>Advisor for Teams in now available in GCC as a preview</STRONG> <BR />Found in the Microsoft Teams admin center, Advisor for Teams assists IT admins in planning a successful Teams deployment for their organization, offering recommended plans and a collaboration space for the deployment team to streamline the roll out of all the Teams workloads, including messaging, meetings and calling workloads. This feature is currently in public preview.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 04 May 2020 18:35:33 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"809078ed43fe943e2b424a8d505166a7","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"MicrosoftTeamsTeam","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/Teams/3by3group.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn84@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-57-34-798_b983b37e80c3c1f0.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187651iF81E48CEE440635D/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn81@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-58-19-894_88fb41ed24659091.webp","https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/Teams/Background-Effects.gif":null,"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187656i3DA57BAC9C109CC6/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn67@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-58-18-957_ca84e5704220dd31.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187657iA677ABAA689620D2/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn27@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-57-12-733_6d531acdd54e2f79.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187658iF83B82F779DF0B7A/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn4@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-57-03-533_ecce4e2d28b721fe.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/188059iC1AA406868AA3703/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn15@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-26-000_6c765256c46c8117.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187644iDEE60A85BD521619/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn44@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-04-545_99e3e97b1c7fe52b.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187643iBE67A7F55B1C74D0/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn31@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-57-05-135_bab579536bfb68b7.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187646i59DED89FBE7305B5/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn83@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-57-39-523_e54628adcd603ee9.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187648i56B52CA039B29692/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn35@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-57-18-763_36f28e485fe1e825.webp","https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/Teams/Yammer%20in%20teams.gif":null,"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187672i944A365685FC007B/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn99@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-57-40-115_6d3f6310142cfb15.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401922},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Take these steps to enable your Firstline Workers today","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/take-these-steps-to-enable-your-firstline-workers-today/ba-p/1294328","description":"<P>COVID-19 has heavily impacted organizations with workers in service and task-oriented roles across various industries. In some cases, customers are experiencing a complete halt in operations, and in other cases, supply chains are being shifted to make essential products and logistics are being altered to accommodate new demand. Now more than ever, are we dependent on the heroes on the ground to keep our world moving, and we wanted to provide some tips to help scale Firstline Worker operations. Check out ways you can digitize environments for Firstline Workers, while maximizing on safety and wellbeing.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Learn how to get your Firstline Workers up and running on Teams</STRONG></P>\n<P>We recognize the level of uncertainty many organizations are facing, and as a result, we are making Teams available to as many people as possible to support public health and safety by keeping teams at all levels of the organization connect and informed. Participate in our <A href=\"https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=v4j5cvGGr0GRqy180BHbRyMDv-1voW9MqL7zkQ11DzBUREZaU1E0WEk5T0NYS0NDSkFMSDROUUdYMC4u\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">white glove support program</A> and sign up for our upcoming <A href=\"https://aka.ms/TeamsChalkTalks\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Chalk Talks</A> and <A href=\"https://aka.ms/TeamsLiveTraining\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">webinar series</A> to learn how to stay engaged with your Firstline Workers.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Provision identities for your Firstline Workers and enable them to access Teams</STRONG></P>\n<P>With IT departments strained under new workloads, we recognize the need for speed and scale in getting your Firstline workforce online and connected during these changing times. With inbound user provisioning from human capital management systems like <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/azure-active-directory-identity/say-good-bye-to-custom-scripts-and-simplify-your-workforce/ba-p/320540\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Workday</A> and <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/azure-active-directory-identity/ring-in-the-new-year-with-automated-user-provisioning-from-sap/ba-p/1063603\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SAP SuccessFactors</A>, or with PowerShell scripts, IT administrators can streamline Firstline Workers provisioning at scale, to start onboarding them to the tools and technology they need.&nbsp;We have created a solution that will help you provision tens of thousands of identities in an accelerated manner to access the Teams app. Learn more about this solution <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/MicrosoftTeams/flw-scripted-deployment\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>, complete with a step by step walkthrough.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Connect Firstline Workers to experts with a head-mounted, wearable device</STRONG></P>\n<P>Connecting with Firstline Workers who are currently working in critical field service roles or safety-first environments to support COVID-19 efforts can be challenging given the need to share information quickly and safely. <STRONG><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/microsoft-announces-realwear-integration-for-teams/ba-p/1233202\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Teams on RealWear</A></STRONG> unlocks “I see what you see” scenarios, to connect experts to field workers and train new employees remotely without compromising health and welfare, all while being hands-free. Teams for RealWear is now available in preview. Learn more <A href=\"https://aka.ms/teams-realwear-docs\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Make scheduling easier for your Firstline Workers</STRONG></P>\n<P>With demands in constant flux, scheduling your firstline workforce can add a layer of complexity to your company’s operations. For example, some teams may be experiencing an increase in overtime, while others may need to track time &amp; attendance remotely or need a way to offer additional/open shifts. The <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/expand-teams-across-your-org/shifts-for-teams-landing-page\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><STRONG>Shifts</STRONG></A> app in Teams can aid in managing schedules effectively. We’ve heard from customers in the healthcare segment that they are using Shifts to schedule the influx of patient care providers and COVID-19 screeners during this crisis.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Want to know if you’re Firstline Workers have clocked in? Here’s how</STRONG></P>\n<P>When it comes to tracking time and attendance, customers in essential industries like manufacturing, government, and grocery retail tell us that tracking time and attendance also helps to keep workers safe during the COVID-19 outbreak. <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/set-up-time-clock-for-shifts-63ff9958-3594-4d05-82eb-a4a342cba2e2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><STRONG>Time clock</STRONG></A>, located in the Shifts app, offers a digital clock-in/clock-out solution in place of a physical, analog time-clock station and it serves as a simple way to record attendance that also helps keep workers safe.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Collect information to stay abreast of team wellbeing</STRONG></P>\n<P>We recognize the health and wellness of your Firstline Workers is a top priority. One practice our Microsoft Stores has enacted is to share a survey via <STRONG><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/forms-pro/create-survey\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Forms</A></STRONG> on a weekly basis to gather information from associates about the state of their health and whether they have any questions. This practice has also been implemented at one of our customers in the hospitality segment. In addition to collecting health status information via Forms, they have been leveraging Teams meetings to conduct health talks and share health tips in dedicated channels.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Teams-Forms-Covid-blog-phone 1.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/183264iCD954ECBCFF4F425/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Teams-Forms-Covid-blog-phone 1.png\" alt=\"Gather employee wellbeing information via Microsoft Forms and ensure the safety of your team.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Gather employee wellbeing information via Microsoft Forms and ensure the safety of your team.</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Customer story: Suffolk communicates with speed to their Firstline Workforce</STRONG></P>\n<P>Cascading information down to employees on the ground can be challenging. Suffolk, a national real estate enterprise and construction company, is using an <STRONG>organization-wide team in Microsoft Teams</STRONG> called 'COVID-19 Communications' which is managed by the company’s Health and Safety, IT and internal communications groups. In this team, Suffolk dedicated a channel to employee Q&amp;A and included a SharePoint app for access to documentation, benefits, etc. related to COVID-19. Suffolk employees can easily monitor updates on the latest guidance concerning the virus and provide valuable feedback to leadership. Alex Hall, the Suffolk executive vice president heading up all internal COVID-19 communications, confirmed that providing a continuous and transparent stream of factual information about the virus has helped create a sense of security and trust throughout the organization during this unprecedented and challenging time.    </P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Acknowledge exceptional efforts and mindset</STRONG></P>\n<P>Despite how challenging these times are, Firstline Workers are going above and beyond to help our communities. To show appreciation of their efforts, we’ve released three new badges (courage, optimism and inclusive) in <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/send-praise-to-people-50f26b47-565f-40fe-8642-5ca2a5ed261e?ui=en-us&amp;rs=en-us&amp;ad=us\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><STRONG>Praise</STRONG></A>, to celebrate those who are truly making a difference. Start using these badges today.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Praise-courage-optimism-inclusive-4x (1).png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/183266i1A43D680BE338F05/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Praise-courage-optimism-inclusive-4x (1).png\" alt=\"Celebrate team members with new badges in Teams.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Celebrate team members with new badges in Teams.</span></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>Let us know what you think</STRONG></P>\n<P>While the COVID-19 pandemic has caused organizations to operate in extreme circumstances, we want to learn more from your feedback to better our product experience. If you have suggestions on how to make Teams better, please submit your idea via <A href=\"https://microsoftteams.uservoice.com/forums/555103-public\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">User Voice</A> or vote for existing ideas to help us prioritize the requests. We read every piece of feedback that we receive to make sure that Microsoft Teams meets your needs.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>—Keara James, product marketing manager Microsoft Teams</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 09 Apr 2020 17:17:20 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/183264iCD954ECBCFF4F425/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"981465cfda180d9108a6af4177ac2bd0","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn84@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-56-43-247_fc39196fa623d322.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":562,"sourceBytes":65650,"destBytes":12722,"author":"MicrosoftTeamsTeam","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/183264iCD954ECBCFF4F425/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn84@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-56-43-247_fc39196fa623d322.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/183266i1A43D680BE338F05/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn7@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-58-23-025_d87ba69aa43a19d1.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401922},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Modernize employee experience with this no-code chatbot in Teams","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/modernize-employee-experience-with-this-no-code-chatbot-in-teams/ba-p/839641","description":"<P>As organizations grow, they amass tons of tribal knowledge that often sits within documents, SharePoint sites and FAQ manuals. Not everyone is interested in everything and it becomes tricky to find the information quickly. This forces employees to switch context between applications or deal with the specialists / subject matter experts directly which causes frustration for both.</P>\n<P>An FAQ bot can solve the problem and with <A href=\"https://www.qnamaker.ai/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft’s QnA Maker tool</A> it is simple to create a powerful chatbot rather quickly without writing a single line of code. However, there are two areas of opportunity to better the experience for employees:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Meet employees where they live</STRONG><STRONG>:</STRONG> The best place for providing support is in the moment when one needs help. When employees spend most of their time collaborating and working within Teams – it makes sense to surface that information within Teams so that there is no costly context switching.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Bring in a human in complex scenarios:</STRONG> Employee needs for information are so varied that it is impossible to handle every scenario. It negatively impacts employee experience when the bot fails, and the employee doesn’t have anywhere else to go to. Therefore, there needs to be an easy way to bring a human in the loop when that happens.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>We’re excited to bring to you the FAQ Plus app template that capitalizes on both the areas of opportunities above to deliver a rich employee experience. In addition, creating your own employee facing bot using the template requires no coding and deploys in minutes.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Here’s how it works:</P>\n<P>Let’s say you’ve used the template to create a Teams adoption bot that answers all employee questions on using Teams while you’re rolling Teams in your organization.</P>\n<P>Now the employee has a question about a new Teams feature and needs instant help. It is as easy as asking a friend through a quick chat message.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"FAQ Plus End user.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/130358iFF25FE703AC80C62/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"FAQ Plus End user.gif\" alt=\"FAQ Plus End user.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Change of any kind is hard and it requires careful hand-holding and human support. With this template it becomes simple to bring a human in the loop when the bot can’t help. If the employee has a question that the bot couldn’t help with – instead of having a dead-end with the bot – it is able to bring a human in the loop seamlessly! It posts a real time notification in the Team of subject matter experts using which the experts can directly provide help in the moment.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"FAQ Plus Experts View.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/130359i08BAECABE5CEECAA/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"FAQ Plus Experts View.gif\" alt=\"FAQ Plus Experts View.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>What’s so powerful about this experience is that one – it delights employees by providing help when and where they need it; two – by posting real time in the experts team, it is helping the team get real time feedback and gets the process on the path of continual improvement without requiring expensive and cumbersome context switching for experts – a true win-win.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Finally, as a bonus, there is lightweight ticketing built within the experts’ team experience so managing incoming influx of requests becomes easy and contextual. For example, I can quickly see a list of requests assigned to me or look at all unassigned request – all within the same team, without having to go to a separate application.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>There are so many ways this template can be used to deliver delightful employee experiences. A few that we believe are particularly suitable include HR FAQs, IT Helpdesk and Change management for new internal initiatives.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>As with all app templates, these are open-source production ready apps that don’t require writing any line of code, deploy to Teams in minutes and are easily customizable in branding and functionality.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"3\">We’d love for you to give this a try – Build your powerful bot today by following this <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/samples/app-templates#faq-plus\" target=\"_self\">link</A> and share with us your feedback <A href=\"https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=v4j5cvGGr0GRqy180BHbR2_7qFm_lcZAr4eqEhnLsZ9UMVZGT1lCT0FXUDdZMUM0RkpBS1BESTAwWC4u\" target=\"_self\">here</A>.</FONT></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Also see:</STRONG></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L2FmsUVXyhg&amp;t=39s\" target=\"_self\">Demo video of FAQ Plus App Template</A></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/samples/app-templates\" target=\"_self\">Other useful App Templates for employee productivity scenarios</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 05 Sep 2019 19:06:59
