07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Teams and Skype Inter/Op now available","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/teams-and-skype-inter-op-now-available/ba-p/1469083","description":"<P>As noted in the <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/what-s-new-in-microsoft-teams-may-2020/ba-p/1423015\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">What’s New in Microsoft Teams | May 2020</A> blog, we recently started rolling out Teams and Skype Inter/Op. Today we are happy to share the roll out is complete – Teams users can now chat and call millions of Skype users around the world.</P>\n<P><BR />We know there is a large ecosystem of small and medium businesses using Skype as their collaboration tool. Many of our Microsoft 365 customers value being able to do business with this ecosystem. Scenarios such as securely communicating with vendors, suppliers, contractors, project managers and HR interviews are just some of the reasons why this is important. Usage is growing with thousands of messages being sent every day.</P>\n<P><BR />Remote workers using Teams will also be pleased to know we support this on a variety of devices: mobile (Android and iOS), Web, Windows, and Mac. For an optimal Skype experience, we recommend version 8.58 and later. We also are targeting support for Teams Phones by the end of June.</P>\n<P><BR />Let’s understand the capabilities that are supported.</P>\n<P><BR /><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Teams Users searching for Skype Users</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>It starts with Teams or Skype users wanting to collaborate together directly. Teams users can invite a Skype colleague by using the search bar or simply start a chat. The Skype user then accepts the request and both users can chat, call or share video. Alternatively, the Skype user can also block the request if they so choose.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"1.jpg\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/199104i2B7A390AB7C1CD60/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"1.jpg\" alt=\"1.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Skype users searching for Teams users</STRONG></FONT><BR />Skype users can reach out to collaborate by sending a request. The Teams user is warned this is an external user and then they can accept or block. Admins can also block at the tenant level – see below for more information.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/199105iFEE421DB131E3BF0/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"2.png\" alt=\"2.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Chatting, Audio, and Video</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Once users are connected – they can easily chat back and forth. It is encrypted at rest and in transit so both parties can securely communicate. Today simple text is supported but we are looking at enhancing that based on feedback. And it’s easy to add audio and/or video to the chat for a full collaborative calling experience.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"3.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/199106i337F131664BCF980/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"3.png\" alt=\"3.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Easily Managed by Users and Admins</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>Individual Teams users</STRONG> can easily block any requests with a simple right-click. This lets them control which Skype users they will collaborate with.</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>Teams Administrators</STRONG> can also easily control usage at the tenant level. A single switch can be set to off and block all Skype users from communicating with tenant users. And for admins who prefer PowerShell this is easy to configure as well.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"4.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/199108i638152615ECE2E9C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"4.png\" alt=\"4.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><BR />If you have Teams deployed in your organization and need to provide access to Skype users, please give it a try. It's easy to use and support. Be sure to read our documentation for it <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-skype-interop\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>. We would love to hear your use case for it – post a comment below.<BR /><BR /><BR /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 17 Jun 2020 15:00:00 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/199104i2B7A390AB7C1CD60/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400","linkMd5":"0a5445baa06fdf0bc3d72b17619b0205","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn24@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-56-43-840_6bb2f265b1906683.webp","destWidth":400,"destHeight":170,"sourceBytes":9113,"destBytes":6004,"author":"MicrosoftTeamsTeam","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/199104i2B7A390AB7C1CD60/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn24@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-56-43-840_6bb2f265b1906683.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/199105iFEE421DB131E3BF0/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn18@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-58-07-425_605103ee719f4676.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/199106i337F131664BCF980/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn8@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-57-35-158_be3ee8ff2d86bdf6.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/199108i638152615ECE2E9C/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn55@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-15-916_4fdcfc2bacce0a85.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401920},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Watch your competition’s stock prices: Citizen Productivity using Microsoft Teams + Power Automate","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/watch-your-competition-s-stock-prices-citizen-productivity-using/ba-p/1180004","description":"<P>Millions of users in enterprises today start their day with Microsoft Teams, live their day in Teams and wrap their day with Teams! Teams is where people come together to plan, collaborate, share, discuss, decide and take action on things that matter to their businesses and productivity. Teams as the collaboration hub also plays a central role in enterprises today among strategy and planning group members who keep a close eye on all facets of the business including competition.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Recalling what Peter Thiel says “All failed companies are the same: They failed to escape competition.” - in today’s post let’s explore how Microsoft Teams and Power Automate (erstwhile Microsoft Flow) when put together allows strategy teams in an organization keep a close eye on competition’s stock prices – a leading metric of how Wall Street perceives their progress.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>First Things First</STRONG></P>\n<P>Imagine the strategy team in Contoso (our favorite imaginary company) is collaborating on Microsoft Teams using their private workspace as follows. Among other things, Competitive Info is a channel where they keep a close watch on their named competitors, track compete news, discuss impact, market perception etc.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Vishrut Shukla_0-1582037157214.png\" style=\"width: 270px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171669i410F2DC661C044E1/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Vishrut Shukla_0-1582037157214.png\" alt=\"Vishrut Shukla_0-1582037157214.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><STRONG><BR />The Objective</STRONG></P>\n<P>Strategy team often checks ups and downs in their competitors’ stock prices. Someone from the team always takes turns in querying stock prices from public sources such as <A href=\"https://www.msn.com/en-in/money/stockdetails/company/nas-msft/fi-a1xzim\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">MSN Money</A> or <A href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/MSFT/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Yahoo! Finance</A> and preparing a report for the rest of the team to consume. One of the strategy team members (that’s me!) wants to automate this repetitive task and imagine a world where periodic tracking of compete stock prices happen, essentially getting notifications about stocks once every 12 hours.<BR /><BR /></P>\n<P>I intend to use Power Automate flow inside Microsoft Teams for the same.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Identifying the basic ingredients</STRONG></P>\n<P>Contoso team identifies the following as pieces of this automation puzzle:<BR /><BR /></P>\n<OL>\n<LI><STRONG>List of compete stocks to track</STRONG>: The list of stock symbols to track is maintained in a simple Excel file which can be edited by anyone in the team making it effortless to add/remove competitors from the stock tracking mix. The table where stock symbols are entered is given a name as well.<BR /><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Vishrut Shukla_1-1582037157222.png\" style=\"width: 798px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171671i07089F08820C95B9/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Vishrut Shukla_1-1582037157222.png\" alt=\"Vishrut Shukla_1-1582037157222.png\" /></span>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Vishrut Shukla_2-1582037157224.png\" style=\"width: 209px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171670i59C22F8EBA302174/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Vishrut Shukla_2-1582037157224.png\" alt=\"Vishrut Shukla_2-1582037157224.png\" /></span>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Channel where the stock price alerts will be posted:</STRONG> This can be the Competitive Info channel in the Corporate Strategy HQ team.<BR /><BR /></LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Web service / Data source for querying stock prices</STRONG>: As the most critical piece of the automation, the team will need a source to query latest stock price information for a given symbol. There are a number of public web APIs available which provide this information as a simple JSON response via a simple http GET call. For the purpose of this automation, I pick up the Yahoo! Finance API. See a sample response here: <A href=\"https://query1.finance.yahoo.com/v7/finance/chart/MSFT?&amp;interval=1m\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">https://query1.finance.yahoo.com/v7/finance/chart/MSFT?&amp;interval=1m</A><BR /><BR /><LI-CODE lang=\"javascript\">{\"chart\":{\"result\":[{\"meta\":{\"currency\":\"USD\",\"symbol\":\"MSFT\",\"exchangeName\":\"NMS\",\"instrumentType\":\"EQUITY\",\"firstTradeDate\":511088400,\"regularMarketTime\":1581445810,\"gmtoffset\":-18000,\"timezone\":\"EST\",\"exchangeTimezoneName\":\"America/New_York\",\"regularMarketPrice\":186.86,\"chartPreviousClose\":188.7,\"previousClose\":188.7,\"scale\":3,\"priceHint\":2,\"currentTradingPeriod\":{\"pre\":{\"timezone\":\"EST\",\"start\":1581411600,\"end\":1581431400,\"gmtoffset\":-18000},\"regular\":{\"timezone\":\"EST\",\"start\":1581431400,\"end\":1581454800,\"gmtoffset\":-18000},\"post\":{\"timezone\":\"EST\",\"start\":1581454800,\"end\":1581469200,\"gmtoffset\":-18000}},\"tradingPeriods\":[[{\"timezone\":\"EST\",\"start\":1581431400,\"end\":1581454800,\"gmtoffset\":-18000}]],\"dataGranularity\":\"1m\",\"range\":\"1d\",\"validRanges\":[\"1d\",\"5d\",\"1mo\",\"3mo\",\"6mo\",\"1y\",\"2y\",\"5y\",\"10y\",\"ytd\",\"max\"]},​</LI-CODE>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n</LI>\n</OL>\n<OL start=\"4\">\n<LI><STRONG>Power Automate flow</STRONG> which does the magic!<BR /><BR /></LI>\n</OL>\n<P><STRONG>Building the Power Automate flow</STRONG></P>\n<P>The Power Automate flow looks like this:<BR /><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"3.PNG\" style=\"width: 589px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171739iD0FD6EE2D23313EC/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"3.PNG\" alt=\"3.PNG\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Each step in the creation of the flow used for this is explained below:<BR /><BR /></P>\n<OL>\n<LI><STRONG>Create Flow</STRONG>: I created this using the “+Create” menu option, starting a “Scheduled flow” from scratch.<BR /><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"4.PNG\" style=\"width: 819px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171740iA9759134548A9B9F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"4.PNG\" alt=\"4.PNG\" /></span></LI>\n<LI><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\"><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\"><STRONG>Recurrence</STRONG>: Since the flow is a recurring one, the first step of the solution is Recurrence (a timer event) which Power Automate will automatically add resulting from the Create new step above.<BR /><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"5.PNG\" style=\"width: 553px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171741i62D666B6BD14EF4C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"5.PNG\" alt=\"5.PNG\" /></span></SPAN></SPAN>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Initialize variable</STRONG>: Since I want to post a single message in the Teams channel containing prices of more than one stock symbols of Contoso’s competitors, I will create a variable and keep building the content of the channel message dynamically.<BR /><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"6.PNG\" style=\"width: 727px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171742i7D0C1B2CA94F4F39/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"6.PNG\" alt=\"6.PNG\" /></span><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">&nbsp;</SPAN></LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Fetch stock symbols from the table</STRONG>: I then read the compete stock symbols by listing rows from the Excel file Stock.xlsx as the next step.&nbsp;<BR /><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"6.1.png\" style=\"width: 727px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171743i96651F0A3AE9A4A4/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"6.1.png\" alt=\"6.1.png\" /></span>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\nUsing the ‘Apply to Each’ control action, for each row in the table represented by ‘Current item’, the following steps are performed:<BR /><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"6.2.png\" style=\"width: 771px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171744i41E8055967C88E21/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"6.2.png\" alt=\"6.2.png\" /></span>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\"><STRONG>Parse JSON</STRONG>: Here the row item picked up as the dynamic parameter ‘value’ is parsed as a JSON output so that we can read stock symbols from the Excel file.&nbsp;<BR /><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"7.PNG\" style=\"width: 726px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171746iF886E17781DDF84C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"7.PNG\" alt=\"7.PNG\" /></span></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">You may be wondering how to fill the Schema for the JSON output in this step. Let me share the trick for the same. Power Automate supports generating the schema from a sample output using ‘Generate from sample’ action. But how do you know the JSON output for an Excel file’s rows?<BR /><BR /></SPAN><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">I got that by simply running the flow until step 3 i.e. ’List rows present in a table’ through the ‘Test’ action and seeing the output of the flow run. The Flow Runs Page will show the last run instance of the flow as follows:<BR /><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"8.PNG\" style=\"width: 390px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171755iA174B8F32A8E5A3A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"8.PNG\" alt=\"8.PNG\" /></span></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"9.PNG\" style=\"width: 553px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171760iB82DDCC65CD2B6EE/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"9.PNG\" alt=\"9.PNG\" /></span></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">Clicking on the last run flow will allow you to step into and see outputs as follows:<BR /><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"10.PNG\" style=\"width: 668px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171761i369E81AC02E5557E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"10.PNG\" alt=\"10.PNG\" /></span></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">Under Outputs, the Body section contains how rows read from Excel are represented in JSON format.<BR /><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"11.PNG\" style=\"width: 664px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171763iF5AD2383CFCC18AB/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"11.PNG\" alt=\"11.PNG\" /></span></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">From this output, you can pick up one of the ‘value’ items that can be passed to the ‘Generate from sample’ dialog in the ‘Parse JSON’ step.&nbsp;<BR /><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"12.PNG\" style=\"width: 572px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171764i1C919E96E2945BC9/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"12.PNG\" alt=\"12.PNG\" /></span></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;<BR /><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">This will spit out the schema for parsing JSON and extract relevant values for use in the next step.<BR /><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"13.PNG\" style=\"width: 798px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171765iEAE8C9AB16E3A3AF/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"13.PNG\" alt=\"13.PNG\" /></span></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"14.png\" style=\"width: 694px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171766i93A58DD1DC84DA11/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"14.png\" alt=\"14.png\" /></span>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n</LI>\n<LI>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\"><STRONG>HTTP GET call</STRONG>: Next I add the HTTP action to invoke a REST API for getting the latest stock price of the symbol.&nbsp;<BR /><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"15.PNG\" style=\"width: 728px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171767iDB5145ADA636CAD2/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"15.PNG\" alt=\"15.PNG\" /></span></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">The URI field is the most important here. Yahoo! Finance’s stock price URL is of the form “</SPAN><A style=\"font-family: inherit; background-color: #ffffff;\" href=\"https://query1.finance.yahoo.com/v7/finance/chart/%3cINSERT%20STOCK%20SYMBOL%20HERE%3e?&amp;interval=1m\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">https://query1.finance.yahoo.com/v7/finance/chart/&lt;INSERT STOCK SYMBOL HERE&gt;?&amp;interval=1m</A><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">”. Hence, using the ‘Add dynamic content’ feature, I can input the parsed ‘Stocks’ string from the previous step to construct the right HTTP GET URL for each stock symbol.<BR /><BR /></SPAN>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n</LI>\n<LI>\n<P><STRONG>Parse JSON</STRONG>: Now, the response from the HTTP GET step needs to be parsed to extract stock price metrics for the given stock symbol. Body field from the previous step acts as the ‘Content’ input here. Similar to the previous step, the Schema is generated using the ‘Generate from sample’ option. You can use the JSON response you obtain when executing the Yahoo! Finance URL in your browser for any stock symbol. For eg: when you visit this URL: <A href=\"https://query1.finance.yahoo.com/v7/finance/chart/MSFT?&amp;interval=1m\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">https://query1.finance.yahoo.com/v7/finance/chart/MSFT?&amp;interval=1m</A> in your browser, you’ll get the JSON response to this GET call. Use this entire output to generate the schema.<BR /><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"17.PNG\" style=\"width: 727px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171770iFDBB1D91B2DCB51B/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"17.PNG\" alt=\"17.PNG\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n</LI>\n<LI>\n<P><STRONG>Append to string variable</STRONG>: Now, it’s time to construct what get’s posted for end users in the Teams channel as a conversation. From the previous step, I now have all pieces of information – it’s just a matter to compose the message. Using the ‘Append to string variable’ action, I keep appending to the string variable called ‘Message’ we’d defined earlier.</P>\n<P><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"17.PNG\" style=\"width: 727px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171770iFDBB1D91B2DCB51B/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"17.PNG\" alt=\"17.PNG\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<DIV id=\"tinyMceEditorVishrut Shukla_19\" class=\"mceNonEditable lia-copypaste-placeholder\">&nbsp;</DIV>\n<P>The output of the HTTP GET call when parsed gives us the stock symbol, currency, regularMarketPrice etc. all of which are dynamic content available to be used in the ‘Value’ field to construct the string for each competitor’s stock symbol.</P>\n<BR />\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n</LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Post the message into Teams channel</STRONG>: The last step is to post the message containing all compete stock prices into Microsoft Teams channel. You should be careful that this step should be outside the ‘Apply to each’ loop, otherwise, the flow will end up posting multiple times with incremental content as the Message string gets constructed for symbols one by one.<BR /><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"18.PNG\" style=\"width: 605px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171771iAAB1F6EB8D3ECE77/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"18.PNG\" alt=\"18.PNG\" /></span>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\nHere, I use the ‘Post a message’ action in Power Automate to simply post the Message string variable to Teams in the chosen team/channel.<BR /><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"19.PNG\" style=\"width: 725px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171772iDFCF81FC6EA00F6F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"19.PNG\" alt=\"19.PNG\" /></span>\n<P>&nbsp;<BR /><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">Keeping with the best practices of starting conversations in Teams, the ‘Subject’ field is set as well. To report when the compete stock prices have been captured, I also included the time snapshot when this message gets posted using a dynamic expression compiled using:<BR /><BR /></SPAN></P>\n<LI-CODE lang=\"javascript\">convertTimeZone(utcnow(),'UTC','India Standard Time','dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm:ss')</LI-CODE>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n</LI>\n</OL>\n<P><STRONG>Testing the Power Automate flow</STRONG></P>\n<P>To test the flow, I can trigger it manually and check the Competitive Info channel to find the below message beautifully posted along with the latest stock prices of all competitors of Contoso!</P>\n<P><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"20.PNG\" style=\"width: 656px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171773i5307C5D964703202/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"20.PNG\" alt=\"20.PNG\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Say hello to real-time, productive and meaningful collaboration!</STRONG></P>\n<P>The entire corporate strategy team can now always stay in the know about how Wall Street is responding to their competitors. Automated messages such as the above periodically posted in Microsoft Teams where the entire team collaborates allow the team to quickly react to stock price movements and analyse the market around them.</P>\n<P><BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"21.PNG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img f598dd5ee6f.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171770iFDBB1D91B2DCB51B/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn47@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-07-232_230b594a18d457bb.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171771iAAB1F6EB8D3ECE77/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn88@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-24-419_4ebf7b9d3c19ee96.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171772iDFCF81FC6EA00F6F/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn94@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-58-05-171_221c90471624a2e9.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171773i5307C5D964703202/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn76@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-57-45-109_c1a959574d60d956.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171774iF0E130AFB63EF02E/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn16@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-41-378_224a8b339c05d2fd.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401926},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 2020","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/microsoft-at-integrated-systems-europe-2020/ba-p/1187858","description":"<P>Microsoft Teams created a splash during Integrated Systems Europe 2020, with a joint showcase of Teams devices and Surface Hub. Nearly 80,000 customers and partners from around the world walked the floors of the Rai convention center, exploring the newest solutions in professional audiovisual communication, electronic systems integration and IT industry innovation.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Expo Hall&nbsp;</STRONG></FONT><BR />We showcased the latest hardware innovations for Teams by recreating four common settings: the personal office, focus room, huddle room and conference room. Attendees were invited to take a tour through these work spaces and were presented with ideas of how digital transformation can take place from the ground up.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"IMG_0413.JPG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"IMG_0418.JPG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The huddle space and conference room</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">The Conference Room</span></span></P>\n<P>Microsoft representatives from corp, Europe region, and Dutch subsidiary were present to provide live demonstrations of the solutions, inform customers of the latest and greatest in Teams, and answer questions.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"IMG_3748.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/172588iAA9E7C8830DA6E6F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"IMG_3748.jpg\" alt=\"IMG_3748.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Global Presence Alliance Tour</STRONG></FONT>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>One exciting tour was for the <A href=\"https://www.global-presence.org/\" target=\"_self\">Global Presence Alliance</A>, an organization based in key cities around the world with local re-seller affiliations. When a customer needs a communication solution that spans geographies, the GPA is able to facilitate the seamless deployment of solutions. We showed them our newest solutions and explained the strategy behind how Teams can come to life across different devices and spaces.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"GPA Tour.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/172591iCF7592CD53FEA9A8/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"GPA Tour.jpg\" alt=\"GPA Tour.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Lastly, besides the innovation that came to life in our booth, our partner's commitment to innovating in the Teams devices ecosystem was evident in booth spaces all across the Rai. Transfer to Contacts</STRONG><BR />When transferring a call, Microsoft Teams phones will now suggest frequent contacts to easily transfer calls with a single touch. If you don’t see the contact from the suggested list, you can still search using the search bar. <BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"111.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/202027i9D77D5944417F951/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"111.png\" alt=\"111.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>5. Seamless Lock/Unlock with your PC</STRONG><BR />With this new feature, your Teams phone and Teams PC client will have a coordinated and seamless lock and unlock experience.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>To set this up, you will need to connect your Teams PC client to your Teams phone. <BR />Prerequisites:</P>\n<OL>\n<LI>Both devices need to be signed into the same user account.</LI>\n<LI>Your PC must be Bluetooth enabled and in proximity to your Teams phone.</LI>\n<LI>Your PC must run 64-bit Teams desktop client with version &gt;= 1.3.00.15364.<BR />Note: Mac, Linux, web, mobile and 32-bit/ARM-based Teams clients are currently not supported.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P>Lock / unlock setup:</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"7.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/201886iCCC203A97A50A81C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"7.png\" alt=\"1. SCXW246544926 BCX0\" data-ccp-charstyle=\"normaltextrun\" data-wac-het=\"1\">Teams mobile app</SPAN></SPAN></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">The&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">Bookings&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">app&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">in Teams is an extension of</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">&nbsp;the&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">current Microsoft Bookings&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">capabi</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">lities</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">&nbsp;available&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">to Microsoft 365 customers.&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">Learn more about how we’re</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">&nbsp;expanding&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">the&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">features and availability o</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">f Microsoft Bookings&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"http://aka.ms/BookingsforEnterprises\" target=\"_self\"><SPAN>here</SPAN></A><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">.</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\" data-wac-het=\"1\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">In addition, with the </SPAN><SPAN><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/api/resources/onlinemeeting?view=graph-rest-1.0\" target=\"_self\">Microsoft Graph</A> </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">API, organizations can incorporate Teams meetings into their unique healthcare workflows. The API supports the integration of both scheduling and meeting-join links into existing healthcare applications like electronic health record systems.</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">Partners</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">&nbsp;like&nbsp;</SPAN><A href=\"https://modalitysoftware.com/oneconsultation/no-integration-no-scheduling\" target=\"_self\"><SPAN>Modality Systems</SPAN></A><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">&nbsp;are already&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">using these APIs</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">&nbsp;to bring&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">customized&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">virtual&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">visit workflows</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">with Microsoft Teams&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">to healthcare providers</SPAN><SPAN>.</SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\" data-wac-het=\"1\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><U>Availability</U><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">: Bookings app in Teams will be&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">available in the coming weeks.</SPAN></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 12.0pt; color: #333333;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 12.0pt; color: #333333;\" data-unlink=\"true\"><SPAN style=\"text-decoration: underline; background: white;\">Early Access:</SPAN><SPAN style=\"background: white;\"> If your organization is interested in getting early access to the Bookings app in Microsoft Teams to schedule, manage, and conduct virtual visits, please fill out this </SPAN><A href=\"http://aka.ms/teamsvirtualvisits\" target=\"_self\"><SPAN style=\"background: white;\">form</SPAN></A>&nbsp;<SPAN style=\"background: white;\">. </SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">2. Reach the right on-shift clinician with targeted communications&nbsp;</SPAN></STRONG><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:160,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\" data-wac-het=\"1\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">Knowing who is on shift and being able to reach them at the right time is key to delivering timely patient care. Often, valuable time is spent trying to identify the correct contact information for healthcare staff members. </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">C</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">urrently with targeted communications in Teams, you can manually create tags to organize users based on attributes such as a role, skill, or location. </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">Once applied you can message everyone assigned to a tag at the same time in a chat or channel conversation:  for example, you can message all </SPAN><STRONG><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">@Orderlies</SPAN></STRONG><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\"> in a ward. </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\"> </SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;134233117&quot;:true,&quot;134233118&quot;:true,&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:240}\" data-wac-het=\"1\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\"> </SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;134233117&quot;:true,&quot;134233118&quot;:true,&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:240}\" data-wac-het=\"1\">&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">And </SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">coming soon, Teams messages can be targeted to role recipients based on the shifts they are working. With this added ability to tag based on shift awareness,</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">users are automatically assigned to tags matching their schedule in the Shifts app in Teams, which allows for integration with major workforce management systems</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">including </SPAN><A href=\"https://aka.ms/AA7kadb\" target=\"_self\"><SPAN>AMiON</SPAN></A><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">,<A href=\"https://aka.ms/AA7kadc\" target=\"_self\"> </A></SPAN><A href=\"https://aka.ms/AA7kadc\" target=\"_self\"><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">JDA</SPAN></A><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">, and </SPAN><A href=\"https://aka.ms/AA7khyp\" target=\"_self\"><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">Kronos</SPAN></A><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"TCSBT Channel.png\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img posts\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Targeted communications in channel posts</span></span></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN with manual tags&nbsp;</SPAN></SPAN><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/manage-tags\" target=\"_self\"><SPAN class=\"FieldRange  BCX0 SCXW89685520\"><SPAN class=\"TextRun data-wac-het=\"1\">.</SPAN></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN><STRONG>Partnering to drive</STRONG></SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">&nbsp;<STRONG>healthcare innovation</STRONG></SPAN><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\">Navigating&nbsp;the challenges and disruption facing the healthcare industry&nbsp;requires&nbsp;partnership among healthcare organizations, industry associations, and technology providers.&nbsp;Building on our&nbsp;momentum with partners&nbsp;and ISVs across healthcare, there are&nbsp;a few exciting new announcements:</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/AA7kadk\" target=\"_self\"><SPAN>Innovaccer</SPAN></A><SPAN>&nbsp;is&nbsp;integrating&nbsp;care management and coordination into Microsoft Teams to reduce redundant tasks,&nbsp;surface&nbsp;insights,&nbsp;and increase communication across the care team.&nbsp;</SPAN></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/AA7khyz\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><SPAN>Andor Health</SPAN></A><SPAN>&nbsp;gives clinicians the power to configure workflows and&nbsp;bring&nbsp;messages originating in an EHR&nbsp;directly into Teams,&nbsp;enabling&nbsp;the&nbsp;clinicians to personalize the signals used&nbsp;to&nbsp;help them&nbsp;provide care.&nbsp;</SPAN></LI>\n<LI><SPAN><A href=\"https://appsource.microsoft.com/en-us/product/web-apps/dapasoft.corolar-fhir-cdr-for-teams?tab=Overview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Dapasoft Corolar</A> brings integration with EHRs using FHIR to enable care providers to communicate about patient care in real-time with Microsoft Teams.</SPAN></LI>\n<LI><SPAN><A href=\"https://aka.ms/AA7khz0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Imprivata</A>&nbsp;enables Microsoft&nbsp;365 to support&nbsp;“badge-tap” access&nbsp;to make&nbsp;secure&nbsp;sign-on&nbsp;to applications,&nbsp;whether&nbsp;on-premise&nbsp;or in the cloud,&nbsp;even more efficient&nbsp;for staff.&nbsp;Clinicians can simply tap their badge to be quickly authenticated and log directly&nbsp;into&nbsp;and out of Teams&nbsp;instead of entering a&nbsp;username&nbsp;and password&nbsp;to access mobile&nbsp;and other shared clinical&nbsp;devices.&nbsp;</SPAN></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN><STRONG>Hear it from our customers </STRONG></SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><BR /><A href=\"https://aka.ms/Northwell_Hero_cs\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><SPAN><STRONG>Northwell Health</STRONG></SPAN></A><SPAN><STRONG>,</STRONG></SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;New York&nbsp;state’s&nbsp;largest healthcare provider,&nbsp;has rolled out&nbsp;Teams to&nbsp;all of&nbsp;its employees,&nbsp;helping transform patient&nbsp;care&nbsp;coordination,&nbsp;and ultimately resulting in shorter hospital stays and&nbsp;improved&nbsp;patient outcomes.&nbsp;Vish&nbsp;Anantraman, AVP Chief Technology Innovation Officer,&nbsp;explains: “Microsoft Teams is a great platform for collaboration. It is a platform on which we have been able to innovate.”&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN>Clinicians at&nbsp;UK&nbsp;National Health Service&nbsp;(NHS)&nbsp;<STRONG>Calderdale&nbsp;and Huddersfield&nbsp;Trust</STRONG>&nbsp;are conducting virtual visits with patients using Teams,&nbsp;saving&nbsp;on travel time&nbsp;for both doctors and patients.&nbsp;They’ve seen&nbsp;the&nbsp;quality of care&nbsp;increase and&nbsp;costs reduced.&nbsp;Stay tuned for&nbsp;a new&nbsp;video, which will be posted here&nbsp;soon.&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN>With locations in 26 countries,<STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG><A href=\"https://aka.ms/Cerner_Hero_cs\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><STRONG>Cerner Corporation</STRONG></A>&nbsp;is using Teams to&nbsp;help&nbsp;its&nbsp;associates work smarter to power healthcare innovation with Microsoft 365.&nbsp;Bill Graff, Chief Information Officer,&nbsp;explains,&nbsp;“We were looking for borderless mobility, an intelligent work experience infused with AI. And we wanted that work to happen in an environment with tight security from the start. Microsoft 365 delivers on all counts.”&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Resources for healthcare organizations</STRONG></P>\n<P>Check out the <A href=\"https://products.office.com/en-us/microsoft-teams/healthcare-solutions\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Teams for healthcare</A> page to learn more about how Teams can empower healthcare professionals in a modern workplace. To help get started with digital transformation for your healthcare organization, check out the resource below:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/expand-teams-across-your-org/healthcare/healthcare-templates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Teams healthcare templates information</A></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/business-voice/policy-packages\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Teams healthcare policy package information</A></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2019/04/HIPAA-Compliance-Microsoft-Office-365-and-Microsoft-Teams.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">HIPAA compliance and Teams whitepaper</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Let us know what you think!</STRONG><BR />Try the new features and provide feedback using the feedback link in the lower left corner of Microsoft Teams. 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Microsoft Teams Calling, Meetings, and Devices at Ignite 2019: that’s a wrap!","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/microsoft-teams-calling-meetings-and-devices-at-ignite-2019-that/ba-p/1000071","description":"<P>Thank you to everyone who joined us last week at Microsoft Ignite 2019 in Orlando and participated in keynotes, breakout sessions, and spent time on the expo floor. &nbsp;There were many announcements for Microsoft Teams shared across the week.&nbsp; And for those that were unable to attend in person you can watch the sessions on-demand. &nbsp;The following is a list of sessions related to Teams meetings, calling, devices, and transition planning.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Microsoft Teams Meetings</STRONG></P>\n<P>Experience new ways of connecting and collaborating through online meeting solutions and devices that enable your organization to meet anywhere, meet with intelligence, and meet with confidence.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/MicrosoftIgnite2019/MTG10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">MTG10: Get the most out of meetings with Microsoft Teams</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/MicrosoftIgnite2019/MTG20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">MTG20: What’s new for Microsoft Teams Meetings</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/MicrosoftIgnite2019/MTG30\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">MTG30: Microsoft Teams Rooms deployment for an inclusive and enhanced meeting room</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/MicrosoftIgnite2019/MTG40\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">MTG40: Meetings First: Microsoft Teams meetings for Skype for Business Server customers</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/MicrosoftIgnite2019/MTG50\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">MTG50: Host large scale town halls, webinars, and meetings with up to 10,000 attendees with Microsoft Teams Live Events</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Calling in Microsoft Teams</STRONG></P>\n<P>Build your organizations cloud voice strategy to provide every user with the ability to make and receive calls globally.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/MicrosoftIgnite2019/VCE10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">VCE10: Calling in Microsoft Teams</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/MicrosoftIgnite2019/VCE20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">VCE20: Deploying Direct Routing</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/MicrosoftIgnite2019/VCE30\" Compliance Recording and Microsoft Teams</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/MicrosoftIgnite2019/VCE50\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">VCE50: Contact center and Microsoft Teams</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Microsoft Teams Devices</STRONG></P>\n<P>Teams is modernizing the meeting experience.&nbsp; Learn what intelligence mean when it comes to meetings and calling, including your devices experiences.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><SPAN><A href=\"https://aka.ms/MicrosoftIgnite2019/BRK2198\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">BRK2198: Microsoft Teams Phones and innovative and intelligent devices for Microsoft Teams</A></SPAN></LI>\n<LI><SPAN><A href=\"https://aka.ms/MicrosoftIgnite2019/BRK2373\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">BRK2373: Microsoft Teams room management</A></SPAN></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Upgrading from Skype for Business to Microsoft Teams</STRONG></P>\n<P>Help your company embrace and adopt this new way of working. With examples from different industry verticals as well as tips and tricks to help you activate teamwork across your organization.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><SPAN><A href=\"https://aka.ms/MicrosoftIgnite2019/BRK3232\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">BRK3232: Plan and implement a successful upgrade from Skype for Business to Microsoft Teams</A></SPAN></LI>\n<LI><SPAN><A href=\"https://aka.ms/MicrosoftIgnite2019/BRK3217\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">BRK3217: Optimizing coexistence on your path to Teams</A></SPAN></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>News recap</STRONG></P>\n<P>And if you haven't already heard the news, quickly catch up on all of the announcements made at Ignite 2019.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-Teams-Blog/What-s-New-in-Microsoft-Teams-Ignite-2019/ba-p/937025\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">What’s New in Microsoft Teams | Ignite 2019</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-Teams-Blog/Microsoft-amp-Cisco-partner-to-simplify-meetings-and-calling-for/ba-p/971835\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft &amp; Cisco partner to simplify meetings and calling for mutual customers</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-Teams-Blog/What-s-New-for-Calling-in-Microsoft-Teams-Ignite-2019-Edition/ba-p/974935\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">What's New in Calling in Microsoft Teams</A></LI>\n</UL>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 11 Nov 2019 17:36:33 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"827b54a1fd8a96968e16bb782f9547e8","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"James Skay","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401927},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"What’s New in Microsoft Teams | February 2020","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/what-s-new-in-microsoft-teams-february-2020/ba-p/1199785","description":"<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">February may be the shortest month of the year, but we were still able to bring plenty of new functionality to Microsoft Teams! From the new Outlook integrated experience to enhanced compliance controls, we are constantly improving to help people do their best work. Read on to learn about everything that is new to Teams in February.</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\"><STRONG>N<FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">ew Teams &amp; Outlook integrated experience&nbsp;</FONT></STRONG></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Teams is the hub for getting work done with your team—but we know that is not the only way people communicate. We have built this new integration between Outlook and Teams to make it easy to collaborate no matter where the conversation is taking place. The user can now move a Teams conversation from Teams to Outlook by clicking on the more options (\"...\") icon in a conversation. And rolling out in March, users will be able to move an email conversation form Outlook, including attachments, into a Teams chat or channel conversation by clicking on the ‘’Share to Teams’’ in Outlook. Learn more <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/share-to-outlook-from-teams-f9dabbe9-9e9b-4e35-99dd-2eeeb67c4f6d\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</FONT></DIV>\n<P><VIDEO autoplay=\"autoplay\" loop=\"loop\" muted=\"\" width=\"950\" height=\"475\">\n<SOURCE src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/Teams/Teams to Outlook - Mar 2020.mp4\n\" type=\"video/mp4\"></SOURCE></VIDEO></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: Chat &amp; Collaboration</FONT>&nbsp;</P>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\"><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Get in touch with the right people with targeted communication</FONT></STRONG></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">What do you do when you need to get an important message across to all cashiers in a store, or all managers in a warehouse? Targeted communication allows team members to message everyone assigned to a specific tag at the same time; simply @mention the tag name in a post. Using tags, team owners can organize users based on a common attribute, like a role, project, or location. Admins can control who can add tags and how tags are used across your organization in the Microsoft Teams admin center. Learn more <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/MicrosoftTeams/manage-tags\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</FONT></DIV>\n<IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/Teams/TargetedCommunications.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"980\" />\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Automatic creation of an org-wide team</STRONG> </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Streamline the process of bringing everyone together in your small to medium-sized business. All new tenants with 5000 users or fewer will start with an org-wide team. Learn more about org-wide teams and related best practices <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/create-an-org-wide-team\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><BR /><STRONG>New Files Experience in Teams powered by SharePoint rolled out worldwide!</STRONG><BR />The Teams file experience is powered by SharePoint, and we are happy to share that the new file experience in Teams has now rolled out to 100% of worldwide tenants! This new experience in the File tab of a channel includes the ability to sync files to your computer (PC or Mac), see rich previews across 320+ file types, create views and work with metadata, see document life-cycle signals, review on-hover file cards, pin files to the top, take actions like check in and check out, and much more. See more of the experience <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/rich-new-file-and-sharing-experiences-throughout-microsoft-365/ba-p/960129\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>. <BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"sharepoint files.png\" style=\"width: 792px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/174016i9EFC0A2A72E3FE7E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"sharepoint files.png\" alt=\"sharepoint files.png\" /></span></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: Calling &amp; Meetings</FONT> <BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Store recordings in-region storage when Stream is not available in Go Local</STRONG> <BR />Teams meeting recordings are stored in Microsoft Stream cloud storage. Tenant administrators have an option to go to the admin center to turn ON/OFF “Allow cloud recording” setting for Teams meetings. Cloud recordings are currently not allowed/enabled for customers where Stream service is not available in the corresponding Go Local region. We are going to change the existing behavior by enabling “Allow cloud recording” and turning it ON by default. This change will store the recordings in the respective in-region data center. Learn more <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/cloud-recording\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: IT Admins</FONT> <BR /><STRONG>Manage your App Catalog in the Teams Admin Center</STRONG><BR />Confidently manage apps from the Microsoft Teams admin center. The Manage apps page provides administrators with a view into all available apps in the tenant and includes information to help them decide which apps to enabled for their organization. Additionally, the app catalog allows administrators to streamline the process of testing and distributing line-of-business applications. Learn more <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/manage-apps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><BR /><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: Security &amp; Compliance</FONT> <BR /><STRONG>Legal hold for Teams private channels messages</STRONG><BR />Meet legal requirements by preserving information in Teams. Legal hold now supports the preservation of private channel messages. Learn more <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/legal-hold\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><BR /><STRONG>Communication Compliance</STRONG><BR />Minimize communication risks in your organization. Communication Compliance helps administrators detect, capture, and take remediation actions for inappropriate messages. Learn more <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/communication-compliance?view=o365-worldwide\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><BR /><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: GCC, GCC High, &amp; DOD</FONT><BR /><STRONG>Phone System Additions for GCC</STRONG> <BR />There were several additions to These features are available to GCC customers. This includes (1) Teams users can screen share to Skype for Business users, (2) Callers can transfer directly to voicemail, (3) Caller ID for Teams users (AAD)&nbsp; (4) Chrome browser users can send and receive video calls, and (5) use the powerbar slash command to make PSTN calls.</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><BR /><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: Apps &amp; Workflows</FONT><BR /><STRONG>Enhanced Power BI Tab for Teams</STRONG><BR />We’re excited to announce the new Power BI tab for Microsoft Teams. The new tab adds support for reports in the new workspace experiences, reports in Power BI apps, and paginated reports. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">When the tab is added to your channels and chats, it’s easier for everyone to find and track the data they need to achieve their objectives. It’s also a great way to manage change in your organization. As new people join a team, the data they need is right there and ready for them to use</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><BR /><STRONG>Pin your apps to the left-hand rail for easy access</STRONG> </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Access to your favorite apps just got easier. You are now able to pin personal apps to the left-hand rail (also known as the Teams app bar). Simply find the app, right-click the app icon, and select “pin”. Even after you navigate away, the app icon will remain so you can easily return to it. Remember, you can also pin apps to relevant channels or chats for easy access as well! </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><BR />The Teams Admin can also create group policies so certain apps appear on everyone’s Teams app bar. Learn more about Admin app pinning <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-app-setup-policies\" target=\"_self\">here</A>.</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"61d87259-3e6e-404d-a100-6d71ce7517cb.png\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/174154i351FA06DC8AB932D/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"61d87259-3e6e-404d-a100-6d71ce7517cb.png\" alt=\"61d87259-3e6e-404d-a100-6d71ce7517cb.png\" /></span></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: Education</FONT> <BR /><STRONG>Introducing Microsoft Teams QBot!</STRONG> <BR /><A href=\"https://github.com/unsw-edu-au/QBot\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">QBot</A> is a solution designed for classroom teaching scenarios which allow teachers, tutors and students to intelligently answer each other's questions within the Microsoft Teams collaboration platform. It leverages the power of Azure Cognitive Services, in particular QnA Maker to achieve this.<BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Once the app is deployed to a Team, a student can ask a question on the channel by @tagging QBot. QBot will respond with the correct answer or tag a group of demonstrators allowing them to collaborate on a response. Accepted answers are subsequently used to train Qbot for future questions.<BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">See a quick, animated demo of the various app scenarios <A href=\"https://github.com/unsw-edu-au/QBot/blob/master/Documentation/demo.md\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.<BR /></FONT></DIV>\n</DIV>\n</DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><FONT size=\"5\">And More...</FONT></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><STRONG style=\"font-family: inherit;\">The Intrazone podcast episode: “An API for Teamwork”</STRONG></DIV>\nCheck out this recent episode of The Intrazone,&nbsp;<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sharepoint-blog/an-api-for-teamwork-all-about-microsoft-teams-as-a-platform-on/ba-p/1179830\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">“An API for Teamwork”</A>, hosted by Microsoft’s Mark Kashman (<A href=\"https://twitter.com/mkashman\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">@mkashman</A>) and Chris McNulty (<A href=\"https://twitter.com/cmcnulty2000\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">@cmcnulty2000</A>). In this episode, Mark and Chris uncover the power and capabilities of Microsoft Teams as a platform while chatting with experts inside and outside of Microsoft. You’ll hear all about bots, tabs and connectors – the basis of what and how to approach extending the Microsoft Teams platform offering.</DIV>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 11 Mar 2020 19:29:14 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"da49bcc2026949be2d41664ba526701b","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Marissa Salazar","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/Teams/TargetedCommunications.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn61@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-58-16-312_d123e3ba7bc9c8e7.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/174016i9EFC0A2A72E3FE7E/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn19@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-57-48-513_af497117ebcbec27.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/174154i351FA06DC8AB932D/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn15@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-57-10-501_e1193cc10eb7104c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401924},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Teams is shaping the future of work with low code features to enhance your digital workspace","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/teams-is-shaping-the-future-of-work-with-low-code-features-to/ba-p/1507180","description":"<P>Over the last four months, COVID-19 has vaulted us all into a new way of working. With the shift to remote and hybrid work, Microsoft Teams has enabled people around the world to continue to create, collaborate, and communicate. With more than 75 million daily active users, Teams is how people are getting work done.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Teams is a hub for productivity for many workers, which makes it critical that key business processes, data, and apps are easily accessible in Teams. Today we are announcing new capabilities that will make it easier for Teams users to create low code applications and customized chatbots to simplify processes for their organizations. We are also making it easier to bring data into the flow of people’s work and conversation through easy sharing of reports and dashboards. These new functionalities will empower business users to rapidly respond to changing business needs and create innovative custom solutions improve how work gets done.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P data-unlink=\"true\"><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Microsoft Project Oakdale, a built-in, low code data platform for your apps, bots, and automation within Teams</FONT></STRONG><BR />Microsoft Project Oakdale&nbsp; is a new built in low code data platform for Microsoft Teams supporting relational, file, and image data with find filter and sort capabilities. It will let users utilize a wide range of data types for their Power Platform solutions in Teams. Project Oakdale makes the back-end tech logistics of creating and administering business process solutions for Teams easier than ever. Users can now easily create custom data tables, a built-in low code platform, and low code data storage. Project Oakdale provides security and governance features that allow you to control access to apps, bots, and flows, as well as their underlying data.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/Gif%20for%20dataflex%20Inspire%20annoncement%20-%20V1%20(1).gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The new Project Oakdale, Power Apps, Power Automate, and Power Virtual Agents functionality in Teams are coming soon for select <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/?p=234710\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft 365</A> and Office 365 users for no additional cost.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Make apps, flows, and chatbots directly within Teams with Power Apps, Power Automate, and Power Virtual Agents</FONT> </STRONG><BR />App makers will now be able create low code apps with <A href=\"https://teams.microsoft.com/l/app/a6b63365-31a4-4f43-92ec-710b71557af9?source=store-copy-link\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Power Apps</A> directly within Teams, which is all made possible by Project Oakdale. The new integrated app studio&nbsp;will allow app makers to:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Create and edit custom apps and flows, then quickly publish them for anyone on their team to use</LI>\n<LI>Easily deploy fully functional solutions to Teams with just one click</LI>\n<LI>Customize app templates and responsive app layouts native to Teams</LI>\n<LI>Manage all apps and flows via a secure, relational backend with Project Oakdale</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>These new features will be rolled out in public preview in August, allowing citizen developers to start building apps and professional developers to accelerate app development and deployment.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/Teams%20%2B%20Power%20Apps.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Many organizations are looking to automate manual and time consuming processes, and that’s why we are deepening the integration of the Power Platform’s newest component, <A href=\"https://aka.ms/Inspire20OAftab\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Power Virtual Agents and Teams</A>. Power Virtual Agents allow users to create chatbots using a built-in natural language processing AI engine and no-code graphical interface, making it easier for everyday business users without coding or data science backgrounds to start building and managing their own bots. Makers can easily add Power Automate’s workflow automation into their bots to complete common business processes conversationally.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Some of what you’ll be able to do in Teams includes:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Create and edit bots, then publish and make them available for their team or organization to use</LI>\n<LI>Make content updates and publish real time to keep the bot content up to date to meet the latest need of your team and organization</LI>\n<LI>Manage your bots and their content via a secure, relational backend with Project Oakdale</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>By making the bot creation process more approachable and intuitive for users without a software development background, it empowers the people that know the business to create bots and can quickly adapt the conversation to changing policies, information, and business needs.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/PVA%20Gif%20for%20Inspire%20-%20V2.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Power Virtual Agents Teams app will be available at no additional cost for select Microsoft 365 and Office 365 users to create bots for their teams or their entire organization starting with a public preview in August.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Power BI app for Teams – a central place for your analytics</STRONG></FONT><BR />To help shift to rapidly changing conditions, organizations are looking for new ways to leverage their data to drive insights. The new Power BI personal app for Teams gives people a hub for all their data visualizations and a place to find more data from across their organization.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/power%20bi.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The app provides a more streamlined experience for accessing Power BI reports in Teams and provides sample reports, training information, and <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/collaborate-share/service-embed-report-microsoft-teams\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">streamlined sharing functionality</A> to help users incorporate data-driven decision making in their work.</P>\n<P><BR />The new personal app will soon be available in August in the Teams app store to help make data a part of all your teams’ conversations.</P>\n<P><BR /><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Automate remote work with Teams + Power Automate</STRONG></FONT><BR />For many of us, work is busier than ever, so we’ve built a few new features for the <A href=\"https://aka.ms/Inspire20SSiciliano\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Teams and Power Automate integration</A> that will “give some time back” to our increasingly hectic days.</P>\n<P><BR />You can now use the “for a selected message” trigger in <A href=\"https://teams.microsoft.com/l/app/c3a1996d-db0f-4857-a6ea-7aabf0266b00?source=store-copy-link\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Power Automate</A>, to allow Teams users to initiate an automated workflow right from a Teams message – whether that’s submitting a trouble ticket for IT, requesting supplies, or creating a sales lead.</P>\n<P><BR />Lastly, Teams users can automatically @mention colleagues to draw their attention to important messages, even if they were sent as part of an automated workflow.</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Resources for your organization to get started</FONT> </STRONG><BR />There are many ways to get started using Teams and Power Platform. For new users looking to get started building low code custom solutions with Power Platform, there are a number of online resources to help you get started. We also have programs that we run in collaboration with many of our partners, such as App in a Day and Dashboard in a Day, that will have you building your first app or dashboard in no time. These trainings are now hosted in virtual formats, so you can learn more about these tools that will help modernize your business processes, even while working remotely.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoftevents.com/profile/web/index.cfm?PKwebID=0x1024196abcd\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">App in a Day</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/diad/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Dashboard in a Day</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"http://aka.ms/PowerPlatformResources\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Power Platform learning resources</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"http://aka.ms/PowerPlatformLabs\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Power Platform training materials</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>Also, you can take a look to see how customers like <A href=\"https://aka.ms/CenturyLink_FLW_Teams\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">CenturyLink</A>, <A href=\"https://customers.microsoft.com/en-SG/story/765534-telstra-telecommunications-teams\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Telstra</A>, <A href=\"https://customers.microsoft.com/en-SG/story/794051-paypal-banking-capital-markets-teams\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">PayPal</A>, and <A href=\"https://customers.microsoft.com/en-SG/story/768079-capitol-records-media-entertainment-power-platform\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Capitol Records</A> have already started to modernize their business processes with powerful Teams and Power Platform integrations and check out Forrester’s recently published <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/total-economic-impact-of-using-microsoft-teams-as-a-platform-and/ba-p/1520009\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">New Technology Total Economic Impact™ study</A> of Microsoft Teams Platform to see how these technologies have already helped our customers.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Please visit these other blogs to learn more about these exciting product announcements</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/Inspire20OAftab\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Power Virtual Agents in Teams</A></LI>\n<LI><A
