target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft 365 What’s new</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><EM>Note: Blog was updated to reflect changes to naming on 8/10/2020</EM></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 12 Aug 2020 15:10:17 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"7c128215aafe13455655608a35a8f4ec","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"MicrosoftTeamsTeam","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/Gif%20for%20dataflex%20Inspire%20annoncement%20-%20V1%20(1).gif":null,"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/Teams%20%2B%20Power%20Apps.gif":null,"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/PVA%20Gif%20for%20Inspire%20-%20V2.gif":null,"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/power%20bi.gif":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401917},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Design your remote work culture with Microsoft Teams apps","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/design-your-remote-work-culture-with-microsoft-teams-apps/ba-p/1317308","description":"<P>Microsoft Teams is best known for group channels, chat conversations, meetings, and calendars all in one place, making team collaboration easier within a unified hub. But beyond this - by providing many ways that apps can integrate, Microsoft Teams is designed to be highly tailored. It can become a customized digital home for your team, well suited for remote work scenarios. Many teams are now fully working remotely. As they adapt, it’s important to keep experimenting in customizing the mix of communication styles and applications to find the right balance for your team.</P>\n<P><BR />Many of the app integrations for Microsoft Team focus on connecting with the apps you’re already using, like ADP or Adobe Creative Cloud. As you design and iterate on remote working to further keep your team culture together and integrated, many solutions within the Microsoft Teams Store are specifically designed to help keep teams working together.</P>\n<P><BR />Over the following weeks, we’ll highlight several categories of applications across whiteboarding, design, development, learning, and more that you can use to keep connected. This week, we’ll cover pulse surveys as a communication style.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Taking a pulse of the team</FONT></STRONG><BR />In-person work provides many informal ways to connect and keep connected – from hallway conversations and watercoolers, to 60 person team meetings where you can ask for formal Q&amp;A. 1 to 1 and group chat can facilitate many of these opportunities, but you may want to consider additional tools to ensure every voice is heard.</P>\n<P><BR />One technique is to consider pulse surveys – small one or two question surveys that are easy to fill out. In v-team meetings that can involve many, a quick poll can provide a low impact way to get the sense of your team – providing the virtual equivalent of taking stock of a room.</P>\n<P><BR />Partner applications integrate with Microsoft Teams capabilities including chat and team spaces to make creating a poll possible in as few as three clicks. Through the compose bar within Microsoft Teams, you can add a quick poll for your team, within you channel and meeting conversations. A quick, non-intrusive poll will frequently elicit responses a normal chat conversation may not. Common applications for quick polling functionality can include Polly, SurveyMonkey, Open Agora, TinyPULSE, and more.</P>\n<P><BR />These applications are becoming more tailored for gathering quick feedback in real-time – SurveyMonkey, for example, has released several updates recently to make their surveys, polls and quizzes even more dynamic and accessible within Microsoft Teams. With multiple question types and live previewing during survey creation, users can launch surveys seamlessly and with the flexibility they need. In addition to powerful analytics within the SurveyMonkey app, you can now access results within Teams channels.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Resultscard.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/185112iFF9C07C40A0326D1/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Resultscard.png\" alt=\"Pulse surveys from SurveyMonkey within Microsoft Teams\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Pulse surveys from SurveyMonkey within Microsoft Teams</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Polly also makes it easy to get started with a pulse survey habit – simply add the Polly app to an existing site. Within the compose bar, you can gather quick feedback within your team using Polly.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"teams_weekly_pulse.png\" style=\"width: 841px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/185113iD5DAF4F859D88CC1/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"teams_weekly_pulse.png\" alt=\"teams_weekly_pulse.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Staying connected to your team is more important than ever. As with meetings, you can use Polly’s pulse surveys to regularly check in with your team in-channel – for example, a weekly pulse survey at the start or end of week that captures the week’s goals and overall sentiment.</P>\n<P><BR />One common suggestion is to use a rotation of common “pulse” questions for your team, including:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>How are you feeling?</LI>\n<LI>What’s your primary focus this week?</LI>\n<LI>Is anyone blocked in taking their next step?</LI>\n<LI>What are folks doing to learn and grow more this week?</LI>\n<LI>Are there any challenges you’d need help with?</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>The simplest kind of pulse survey is one that simply asks for peoples’ outlook and perspective – for example, Are people are feeling Great/Good/OK/Bad. When asked consistently, week over week this can help provide a perspective around “changes in temperature”.</P>\n<P><BR />Qubie is one application that provides a concise and focused team feedback experience along these lines. Its design as a Team Coach app focuses on delivering a concise input experience – just pick from a status emoji – and channels that feedback into overall team assessments with details and analytics for team leaders.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"qubie.png\" style=\"width: 976px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/185114iC2BC51149000A40D/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"qubie.png\" alt=\"qubie.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Whether you are designing your own weekly polls within polling applications, or using an app like Qubie, these questions can be rolled into a weekly assessment for your team, to help foster a habit around team connection and overall feedback assessment.</P>\n<P><BR />As part of connecting teams together, get started in your meetings and team channels to take the pulse of your team. This will help you get a better sense of how your team is doing, and provide ways to collect input from all voices on the team. Within Microsoft Teams, several applications – including SurveyMonkey, Polly, and Qubie – provide a streamlined path to quick Q&amp;A. The diversity and power of these applications will make it easy for you to find just the right style of communication with your team.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Learn more!</STRONG></P>\n<P>If you would like to learn how to better use apps in Teams to enhance remote work, see our <A href=\"https://aka.ms/teamsrwapps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">remote work Teams apps</A> site with more use cases and ideas, and take advantage of the free virtual training events each week.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>For Teams end-users:</STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>See more related <A href=\"https://aka.ms/teamsrwapps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">remote-work apps and scenarios</A> available from our Teams store.</LI>\n<LI>Check out our guide to <A href=\"https://aka.ms/teamsappguide\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">remote work apps</A></LI>\n<LI>Join a <A href=\"https://aka.ms/LearnTeamsApps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">live, instructor-led training session</A> called “Learn to Use Apps in Microsoft Teams.” We’ll show you how to find, install, and leverage the full functionality of some of our most popular apps.</LI>\n<LI>&nbsp;</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG>For Teams Admins: </STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Join our <A href=\"https://microsoftteams.eventbuilder.com/ChalkTalksApps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Chalk Talk series</A>, where members of Teams engineering walk through the security, deployment, and management of third-party integrations.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 20 Apr 2020 15:00:00 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Strengthening team culture – It’s the little things that count","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/strengthening-team-culture-it-s-the-little-things-that-count/ba-p/1015917","description":"<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Technology has the ability to bring people together and build great solutions, and the new Icebreaker bot helps making connections even easier.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The Icebreaker bot is basically a ‘getting to know you’ tool that proactively suggests meet ups between colleagues. People interested in joining these meetings join a group in Teams, and the bot pairs up random people every Monday morning. And then, if you need it to, it can search both your calendars to find mutual available meeting times.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>After having <A href=\"https://www.geekwire.com/2019/microsoft-teams-new-icebreaker-bot-pairs-co-workers-random-get-know/\" target=\"_self\">read about</A> the Icebreaker bot, Chief Technology Officer Ruan Viljoen at BroadReach Consulting decided to experiment with the <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/samples/app-templates#icebreaker\" target=\"_self\">Icebreaker bot</A> in his organization. What sparked his attention was that it held the promise to build more personal connections between employees.</P>\n<P>BroadReach has a very diverse and eclectic workforce.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>He therefore decided to run an experiment within the head office, with about 150 employees situated over various floors, to see if it could help break silos. The leadership team is not only focused on performance, but building a culture of growth, innovation and inclusion. If the bot worked, it could help to facilitate a greater sense of team cohesion. So, he deployed it, and invited a few employees to the open Team.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_0.png\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/157790iF90C7F6CCAAA7C37/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"clipboard_image_0.png\" alt=\"clipboard_image_0.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>Ruan Viljoen, CTO, BroadReach Consulting</P>\n<P><EM>“It was so simple to get started with Icebreaker in Teams! It’s amazing to see how a small initiative deliver big meaningful impact.”</EM></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The experiment was a roaring success. Within a week most employees had joined simply by word of mouth. Ruan himself had a positive experience – he was paired with his direct report, and they realized that they’d not had a chance to grab lunch recently, so they scheduled one. This meeting helped to foster a deep connection.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Other employees within the region were having similar experiences. One employee remarked that at first, he was a bit hesitant to meet the person he’d been paired up with, as they were from different departments and they seldom worked together. However, after the meet-up his outlook changed, and he was pleasantly surprised by the happy and engaged conversation they had.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>An employee from the marketing department met with a colleague from administration that they thought they knew quite well – but the casual nature of this meeting (they decided to go for a walk outside) revealed some interesting tid-bits they didn’t know about each other. This one-time ice breaker walk has evolved into regular walks to get out of the office, get moving and take a break and has snowballed into a lunchtime ‘<EM>walk n talk</EM>’ group!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Given the success of Icebreaker, the team at BroadReach Consulting is now excited to try the rest of the App Templates to make collaborating with team members more fun. If you want to give it a try yourself, you can follow along at this link: <A href=\"http://www.aka.ms/TeamsAppTemplates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">www.aka.ms/TeamsAppTemplates</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Do share your feedback at <U>feedback link.</U></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Also see:&nbsp;</P>\n<UL style=\"box-sizing: border-box; This is why there are more than 20 million daily active users of Teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>But it isn’t all about productivity, we want Teams to contribute to your security and compliance requirements and you probably have a lot of questions on how this happens. You may be used to protecting email and files in Microsoft 365 and on your mobile devices, but how should you approach security and compliance as you add Teams to the mix? Did you know, for example, that Teams keeps persistent records of chat conversations by default?</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>As we enter the new year, we’ll help you answer these top-of-mind questions starting with the latest episode in our Microsoft Teams for IT series on Microsoft Mechanics, dedicated to security and compliance.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><LI-VIDEO size=\"large\" vid=\"https://youtu.be/91lHNKVVvQ4\" align=\"center\" width=\"600\" height=\"338\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/91lHNKVVvQ4/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Make Microsoft Teams part of your information governance approach </STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>If you’re new to how persistent chat works in Teams, the good news is that you have control over <EM>how</EM> <EM>persistent</EM> chat conversations are. Retention thresholds for chat to can be set to time period as short as 24 hours. In fact, there are a multitude of security and compliance controls that you can apply to Teams chat, meetings and calls. For example, you can <STRONG>disable screen sharing</STRONG> for specific users, or with <STRONG>information barriers</STRONG> via PowerShell, you can prevent illicit communications between different segments of users. In regulated sectors such as Finance, where you may be required to prove the right measures are in place to prevent insider trading, this capability can come in handy.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>As you protect your files and emails in Microsoft 365, we help you make Teams another endpoint in your overall security and compliance strategy. This allows the policies that you set universally, inherited from services like SharePoint, OneDrive, and Exchange, to apply to Teams and take advantage of capabilities such as Data Loss Prevention, Advanced Threat Protection, organizational search and in-place hold with eDiscovery, or Communication Compliance to monitor and prevent inappropriate behaviors. You can discover Microsoft 365 controls available to you by reviewing the security and compliance scores for your tenants, which recommend controls that could help increase your scores.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Microsoft makes sure the Microsoft Teams service is secure and compliant in regard to data flow. Data within Microsoft data centers is encrypted at rest and in transit. We keep a robust control framework of more than 1,000 controls to meet the requirements of some of the most rigorous industry regulations and continuously review and add controls as new requirements emerge. In fact, you can find 3<SUP>rd</SUP> party auditor reports for Microsoft 365 and Teams services in the Service Trust Portal at <A href=\"https://servicetrust.microsoft.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">aka.ms/STP</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>These are just some of the top ways we keep you secure and compliant with Teams and in this Microsoft Mechanics episode, I’ll walk you through your options and more details.</P>\n<P>You can follow our full playlist at <A href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MfDB7VenWuA&amp;list=PLXtHYVsvn_b_JeDjgD5XdkyHTDXdYgPGn\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">aka.ms/MicrosoftTeamsforIT</A>, which starts with an overview of Microsoft Teams for IT Admins, and with upcoming episodes that will cover how to configure security and compliance controls for Teams, upgrading from Skype for Business, and how to scale end-user adoption.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>If you are in a government cloud service such as the US Government Community Cloud (GCC), GCC High, or Department of Defense, and don’t see some of these capabilities available yet, rest assured we are working on it, and you can stay updated at <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=DoD%2CGCC%20High%2CGCC%2CMicrosoft%20Teams\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">aka.ms/TeamsGovRoadmap</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Please give us your feedback on other questions you may have or other topics you’d like us to cover and enjoy the new year!</P>\n<P>Nydia</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 07 Jan 2020 17:04:26 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"3d556bc7b12651eb21890f60b49fd2f7","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Nydia Cavazos","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401925},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"What’s New in Microsoft Teams | July 2020","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/what-s-new-in-microsoft-teams-july-2020/ba-p/1551561","description":"<P><FONT color=\"#000000\">We announced a new set of features earlier this month that make <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2020/07/08/reimagining-virtual-collaboration-future-work-learning/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">virtual interactions in Microsoft Teams more engaging and inclusive</A>, along with new capabilities announced at <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2020/07/21/meeting-experiences-teams-security-capabilities-microsoft-365/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Inspire 2020</A>. Take a look at our new meetings, calling, devices, chat and collaboration, IT admin, and industry features this month!</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: Meetings &amp; Calling &amp; Devices</FONT></STRONG><BR />We are continuing to transform the meetings experience in Teams to include new features, settings, and devices to create a better experience.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New multi-window meeting and calling experiences</STRONG> <BR />We are pleased to share that the rollout of our new multi-window meeting and calling experiences has started. This new experience is the foundation for not only pop-out meetings and calling, but for Together mode and Large gallery views. You can find additional information on how to enable <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/new-meeting-and-calling-experience-in-microsoft-teams/ba-p/1537581\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"multi-window meeting and calling.png\" style=\"width: 768px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/208587i6DDE8945E9D436A5/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"multi-window meeting and calling.png\" alt=\"multi-window meeting and calling.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New lobby setting in Teams Meeting Options: “only me”</STRONG><BR />A new lobby setting is coming to Teams Meeting Options that gives you greater control over who can enter your meeting. We are adding \"Only me\" as an option to the \"Who can bypass lobby?\" setting. Once enabled, only the organizer will be able to join the meeting directly. Everyone else, including people from within the same organization, will be sent to the lobby.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Student Lobby option - available now.png\" style=\"width: 960px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209096iD56930537EF0B689/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Student Lobby option - available now.png\" alt=\"Student Lobby option - available now.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Microsoft Teams Rooms, app version 4.5.35.0 now available</STRONG> <BR />The latest Microsoft Teams Rooms app, version <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/rooms/rooms-release-note#45350-07232020\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">4.5.35.0</A>, is now available through the Windows Store. Some of the most anticipated features enabled through this update include:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Support for video gallery-only layouts:</STRONG> For meeting room configurations with a single front of room display, you can now switch between viewing the video gallery or presented content. By tapping the layout icon on the Teams Room console, you can select different views based on their needs. Options include video gallery-only, content-only, or combined video and content.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Raise hand:</STRONG> During a meeting, you can raise a virtual hand from the center of room console to let people know you want to contribute without interrupting the conversation. Additionally, when someone raises their hand, a notification will appear on the center of room console and in the video gallery view.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Default speaker volume settings:</STRONG> From within the Teams Rooms settings, device administrators can now set a default volume level for in-room conferencing and system speakers.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Direct guest join for Cisco Webex meetings and devices:</STRONG> Now Teams Rooms and Cisco Webex meeting room devices can connect to each other’s meeting services via embedded web technologies. More details are included below.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Auto-enrollment and device management from Teams Admin Center:</STRONG> Microsoft Teams Rooms have been added to the list of devices that can be managed through the Teams Admin Center.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>The full list of updates included in app version 4.5.35.0, is available in the <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/rooms/rooms-release-note#45350-07232020\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">release notes</A>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"raise hands on console.1.png\" style=\"width: 997px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/208823i92A54937A9029D97/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"raise hands on console.1.png\" alt=\"raise hands on console.1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Direct Guest Join</STRONG> <BR />Many people work with organizations outside of their own and need to be able to join occasional meetings from other meeting providers. We want you to be able to join these meetings from your Microsoft Teams Rooms devices. At Ignite 2019, we <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/microsoft-amp-cisco-partner-to-simplify-meetings-and-calling-for/ba-p/971835\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">announced</A> a direct guest join capability that would enable meeting room devices to connect to meeting services from other vendors via embedded web technologies. We are excited to announce Direct Guest Join has reached general availability and is available through the latest Microsoft Teams Room app, version <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/rooms/rooms-release-note#45350-07232020\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">4.5.35.0</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Through an embedded web experience, you can now use your Teams Rooms devices to join a Cisco Webex meeting. Leveraging this experience, you can use the Teams Room console to interact with the Cisco Webex app and control in-room audio and video devices. Similarly, the Microsoft Teams web experience is also available on web-enabled Cisco Webex devices allowing you to join a Microsoft Teams meeting from a Cisco Webex Room device. While no web experience can offer the same robust feature set as a native Teams meeting experience on a native Teams device, this will reduce the friction you experience when trying to join calls from external partners or clients who may not be using the same meeting service. The direct guest join feature will also be enabled for Zoom Meetings in Microsoft Teams Rooms and Teams Meetings in Zoom Rooms, and is currently in preview. Learn how to enable this feature <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/rooms/third-party-join\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Direct Guest Join with Webex GIF smaller file.gif\" style=\"width: 853px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/208590i80B67DD17A25D83C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Direct Guest Join with Webex GIF smaller file.gif\" alt=\"Direct Guest Join with Webex GIF smaller file.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>For those who have chosen Microsoft Teams as their communication and collaboration service but are not yet using native Teams devices, there are Cloud Video Interop (CVI) solutions available. While these solutions do not provide users with the full Microsoft Teams Room experience, it allows you to join Teams meetings from your existing devices as you make the transition to native Teams Room devices. CVI offers are currently available from Bluejeans, Pexip and Poly. At Ignite 2019, we announced Cisco would be joining as our fourth partner, and beginning today, their offer is in preview.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Manage Microsoft Teams Rooms and other Teams devices using enhanced device management capabilities in Teams Admin Center</STRONG><BR /><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/one-place-to-manage-all-your-teams-devices/ba-p/1527766\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">New device management capabilities in the Teams Admin Center</A> make it easier to deploy and manage a fleet of devices, with improvements across device set-up, bulk management tasks, and health monitoring. And now <STRONG>you can manage your Microsoft Teams Room devices in the same place as your collaboration bars and IP phones</STRONG>. Some of the enhancements include the ability to enable auto-updates, new device tagging capabilities, the ability to securely delegate device management access to partners, and more! To learn about all the new capabilities read our <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/one-place-to-manage-all-your-teams-devices/ba-p/1527766\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">blog</A>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Teams Admin Center.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/208592iA83B5A4CD7AEFF9D/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Teams Admin Center.gif\" alt=\"Teams Admin Center.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New Options to Enable and Manage Microsoft Teams Rooms devices</STRONG><BR />We’re delivering more ways to enable great room experiences with Teams devices: Microsoft Teams Rooms Standard and Microsoft Teams Rooms Premium.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><BR /><STRONG>Microsoft Teams Rooms Standard</STRONG></P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">The Microsoft Teams Rooms Standard offering, formerly known as the Meeting Room SKU, enables inclusive and collaborative meeting room experiences across Teams Rooms, collaboration bars and Surface Hub. Microsoft Teams Rooms Standard provides the necessary licenses for Microsoft Teams, Skype for Business Online, and Intune management. Furthermore, the offering enables Phone System, necessary for PSTN integration, and Audio Conferencing, where available. As part of this offering, customers have access to the newly enhanced device management experience through Teams Admin Center allowing them to manage devices themselves or delegate access to a partner who can manage devices on their behalf.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><STRONG>Microsoft Teams Rooms Premium</STRONG></P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">Microsoft Teams Rooms Premium includes all the licenses that come with Microsoft Teams Rooms Standard while providing additional value through a cloud-based remote management service. This service enables customers to shift the operational responsibility of managing and monitoring Teams Rooms devices to Microsoft. Microsoft Teams Rooms Premium provides 24/7 management and monitoring of room operating systems and software, surfacing insights and alerts, and taking remote action on behalf of the customer as permitted. Today’s offering is just the beginning, and we look forward to expanding with additional premium experiences in the future.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>For more information about the Microsoft Teams Rooms Standard and Premium offering, read our <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2020/07/21/microsoft-teams-meetings-hybrid-workplace-options/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">blog</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: Chat &amp; Collaboration</FONT></STRONG><BR />We have added new chat and collaboration capabilities to keep everyone connected. Check out the new capabilities below.</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>Contextual Search</STRONG> <BR />Find information faster with contextual search in Microsoft Teams. You will have the ability to search for content in a specific channel or chat by pressing CTRL + F. Search results will only contain messages and files found in the selected chat or channel. This feature is generally available.&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Contextual Search in Teams.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/208595iEA63B8A679124718/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Contextual Search in Teams.png\" alt=\"Contextual Search in Teams.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New file sharing experience</STRONG><BR />We’re rolling out a new, consistent file sharing and access control experience in Teams users already know from other Microsoft 365 apps, including OneDrive, Outlook, and Office. Soon, when you go to share a file from within Teams, you’ll have the option to create sharing links that provide access to anyone, people within your organization, people with existing access, or specific people, including those in a private or group chat. Learn more <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2020/07/01/introducing-new-onedrive-features-to-share-and-collaborate-across-work-and-life/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"File Sharing in Teams.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/208598iDE86E187851B6E19/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"File Sharing in Teams.gif\" alt=\"File Sharing in Teams.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Stay connected to your Yammer Communities while in the Microsoft Teams mobile apps</STRONG><BR />Engage your employees with company-wide announcements and live events that they can access anywhere. Stay connected to what’s happening in your communities, share knowledge across teams and departments, and crowdsource solutions and best practices at the edges of the organization. Starting 7/21, users with the <A href=\"https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fmicrosoft-365%2Fblog%2F2020%2F04%2F20%2Fconnect-people-across-entire-organization-through-communities-microsoft-teams%2F&amp;data=02%7C01%7Caytange%40microsoft.com%7C94caf77ee9564cd8d3be08d824772d13%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637299441587236003&amp;sdata=TN2ctdeWgbn41mTm68yzzAQWPCmgQe%2BSMzgrmd6EMME%3D&amp;reserved=0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Communities app</A> installed in the Teams web or desktop clients will also see the Communities app in mobile. Admins pinning the app for their users will now also see the app appear in mobile. For info on how to install the Communities app, go <A href=\"https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdocs.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fmicrosoftteams%2Fmanage-apps&amp;data=02%7C01%7Caytange%40microsoft.com%7C94caf77ee9564cd8d3be08d824772d13%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637299441587245995&amp;sdata=AxnOsw8rGhr2%2BA77UkKP%2FMM31nYQFdJ35k6ieGJ6g6w%3D&amp;reserved=0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/yammer%20communities%20in%20Teams%20app.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Channel info pane</STRONG><BR />Selecting the “Channel information” icon in the channel header will display summary information related to that channel including the description, a list of recent contributors and members, as well as system messages. Learn more <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/show-channel-info-in-teams-61c3319d-a2c0-4b60-99b9-3226b9e248f9?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US&amp;storagetype=live\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Filtering out system messages from the General channel</STRONG><BR />We are removing system messages from the General channel. Information about who is a member of the team can be found in the Member List or in the information pane of the channel.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>What’s New: IT Admin</STRONG></FONT> <BR />We continue to enhance our management capabilities to address IT admins evolving needs and make work more efficient. In addition to the <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/one-place-to-manage-all-your-teams-devices/ba-p/1527766\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">new device management capabilities in Teams admin Center</A>, here is what is rolling out this month.</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>Enabling App configuration in Team Admin center</STRONG></P>\n<P>We are adding the capability to <STRONG>configure your applications</STRONG> from the same Teams Admin Center portal, without the need to jump between portals to the application store to perform the changes. This new manageability experience enables you to configure App specific settings that will streamline your management task and enable simple customization of apps to the organization needs. App configuration is now available in Teams Admin Center for Teams and Microsoft Apps.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Advisor for Teams</STRONG></P>\n<P>Advisor for Teams is a new onboarding tool coming to help you plan the best possible Teams deployment in your organization and is now generally available. It offers recommended plans and a collaboration space for the deployment team to streamline the roll out of all the Teams workloads, including messaging, meetings and calling and Skype for business upgrade workloads. We have learned that organizations who use this tool might be able to increase their deployment velocity by up to 300%.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Read more about our <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/new-capabilities-for-teams-management-july-2020/ba-p/1530282\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">New capabilities for Teams Management | July 2020</A> to get more details on all of the new management features.</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>Microsoft Information Protection sensitivity labels in Teams</STRONG></P>\n<P>We are excited to announce the <STRONG><A href=\"https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftechcommunity.microsoft.com%2Ft5%2Fmicrosoft-security-and%2Fgeneral-availability-microsoft-information-protection%2Fba-p%2F1497769&amp;data=02%7C01%7CJohn.Gruszczyk%40microsoft.com%7C8596c47e219e49fd776c08d83262862b%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637314746021904817&amp;sdata=Ze6fkSlAfAI7TKiRuKiJ3Fd8BJYjAqr%2B82PTKZdozlM%3D&amp;reserved=0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">general availability of sensitivity labels</A> for Teams, SharePoint sites, and Microsoft 365 Groups</STRONG>. You can now associate a sensitivity label with policies related to privacy, external user membership, and unmanaged device access. With users constantly creating and sharing sensitive data in Teams and on SharePoint sites, this capability allows for holistically securing sensitive content whether it is in a file or in a chat by managing access to these containers. Along with manual and auto-labeling of documents on SharePoint and Teams, sensitivity labels helps you scale your data protection program to meet the proliferation of data and the challenge of secure collaboration while working remotely.</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>Teams Communication Compliance</STRONG></P>\n<P>Back in February we announced the general availability of <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-security-and/use-communication-compliance-to-monitor-microsoft-teams-emails/ba-p/1167989\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Communication Compliance</A> – we are now announcing improvements, including improved remediation actions through Teams. In this release, you have the ability to remove Teams messages, Teams chat support for on-premises mailboxes, and the ability to automatically add all of user’s Teams memberships when creating policies. Read more about <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-security-and/foster-a-culture-of-inclusion-and-safety-with-microsoft-teams/ba-p/1530254\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">how to foster a culture of inclusion and safety with Microsoft Teams and Communication Compliance</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>What’s New: Developer &amp; Platform</STRONG></FONT><BR />We are announcing new features to the Teams platform to continue to provide a rich canvas for developers to build, engage, and transform workflows.</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>Create, manage, and deploy Power Platform apps and chatbots seamlessly – powered by Dataflex</STRONG> <BR />We are excited to announce new capabilities that will make it even easier for customers to <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/microsoft-teams-is-shaping-the-future-of-work-with-low-code-apps/ba-p/1507180\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">create, deploy and manage apps and chatbots directly within Microsoft Teams</A>, at no additional cost for select Microsoft 365 and Office 365 users. With <A href=\"https://aka.ms/Inspire20CLamanna\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Dataflex</A> - a built in relational database for Teams - makers can build, deploy, and manage these apps using Power Apps and chatbots using Power Virtual Agents to simplify and digitize their everyday work. This powerful combination of tools expands on the promise of Teams being a hub for collaboration and business processes.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/Teams%20%2B%20Power%20Apps.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New Power BI app for Teams</STRONG><BR />Organizations are looking for new ways to leverage their data and take action based on insights. The new Power BI app for Teams enables you to access reports and dashboards in Teams to easily find insight in context and collaborate. This app also helps you make data-driven decisions at scale with confidence and provides new ways to connect insight to action through sample reports, automation, and easy sharing functionality.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/power%20bi.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New meetings extensibility points for Teams apps</STRONG><BR />At Inspire, we announced new meetings extensibility points that will enable developers to expand the Teams meeting experience. With this new capability, developers will be able to build apps or integrate their existing ones within the meeting surface and provide a richer collaboration experiences for users across the entire meeting lifecycle – covering events and actions from before, during, and after a meeting. These new extensibility points will be available soon for developer preview. Learn more <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/extend-meeting-capabilities-with-teams-apps/ba-p/1527812\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"New meetings extensibility points.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/208601i90A42AED07105C32/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"New meetings extensibility points.png\" alt=\"New meetings extensibility points.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Single-Sign On (SSO) support for Teams tabs with Azure Active Directory</STRONG><BR />Teams tabs support for single sign-on (SSO) with Azure Active Directory is now generally available for both desktop and mobile! Developers can now build their apps to sign-in their users using the same account they are using to sign into Microsoft Teams – giving users a more enjoyable and frustration-free sign-on experience.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"SSO support for Teams tabs.png\" style=\"width: 849px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/208603i7681166700C97F4D/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"SSO support for Teams tabs.png\" alt=\"SSO support for Teams tabs.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Microsoft Teams Toolkit for Visual Studio and Visual Studio Code</STRONG><BR />At Build, we unveiled the Microsoft Teams Toolkits for Visual Studio and Visual Studio Code, which provide developers everything they need to jump start their Teams app development journey. From code through publish, these toolkits provide a frictionless and enjoyable experience building Teams apps. We’re excited to announce that the Teams Toolkit for Visual Studio Code is now generally available and can be installed <A href=\"https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=TeamsDevApp.ms-teams-vscode-extension\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>. The Teams Toolkit for Visual Studio is also available for developer preview and can be installed <A href=\"https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=TeamsDevApp.vsteamstemplate\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>. Learn more about these toolkits in our Teams Developer <A href=\"https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-teams/blogs/building-teams-apps-with-visual-studio-and-visual-studio-code-extensions/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">blog post</A>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Teams Toolkit for Visual Studio and Visual Studio Code.2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209345iFDA45817CB64283E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Teams Toolkit for Visual Studio and Visual Studio Code.2.png\" alt=\"Teams Toolkit for Visual Studio and Visual Studio Code.2.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Teams Graph APIs updates&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>POST / Teams API</STRONG> now available in the Microsoft Graph v1.0 endpoint. <STRONG>New team membership API</STRONG> is coming soon in preview, allowing developers to list members, add and remove members, and change members’ roles. Lastly, <STRONG>granular permissions for proactive messaging available</STRONG> is now in preview., which will allow apps to install only itself and provide developers more convenient APIs for retrieving the chat thread ID for bots to use.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>User attribution for bot messages</STRONG><BR />We’re pleased to announce that user attribution for bot messages is now generally available! In scenarios where a bot sends messages on behalf of a user, attributing the message to that user can help with engagement and showcase a more natural interaction flow. This also helps condense the card design and provides a cleaner interface. Learn how to configure this capability <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/messaging-extensions/how-to/action-commands/respond-to-task-module-submit?tabs=dotnet%2Cdotnet-1#user-attribution-for-bots-messages\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"user attribution for bot messages.png\" style=\"width: 964px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/208614iE1FED6541D9CDFE1/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"user attribution for bot messages.png\" alt=\"user attribution for bot messages.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Access and manage Visio files in Microsoft Teams with tabs</STRONG><BR />Visio tabs in Teams allow team members to quickly access content in a dedicated space within a channel or in a chat. With the new Visio as a tab feature, you can create a tab from any Visio file (new or existing) in Teams with a single click. Adding a tab in Teams is now available to all Teams users. However, editing is only available for those with a Visio Plan 1 or Plan 2 subscription.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>What’s New: Firstline Workers</STRONG></FONT><BR /><STRONG>Time clock now available on Web and Desktop</STRONG><BR />Now, employees will be able to clock in and out of Shifts directly from web or desktop with Time clock along with the existing mobile experience This provides a hybrid clock in and clock out experience so Firstline Workers can start their shift from wherever their work is, whether remote or at the job location, all with the geo-fencing capabilities. If you already have Time Clock enabled - simply go to the Shifts App in Microsoft Teams and get started! To learn more about Time Clock and how to set it up, go <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/clock-in-and-out-with-shifts-ae7b676c-7666-46c7-9f68-85ff54acec8b#:~:text=%20Clock%20in%20and%20out%20with%20Shifts%20,out%20to%20start%20your%20break.%20From...%20More%20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New policy packages for Firstline Worker and Managers</STRONG><BR />Firstline Worker and Firstline Manager policy packages for Teams provide IT administrators with pre-defined policies and policy settings tailored for their entire Firstline Workforce. Policy packages simplify, centralize, and help provide consistency when managing policies for Firstline Workers and managers across your organization. These new policy packages will be available by default in the IT Admin Center and in PowerShell. Learn more about setting up and customizing the policy packages for Firstline Workforce <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/manage-policy-packages\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/MOPO-pkg.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Search for Shifts activities in Teams Shifts Audit Logs</STRONG><BR />Audit logs for Shifts, now generally available, provides IT admins a unified view and search functionality to help monitor and keep track of activities. Staying on top of employees clocking in and out and making edits to shifts is critical to ensuring smooth and compliant operations. To learn more about what Shifts activities are logged and how to get started, please go <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/audit-log-events#shifts-in-teams-activities\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><BR />Check out more product news for Firstline Workers <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/5-ways-to-evolve-your-firstline-workforce-for-the-new-normal/ba-p/1524313\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>What’s New: Teams for Education</STRONG></FONT><BR />Microsoft Teams for Education continues to evolve to meet the changing needs of institutions and educators. Now, there are more ways for educators to control their online classrooms and for IT Admins to support new team creation.</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>Student Lobby</STRONG><BR />To prevent uninvited students in class, Student Lobby, which keeps students in a lobby until invited in by the educator, is now available.</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>School Data Sync (SDS) team creation is back on</STRONG><BR />Admins can now (once again) automatically bulk-create both M365 Group and class teams for their educators. This helps to save educators time and makes a new team “locked” and inaccessible by students until educators unlock the team.</P>\n<P><BR />To learn about these and the other 20+ new features and updates coming to Microsoft Teams for Education, visit the <A href=\"https://aka.ms/TeamsEduJuly2020\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">What’s New in Teams for Education | July 2020 blog post</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>What’s New: Teams for US Government</STRONG> </FONT><BR />We are here to support US Government clouds. Here are the new capabilities for GCC customers.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Microsoft Teams meeting attendee limit increases to 300 participants for GCC, GCC-High, and DoD</STRONG></P>\n<P>To help customers meet rapidly changing communication and meeting needs, we are increasing the maximum number of participants allowed in a Teams meeting to 300.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Increase in the number of simultaneous videos in Teams meetings for GCC High and DoD customers</STRONG><BR />We are increasing the number of participants who can be viewed simultaneously on the Teams meeting stage from 4 to 9. This new experience optimizes for attendees who have enabled video and places the remaining audio-only participants below the meeting stage. To provide a high audio and video quality experience, the layout logic will consider user bandwidth and alter the number of videos shown to provide the best meeting experience.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Raise Hands for GCC, GCC High, and DoD</STRONG><BR />The raise hands feature allows meeting attendees to identify that they wish to speak by toggling the hand icon in the meeting control bar, making it easier to actively participate in meetings. Raise hands will be available for both PC, Mac, and web-based clients to start, with mobile applications quickly following.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>PSTN participant phone numbers are masked from external users for GCC</STRONG><BR />For those with Audio Conferencing enabled for their Teams meetings, we will mask the PSTN participant's phone number to users who have joined from outside of your organization.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Multi-Window Chat for GCC, GCC High, and DoD</STRONG><BR />You will be able to pop out individual Teams chat conversations into a separate window, to help them streamline their workflow and more easily move between ongoing conversations.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Priority Notifications in Gov Clouds</STRONG><BR />Share urgent messages and time-sensitive information more effectively with Teams. Priority notifications alert a recipient of an urgent message on their mobile and desktop devices until a response is received, every two minutes for up to 20 minutes. IT Admins can manage this feature as part of messaging policies in Teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New channel files tab for GCC, GCC-High, and DoD</STRONG><BR />We are rolling out the new channel files tab experience to the government clouds. This upgrade brings in more than 10 new features, including different SharePoint view, ability to view metadata, sync, row/column formatting etc.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Channel info pane for GCC</STRONG><BR />Selecting the \"Channel info\" icon in the channel header will display summary information related to that channel including the description, a list of recent contributors and members, as well as system messages.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 31 Jul 2020 15:17:40 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"3 Microsoft Teams apps for running productive standups while working remotely","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/3-microsoft-teams-apps-for-running-productive-standups-while/ba-p/1381151","description":"<P>As everyone adjusts to the “new normal” of remote work, even agile development teams are learning how to adapt “in-office” processes to function in a remote work environment. A common reaction is to shift all rituals and meetings, like the daily standup, online – however, this is a missed opportunity to make full use of the situation to determine 1) whether the meeting was effective in the first place, and 2) whether there are other approaches and tools to enhance the process to fit the current environment and future.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Microsoft Teams and partner app integrations give agile teams the opportunity to experiment with several tools and approaches so they can build an intentional process that fits the needs of their workforce and accomplishes the principles and purpose of a standup.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Using apps in Teams to rethink daily standups</FONT></STRONG></P>\n<P>Daily standups even when times were “normal” were difficult to manage – e.g., finding a convenient time to meet, keeping it brief/efficient, and keeping everyone focused and informed. Now add the challenge of managing a completely remote team and you’ve got yourself a tricky situation. Before you shift your standups online, consider experimenting with new ways to make them simpler to manage, more flexible and valuable to your team. Teams and partner app integrations make it easy to experiment and discover what works best for your team.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>An asynchronous standup is a great example of an opportunity to explore when your team is remote. Rather than a fixed time each day to sync, members provide their daily update when they can – providing flexibility and time to focus on doing work, as well as a record for tracking. Popular apps like AgilePolly and ScrumGenius automate the coordination, tracking, and reporting of asynchronous standups – making it easy for your teams to stay informed and progressing.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><A href=\"https://www.polly.ai/agile-polly-for-microsoft-teams\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><STRONG>AgilePolly</STRONG></A> makes it easy for teams to stay in the loop, keep organized and save time by automating standups and team check-ins all while working inside Teams. AgilyPolly handles scheduling the standup series and takes care of sending out questions, collecting/consolidating updates, and displaying progress. Whether using AgilePolly for real-time standups, asynchronously, or both – you will waste less time gathering information and more time problem-solving.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture1.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/190768iD628263F8556CA74/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Picture1.png\" alt=\"Picture1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><A href=\"https://scrumgenius.com/platforms/microsoft-teams/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ScrumGenius</A></STRONG> enables teams to perform asynchronous remote standups – all without leaving Teams. Check-ins are collated and played back to team members, while the ScrumGenius bot tracks their responses for progress on tasks, goals for the day and blockers. Insights are sent in an email summary report to the team and stakeholders and stored on the dashboard accessible in your Teams tab. From the dashboard, filter historical standup results by individuals, check-in status, or even keyword, to gain a rapid overview of team engagement. ScrumGenius also integrates with popular agile tools such as JIRA, GitHub, and Azure DevOps to match code pushes and issue changes from each team member seamlessly.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture2.png\" style=\"width: 718px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/190769i955FD6ACFD8FF23C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Picture2.png\" alt=\"Picture2.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Integrate your task boards directly into your Teams channel</FONT></STRONG></P>\n<P>Another key consideration when exploring new opportunities of optimizing your standup is having your task boards available to your team in the place where they collaborate. Your task boards are the visual cues into how your team is progressing with work items and stories throughout the sprint and are important for them view alongside the daily standup updates. Popular apps like Jira Cloud &amp; Server and Azure DevOps are integrated with Teams, enabling boards to be populated directly into tabs within channels for easy access and dialogue on.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><A href=\"https://teams.microsoft.com/l/app/aa183fd9-7104-46c4-af9f-9ee9b81d717e?source=store-copy-link\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><STRONG>Jira Cloud</STRONG></A><STRONG> &amp; <A href=\"https://teams.microsoft.com/l/app/6eacb5f0-68b0-46f0-9507-9e906c6861fc?source=store-copy-link\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Jira Server</A></STRONG> are tools designed to help you plan, track, and release world-class software. Access your Jira boards directly from Teams for a seamless collaboration experience and have notifications pushed to the channel for the team to view and act on.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture3.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/190773iA619980C208A7796/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Picture3.png\" alt=\"Picture3.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>As challenging as the current remote work environment may be, it is also a time for teams to explore new opportunities of working and communicating with each other. Whether considering asynchronous standups or a hybrid approach, it is important to remember that any change takes time and finding the right fit is an experiment. The breadth and depth of the partner apps found in Teams will make it easy for you to find the right fit for your team.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Learn more!</STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>If you would like to learn how to better use apps in Teams to enhance remote work, see our <A href=\"https://aka.ms/teamsrwapps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">remote work Teams apps</A> site with more use cases and ideas, and take advantage of the free virtual training events each week.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>For Teams end-users:</STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Check out our guide to <A href=\"https://aka.ms/teamsappguide\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">remote work apps</A></LI>\n<LI>Join a live, instructor-led training session called “<A href=\"https://aka.ms/LearnTeamsApps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn to Use Apps in Microsoft Teams</A>.” We will show you how to find, install, and leverage the full functionality of some of our most popular apps.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG>For Teams Admins:</STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Join our <A href=\"https://microsoftteams.eventbuilder.com/ChalkTalksApps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Chalk Talk series</A>, where members of Teams engineering walk through the security, deployment, and management of third-party integrations.</LI>\n</UL>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 12 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Microsoft Teams Rooms May update","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/microsoft-teams-rooms-may-update/ba-p/1387779","description":"<P>The impact of COVID-19 has dramatically changed how we work today, with a monumental number of organizations working from home. While physical meeting rooms may not be a focal point for many right now, there are still organizations and industries whose essential workers continue to rely on these spaces during this time. We also recognize the vital role Microsoft Teams Rooms will play when organizations return to work. To this end, we want to share the latest update for Microsoft Teams Rooms, app version 4.4.41.0, now available on the Windows store and coming to every Microsoft Teams Room over the next few weeks.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This release contains the following features:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Modern authentication support</STRONG></P>\n<P>Microsoft Teams Room administrators can now configure Microsoft Teams Rooms to use modern authentication to connect to Microsoft Exchange, Microsoft Teams and Microsoft Skype for Business services. Although Microsoft Teams Rooms already communicate over encrypted channels (such as TLS 1.2), using modern authentication reduces the need to send passwords over the network, leveraging tokens provided by Azure Active directory. To help reduce the potential attack surface, Microsoft Exchange Online will disable basic authentication in the future, as announced in the blog “<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/exchange-team-blog/improving-security-together/ba-p/805892\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Improving Security – Together</A>”. Modern authentication support for Microsoft Teams Rooms will help ensure business continuity for your devices connecting to Exchange Online.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In light of COVID-19, and to reduce potential impact for existing on-premises customers who may need time to plan and implement hybrid modern authentication, turning on modern authentication will be manual. To learn more about how to set up and use modern authentication, follow the guidance published in <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/MicrosoftTeams/rooms/rooms-authentication\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Authentication in Microsoft Teams Rooms</A>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture1.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191467i438304CE7F2E2BD5/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Picture1.png\" alt=\"Picture1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Application splash screen</STRONG></P>\n<P>The new application splash screen improves the startup experience when a Microsoft Teams Room device wakes up from an idle state or the device reboots. This provides end users with a more visually appealing experience while the device loads.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191468i7C4044D67CD3437F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Picture2.png\" alt=\"Picture2.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Project content to one or both front of room displays</STRONG></P>\n<P>For configurations with dual front of room displays, we now provide the flexibility to project content to only one display when using an HDMI cable to present outside the context of a meeting. Meeting Room administrators can apply this setting via an XML configuration file. Learn more about using the XML configuration file in the documentation titled “<A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoftteams/room-systems/xml-config-file\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Manage a Microsoft Teams Rooms console settings remotely with an XML configuration file</A>”.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Support for dynamic emergency calling for Microsoft Teams</STRONG></P>\n<P>Microsoft Teams Rooms now supports dynamic emergency calling and provides an updated calling experience tailored to emergency policies set by Microsoft Teams administrators. During an emergency call, both the console and front of room displays will show the phone number and location associated with the Microsoft Teams Room. Using emergency policies configured by Microsoft Teams administrators, the emergency call can be routed to specific emergency numbers. Learn more about emergency calling in <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/MicrosoftTeams/what-are-emergency-locations-addresses-and-call-routing\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Manage emergency calling</A>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture3.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191469i75C0EC13741AE5A9/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Picture3.png\" alt=\"Picture3.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Open Source Software (OSS) notices in device settings</STRONG></P>\n<P>Room administrators can now easily access Microsoft Teams third-party software notices on the Microsoft Teams Room console. Administrators can see these notices in <STRONG>Settings</STRONG>, under the <STRONG>About</STRONG> tab. Notices can also be viewed through the Microsoft Teams desktop application.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture4.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191470i5ED92C0EBA1CD1F5/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Picture4.png\" alt=\"Picture4.png\" /></span></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 21 May 2020 15:00:00 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191467i438304CE7F2E2BD5/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"43c3971b14d821cbcf115b43b9c19216","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn92@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-56-42-518_d4bef78094d776ab.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":665,"sourceBytes":86373,"destBytes":15148,"author":"MicrosoftTeamsTeam","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191467i438304CE7F2E2BD5/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn92@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-56-42-518_d4bef78094d776ab.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191468i7C4044D67CD3437F/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn11@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-30-638_e22e3c7dd964f303.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191469i75C0EC13741AE5A9/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn72@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-39-141_5846d3fb9b5aa461.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/191470i5ED92C0EBA1CD1F5/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn7@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-57-10-203_7ac5accf49403d17.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401920},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 Give your Firstline Workers easier access to Teams\n  </A>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <A
