+0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206739i12AF5C1F2C702FAF/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"9bb3e8fdb45e63e7b911495c318d4863","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn4@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-56-43-811_d19569caf34e1878.webp","destWidth":997,"destHeight":633,"sourceBytes":231331,"destBytes":44450,"author":"MicrosoftTeamsTeam","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206739i12AF5C1F2C702FAF/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn4@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-56-43-811_d19569caf34e1878.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401918},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"What’s New in Microsoft Teams | December 2019","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/what-s-new-in-microsoft-teams-december-2019/ba-p/1073279","description":"<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">As we near the end of 2019, we can’t help but reflect on all of the incredible ways that Teams has evolved this past year, and how so many of our <A href=\"https://customers.microsoft.com/en-US/story/760500-loreal-consumergoods-m365\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">customers</A> were able to use Teams to help them transform their own workplace collaboration. And a big thank you to all of you who have implemented Teams at your own organizations, and shared feedback with us along the way! Read on to learn what’s new in Teams in the month of December. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Microsoft Teams is now available on Linux</FONT></STRONG></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Microsoft Teams is now available for Linux users in public preview, enabling high quality collaboration experiences for the open source community at work and in educational institutions. Users can download the native Linux packages in .deb and .rpm formats <A href=\"https://teams.microsoft.com/downloads\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>. We are constantly improving based on community feedback, so please download and submit feedback based on your experience. Learn more <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-Teams-Blog/Microsoft-Teams-is-now-available-on-Linux/ba-p/1056267\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>. <BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/Teams/chat%20linux%20gif1.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"980\" /></P>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"5\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">What’s New: Chat &amp; Collaboration</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Native Federation for 1:1 Chats with users outside your organization </FONT></STRONG></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Have richer conversations with people outside your organization with Microsoft Teams. Users in TeamsOnly mode can now enjoy the same familiar chat experience whether they are communicating with a colleague or someone who is outside of their organization. An icon will appear next to the user’s name to indicate that they are external.<BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"chat federation.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162480i482D44EE57AA19EA/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"chat federation.png\" alt=\"chat federation.png\" /></span></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"5\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">What’s New: Calling &amp; Meetings</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Add captions to your meetings with the Live Captions Preview (English)</FONT></STRONG></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Live Captions in Teams meetings allows you to turn on captions during the meeting. This makes meetings more inclusive, giving participants another way to follow along with the conversation, and addressing the needs of participants with different hearing abilities or language proficiencies. We have rolled out this feature to all of our customers in the commercial cloud as a public preview feature in English, and will look to roll this out in additional languages in 2020. <BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n</DIV>\n</DIV>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Microsoft%20Teams/Updated%20live%20captions.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"980\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Dynamic Emergency Calling for Direct Routing</STRONG> </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Dynamic Emergency Calling for Direct Routing is now available as a part of Microsoft Teams Phone System. It uses the caller’s current location to route their emergency call to a Public Safety Answering Point (PSAP), a call center operated by the local government. This is especially helpful when the user is not in their home country and does not know how to get in contact with local emergency services. Learn more <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/configure-dynamic-emergency-calling\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Add additional participants to meeting chats</FONT></STRONG></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Today in private meeting chat threads (i.e. the chats that are created in association with a meeting), users don't have functionality to easily add more participants to chat. This feature will add an entry point \"Add participants\" in the meeting chat header and users who are already part of the chat thread will be able to add more users to the meeting chat using this feature. This functionality currently exists in group chat and it will work the same way as group chat.</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Reduce your notifications with muted meeting chats</FONT></STRONG></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Sometimes we must miss a meeting, and we don’t always need real-time notifications from the in-progress meeting chat. By default, meeting chats will now be muted until you either send a message in the chat or join the online meeting. So you can reduce notifications, but still keep track of the conversation. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">To change these defaults, go to your profile picture at the top right of the app, select <STRONG>Settings &gt; Notifications</STRONG>. From there, scroll to the meetings section and open the menu next to <STRONG>Meeting chat notifications</STRONG>.</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Presenter or attendee? You decide.</FONT></STRONG></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Introducing meeting roles. Organizers, you can now choose what roles your invitees have during your meetings. Follow the directions at <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/roles-in-a-teams-meeting-c16fa7d0-1666-4dde-8686-0a0bfe16e019\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Assign roles in a Teams meeting</A> and view what each role can do during the meeting.</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Video Calling on Chrome is here!</FONT></STRONG></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Video calling on Chrome is now generally available. Now Teams users on Google Chrome can initiate and accept video calls with other Teams users. This release completes our story of full modality support (visual, audio, and screensharing) in Web Calling. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Citrix VDI support is now generally available</FONT></STRONG></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">We have delivered an optimized media experience for Microsoft Teams in Citrix on-premises, Citrix Cloud, and Azure-hosted Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) environments.&nbsp; You can find more information on these topologies and capabilities <A href=\"https://www.citrix.com/blogs/2019/12/12/hdx-optimization-for-microsoft-teams-now-generally-available/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.<BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Contact Center APIs are ready for development</STRONG><BR />At <A href=\"https://medius.studios.ms/video/asset/HIGHMP4/IG19-VCE50\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Ignite</A> we announced the upcoming Certified for Microsoft Teams program for <A href=\"https://medius.studios.ms/video/asset/PPT/IG19-VCE50\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">connected contact center solutions</A>.&nbsp; Today, we’re happy to share much of the package of APIs to enable these solutions. Take advantage of the Microsoft Graph <A href=\"https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/blogs/microsoft-graph-presence-apis-are-now-available-in-public-preview/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Presence</A>, <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/api/application-post-onlinemeetings?view=graph-rest-beta&amp;tabs=http\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Create Online Meeting</A> APIs &amp; Phone System <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/direct-routing-plan\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Direct Routing</A> APIs to develop your solution. More coming soon!</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: Admin</FONT> </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Microsoft Teams is coming to existing installations of Office 365 ProPlus on the semi-annual channel</STRONG> </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">We are making it easier for you to give your users the richest Teams experience, our desktop client, by adding Teams to Office 365 ProPlus. Starting January 14th, the Teams desktop client will be added to existing installations of Office 365 ProPlus on the Semi-Annual Channel. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Since everyone in the organization needs to communicate and collaborate, it’s important to make Teams available to all end users. We’ve published guidance to help you plan your rollout: <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/adopt-microsoft-teams-landing-page\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Adopt Microsoft Teams</A>. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">While we encourage you to adopt Teams, we enable you to deploy at your own pace. If you wish to exclude it from your installation or disable auto-start of Teams, you are fully in control. You can find guidance on deploying Teams as a part of Office 365 ProPlus: <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/teams-install\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Deploy Microsoft Teams with Office 365 ProPlus</A>. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">New mobility policy requiring Wi-Fi for the Teams Mobile app</FONT></STRONG></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">A new mobility policy for the Teams Mobile app allows IT Admins to require their users to have Wi-Fi connections when making or receiving Teams video and/or video calls and meetings to control cellular data usage costs. Admins can apply this restriction on selected or all users in their organization. Learn more <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-app-setup-policies\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Number Normalization Rules for tenant administrators</FONT></STRONG></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Tenant administrators often need to change a phone number for live inbound/outbound calls in order to ensure interoperability with phone networks.&nbsp; The rule can translate either callee or caller numbers to a desired format. Policy can then be applied using PowerShell in inbound and/or outbound directions.</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Changes in Incoming IP Video policy</FONT></STRONG></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">We have updated our meeting policies to allow IT administrators more control over how video is managed in Teams Meetings. The previous policy only prevented outgoing video. We have extended the Allow IP Video policy to prevent both outgoing and incoming video as needed. Tenant administrators can use this policy to manage bandwidth.</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: Teams for Education</FONT>&nbsp;<BR /><STRONG>Early teacher access to class teams</STRONG></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Microsoft School Data Sync (SDS) enables automatic creation of all your class teams using the data found in your school's student information system.&nbsp; With <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/activate-early-access-class-teams-created-with-school-data-sync-preview-0d154696-66ab-4fcf-b22f-c3d9a82aaf78\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">early teacher access to classes</A>, you now have time to set up assignments, add files, and get organized before your students begin using the SDS-created team. Once your class team is ready to go, simply click “Activate” and that’s it! You control when students have first access to the class. Early teacher access to classes will be gradually rolling out this month.<BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"EDU.png\" style=\"width: 826px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162488i035C3C727EEC64DE/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"EDU.png\" alt=\"EDU.png\" /></span></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Sync Teams assignments and grades to PowerSchool with Grade Sync</FONT></STRONG></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Using PowerSchool SIS for grades? Sync your assignments and grades directly to PowerSchool PowerTeacher Pro with Grade Sync and save yourself a step. Learn how to setup today, <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Education-Blog/Soar-into-2020-with-12-new-Microsoft-Teams-for-Education-updates/ba-p/1055102\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>!<BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"powerschool.png\" blog</A>, for all the new updates coming to Teams for Education!</FONT></DIV>\n</DIV>\n</DIV>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 08 Jan 2020 23:33:34 We also recognize that it is 2020, and very few of you, if any, only use our technology to get work done. We created <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Teams as a platform</A> to not only bring together your existing workplace investments, but to make them more valuable when used within Teams. Countless organizations have grabbed this opportunity and delivered truly innovative solutions for their workplace. We’ve dubbed those who have taken this Teams experience to the next level the Teams Superheroes, and we want to share what they are doing.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>A notable example is <A href=\"https://www.tmsw.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">HAVI</A> - a world leader in supply chain management with over 10K employees - who slashed their employee pre-boarding process from weeks down to just 40 minutes with an elegant blend of Teams, Power Platform, and Azure:</P>\n<P><LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BWyr80ZX3mg&amp;list=PLXPr7gfUMmKxG49leHp2XJv_3nfJysQm-&amp;index=14&amp;t=3s\" align=\"center\" size=\"large\" width=\"600\" height=\"338\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/BWyr80ZX3mg/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Over the past three years, organizations have been asking us for guidance on where to begin. There are unlimited possibilities when it comes to <A href=\"https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-teams\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">extending and personalizing your Teams experience</A>, and we hope that providing detailed scenarios like the one above makes it much easier to visualize possibilities and identify the right place to start.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>With the explicit goal of <STRONG>helping you find the scenarios that best fit your organization’s business goals, we are launching <A href=\"https://teamssuperheroes.eventbuilder.com/MonthlyRoadshows\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Unleashing Microsoft Teams</A></STRONG> (&lt;-- register here) – a monthly Live Event, where we will cover one or more key scenarios delivered by organizations in Teams. Each monthly call will be held in three different time zones, recorded, and shared with registrants and on our <A href=\"https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLXPr7gfUMmKxG49leHp2XJv_3nfJysQm-\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Superheroes YouTube playlist</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Who should join this community call?</STRONG></P>\n<P>Anyone with foundational experience in Teams. We have heard from many IT (Information Technology) departments that Teams platform has become the bridge between their group and their broader organization. So, if you're in IT and reading this we encourage you to invite your business counterparts along.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">Last Thoughts</SPAN></STRONG></P>\n<P>We hope to see you on one of our calls. We are constantly on the go, getting work done from coffee shops, the airport, the couch, and while commuting. And for those in certain lines of work, like retail, healthcare, or many service industries, your phone may be your primary or only device! This is why the Teams experience on your phone is just as crucial as the experience you have on your desktop. We have a whole team at Microsoft focused on optimizing your Teams mobile experience and building features to make your busy lives easier.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>And it’s not just us who love the Teams mobile app. Not to brag… but Teams is a top-rated productivity app on both the <A href=\"https://apps.apple.com/us/app/microsoft-teams/id1113153706\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">App Store</A> (4.8) and <A href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.microsoft.teams\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">&nbsp; Play store</A> (4.6). There are <EM>many </EM>reasons to love Teams mobile, but here are a few of our favorites.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>1. Quiet hours &amp; quiet days </STRONG></P>\n<P>It is important to set personal boundaries and optimize your work hours in the way that works best for you and your job. But when we work with teams of people who are spread across time zones, and have different work styles and job duties, there is often someone on our team who is working at all hours of the day. On Teams mobile, you can set “Quiet Hours” (for example, 7PM to 7AM) and “Quiet Days”(for example, Saturday and Sunday) This feature helps you take control over your after-work time and can help relieve stress.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"quiet hours mobile gif.gif\" style=\"width: 201px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/135139i5F70A19A442550C8/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"quiet hours mobile gif.gif\" alt=\"quiet hours mobile gif.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>2. Share content in a meeting from your cell phone</STRONG></P>\n<P>This feature is a lifesaver when you are away from your desk but still need to present content in a meeting or call. On Teams mobile you can present PowerPoint slides, videos, photos, or even share your phone screen to show someone exactly what you are looking at on your phone.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"share content mobile gif.gif\" style=\"width: 200px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/135142i1F69CD602D213BEC/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"share content mobile gif.gif\" alt=\"share content mobile gif.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>3. Transfer a call from your laptop to your phone</STRONG></P>\n<P>Have you ever had to drop off an important conference call in order to rush to your next appointment, or make sure you would be home in time for dinner? Teams makes it a seamless experience to transfer a call from your PC to your mobile device (or vice versa) without interrupting the flow of your meeting, so you can finish your work while also getting where you need to go (feature coming soon).&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"transfer call mobile gif.gif\" style=\"width: 200px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/135144iE56EB76081A51F65/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"transfer call mobile gif.gif\" alt=\"transfer call mobile gif.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>4. Audio messages </STRONG></P>\n<P>The ability to send audio messages in a chat is a fantastic alternative to typing and is often preferred by people in regions where multiple dialects are spoken. You can send a message when you are on the go, walking or are even cooking. And unlike text, a voice message can help lend your unique personality and tone to the message.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"audio messages mobile gif.gif\" style=\"width: 201px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/135147i2DC9D0CF52F2F0D1/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"audio messages mobile gif.gif\" alt=\"audio messages mobile gif.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>5. Dark mode</STRONG></P>\n<P>Like the much loved “dark mode” in Windows File Explorer, Office applications, and Teams on your desktop, the Teams mobile app is available in dark mode! Dark mode is a great option for low light environments, reduces strain on some people’s eyes, and is a great battery saver.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"darkmode mobile gif.gif\" style=\"width: 200px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/135149iF409E77658174C6B/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"darkmode mobile gif.gif\" alt=\"darkmode mobile gif.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>6. Integrated Office lens <BR /></STRONG>Using our phones to take and share pictures is already a powerful tool but using the <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/what-is-office-lens-f5f6b88d-356f-4037-b7e8-49f34be86db3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office Lens</A> through Teams takes it to the next level. The Office Lens recognizes when you are taking a photo of a whiteboard or a document and optimizes the picture for that medium— even straightening out the document, or making the whiteboard writing show up more clearly. And you can annotate images with text or by drawing on the image with your finger.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"office lense mobile gif.gif\" style=\"width: 201px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/135151i3ADC0A3F79B9557B/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"office lense mobile gif.gif\" alt=\"office lense mobile gif.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>7. Re-ordering the bottom bar</STRONG></P>\n<P>Today, our phones often feel like an extension of ourselves; and the ability to customize how your phone is set up is crucial. You can customize your bottom navigation bar with the tools that make the most sense for you, to give you ready access to the tools you need.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"reorder 2 gif.gif\" style=\"width: 200px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/135490i8DDF2CB021B14896/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"reorder 2 gif.gif\" alt=\"reorder 2 gif.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>8. Share Location </STRONG></P>\n<P>The beauty of using Teams on your mobile device is that you can truly be productive while on-the-go and in between working locations. When you are on-site with a customer or en route to a job site you can easily share your physical location with your manager from your Teams mobile app. This is especially important for those in service roles or who need check-in documentation to certain job sites. And since this is done through the Teams mobile app it is secure and compliant.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"share location mobile gif.gif\" style=\"width: 200px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/135155iE78AC2463D5CB5A8/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"share location mobile gif.gif\" alt=\"share location mobile gif.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>9. Triage your notifications with a quick swipe </STRONG></P>\n<P>It’s great to be able to get a jump start on our day before you even get into the office, which is why we love the ability to swipe to mark messages and notifications as read/unread with one easy gesture. Because as we know, there is a big difference between a casual chat conversation that you read on your way into work, and a notification with several items you will need to follow up on.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"activity feed mobile gif.gif\" style=\"width: 200px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/135157i1458F6568E18A592/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"activity feed mobile gif.gif\" alt=\"activity feed mobile gif.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>10. Easily swap shifts with a co-worker from your phone </STRONG></P>\n<P>When you are a Firstline Worker, something as simple as figuring out your weekly schedule can be a major headache. Instead of having to take a picture of a paper schedule in the break room, manually add your shifts to your own calendar, and then track down the phone number of your co-worker you need to swap shifts with, use Shifts in Teams to manage your schedule and keep in touch with your team! Whether you are a manager creating your team’s schedule, or just trying to remember when you are scheduled to work this week, Shifts in Teams has you covered. Learn more <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/expand-teams-across-your-org/shifts/manage-the-shifts-app-for-your-organization-in-teams\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"shift.png\" style=\"width: 198px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/135158iBEC7EF3B3BA53EB4/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"shift.png\" alt=\"shift.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>If you already use Teams, make sure you have the Teams mobile app installed on your phone to take advantage of all these great features and more.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Find Teams:</P>\n<P><A href=\"https://apps.apple.com/us/app/microsoft-teams/id1113153706\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">App Store</A> and <A href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.microsoft.teams\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">&nbsp; Play store</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>If you are not yet a Teams user, <A href=\"https://products.office.com/en-US/microsoft-teams/group-chat-software\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">get started with Microsoft Teams today</A>!</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 09 Oct 2019 17:00:33 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Microsoft & Cisco partner to simplify meetings and calling for mutual customers","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/microsoft-amp-cisco-partner-to-simplify-meetings-and-calling-for/ba-p/971835","description":"<P>In a modern workplace we recognize that customers can have a mix of different vendors across conference rooms and calling infrastructure solutions. Over the year’s customers have asked us to simplify their deployment complexity in a mixed vendor environment. With today’s announcements we hope to simplify and accelerate conference room and IP voice gateway deployment options for our customers as they adopt Microsoft Teams within their organizations.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Today<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><STRONG>Microsoft and Cisco<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN></STRONG>are announcing a partnership to work together to simplify the interoperability between Microsoft Teams Rooms and Phone System with Cisco Webex Room devices and IP voice gateways respectively. This partnership aligns with both Microsoft and Cisco’s dedication to openness, interoperability and customer choice. It includes three new initiatives to help our customers to get more out of their current investments:<BR /><BR /></P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Cloud Video Interop (CVI)</FONT></STRONG></P>\n<P>This partnership enables&nbsp;Cisco&nbsp;Webex&nbsp;video devices to connect to the Microsoft Teams meeting services.&nbsp;Cisco Webex will introduce an interop solution that will be certified as a Microsoft&nbsp;Cloud Video Interop (CVI)&nbsp;solution. This offer&nbsp;will allow Cisco Webex Room devices and SIP video conferencing devices to join Microsoft Teams meetings with a reliable interop experience. This will benefit customers who have asked for Cisco and Microsoft to provide a reliable interop solution to enable their existing Cisco video devices to join Microsoft Teams meetings in a seamless way.&nbsp;This solution is expected to GA in early CY20.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Direct guest join, for meeting room devices</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Cisco and Microsoft are working together on a new approach that enables meeting room devices to connect to meeting services from other vendors via embedded web technologies. Microsoft and Cisco will be enabling a<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><STRONG>direct guest join capability</STRONG><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>from their respective video conferencing device to the web app for the video meeting service. This capability will be supported on latest generations of meeting room devices like Microsoft Teams Rooms and Cisco Webex Room devices, which can run embedded web technologies. This solution is expected to GA in early 2020.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Cisco-join-final.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/152740iD4B7EB6587F40F5A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Cisco-join-final.gif\" alt=\"Microsoft Teams Room joing Cisco Webex Meeting via direct guest join\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Microsoft Teams Room joing Cisco Webex Meeting via direct guest join</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Direct Routing for Phone System</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Direct Routing, a feature of Microsoft Phone System, allows customers to choose and then directly connect their telecom provider to Teams. At the heart of this solution is an essential component known as the Session Border Controller (SBC). It provides a wide variety of services which improve the experiences and security for users making calls. Many customers also use Cisco Networking technology including SBCs and want both companies to provide joint solutions that do not require replacement of key infrastructure. Today we are excited to share that<SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN><STRONG>Cisco</STRONG><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN>has joined our certification program for Session Border Controllers. Customers who already has a telecom provider and use Cisco SBCs will soon be able to deploy Direct Routing for dial tone in Teams without replacing infrastructure.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 04 Nov 2019 14:00:01 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/152740iD4B7EB6587F40F5A/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"7ea2246d08cb81f6649a700fe12537e5","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn20@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-56-42-688_aa25b10418899785.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":562,"sourceBytes":310227,"destBytes":51438,"author":"Lan Ye","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/152740iD4B7EB6587F40F5A/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn20@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-56-42-688_aa25b10418899785.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401927},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Microsoft Teams is now available on Linux","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/microsoft-teams-is-now-available-on-linux/ba-p/1056267","description":"<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Starting today, Microsoft Teams is available for Linux users in public preview, enabling high quality collaboration experiences for the open source community at work and in educational institutions. We are constantly improving based on community feedback, so please download and submit feedback based on your experience. </FONT></P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><BR />The Microsoft Teams client is the first Microsoft 365 app that is coming to Linux desktops, and will support all of Teams’ core capabilities. Teams is the hub for teamwork that brings together chat, video meetings, calling, and collaboration on Office 365 documents and business processes within a single, integrated experience. <BR /></FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/Teams/chat%20linux%20gif1.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"980\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Most of our customers have devices running on a variety of different platforms such as Windows 10, Linux and others. Every day millions of people around the world rely on Teams to communicate better through meetings, calls and chat. In this series, we share best practices and highlight new communication features in Teams designed to help you and your teams stay connected and accomplish more together.</EM></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Meetings have always been a cornerstone of teamwork. In fact, meetings are so vital that 37 percent of employee time is spent in meetings and many attend over 60 meetings a month.<A href=\"https://e-meetings.verizonbusiness.com/global/en/meetingsinamerica/uswhitepaper.php#INTRODUCTION\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><SUP>1</SUP></A> But are we getting the most out of every meeting?</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>All too often, people come to meetings unprepared because it takes too much time to find and review pre-meeting materials. During the meeting, it’s often a struggle, especially for remote participants, to fully engage and feel included, especially if they’re struggling to see or hear what’s being discussed. Afterwards, the value of meetings further diminishes when important insights—like decisions and action items—fall between the cracks from one meeting to the next.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>To help get the most out of meetings, we need to change the way we think about meetings. Today, a meeting is treated as a stand-alone event, and the phone and video conferencing tools many people use are designed to support that event. But our extensive user research tells us two things: first, meetings are rarely discrete events, but a series of collaborative connections; and secondly, great meetings are not just about what happens during the meeting, but also before and after.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Microsoft Teams was built with this holistic approach as the central guiding principle for developing meetings. We treat meetings as an ingredient of collaboration that relies on a series of connections until the project is complete. Teams keeps all the relevant meeting content and discussions in one place so that participants can spend less time hunting down information and stay focused and engaged before, during and after meetings. Here’s what this looks like in practice:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"padding-left: 30px;\"><STRONG>Before</STRONG><BR />A lot of meetings prep is about content, context and conversation. This is now made simpler because every Teams Meeting comes with a persistent conversation. Microsoft Teams surfaces this information easily and conveniently in the context of your meeting. People can have discussions about the meeting beforehand and bring those conversations into the meeting without losing context. And since Teams is the hub for teamwork in Office 365, your Teams Meetings are held where your chats and files live, naturally bringing this context into your meeting.</P>\n<P style=\"padding-left: 30px;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"padding-left: 30px;\"><STRONG>During</STRONG><BR />Once the meeting begins, people can use a variety of features that help focus attention, drive engagement, and foster inclusion. These include high-fidelity audio and video, <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-Teams-Blog/What-s-New-in-Microsoft-Teams-July-2019/ba-p/779946\" target=\"_self\">live captions</A>, rich real-time <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Document-collaboration-and-co-authoring-EE1509B4-1F6E-401E-B04A-782D26F564A4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">co-authoring with Office 365 apps</A>, <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/whiteboard-in-a-teams-meeting-d9210aa2-876a-40f0-8ca0-5deb2fc11ca6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">digital whiteboard</A>, and <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Blur-your-background-in-a-Teams-meeting-f77a2381-443a-499d-825e-509a140f4780\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">distraction-free backgrounds</A>. Teams also makes it easy to bring in participants outside your organization, even if they don’t have an Office 365 account. They can join using the Teams app or through most web browsers because Teams has full WebRTC support for meetings and calling. For those that may not have a fully supported browser, Teams offers a <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-Teams-Blog/What-s-New-in-Microsoft-Teams-September-2019/ba-p/881539\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">lightweight meeting join experience</A>.&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"padding-left: 30px;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"padding-left: 30px;\"><STRONG>After</STRONG><BR />After the meeting, all the related assets – including the <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Record-a-meeting-in-Teams-34dfbe7f-b07d-4a27-b4c6-de62f1348c24\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">recording of the meeting</A>, chat, <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/take-meeting-notes-in-teams-3eadf032-0ef8-4d60-9e21-0691d317d103\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">meeting notes</A>, <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/whiteboard-in-a-teams-meeting-d9210aa2-876a-40f0-8ca0-5deb2fc11ca6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">digital whiteboard</A>, transcript, and shared files are saved in a persistent conversation that helps the team continue the discussion and drive work forward. Nothing gets lost in the cracks. Teams makes it easy to review the recording of the meeting by enabling people to search for keywords and quickly jump to the point in the recording where a specific topic was discussed. &nbsp;Never miss the meeting, even if you missed the meeting!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Microsoft Teams Meeting - search meeting recording animation.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/137101i5870B769326D3452/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Microsoft Teams Meeting - search meeting recording animation.gif\" alt=\"Animation showing a keyword search of a Microsoft Teams meeting transcript and jumping to the point in time of the meeting where it was mentioned.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Animation showing a keyword search of a Microsoft Teams meeting transcript and jumping to the point in time of the meeting where it was mentioned.</span></span></P>\n<P>We’re excited to tell you more about how you can use Teams to get the most out of your meetings. Stay tuned for other topics.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN>​</SPAN>Get more from your meetings today with Microsoft Teams Meetings, <A href=\"https://products.office.com/en-us/microsoft-teams/group-chat-software\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">try it now</A>.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 11 Oct 2019 15:00:00 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/137101i5870B769326D3452/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"808dd16b0ec1e825bad525be5e258d24","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn64@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-56-52-376_ded56ca5f410c2fe.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":562,"sourceBytes":720730,"destBytes":652616,"author":"James Skay","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/137101i5870B769326D3452/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn64@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-56-52-376_ded56ca5f410c2fe.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401927},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Stay productive and connected using apps in Teams","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/stay-productive-and-connected-using-apps-in-teams/ba-p/1305854","description":"<P>Many organizations are re-evaluating the tools in their toolkit to help ensure employees remain productive and connected while working remotely. If you are already using Microsoft Teams for collaboration, you instantly have access to over 400 third-party apps in the Teams app store. We’d like to share five apps that can be helpful in our new way of working – helping to foster more informed customers, happier co-workers, and peace-of-mind for organizations of all sizes.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"dynamic121.png\" style=\"width: 101px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184268iB3551BEA05B55C96/image-size/small?v=1.0&amp;px=200\" title=\"dynamic121.png\" alt=\"dynamic121.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>Dynamic Signal</STRONG><BR />Ongoing communication and employee connection maximize the likelihood that your workforce is informed, engaged, and agile. Dynamic Signal allows you to proactively broadcast critical news as a channel post, and users can curate a news repository in the Dynamic Signal Teams app. One of the great benefits of this integration is that you can send personalized communications through the devices and channels employees prefer to help ensure awareness in a timely manner.</P>\n<P><BR /><A href=\"https://teams.microsoft.com/l/app/6f98619e-a822-4a74-8ee9-af6a358f2750\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more about Dynamic Signal</A></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"dy123.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184269iD5326ED683AFFCE8/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"dy123.png\" alt=\"dy123.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"qubie11.png\" style=\"width: 154px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184270i3E0D92C23D4BE96D/image-size/small?v=1.0&amp;px=200\" title=\"qubie11.png\" alt=\"qubie11.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>Qubie</STRONG><BR />As we are all adapting to new routines, including working from home, ensuring your team is working optimally may well be on the top of your ‘to do list’. Thankfully, Qubie is designed to help. Managers can collect feedback in Teams and analyze the results to quickly understand where improvements can be made. If you’ve considered pulse surveys, it’s worth taking a closer look at Qubie – interacting is simple, insightful, and captures employee sentiment around their new work arrangements.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><A href=\"https://teams.microsoft.com/l/app/a4b9907d-cff2-4771-91d5-30cb794f00c5?source=store-copy-link\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more about Qubie</A></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"qubie.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184243i6EDABBF082AA8EAF/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"qubie.png\" alt=\"qubie.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"text1121.png\" style=\"width: 192px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184272i92CCD2EF57824BE6/image-size/small?v=1.0&amp;px=200\" title=\"text1121.png\" alt=\"text1121.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>Text</STRONG><BR />To help your team quickly respond to customer concerns or to allow employees to report health and safety issues, you may be exploring options for an employee, customer, or partner help line. The Text app in Teams is one of the quickest ways to set up an SMS help line. When a customer or partner sends a text message to your business, the Text app delivers the message into Teams. Replies to text messages are typed into Teams and sent back outbound without requiring the end user to login to any portal. Teams customers have loved how easy and quick it is to implement Text for urgent scenarios.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><A href=\"https://teams.microsoft.com/l/app/a622ceb4-b6e2-4557-8218-e22e80975ba4?source=store-copy-link\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more about Text</A></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"text2.png\" style=\"width: 998px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184248i958936CF859527DA/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"text2.png\" alt=\"text2.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"disco1121.jpg\" style=\"width: 141px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184274i487CC4B49E4CABE6/image-size/small?v=1.0&amp;px=200\" title=\"disco1121.jpg\" alt=\"disco1121.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>Disco</STRONG><BR />Spontaneous acts of goodwill might be harder to come by these days without seeing your coworkers’ needs and challenges in person. As some might have begun to feel isolated in our remote work environments, it is even more important to celebrate teamwork. That’s why we recommend trying out Disco, an app in Teams that helps your employees celebrate achievements, give peer recognition, and live your company values. The more that collaborative moments are celebrated virtually, the more your employees will seek out opportunities to help each other in unexpected ways.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><A href=\"https://teams.microsoft.com/l/app/57ca9979-33f7-4ae8-93d8-5ba497be7f29?source=store-copy-link\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more about Disco</A></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"disco.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184249i1214B028A9476126/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"disco.png\" alt=\"disco.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"alli1121.png\" style=\"width: 144px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184275i2DAF859C07F1EDFA/image-size/small?v=1.0&amp;px=200\" title=\"alli1121.png\" alt=\"alli1121.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>Alli</STRONG><BR />There is a lot of change in the air and employees probably have a lot of HR questions – about company policies, tips for interacting with partners/customers, and, of course, how long they might be stuck working from home! Alli in Teams will help your organization resolve employees’ questions automatically through a bot conversation. You share your knowledge base of FAQs with the bot, and it intelligently delivers answers to employee questions in natural language. The result is a lot of saved time responding to tickets and emails.</P>\n<P><BR /><A href=\"https://teams.microsoft.com/l/app/847e7d34-9b8a-48e1-8871-0474a4f11ceb?source=store-copy-link\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Learn more about Alli</A></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"alli.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184251i710A3A28C5764FD4/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"alli.jpg\" alt=\"alli.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Learn more!</STRONG><BR />If you would like to learn how to better leverage apps in Teams, check out <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/four-more-reasons-to-love-apps-in-microsoft-teams/ba-p/1119114\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">this blog post</A> to learn more about recent enhancements to the apps experience, and take advantage of the free virtual training events each week:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>For Teams end-users:</STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://aka.ms/LearnTeamsApps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Join a live, instructor-led training session</A> called “Learn to Use Apps in Microsoft Teams.” We’ll show you how to find, install, and leverage the full functionality of some of our most popular apps.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><STRONG>For Teams Admins:</STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://microsoftteams.eventbuilder.com/ChalkTalksApps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Join our Chalk Talk series</A>, where members of Teams engineering walk through the security, deployment, and management of third-party integrations.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 14 Apr 2020 15:05:15 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184268iB3551BEA05B55C96/image-size/small?v=1.0&px=200","linkMd5":"d7c311a79183a6b18a6c8c3451b89540","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn4@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-56-42-377_0fa01fc717d0e69f.webp","destWidth":101,"destHeight":101,"sourceBytes":11499,"destBytes":1112,"author":"MicrosoftTeamsTeam","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184268iB3551BEA05B55C96/image-size/small?v=1.0&px=200":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn4@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-56-42-377_0fa01fc717d0e69f.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184269iD5326ED683AFFCE8/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn72@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-53-927_6720f3ae0830113b.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184270i3E0D92C23D4BE96D/image-size/small?v=1.0&px=200":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn72@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-07-356_56a7370a1b1311eb.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184243i6EDABBF082AA8EAF/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn63@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-57-24-179_26771794f75be9f8.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184272i92CCD2EF57824BE6/image-size/small?v=1.0&px=200":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn91@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-57-29-679_7141294382d13ec9.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184248i958936CF859527DA/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn4@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-57-17-816_187baaffe46e0585.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184274i487CC4B49E4CABE6/image-size/small?v=1.0&px=200":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn28@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-57-07-009_7d97521b80b943d8.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184249i1214B028A9476126/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn56@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-32-730_eb7a78af8df61e7c.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184275i2DAF859C07F1EDFA/image-size/small?v=1.0&px=200":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn56@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-37-897_b5b7328c53c8a95f.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184251i710A3A28C5764FD4/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn44@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-22-818_370c87113769db3c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401922},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Reach the right people faster with tags in Microsoft Teams","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/reach-the-right-people-faster-with-tags-in-microsoft-teams/ba-p/1302986","description":"<P>Knowing the right person or group of people to contact can be a continuous challenge. It’s difficult to remember every member of a project team, the owner of a process, or the appropriate expert. Searching through old emails, looking through paper lists of names, or asking other people to find the right contact can be time-consuming and frustrating. With targeted communication using tags in Microsoft Teams, you can now organize users within your Team based on attributes such as role, skill, or expertise. Once tags are applied, you can quickly and easily reach the right people. &nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\">Create and use tags in Teams </FONT></P>\n<P>To get started with tags, find a Team on the left-hand side of the screen, select <STRONG>More options …,</STRONG> and choose <STRONG>Manage Tags</STRONG>. Here&nbsp;you can create tags:</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"CreateTagZoomed.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184048i3F86771AD1F6747E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"CreateTagZoomed.png\" alt=\"Create a new tag\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Create a new tag</span></span></P>\n<P>Once a tag is created, you can use the tag to reach people either with a chat or in a Channel post. In a Channel, you can @mention the tag so that the tag members will be notified.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"UseTagZoomed.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184049i7FB500071CDE4634/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"UseTagZoomed.png\" alt=\"Using a tag in a channel post\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Using a tag in a channel post</span></span></P>\n<P>Here are some situations where tags might be able to help your group communicate and collaborate more efficiently.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Role-based work</STRONG>: In organizations where people often know the role of the person they need to reach, but they don’t know their name, tags can provide the right context to find them. For example, if I work in a role where I pass specific types of issues to a support team, I could create a <EM>CustomerSupport </EM>tag. Then, I could post a customer issue to a Channel Post and include <EM>@CustomerSupport</EM> so that the right people get notified.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Large Teams:</STRONG> Within large Teams, tags are middle ground between @mentioning an individual and @mentioning a Channel. For example, if I work in a retail store with a bunch of departments, I could create a <EM>Footwear</EM> tag for employees assigned to that department. Then, when I create a channel post to let the whole store know that two displays are going to be reorganized and include @Footwear to make sure employees in that department get the message.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Cross-functional project teams</STRONG>: For special projects where the members may not frequently work together, tags can be used as a light-weight way to create a project group. This is especially useful for short-term projects. For example, if I’m working on a new product design concept with some people from Marketing, Merchandising, and Branding, I could create a <EM>ProductAlpha</EM> tag for our group.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Identifying an expert or owner</STRONG>: Tags can also be helpful to identify an expert or a single point of contact. For example, if I work in a manufacturing plant, I might want to tag people with a specific safety certification.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><FONT size=\"6\">Learn more and upcoming tagging capabilities</FONT></P>\n<P>When using tags, here are some other things to keep in mind:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Pick a name that all members of the Team can easily understand.</LI>\n<LI>Remember, Tags are only accessible to people who are members of the Team where the tag was created.&nbsp;</LI>\n<LI>There is currently a limit of 100 tags per Team and 100 members per tag. Each user can be assigned a maximum of 25 tags.</LI>\n<LI>Tags can be disabled by the IT Admin or changes to tags can be controlled only by the Team Owner. If you don’t see tags, they may have been disabled in your environment. For more information, see the <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/manage-tags\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Manage Tags</A> article.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>To learn more about tags in Teams, check out the links below.</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/using-tags-in-teams-667bd56f-32b8-4118-9a0b-56807c96d91e?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Using tags in teams</A></LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2020/03/06/empowering-care-teams-with-new-tools-in-microsoft-365/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Empowering care teams with new tools in Microsoft 365</A></LI>\n</UL>\n<P>Right now, tags are maintained by Teams users. We’re currently working on new tag capabilities that will automatically apply tags to users based on when they are working. This functionality is backed by <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/what-is-shifts-f8efe6e4-ddb3-4d23-b81b-bb812296b821\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Shifts</A> in Teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Thanks for taking the time to read about tags in Teams! We’d love to hear from you, if you have an idea for what you’d like to see next, please submit a suggestion on <A href=\"https://microsoftteams.uservoice.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">UserVoice</A>.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 14 Apr 2020 21:24:55 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184048i3F86771AD1F6747E/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"563ad966c0a7d570acfdbac7f212a0bc","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn87@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-56-43-329_626abbed564030f8.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":595,"sourceBytes":115535,"destBytes":16564,"author":"Annie Colonna","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184048i3F86771AD1F6747E/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn87@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-56-43-329_626abbed564030f8.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184049i7FB500071CDE4634/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn12@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-57-05-235_50224853ff9d4341.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401922},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Introducing the Advanced Call Quality Dashboard","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/introducing-the-advanced-call-quality-dashboard/ba-p/972586","description":"<P>If you are an IT administrator looking to monitor and manage your Teams (or migrate from Skype for Business Server 2019, or Skype for Business Online) call analytics, you will be excited to learn that the latest updates to Call Quality Dashboard (CQD) are now available. The new CQD comes packed with exciting new capabilities, features, and reports. The addition of these new latest enhancements represents a major update for CQD. The new reports enable administrators to actively troubleshoot system and individual user issues.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\">Powerful New Capabilities</FONT></P>\n<P>In order to provide new insights, CQD is also adding new capabilities to support them. Even those Teams administrators who choose not to make use of the new reports will see improvements in CQD thanks to these capability enhancements.</P>\n<CENTER>\n<P style=\"text-align: left;\">&nbsp;</P>\n</CENTER>\n<P><STRONG>Near Real-Time Data</STRONG> - CQD is now available on average in 30 minutes! Admins can quickly receive feedback on the success or failure of their troubleshooting efforts helping improve satisfaction across the board. In the past, Call data used to take 24 hours on average to become available and admins making changes to the network configuration meant waiting 1 or more days before confirming success.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"padding-left: 30px;\"><STRONG><FONT color=\"#333399\"><EM>“With 350 million monthly audio minutes and 16 million monthly video minutes, we need the right quality data to support Accenture’s more than 200,000 Microsoft Teams and 400,000 active users. The updated version of CQD, with new drill down capabilities, user-level data and latency data, is a game changer. Data from the CQD enables us to pinpoint isolated problems versus enterprise-wide issues and respond quickly to users.” Bill Schulz, Accenture</EM></FONT></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>EUII Data</STRONG> (End User Identifiable Information) gives Teams admins the ability to zoom all the way down to the user level. Available fields include the users full IP address, MAC address, BSSID, user IDs, Machine Endpoint Name, the user’s verbatim feedback, and Object ID. (For compliance reasons, PII/EUII data is only stored for 30 days.)</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\">Helpful Features</FONT></P>\n<P>Making the most of these new capabilities, these updates to CQD are also adding a host of features to enable entirely new workflows.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Improved Date Controls</STRONG> add new Trend and date parameters to CQD. Rolling Trends allow for the generation of reports that show data for the last 5, 7, 30, 60, or 90 days. New date parameters also allow Teams admins to view the data starting from any given date, as opposed to the previous full month resolution.<BR /><BR /><STRONG>Drill Down Fields</STRONG> enable quick analysis by allowing the report user to narrow down on a field and automatically filter on a value across multiple queries. Drill down fields can dramatically speed up the “guess and check” process that is common to most troubleshooting.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"padding-left: 30px;\"><STRONG><FONT color=\"#333399\"><EM>“The new version of CQD has enabled us as a company to do effective root causing of incidents. Saving us time. The critical missing item in our [previous] approach was the ability to drill down to the user level.” - FrieslandCampina</EM></FONT></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In addition to these changes, we’ve made various quality-of-life improvements and introduced smaller new features like multi-select filters, dashboard-level filters, and greatly improved building data upload speeds. New Dimensions and Measures, such as Call Counts (versus Stream Counts), have also been added in response to customer requests. These are only some of CQD’s new features and the one we’re most proud to introduce, but for a complete listing of the changes, please review our <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/turning-on-and-using-call-quality-dashboard\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">updated documentation</A>.</P>\n<CENTER>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n</CENTER>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\">Insightful Reports</FONT></P>\n<P>By combining all this new functionality, CQD is now also able to provide all new insights. Teams administrators can now investigate problem calls almost as soon as they’re finished, and even analyze issues on a user-by-user basis. Exposing these new insights, CQD now includes several new standard reports, to include the following:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"padding-left: 30px;\"><STRONG><EM><FONT color=\"#333399\">“Our partnership, in the development and maturity of CQD portal, has enhanced our ability to quickly define end user issues and promote actionable fixes, in an environment with over 120K users and 100M audio minutes a month. The ability to drill down, within an incident, to an individual’s specific challenge expedites our resolutions and increases user experience scores. What used to take 2-3 days for a report is now readily available, near real-time. My team has switched to advanced CQD, a long-time ago!.” – Sridhar Reddy, Johnson &amp; Johnson</FONT></EM></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT color=\"#000000\"><STRONG>Quality Drill Down</STRONG> makes extensive use of drill down fields and EUII data, allowing Teams administrators to slice and review their call quality data by date, region, hour, specific location, specific subnet, and even by user.</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Failure Drill Down</STRONG> follows a similar workflow as the Quality Drill Down, but with a focus on call failures. As with the Quality Drill Down, an admin could use this report to identify which specific locations, subnets, and users contribute most significantly to Teams’ issues.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Rate My Call</STRONG> is similar in workflow to the above reports but differs significantly in that it allows admins to measure and evaluate the subjective experience of their users. Rate My Call draws on direct user feedback to help identify those locations and users who feel as though they are encountering the most issues.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"padding-left: 30px;\"><STRONG><EM><FONT color=\"#333399\">“We used CQD to identify sites that require WLAN infrastructure upgrade and confirm the success of the changes. One of the most vivid examples was a large site in EU, that was affecting call quality stats for the whole region. We recently finished WLAN upgrade and as a result [Poor Call Quality] went down from 6.7% to 0.3% in a month!” – Ivan Lukyanov, Mars</FONT></EM></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Help Desk</STRONG> reverses the pattern of most other reports by starting from the user and working backwards to identify specific issues. By leveraging the new EUII data in CQD, admins can now find a specific user or call and work from there to identify the issues that affected their call experience.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Client Version</STRONG> allows administrators to view session and user counts for each client version. Administrators supervising large or highly dispersed networks will find this report especially useful, as it helps to identify sources of poor call quality resulting from older or out-of-date client versions. Drilling down to the user level will enable those admins to identify the responsible users in order to help keep everyone up to date across their entire network.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Endpoints</STRONG> provides information on machine endpoints by make and model of device, in order to help identify problem platforms. In order use this report, customers must upload endpoint data in a manner similar to building data. More information on that process can be found <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/turning-on-and-using-call-quality-dashboard#upload-tenant-data-information\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><BR /><FONT size=\"5\">What’s Next?</FONT><BR />As large as these changes are, the updates on the horizon are even more exciting. Future updates to CQD will harness the power of machine learning and Power BI in order to provide automated insights, improved visualizations, and easy custom report generation.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>These improvements and countless smaller ones are already well into development. We look forward to continuing to deliver industry-leading insights and innovation in the space of call quality analytics.</P>\n<P style=\"text-align: center;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Slideshow-draft1.gif\" style=\"width: 668px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/154065i97855A230C61BCD5/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Slideshow-draft1.gif\" alt=\"Slideshow-draft1.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P style=\"text-align: center;\"><EM><FONT size=\"2\">The new Location-Enhanced Reports provides all the information you have already come to expect, and more!&nbsp;</FONT></EM></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 05 Nov 2019 14:00:00 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/154065i97855A230C61BCD5/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"623b4dc4b862f53e9e0e586650203af9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn99@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-56-44-934_6ee7d4eb30d45b32.webp","destWidth":668,"destHeight":998,"sourceBytes":332008,"destBytes":158406,"author":"Siunie Sutjahjo","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/154065i97855A230C61BCD5/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn99@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-56-44-934_6ee7d4eb30d45b32.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401927},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Transition from Skype for Business to Microsoft Teams: Latest functionality and upgrade resources","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/transition-from-skype-for-business-to-microsoft-teams-latest/ba-p/1276697","description":"<P><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">As organizations across the globe are taking their operations online, they are increasingly relying on Microsoft Teams to stay connected, enable remote work and keep their business going. For our Skype for Business customers planning their move to Teams, we want to provide an update on the latest Teams functionality improvements and resources that can help you with your transition.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Recent Teams enhancements to assist with your transition from Skype for Business to Microsoft Teams</STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><EM><STRONG>Available Now</STRONG></EM></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/roadmap?featureid=53935\" target=\"_self\">Teams/Skype Consumer interop</A></STRONG> – Teams and Skype for Consumer users can communicate via chat and VoIP calling (Preview release with general availability planned by the end of April, see the announcement <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/what-s-new-in-microsoft-teams-3rd-anniversary-edition/ba-p/1234871\" target=\"_self\">here</A> and href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/roadmap?featureid=53934\" target=\"_self\">Screen sharing in Teams/Skype for Business interop</A></STRONG> – Enables a Teams user to share their screen in chat or VoIP call with a Skype for Business user</LI>\n<LI><STRONG><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=52394\" target=\"_self\">Native federation for 1:1 chats</A></STRONG> – The Teams chat experience is the same whether communicating with colleagues or external users</LI>\n<LI><STRONG><A meeting attendees: presenter and attendee</LI>\n<LI><STRONG><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/roadmap?featureid=53938\" target=\"_self\">Dynamic emergency calling for direct routing</A></STRONG> – This feature of Microsoft Teams Phone System uses the caller’s current location to route to a Public Safety Answering Point (PSAP)</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/roadmap?featureid=53936\" target=\"_self\"><STRONG>Shorter retention</STRONG></A> – Teams Compliance Administrators can set a Teams chats retention policy as short as a single day</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><EM><STRONG>Rolling Out</STRONG></EM></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/roadmap?featureid=24180\" target=\"_self\">Location-based routing</A> – Restricts the call routing between VoIP endpoints and PSTN endpoints based on the party location, and enforces authorization rules for call routing to PBX or PSTN endpoints</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>Want to see more? Check out the “<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/bg-p/MicrosoftTeamsBlog\" target=\"_self\">What’s New in Microsoft Teams</A>” posts, and view the Microsoft 365 roadmap for other <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=teams#owRoadmapMainContent\" target=\"_self\">Microsoft Teams features</A> in development.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Need help planning your upgrade to Teams Only?</STRONG></P>\n<P>Throughout your journey from Skype for Business to Teams, we’ve got planning resources and guidance to help drive technical and user readiness in your organization.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><EM><STRONG>Upgrade Planning Workshops</STRONG></EM><BR />Our free Upgrade Planning Workshops leverage a proven framework to ensure technical and user readiness throughout your organization. <A href=\"https://aka.ms/SkypeToTeamsPlanning\" target=\"_self\">Register now for an online session</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><EM><STRONG>End-to-End Upgrade Framework</STRONG></EM><BR />Visit <A href=\"http://aka.ms/SkypetoTeams\" target=\"_self\">aka.ms/SkypeToTeams</A> for everything you need to plan your upgrade journey, including links to videos explaining coexistence and interoperability options, tips for conducting a successful pilot, and the <A href=\"https://aka.ms/UpgradeSuccessKit\" target=\"_self\">Upgrade Success Kit</A> featuring customizable assets such as a sample project plan, user communications, feedback surveys, and more.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><EM><STRONG>Upgrade Skype for Business to Microsoft Teams Community</STRONG></EM><BR />Have specific questions about upgrading to Teams?
