Microsoft Teams helps your employees, customers, and partners stay connected and productive, from wherever they are. And we’re here to support your upgrade journey.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 02 Apr 2020 21:00:00 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"afc45fee86c4ee228fe2059619f4e90c","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Bindu Pillai","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401923},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Jira Server App for Microsoft Teams","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/jira-server-app-for-microsoft-teams/ba-p/1070363","description":"<P><STRONG>Jira Server integration</STRONG></P>\n<P>Since the release of the Jira Cloud app for Microsoft Teams, we’ve seen significant usage and many delighted customers. At the same time, we know there is a large Jira Server community looking for a similar integration – and we could not ignore this huge market need. We are pleased to answer this demand with our new Jira Server version of the Jira integration for Microsoft Teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>One of our key priorities is to keep parity between Jira Server and Jira Cloud integrations as a main goal, and share the best functionality whether you are using cloud or on-premises Jira. For this reason, the Jira Server app offers many deep integrations, including a messaging extension, a bot, a Teams tab, and a personal app experience. Also, the Jira Server app for Microsoft Teams supports different Jira on-premise options and is compatible with Jira Data Center.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Messaging extension for Jira Server app in Microsoft Teams </STRONG></P>\n<P>Messaging extensions let you embed rich information from Jira directly within your conversations. With the Jira messaging extension for Jira Server you can:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Search issues on your Jira Server</LI>\n<LI>View the list of last modified issues</LI>\n<LI>Share the issue in an interactive card into your channel, group or private conversation</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Jira_Server_Messaging_Extension.gif\" style=\"width: 998px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162172i9BF6F8E274104298/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Jira_Server_Messaging_Extension.gif\" alt=\"Jira_Server_Messaging_Extension.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Microsoft Teams Bot for Jira Server</STRONG></P>\n<P>You can also interact with Jira while engaged with your work in Teams. Speed up processes by using the integrated bot for Jira Server.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture8.png\" style=\"width: 715px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162170i6E27BE28B6E11E3C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Picture8.png\" alt=\"Picture8.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>With this integrated bot, you can:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Create new issues via integrated forms</LI>\n<LI>Quickly find issues and assign issues to yourself</LI>\n<LI>Edit existing issues</LI>\n<LI>Log time you spend on an issue</LI>\n<LI>Start watching issues</LI>\n<LI>Leave a comment on an issue</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Channel Tab</STRONG></P>\n<P>Tabs are popular extensions due to its ability to provide app user experiences directly within Microsoft Teams without switching away from the app and the context of work. This experience is shared when added to your team channel.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>With Jira Server tab, you’ll be able to pin your team’s backlog to the channel and quickly navigate to it whenever you or your teammates need it. You can also apply the custom filters you use from Jira, or configure your own directly from Teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Personal App</STRONG></P>\n<P>Jira Server for Microsoft Teams provides personalized experiences with the bot, and tabs. A personal bot will help you manage your Jira routine tailored to the way you work. Tabs will provide common view on issues assigned to you, reported by you and provide access to your custom filters.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture9.png\" style=\"width: 721px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162171i85BEE1A00F633DAC/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Picture9.png\" alt=\"Picture9.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>How to get started</STRONG></P>\n<P>To start using the integration you need to install Microsoft Teams for Jira Server app within your Jira Server instance. You’ll need Jira Server administrator permissions. Download the app from <SPAN><A href=\"https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1217836/microsoft-teams-for-jira?hosting=server&amp;tab=overview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Atlassian Marketplace</A></SPAN> or install it from within Jira Server plugin manager. Once the app is installed in your Jira Server instance, users should install the Jira Server app from Microsoft Teams Apps menu. If you can’t find Jira Server app in Apps menu, make sure if 3<SUP>rd</SUP> party apps are enabled by your tenant administrators.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>And of course, the webhook-based <SPAN><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-Teams-Blog/New-Jira-Server-Integration-for-Microsoft-Teams/ba-p/327688\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Jira Server connector</A></SPAN> is still available for you if you need one-way communication, to retrieve push notifications from Jira.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Enjoy!</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 17 Dec 2019 17:00:00 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162172i9BF6F8E274104298/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"71d09da1876073859f28222b1caa14e2","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn75@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-56-50-469_3a0c211826c4e824.webp","destWidth":998,"destHeight":854,"sourceBytes":410266,"destBytes":837422,"author":"MSTeamsApps","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162172i9BF6F8E274104298/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn75@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-56-50-469_3a0c211826c4e824.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162170i6E27BE28B6E11E3C/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn87@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-30-049_31d86e996ee5869b.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162171i85BEE1A00F633DAC/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn32@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-57-26-241_8310ce2d29e67040.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401926},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"5 Steps to have a Successful Live Event for your Government Organization","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/5-steps-to-have-a-successful-live-event-for-your-government/ba-p/1280134","description":"<P>A live event is the online equivalent of what happens in an auditorium: One or a few people communicate to a large group, managing the full event experience and controlling the content that is shared. Attendees can watch the event, ask questions, and share in conversation with each other.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Hosting a live event in Microsoft Teams enables you to schedule and produce events for large online audiences. Live events use video and interactive discussion to host organization-wide employee briefings or host a virtual council meeting, and can be as simple or as sophisticated as needed. Up to 10,000 attendees can participate in real-time from anywhere, across devices, or catch up later with the event recording that features automatic transcription and search.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>So, how do you setup a live event?</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Step 1: Plan the live event</STRONG></P>\n<P>Just like an in-person gathering, a live event works best when properly planned ahead of time. Based on your needs, you can consider hosting a lightweight event using a simple laptop and webcam setup and invite the presenters to participate using their own devices, or opt to use professional camera and sound setup. Further, to ensure a seamless experience for your attendees, you should proactively assign roles to various participants. Some roles to consider are:</P>\n<OL>\n<LI><STRONG>Organizer</STRONG> - schedules a live event and ensures the event is set up with the right permissions for attendees and the event group, who will manage the event.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Producer</STRONG> – manages a live event, making sure attendees have a great viewing experience by controlling the live event stream. Responsible for starting and stopping the live event, and switching between presenters. Having a person dedicated to the producer role makes sure that presenters are not burdened with managing the event, and allows presenters to leave the event after they are finished presenting.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Presenter</STRONG> - shares audio, video, or a screen to the live event.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Moderator</STRONG> –joins the event in the “presenter” role to moderate and monitor questions and answers (Q&amp;A). Having a designated moderator ensures timely attention to the questions asked by the attendees and makes for a better attendee experience.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Step 2: Schedule a live event from Microsoft Teams</STRONG></P>\n<P>After you have planned the event and assigned roles, you are ready to schedule you event! You can schedule a live event just like any other meeting, using the calendar in Microsoft Teams. First, you will enter event information, including the title, date and time, and assign people to roles.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Depending on the audience for your event, you can create a Private or a Public event. Public events are a great option to consider for events such as public townhalls, or council meetings. If an event is public, anyone who has the link can attend without logging in.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"1.JPG\" style=\"width: 893px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/182066iE191F3A934CE0E45/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"1.JPG\" alt=\"1.JPG\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Next, you will select a People and Groups, Org-wide or a Public event. If an event is public, anyone who has the link can attend without logging in, making public events ideal for town hall or council meetings.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"2.JPG\" style=\"width: 604px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/182067iA3BC94717AE4D500/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"2.JPG\" alt=\"2.JPG\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>If you want to create a public event but do not see an option to create one, contact your IT administrator. The ability to create a public event is controlled centrally and, by default, users are not granted permission to create a public event. Your administrator can modify the policy for live events in the Teams Admin Center.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"3.JPG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/182069iAB1616C39010BD2C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"3.JPG\" alt=\"3.JPG\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Step 3: Invite attendees to the meeting</STRONG></P>\n<P>As a live event organizer, one of your responsibilities is to invite attendees. When you schedule a live event in Teams, it automatically sends the calendar invite to producers and presenters. From the calendar entry in Teams, you can get a link to the event and send it out to attendees.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"4.JPG\" style=\"width: 871px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/182071i70500B4B8873FE06/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"4.JPG\" alt=\"4.JPG\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Step 4: Go live</STRONG></P>\n<P>When you want to start the live event, select “Join” from the invite. You will enter the event in setup mode. In this mode, you can add content and video you want to go live with. To get a quick overview of how to use the setup mode and go live, watch the video below:</P>\n<P><IFRAME src=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/videoplayer/embed/RE3lHs1?pid=ocpVideo0-innerdiv-oneplayer&amp;postJsllMsg=true&amp;maskLevel=20&amp;market=en-us\" width=\"950\" height=\"405\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" allow=\"accelerometer; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\"></IFRAME></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>You can also go to this <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/produce-a-live-event-using-teams-591bd694-121d-405c-b26d-730315e45a22\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">page</A> to learn more about various production capabilities and tools available to you as you go live with your event.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Step 5: Manage recording and reports</STRONG></P>\n<P>After the live event is over, you can choose to download the recording, as well as attendee and Q&amp;A reports. Sharing the recording with attendees can help them go over the event and using searchable transcripts, even enable them to watch specific parts of the event that they care about the most.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"5.JPG\" style=\"width: 748px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/182070i7DB29EFE7141359C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"5.JPG\" alt=\"5.JPG\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Visit this <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/produce-a-live-event-using-teams-591bd694-121d-405c-b26d-730315e45a22\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">page</A> to learn more.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Live events are a great way to connect with your employees as well as constituents. So, take your next council meeting or employee townhall online, and provide an immersive experience for your audience!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>To know more on how to get started with live events in Microsoft Teams, go to <A href=\"http://aka.ms/liveevents\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">aka.ms/liveevents</A></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 06 Apr 2020 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/182066iE191F3A934CE0E45/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"04b6e2071d1a46952079ca48b3f37db5","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn84@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-56-43-741_5f45e63d1ca8deb5.webp","destWidth":893,"destHeight":324,"sourceBytes":20898,"destBytes":13638,"author":"Sankalp_Jain","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/182066iE191F3A934CE0E45/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn84@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-56-43-741_5f45e63d1ca8deb5.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/182067iA3BC94717AE4D500/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn72@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-57-19-765_d9c4dc3f41388f2c.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/182069iAB1616C39010BD2C/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn24@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-10-528_47d4addf42f9d4d1.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/182071i70500B4B8873FE06/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn88@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-40-184_2c109a62134fa00a.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/182070i7DB29EFE7141359C/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn32@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-22-066_b0d63e2a745cb695.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401923},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"What’s New in Microsoft Teams | August 2019","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/what-s-new-in-microsoft-teams-august-2019/ba-p/830349","description":"<P>In August, we saw updates in Teams that help improve your personal productivity experience, as well as several updates that help Teams of all kinds have effective calls and meetings. Read on for a round-up of exciting features that have launched in Teams over the past month.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>What’s New: Chat &amp; Collaboration</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Teams helps you stay on track with <U>focus time</U></STRONG></P>\n<P>“Where focus goes, energy flows” – Wayne Dyer, American author. Busy people can sometimes fill their days with meetings and appointments and forget to schedule time to focus on their work without any outside distractions. <A href=\"https://products.office.com/en-us/business/myanalytics-personal-analytics\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">MyAnalytics</A> helps you explore your own work patterns and learn ways to work smarter – including AI powered suggestions for setting aside “focus time” on your calendar (i.e. when it notices your week is filling up with meetings). When you schedule “focus time” through MyAnalytics, Teams will automatically help you stay focused by: changing your presence to “focusing” and silencing all notifications during the focus period (based on your priority access settings). Learn more about “focusing” presence <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/presence-admins\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">What’s New: Calling &amp;</FONT> <FONT size=\"5\">Meetings</FONT> </STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Participate in whiteboarding from afar with Microsoft Teams Rooms – Content Cameras and Intelligent Capture </STRONG></P>\n<P>Even with amazing technology at our fingertips, the traditional whiteboard still has an important role in many meeting rooms and can serve as a great collaboration tool. And while Teams provides a wonderful meeting experience for those who can’t be in the room– it can still be difficult for those people to see what’s going on and participate in whiteboarding sessions.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The Microsoft Teams Room app has been updated to include a “content camera” feature—this technology will detect the whiteboard in the room, crop and frame it, and share the content with remote participants. And even when a person steps in front of the whiteboard, the viewers will be able to see right through them to what is on the board!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Learn more about this exciting experience <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-Teams-Blog/An-inclusive-meeting-experience-for-everyone-in-any-room-with/ba-p/805877\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IFRAME src=\"https://www.youtube-nocookie.com/embed/1XvgH2rNpmk\" width=\"900\" height=\"506\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\"></IFRAME></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Meetings First brings Microsoft Teams meetings to Skype for Business Server customers </STRONG></P>\n<P>Designed for Skype for Business Server customers who want the innovative meetings experience available today in Teams, Meetings First is a configuration mode that allows organizations to continue to use Skype for Business Server for their chat and enterprise voice needs, but move their meetings workload to the cloud.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"meetings first.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/129272i1A0A80FDFF832E27/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"meetings first.png\" alt=\"meetings first.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><A href=\"https://aka.ms/meetingsfirst\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Meetings First</A>&nbsp;was designed for organizations who require the enterprise voice workloads of Skype for Business Server but want a superior meetings experience with Microsoft Teams.&nbsp; Any version of Skype for Business Server is supported, though more recent clients will have a better coexistence experience.&nbsp; In addition, organizations need to be licensed for Teams, including Audio Conferencing if PSTN dial-in/dial-out functionality is required.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Houston, we have sound!</STRONG></P>\n<P>You asked and we listened. Now, you can share your audio during a Teams meeting, so all participants, near and far, can hear whatever media you're presenting. So go ahead, add that video to your PowerPoint presentation. Your audience awaits! Learn how to add system audio to your meetings <A href=\"https://support.office.com/f1/topic/share-system-audio-in-a-teams-meeting-dddede9f-e3d0-4330-873a-fa061a0d8e3b\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P><STRONG>Partner Provided Calling Plans for Japan</STRONG></P>\n<P>SoftBank has released their UniTalk calling plans to Office 365 customers in Japan. The Softbank Calling Plans enables SoftBank to sell and support PSTN calling services specifically for the Japanese market.&nbsp;Find the roadmap item <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=52282\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Audio Conferencing via Direct Routing for GCC High and GCC DoD </STRONG></P>\n<P>This feature&nbsp;enables participants to join your organization’s meetings using a standard phone number.&nbsp;Configuring this feature requires your GCC High or GCC DoD organization to use its own numbers for dial-in access and all meeting dial-outs to phones are via Direct Routing. To enable the service, organizations need to set up Direct Routing and configure phone numbers that can be used for dial-in access. Find the roadmap item <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/roadmap?filters=&amp;searchterms=54236\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>, and learn more on direct routing <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/direct-routing-plan\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>What’s New: Developer</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>Personal apps in Microsoft Teams on mobile devices (developer preview)</STRONG></P>\n<P>Personal apps are an important part of how you can extend and customize Microsoft Teams for your organization. It provides a capability for people in your organization to use 3rd&nbsp;party apps within Teams. We are pleased to announce that we are bringing personal app support to the Teams app on mobile devices. We have rolled out personal apps in <EM>developer preview mode</EM> for all developers to view their app experience running inside Teams mobile. We are targeting a broader roll-out of personal apps for end users&nbsp;on mobile devices in last quarter of this calendar year 2019. Learn more <A href=\"https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/office/blogs/?p=3342&amp;preview=1&amp;_ppp=ba39338ec0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"personal apps mobile.png\" style=\"width: 222px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/129273iF9B7000FFAAE7C58/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"personal apps mobile.png\" alt=\"personal apps mobile.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>What’s New: Teams for Education </STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG>Enhanced Assignments tab in Teams for Education </STRONG></P>\n<P>The enhanced Assignments tab now shows a clear view of what’s coming up next. Think of it as a “to do” list. If you’re a teacher, this means work you have left to review or grade. For students, that means approaching due dates.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"assignments tab edu.png\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/129274iBBC6C73E681D5B04/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"assignments tab edu.png\" alt=\"assignments tab edu.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>When creating a class assignment, educators can add resources from your Staff or PLC team. Simply select <STRONG>Add resources</STRONG> on your assignment and choose it from the file picker. You no longer need to move your content between teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"add resources edu.png\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/129276i8CC841D85261A271/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"add resources edu.png\" alt=\"add resources edu.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>When scheduling an assignment and setting the due date, you can also specify when you want to close turn-ins, too. No submissions will be allowed after the close date, granting more flexibility on if/when late or revised work will be accepted.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"schedule assignment edu.png\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/129277i059A4F9E4B9D2F25/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"schedule assignment edu.png\" alt=\"schedule assignment edu.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>Check out these Assignment updates and many others <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Education-Blog/Transform-learning-with-the-new-Microsoft-Teams-Assignments/ba-p/783189\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>!</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 30 Aug 2019 16:13:24 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/129272i1A0A80FDFF832E27/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"838ff6b5a0dd769bcf2b94cb5704dc4a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn28@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-56-44-003_331794cbfbde1786.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":666,"sourceBytes":300143,"destBytes":36222,"author":"Marissa Salazar","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/129272i1A0A80FDFF832E27/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn28@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-56-44-003_331794cbfbde1786.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/129273iF9B7000FFAAE7C58/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn56@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-06-389_a1d9693a0de5daa1.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/129274iBBC6C73E681D5B04/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn95@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-20-696_a98bdd32746c7173.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/129276i8CC841D85261A271/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn60@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-57-23-388_8dc06df615166327.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/129277i059A4F9E4B9D2F25/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn59@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-57-27-480_6540a4a81bec37a4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401929},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"The 3 phases to fuel Microsoft Teams adoption in your organization","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/the-3-phases-to-fuel-microsoft-teams-adoption-in-your/ba-p/1218650","description":"<H2><STRONG>Go beyond the traditional “Plan &gt; Build &gt; Deploy” process</STRONG></H2>\n<P>If you have deployed or upgraded end user experiences in the past, you’ll probably recognize many of the steps from other roll-outs. For the best adoption results, we recommend an incremental and measured approach across three phases: Start, Experiment, and Scale.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<OL>\n<LI><STRONG>Start</STRONG>: As we’ve covered on previous episodes, once you have the technical prerequisites for Teams in place and your users licensed, it’s time to establish a multi-disciplined team to assess your organizational readiness at both a technical and user level, as you roll out Teams. It’s not enough to pilot Teams in IT before you roll it out broadly.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P>In working with thousands of organizations of all sizes, we’ve seen that recruiting a number of critical roles can help accelerate progress. These include:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>An executive sponsor to get others on board and excited about using Teams,</LI>\n<LI>Someone on point to make sure that your user and business stakeholders are happy, and that works with you to set deployment goals and oversee the rollout, and</LI>\n<LI>Multiple “Champions” across departments to help evangelize and help others build their skills in Teams.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>Depending on the scale of your roll-out or the size of your organization, the same person on your roll-out team may serve multiple roles. What’s more important is that you plan for these specific functions, as well as for formal training based on your assessment of organizational readiness. To help with your planning, we’ve created a number of training and communication assets, available at <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/Microsoft-Teams\" target=\"_blank\">aka.ms/SuccessWithTeams</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>How ready your organization is to move to Teams can be evaluated by meeting with the leaders in your organization and by conducting surveys leveraging tools like the questionnaire template in the free <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/use-advisor-teams-roll-out\" target=\"_blank\">Advisor for Teams</A> tool. This is also an area where your help desk can assist by tracking the most common user issues and questions recorded during the pilot or test phase.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Taking your time to get this feedback is worth it, as it will help you understand if different levels of effort are required for different user profiles, departments, or groups. In addition, this feedback will help you craft the right content timelines, and online and in-person strategies for training. You’ll also be able to identify which groups of people are more suited to be part of the first phase of your roll-out. The free <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/use-advisor-teams-roll-out\" target=\"_blank\">Advisor for Teams</A> tool can also help you select the workloads that you want to deploy from Chat, Teams, Channels, Apps, Meetings and Conferencing, along with your specific project teams for each. It also helps you track against milestones with an integrated step-by-step project plan.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<OL start=\"2\">\n<LI><STRONG>Experiment: </STRONG>With your core team in place and baseline information about your organization’s readiness, you can move on to building the foundation for piloting Teams services to specific groups or business units. This is where you’ll want to make sure that you have the right policies and governance models in place. As we covered on our very first <A href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MfDB7VenWuA&amp;list=PLXtHYVsvn_b_JeDjgD5XdkyHTDXdYgPGn\" target=\"_blank\">Microsoft Teams for IT episode</A>, you’ll want to think about how you plan to manage Teams over time. Some things to consider include:\n<UL>\n<LI>Who has permissions to create teams? You may for example, want to limit team creation of teams to managers or project leaders to avoid over-provisioning teams</LI>\n<LI>How long should teams last? Set expiration policies to manage teams overflow</LI>\n<LI>Should teams be standardized? Setting standard naming conventions for new teams may allow for more consistency and easier discoverability</LI>\n<LI>Which apps do you want approved for use within Teams? Consider the many apps already integrated with Teams and how they would add value to your users</LI>\n<LI>Do you need any controls for information protection and retention? Check out my Teams Essentials episode on <A href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=91lHNKVVvQ4&amp;list=PLXtHYVsvn_b_JeDjgD5XdkyHTDXdYgPGn&amp;index=3\" target=\"_blank\">Security and Compliance</A> for more on this topic.</LI>\n<LI>Do you need overlapping capabilities across Skype and Teams? For broader guidance on this topic please watch my <A href=\"https://youtu.be/1HKWEq_uyYU\" target=\"_blank\">Skype to Teams Upgrade episode</A>.</LI>\n<LI>Are you enabling desktop and mobile Teams apps? To drive the best adoption results, we recommend that the desktop and mobile versions of Teams are made available to users, and that you configure them to AutoStart to help users discover them.</LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n</OL>\n<P>As you set pilot and go/no-go decision goals, remember to incorporate measurable business outcomes that you can rally your project team around. The best way to derive these goals is to ask stakeholders about what business processes are critical for them, and where they have opportunities for improvement. You should have gone through this in the Start phase.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Communication is also a critical part of your pilot phase. Try to start with an email from your executive sponsor to explain why Teams is being deployed, how it opens up remote work opportunities, the advantages to improve productivity, &nbsp;and how users can start to get familiar with it. It’s a good idea to include links to self-training resources and frequently asked questions. You could combine this with a kick-off call or short group event over breakfast or lunch to increase excitement, get direct feedback, and share the details of your early adopter program.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<OL start=\"3\">\n<LI><STRONG>Scale: </STRONG>With the early adopter program running during the Experiment phase, you gathered the experiences and skills to broaden your deployment of Microsoft Teams. When expanding to a broad roll-out, you’ll also need to expand your stakeholder groups and implementation team. Consider thinking about potential updates to your governance policies as you add more departments or regions to your roll-out. You’ll also want to set organization-wide goals by working with your roll-out team and your executive sponsor to identify the right metrics to measure success at a company level. Example metrics include driving outcomes tied to your work culture as the basis for teamwork, for example: how often do employees work remotely, as well as tangible or measurable improvements like: reducing time spent joining meetings, or optimizing travel budget.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P>While usage goals are one thing, in parallel make sure to set realistic milestones to get your IT environment ready. For example, adding PSTN calling to Teams as you phase out Skype may extend your deployment timeline and require specific end-user training.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The feedback and reporting channels established at the Experiment phase, along with your Champions, will continue to play an important role as you scale your deployment. Here you can also continue to take advantage of the built-in reporting in Microsoft 365 and the Teams admin center to help you to track end user adoption.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>As you scale, it’s also important to plan for driving broader internal awareness campaigns with materials like posters, digital signage and events, which you can download from <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/Microsoft-Teams\" target=\"_blank\">here.</A> You can also provision Microsoft 365 learning pathway templates into your Intranet, and you can learn more at <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/customlearning/\" target=\"_blank\">aka.ms/m365LP.</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>These three phases and additional guidance for getting your organization on board with Microsoft Teams are covered in more detail in <A href=\"https://youtu.be/BQ7kVacSAt0\" target=\"_blank\">today’s essentials episode.</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>I hope that you’ve enjoyed the guidance and tips from our Microsoft Teams for IT series so far. We’re always ready and willing to support you on your journey with Teams, so please continue to share your feedback and questions here and on <A href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MfDB7VenWuA&amp;list=PLXtHYVsvn_b_JeDjgD5XdkyHTDXdYgPGn\" target=\"_blank\">Microsoft Mechanics</A><SPAN>, </SPAN>or stay in touch with my Teams updates via <A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/nydia-cavazos/\" target=\"_blank\">LinkedIn.</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Until next time!</P>\n<P>Nydia (connect on LinkedIn at:&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/nydia-cavazos/\" target=\"_blank\">https://www.linkedin.com/in/nydia-cavazos/</A>)</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 10 Mar 2020 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"434f543e85df6504f429f0f066beffa9","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Nydia Cavazos","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401924},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"What’s New in Microsoft Teams | July 2019","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/what-s-new-in-microsoft-teams-july-2019/ba-p/779946","description":"<P>Microsoft Teams continues to <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2019/07/11/microsoft-teams-reaches-13-million-daily-active-users-introduces-4-new-ways-for-teams-to-work-better-together/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">gain momentum and popularity</A><SPAN>, </SPAN>with more than 13 million people using Teams on a daily basis. We on the product team couldn’t be happier to continually bring our users exciting features to make their jobs easier. After all, helping to drive workplace collaboration and build inclusive team culture is <EM>our</EM> job!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>What’s New: Chat &amp; Collaboration</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>Use <U>priority notifications</U> to make sure your most critical messages are addressed</STRONG></P>\n<P>Imagine a critical, time-sensitive situation at work—from needing a hospital patient’s medical history, to needing a quick price check on an item in the warehouse. With priority notifications you can send someone an urgent message on their mobile and desktop devices. This means that the recipient will be notified of the message every two minutes for up to 20 minutes, so you are more likely to get the response you need, quickly.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>For a limited time, unlimited priority notifications in Microsoft Teams will be made available for all customers. This promotion will run from July 2019 to December 31, 2019. During this time, all Teams users will be able to send unlimited priority notifications. Find more information about licensing <A href=\"https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdocs.microsoft.com%2FMicrosoftTeams%2Fteams-add-on-licensing%2Fpri-message&amp;data=02%7C01%7CChristopher.Bryan%40microsoft.com%7C3b1f8dfa260a4db6d25508d6f5bbb502%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C636966584162923412&amp;sdata=MdiQq66UTOljSku0Kc4Q9znMlDCDTFPEdttQwpOLB0E%3D&amp;reserved=0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>, and more information about managing users’ messaging policies <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/messaging-policies-in-teams\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"prioritynotifications.png\" style=\"width: 612px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124990i02DE76E4C46E190E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"prioritynotifications.png\" alt=\"Priority notification experience on a mobile device.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Priority notification experience on a mobile device.</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Get someone’s attention with <U>@-less mentions</U></STRONG></P>\n<P>Hey you! Sometimes we need to call out our teammates by name, to alert them to important information, to ask them a question, or to give them recognition. Now you can simply start typing a person’s name (starting with a capital letter) and select the right contact form the list of suggestions to tag them by name. They will receive a notification, which they can click to go directly to the point in the conversation where they were mentioned.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"atlessmentions3.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124992iFC0B9548E26D4471/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"atlessmentions3.gif\" alt=\"atlessmentions3.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>Keep conversations focused with<U> channel moderation</U></STRONG></P>\n<P>Channel moderation gives team owners and members who have been added as moderators, exclusive rights to create new posts in the channel and control whether team members can reply. This is a great resource for when you need to ensure that conversations in a certain channel stay focused and on topic. Learn more <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/manage-channel-moderation-in-teams\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"channel moderation.png\" style=\"width: 653px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124993i064EA3E2B6F75EC7/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"channel moderation.png\" alt=\"Channel moderation admin experience.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Channel moderation admin experience.</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>What’s New: Meetings, Calling, &amp; Live events </STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>Use <U>live captions</U> to give subtitles to your Microsoft Teams live events and meetings </STRONG></P>\n<P>When hosting a meeting or event in Microsoft Teams, it is important to consider how all your audience members or participants will be consuming it. Now in preview, live captions &amp; subtitles allow attendees to read speaker captions in real-time—helping to improve the accessibility and effectiveness of meetings (private preview) and live events (public preview). This is a game changing feature for those who are deaf or hard of hearing, have different levels of language proficiency, or are connecting from a loud location.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Captions and subtitles in live events supports more than 50 languages, so participants can easily select the one that optimizes their experience. Today in private preview, meetings support live captions in English, with more languages coming soon!</P>\n<P>Learn more <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/use-live-captions-in-a-live-event-1d6778d4-6c65-4189-ab13-e2d77beb9e2a\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Live event live caption language selection.png\" style=\"width: 520px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124995i92AC07EC7E5F365C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Live event live caption language selection.png\" alt=\"Live event live caption language selection.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Live event live caption language selection.</span></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>Discover usage trends with <U>live events usage reports</U></STRONG></P>\n<P>Easy access to data and reporting makes it much easier to optimize for future events. Now, admins can easily identify trends across the organization including usage information, event status, views, and who in your organization schedules, presents and produces live events. Learn more <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-analytics-and-reports/teams-live-event-usage-report\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"liveeventusage.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124998i687F721AED59A509/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"liveeventusage.png\" alt=\"Live event usage report.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Live event usage report.</span></span></P>\n<P><STRONG><U>Updates to Microsoft Teams Rooms</U></STRONG><STRONG> to make your meetings experiences even better </STRONG></P>\n<P>In the month of July, the Microsoft Teams Room (MTR) app update 4.0.105.0 was rolled out via the Windows store. This app update included various client and service features for Microsoft Teams Rooms devices. This included a rebrand of the app from “Skype Room System V2” to “Microsoft Teams Room”, UI updates that make the Microsoft Teams Room app experience more similar to using your desktop and mobile clients, updated themes and imagery to the front of room displays, the addition of meeting controls on the MTR device, and the ability to rate call quality on the MTR device.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>There was also the highly anticipated update that allows the use of Microsoft Whiteboard in Microsoft Teams Rooms. This means that when your room has a touch enabled device, you can have real-time whiteboarding sessions with remote participants!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Learn more about the Microsoft Whiteboard and the rest of the Microsoft Teams Rooms updates <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-Teams-Blog/Microsoft-Teams-Rooms-July-Update/ba-p/758164\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"rooms.png\" style=\"width: 551px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124999i96BEE7F079183ED4/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"rooms.png\" alt=\"Microsoft Whiteboard in Microsoft Teams Rooms.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Microsoft Whiteboard in Microsoft Teams Rooms.</span></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>Skype for Business Online will be retired on July 31, 2021</STRONG></P>\n<P>We have announced that Skype for Business Online will be retired on July 31, 2021 , and after that date the service will no longer be accessible. Please note that the Skype Consumer service and Skype for Business Server will both be unaffected by this announcement. Since launching Microsoft Teams in 2017 we have added to and refined the service as to be able to confidently recommend it as an upgrade to all Skype for Business Online customers. Customers who have already made the move tell us that Teams not only has helped them improve collaboration generally, it has also provided a rare opportunity to rethink the way work gets done in their organization. Learn more about the Skype for Business Online retirement plan and what we are doing to help customers migrate <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-Teams-Blog/Skype-for-Business-Online-to-Be-Retired-in-2021/ba-p/777833\" target=\"_self\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>What’s New: Teams Admins</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>Prepare your network with <U>Network Planner</U> (Preview)</STRONG></P>\n<P>We know that admins want to ensure that their network is ready to deliver the best Teams experience to their users. The Network Planner, found in the Microsoft Teams Admin Center, calculates your network requirements for deploying Teams and cloud voice across your organization’s physical locations. You only need to provide your network details and Teams usage. This feature launched in preview on July 1<SUP>st</SUP>. Learn more <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/network-planner\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>What’s New: Teams for Firstline Workers </STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG>Clock in and out of work with <U>time clock</U> in Teams Shifts </STRONG></P>\n<P>The new&nbsp;time clock&nbsp;feature in the Teams Shifts module allows workers to clock in and out of their work shifts and breaks right from their Teams mobile app. Managers have the option to&nbsp;geo-fence a&nbsp;location to ensure team members are at the designated&nbsp;worksite when clocking in or out.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"time clock smaller.gif\" style=\"width: 225px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/125003i5207A8DD48DE69CA/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"time clock smaller.gif\" alt=\"time clock smaller.gif\" /></span></P>\n<H2>&nbsp;</H2>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>What’s New: Government GCC High and Department of Defense (DOD)</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>All these features are coming to the following US Government environments: GCC High and DOD</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Work seamlessly with people outside of your organization with <U>external access</U> </STRONG></P>\n<P>Seamlessly communicate with people outside your organization with Microsoft Teams. Microsoft Teams external access allows users from other domains to participate in your chats and calls, including those who are still using Skype for Business Online or Skype for Business on-prem. This is rolling out now for Government GCC High and DOD, and will be completed by the end of August 2019. Learn more <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/manage-external-access\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Broadcast video and meeting content to large online audiences with <U>live events</U></STRONG></P>\n<P>Live events in Microsoft Teams (both Teams and external app produced) became available in GCC on July 26<SUP>th</SUP>. Microsoft Teams live events are an extension of Teams meetings that enable you to schedule and produce events that stream to large online audiences. Learn more about live events <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/get-started-with-microsoft-teams-live-events-d077fec2-a058-483e-9ab5-1494afda578a\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>See people’s availability whether they are using Teams or Skype for Business with <U>unified presence</U> </STRONG></P>\n<P>Presence status for users (i.e. available, busy or in a call) is now aggregated between Teams and Skype for Business. This ensures that a user has a single presence state regardless of the app and the device they use. So, if you turn your status to “busy” on Teams, Skype users will also see your “busy” status. For this functionality, the underlying Skype for Business account that is connected to the Teams user needs to be hosted in Skype for Business online. This is rolling out now for Government GCC High Learn more <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/presence-admins\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Teams users can now chat 1:1 with Skype for Business users </STRONG></P>\n<P>Interoperability (1:1 Teams – Skype for Business chat) is now available in the Government GCC High and DOD environments. A user that has been upgraded to Teams-Only mode can continue to communicate via chat with other users in the organization who are still using Skype for Business by using the interoperability capabilities between Teams and Skype for Business. This helps users stay productive while the organization transitions from Skype for Business to Teams. Learn more <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-and-skypeforbusiness-coexistence-and-interoperability\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Try the new features and provide feedback using the feedback link in the lower left corner of Microsoft Teams. If you have suggestions on how to make Teams better, please submit your idea via&nbsp;<A href=\"https://microsoftteams.uservoice.com/forums/555103-public\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">User Voice</A>&nbsp;or vote for&nbsp;existing ideas to help us prioritize the requests. We read every piece of feedback that we receive&nbsp;(we really do!)&nbsp;to make sure that Microsoft Teams meets your needs.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><EM>— Marissa Salazar, Product Marketing Manager, Microsoft Teams</EM>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 31 Jul 2019 15:00:00 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124990i02DE76E4C46E190E/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"7deb291b16e823ad5f80567b839bc2fb","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn12@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-56-43-263_72acdfb3c482f10e.webp","destWidth":612,"destHeight":393,"sourceBytes":194024,"destBytes":32956,"author":"Marissa Salazar","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124990i02DE76E4C46E190E/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn12@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-56-43-263_72acdfb3c482f10e.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124992iFC0B9548E26D4471/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn48@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-57-12-229_b7c2e21436e9b31a.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124993i064EA3E2B6F75EC7/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn75@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-57-28-943_f2223b91d908ca56.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124995i92AC07EC7E5F365C/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn84@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-57-56-821_b330ba17ef9b24dc.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124998i687F721AED59A509/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn56@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-58-12-580_9023d01ed8c57868.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/124999i96BEE7F079183ED4/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn28@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-57-03-664_ff5c4f3a105c7cfa.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/125003i5207A8DD48DE69CA/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn8@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-57-36-491_b43d4e743fc60ecd.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401929},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Microsoft Teams launches South Korea Data Residency","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/microsoft-teams-launches-south-korea-data-residency/ba-p/789171","description":"<P>Microsoft Teams will provide customer data residency for South Korea customers starting July 9th, 2019.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Beginning on this date, all new Teams customers in South Korea (e.g., new tenants, or first use of Teams) will be served out of the South Korea data center. For these new customers, files uploaded to a Teams channel will be stored in SharePoint Online, and files uploaded through 1:1 chat will be stored in OneDrive for Business in-country for all new customers. For existing customers, customer data in Teams continues to be stored in its current location.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Teams customer data residency in South Korea, as well as our other Office 365 customer data residency commitments in the data centers located in South Korea, help organizations with data residency requirements to onboard to Teams and Office 365.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This rollout furthers the in-country data residency capabilities of Microsoft Teams. As of this release, the Microsoft Teams services described above store data at rest in the following locations:<BR /><BR /><STRONG>• NEW! South Korea data centers in Seoul and Busan</STRONG><BR />• France datacenters in Marseille and Paris <BR />• Australia: datacenters in New South Wales and Victoria<BR />• Japan: datacenters in Tokyo (Saitama) and Osaka<BR />• APAC [Asia Pacific]: datacenters in Singapore and Hong Kong<BR />• EMEA [Europe, Middle East, and Africa]: datacenters in Dublin &amp; Amsterdam<BR />• AMER [Americas – North, and South]: datacenters in Bay, CA and Boydton, VA<BR />• UK: datacenters in Cardiff and London<BR />• India: datacenters in Chennai and Pune<BR />• Canada datacenters in Quebec City and Toronto<BR />• South Africa datacenters in Cape Town and Johannesburg</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Where your Teams data is stored<BR />The data you provide through your use of Teams is stored differently depending on the content type. Please watch the Ignite Breakout session on Microsoft Teams architecture for an in-depth discussion.<BR /><BR /><STRONG>Core Teams customer data</STRONG>: If an organization provisions its tenant in Australia, Canada, the European Union, France, India, Japan, South Korea, South Africa, the United Kingdom, or the United States, Microsoft will store the following customer data at rest only within that location: (1) Microsoft Teams chats, team and channel conversations, images, voicemail messages, and contacts, (2) SharePoint Online site content and the files stored within that site, and (3) files uploaded to OneDrive for Business. Below is additional information on which Microsoft platforms and applications store Teams data.</P>\n<P><BR />•&nbsp;&nbsp;<STRONG>Chat, channel messages, team structure</STRONG>: Every team in Microsoft Teams is backed by an Office 365 group and its SharePoint Online site and Exchange Online mailbox. Private chats (including group chats), messages sent as part of a conversation in a channel, and the structure of teams and channels are stored in a chat service running in Azure. The data is also stored in a hidden folder in the user and group mailboxes to enable Information Protection features.</P>\n<P>•&nbsp;&nbsp;<STRONG>Voicemail and Contacts</STRONG>: Voicemails are stored in Exchange Online. Contacts are stored in an Exchange Online-based cloud data store. Exchange Online and the Exchange Online-based cloud store already provide customer data residency in each of the worldwide datacenter geos. For all Teams, customers voicemail and contacts are stored in-country for Australia, Canada, France, India, Japan, UK, South Korea, South Africa, and the US. For all other countries, files are stored in the US, Europe, or Asia-Pacific location based on tenant affinity.</P>\n<P>•<STRONG>&nbsp; Images and Media</STRONG>: Media used in chats is stored in an Azure-based media service that is deployed to the same locations as the chat service. (One exception is Giphy GIFs which are not stored, but are reference links to the original Giphy service URLs; Giphy is a non-Microsoft service)</P>\n<P>•<STRONG>&nbsp; Files</STRONG>: Files (including OneNote and wiki) that somebody shares in a channel are stored in the team’s SharePoint Online site. Files shared in a private chat or a chat during a meeting or call are uploaded and stored in the OneDrive for Business account of the user who shares the file. Exchange Online, SharePoint Online and OneDrive for Business already provide customer data residency in each of the worldwide datacenter geos. So, for existing customers, all files, OneNote notebooks, Teams wiki content, and mailboxes that are part of the Teams experience are already stored in the location based on your tenant affinity. Files are stored in-country for Australia, Canada, France, India, Japan, UK, and South Korea. For all other countries, files are stored in the US, Europe, or Asia Pacific location based on tenant affinity.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Please note that customers that allow users to store files with a third-party storage provider are dependent on the third-party's choice of storage location of those services and should, therefore, review the location of data at rest for those services separately. Some uses of third-party storage include: <BR />1. <STRONG>Tabs</STRONG>: Tabs allow users to pin information from apps and services to a channel. Thus, it varies by type of the tab where the data is stored. The tab itself does not store any data within Teams. For example, a SharePoint Online tab will store data based on where the SharePoint Online site collection was provisioned. A tab that includes information from a partner will store the data directly in the system used by the partner and only present a view of it in Teams.</P>\n<P>2. <STRONG>Other partner apps</STRONG>: Microsoft does not provide any data residency support for apps and services from partners that you might be using within the Microsoft Teams experience. Please review information from those solutions directly to learn about where their data is being stored.<BR />We will continue to roll out Microsoft Teams to more local datacenters aligned with the Office 365 customer data residency strategy.<BR /><BR /><STRONG>FAQ</STRONG><BR /><STRONG>Which workloads in addition to Teams provide data residency in South Korea?</STRONG><BR />Exchange Online, SharePoint Online, and OneDrive for Business also provide customer data residency in South Korea.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"image.png\" style=\"width: 624px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/125672i09F349D74604E650/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"image.png\" alt=\"image.png\" /></span><BR /><BR /><STRONG>Where exactly in South Korea is this data stored?</STRONG><BR />Teams chat and media data will be stored in the Korea Central and Korea South datacenters located in Seoul and Busan respectively. <BR /><BR /><STRONG>What does this mean for new customers in South Korea?</STRONG><BR />From July 9th, 2019 (“Launch Date”), customers from South Korea who have never previously logged into Microsoft Teams (i.e. no user in their tenant has ever accessed teams.microsoft.com or signed into any Teams client app) will have customer data residency in South Korea.<BR /><BR /><STRONG>What does this mean for existing customers in South Korea?</STRONG><BR />Customers who are already using Teams will continue to have data residency for their content stored at rest in the APAC location. Soon, Microsoft will provide a migration feature to enable data migration for these existing Teams customers. We do not have a specific date at this point.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>If I have more questions, who should I talk to?</STRONG><BR />Please do not hesitate to contact your Account Team or FastTrack if you have more questions about Teams deployments and how the availability of data residency in South Korea affects your timelines to deploy. Based on your requirements, they will recommend the best approach for you.<BR /><BR /><STRONG>What is the roadmap for data residency in other countries?</STRONG><BR />Our goal is to provide data residency for Teams in all the Office 365 country-based datacenters.<BR /><BR />Thanks again for your time in reading this, and for all the support you’ve shown towards Microsoft Teams.<BR /><BR />Varun Sagar<BR />Senior Program Manager, Microsoft Teams</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 05 Aug 2019 21:20:41 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/125672i09F349D74604E650/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"91c229bc3bb79ab304dfdd763a661713","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn100@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-56-42-559_1df29b27a620af10.webp","destWidth":624,"destHeight":351,"sourceBytes":73882,"destBytes":16814,"author":"Varun Sagar","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/125672i09F349D74604E650/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn100@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-56-42-559_1df29b27a620af10.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401929},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Microsoft Teams highlights from Ignite 2019","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/microsoft-teams-highlights-from-ignite-2019/ba-p/1034812","description":"<P>We hope you had as much fun at Microsoft Ignite 2019 as we did! Since then, Teams adoption and usage continue to grow, as organizations have needed to find better ways to safely connect with their teams, customers, and partners. We’re seeing this play out in the dramatic increase in remote work, where traditional in-person meetings that are now impractical or impossible are being replaced by online meetings, calls, and chats.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Many of our Skype for Business customers have accelerated their upgrades to Teams expressly to bring people, data, ideas, and workflows together in one place, giving them the flexibility to keep working while physically apart.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Skype for Business Online retires July 31, 2021.png\" style=\"width: 981px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209140i6A18C41FE245C89D/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Skype for Business Online retires July 31, 2021.png\" alt=\"Skype for Business Online retires July 31, 2021.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>With <STRONG>12 months until the retirement of Skype for Business Online</STRONG>, we want to ensure each of our customers has a plan to transition to Teams – not only because access to Skype for Business Online will end, but to help realize the full <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2019/04/Total-Economic-Impact-Microsoft-Teams.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">benefits of Teams</A>. Whether your organization is looking to transition from Skype for Business Server, Skype for Business Online, or a hybrid deployment, here are some resources to help along the way.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Training, workshops, and technical guidance for a successful upgrade to Teams</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><STRONG>Teams Upgrade Guidance</STRONG> – The <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/upgrade-start-here\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Skype for Business to Teams content</A> on Microsoft Docs covers upgrades end-to-end featuring a proven project framework, coexistence specifications, and an upgrade success kit. Reference for all-up planning or for answers to specific upgrade questions.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><STRONG>Teams Upgrade Planning Workshops</STRONG> – Project leads, change managers, and IT admins rave about these free, <A href=\"https://aka.ms/SkypeToTeamsPlanning\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">interactive online workshops</A> for their valuable guidance, best practices, and resources for planning and implementing the upgrade to Teams.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Teams Upgrade Planning Workshops.png\" style=\"width: 997px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209141iE8834F5687501B85/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Teams Upgrade Planning Workshops.png\" alt=\"Teams Upgrade Planning Workshops.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><STRONG>Instructor-Led Teams Training – </STRONG>Need guidance for your deployment, or help training your organization to get the most from Teams? Check out the <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/instructor-led-training-teams-landing-page\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">free live and on-demand online training</A> designed to help business decision makers, admins, IT Pros, and end users get up and running with Teams.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><STRONG>FastTrack and Partner Support</STRONG> – When Teams deployment projects require more involved assistance, customers with eligible subscriptions can <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/fasttrack\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">engage FastTrack</A> for support. Customers are also encouraged to engage a <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/solution-providers/home?\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Partner</A> for assistance planning or executing their upgrades from Skype for Business to Teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Plan today for success in the months ahead</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>If you’ve already started your journey to Teams, keep it up. Each organization has its unique technical environment, application and process integrations, and aptitude for change that can shorten or extend the path to “Teams Only”. With a comprehensive upgrade plan in place, you’ll be ready to handle the expected as well as the unforeseen. Upgrade from Skype for Business to Teams and enable your organization to meet, chat, share, and collaborate from wherever they are, until the time is right for everyone to be together again.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>See you on Teams!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 31 Jul 2020 15:45:51 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209140i6A18C41FE245C89D/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"692d96aa81a2d493799573717e32ee62","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn48@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-56-44-283_3a0336096ff71f8d.webp","destWidth":981,"destHeight":223,"sourceBytes":9063,"destBytes":4540,"author":"MicrosoftTeamsTeam","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209140i6A18C41FE245C89D/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn48@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-56-44-283_3a0336096ff71f8d.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/209141iE8834F5687501B85/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn100@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-57-24-972_9aa766201dd8072c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401918},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Create teams quickly with Templates in Microsoft Teams","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/create-teams-quickly-with-templates-in-microsoft-teams/ba-p/1394163","description":"<P>Today we are thrilled to announce Templates in Microsoft Teams, enabling you to create effective teams faster and more easily than ever.</P>\n<P><BR />With Templates in Teams, users can choose from a variety of customizable templates when creating a new team, helping them get started quickly. IT professionals can also create new custom templates for their organization, allowing them to standardize team structures, surface relevant apps, and scale best practices. Templates in Teams will roll out in the next few months.</P>\n<P><VIDEO poster=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/templatesinteamsvideo.png\" preload=\"none\" controls=\"controls\" width=\"95%\" height=\"75%\"> <SOURCE src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/Teams/TemplatesinTeams120718.mp4\" type=\"video/mp4\"></SOURCE></VIDEO></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Create effective teams quickly</FONT></STRONG><BR />Teams are the atomic unit of productivity in the workplace—and in Microsoft Teams. A well-designed team brings together channels, tabs, and apps that combine into something greater than the sum of its parts. Templates in Teams bring together those exact ingredients to help users create teams quickly for effective collaboration. Let us show you how.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"1.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192148i6C68608AE627C8ED/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"1.png\" alt=\"1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>When creating a new team, users soon will be able to choose from a variety of customizable templates depending on the purpose of the team. Options will include common team types like event management and crisis response, as well as industry-specific templates like hospital ward and bank branch. Templates are standardized team structures that come with pre-defined channels, tabs and apps—providing an effective team structure out of the box and helping users discover relevant capabilities.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192149i5D7A67603C4AAA7F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"2.png\" alt=\"2.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Users will be able to customize the team name, description, and channel names when creating a team from a template.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"3.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192150i99E4745EAC3191EC/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"3.png\" alt=\"3.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>After the team is created, users will receive guidance on how to best use and further customize the team. Each template will come with its own getting started guidance.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"4.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192151i70BE740C1D2B6BC2/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"4.png\" alt=\"4.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Initially, we will publish 12 first-party templates spanning key business scenarios and industries so that users can hit the ground running with Teams.</P>\n<P><BR /><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Create new templates for your organization</STRONG></FONT><BR />In addition to leveraging first-party templates from Microsoft, organizations can create their own custom templates to fulfill unique business needs. This allows IT teams to take proven team structures for common scenarios and deploy them at scale across an organization. From the Microsoft Teams admin center, admins can easily create new templates from scratch, modify existing templates, and even templatize an existing team.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"5.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192152iE9CD2EF7BDC169A0/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"5.png\" alt=\"5.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>During the creation process, admins can define the channel structure, tabs and apps that make up the new template. By packaging relevent LOB apps* into templates, IT teams can effectively surface them to the right members of the organization.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"6.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192153i9D2F9C298CB9A4DF/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"6.png\" alt=\"6.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>All templates, whether first-party or admin-created, can be managed and modified from the Microsoft Teams admin center.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"7.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192154iFC13EFEE8C379C31/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"7.png\" alt=\"7.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>For end users, templates created by the user’s organization will appear at the top of the list of available templates during team creation, making them easily discoverable. In the future, we will release policy-based controls that enable admins to target templates to specific users.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"8.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/192155i8661E3DDEBC5B044/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"8.png\" alt=\"8.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Templates in Teams are important building blocks for IT teams and partners to build custom experiences for their users. We can’t wait to see what templates you’ll create.</P>\n<P><BR /><FONT size=\"2\">*Apps that are packaged into templates will still require users to possess the requisite licenses.
