target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">BRK3260: Introduction to Microsoft Teams for government with a \"ask me anything\"</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Intelligent Calls, Meetings &amp; Devices</STRONG></P>\n<P>Teams is modernizing the meeting experience.&nbsp; Learn what intelligence mean when it comes to meetings and calling, including your devices experiences.</P>\n<P><A href=\"https://myignite.techcommunity.microsoft.com/sessions?q=BRK3261&amp;s=%257B%2522name%2522%253A%2522translate.refine.label.sort.relevance%2522%252C%2522type%2522%253A0%257D&amp;t=%257B%2522from%2522%253A%25222019-11-03T08%253A30%253A00-05%253A00%2522%252C%2522to%2522%253A%25222019-11-08T19%253A00%253A00-05%253A00%2522%257D\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">BRK3261: Learn about new, innovative and intelligent devices for Microsoft Teams</A></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://myignite.techcommunity.microsoft.com/sessions?t=%257B%2522from%2522%253A%25222019-11-03T08%253A00%253A00-05%253A00%2522%252C%2522to%2522%253A%25222019-11-08T19%253A00%253A00-05%253A00%2522%257D&amp;q=BRK2373&amp;s=%257B%2522name%2522%253A%2522translate.refine.label.sort.relevance%2522%252C%2522type%2522%253A0%257D\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">BRK2373: Microsoft Teams room management</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Change Management, Adoption and Success Stories</STRONG></P>\n<P>Help your company embrace and adopt this new way of working. With examples from different industry verticals as well as tips and tricks to help you activate teamwork across your organization:&nbsp;</P>\n<P><A href=\"https://myignite.techcommunity.microsoft.com/sessions/83482?source=sessions\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">BRK2161: Top 10 Microsoft Teams adoption best practices</A></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://myignite.techcommunity.microsoft.com/sessions?q=BRK3218&amp;s=%257B%2522name%2522%253A%2522translate.refine.label.sort.relevance%2522%252C%2522type%2522%253A0%257D&amp;t=%257B%2522from%2522%253A%25222019-11-03T08%253A00%253A00-05%253A00%2522%252C%2522to%2522%253A%25222019-11-08T19%253A00%253A00-05%253A00%2522%257D\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">BRK3218: Governance and security for Microsoft Teams</A></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://myignite.techcommunity.microsoft.com/sessions?q=BRK2165&amp;s=%257B%2522name%2522%253A%2522translate.refine.label.sort.relevance%2522%252C%2522type%2522%253A0%257D&amp;t=%257B%2522from%2522%253A%25222019-11-03T08%253A00%253A00-05%253A00%2522%252C%2522to%2522%253A%25222019-11-08T19%253A00%253A00-05%253A00%2522%257D\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">BRK2165: Transform end user training using Microsoft Teams and Microsoft 365 Learning Pathways</A></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://myignite.techcommunity.microsoft.com/sessions?q=BRK2174&amp;s=%257B%2522name%2522%253A%2522translate.refine.label.sort.relevance%2522%252C%2522type%2522%253A0%257D&amp;t=%257B%2522from%2522%253A%25222019-11-03T08%253A00%253A00-05%253A00%2522%252C%2522to%2522%253A%25222019-11-08T19%253A00%253A00-05%253A00%2522%257D\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">BRK2174: Build your adoption success hub</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Upgrading from Skype for Business Online to Teams</STRONG></P>\n<P>These sessions will assist more technical roles to prepare for the transition from Skype for Business to Teams. From planning to migration, we’ve the session for you. &nbsp;Find out more about what you need to know to have a smooth transition:</P>\n<P><A href=\"https://myignite.techcommunity.microsoft.com/sessions?q=BRK3232&amp;s=%257B%2522name%2522%253A%2522translate.refine.label.sort.relevance%2522%252C%2522type%2522%253A0%257D&amp;t=%257B%2522from%2522%253A%25222019-11-03T08%253A30%253A00-05%253A00%2522%252C%2522to%2522%253A%25222019-11-08T19%253A00%253A00-05%253A00%2522%257D\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">BRK3232: Plan and implement a successful upgrade from Skype for Business to Microsoft Teams</A></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://myignite.techcommunity.microsoft.com/sessions?q=BRK3217&amp;s=%257B%2522name%2522%253A%2522translate.refine.label.sort.relevance%2522%252C%2522type%2522%253A0%257D&amp;t=%257B%2522from%2522%253A%25222019-11-03T08%253A30%253A00-05%253A00%2522%252C%2522to%2522%253A%25222019-11-08T19%253A00%253A00-05%253A00%2522%257D\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">BRK3217: Optimizing coexistence on your path to Teams</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Extending Platform and Apps </STRONG></P>\n<P>If you’re interested in understanding the available (and brand new) APIs and extensibility capabilities of the Microsoft Teams platform, make sure to attend these information-packed sessions. In each session we will share how organizations can deliver the real power of the Microsoft Teams platform, to their people:</P>\n<P><A href=\"https://myignite.techcommunity.microsoft.com/sessions?q=BRK2243&amp;s=%257B%2522name%2522%253A%2522translate.refine.label.sort.relevance%2522%252C%2522type%2522%253A0%257D&amp;t=%257B%2522from%2522%253A%25222019-11-03T08%253A00%253A00-05%253A00%2522%252C%2522to%2522%253A%25222019-11-08T19%253A00%253A00-05%253A00%2522%257D\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">BRK2243: Drive digital transformation using apps in Microsoft Teams</A></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://myignite.techcommunity.microsoft.com/sessions?q=BRK1077&amp;s=%257B%2522name%2522%253A%2522translate.refine.label.sort.relevance%2522%252C%2522type%2522%253A0%257D&amp;t=%257B%2522from%2522%253A%25222019-11-03T08%253A00%253A00-05%253A00%2522%252C%2522to%2522%253A%25222019-11-08T19%253A00%253A00-05%253A00%2522%257D\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">BRK1077: Streamline your business processes with Microsoft Teams and the Microsoft Power Platform</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In addition to all these great sessions, we encourage you to stop by the Microsoft Teams booth in the Ignite Hub where you can talk shop with our experts and get hands on with the product and our rich ecosystem of Microsoft Teams devices. We would love to hear your feedback and help you to plan, deploy, secure, and manage your Teams environment.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"ignite11.jpg\" style=\"width: 700px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/145838i052BC7C08DDF12DB/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"ignite11.jpg\" alt=\"ignite11.jpg\" /></span></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 25 Oct 2019 15:52:05 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/145837iE4569495B00F5BC6/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"4fc603debf1012246930804e35eac560","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn75@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-56-44-387_b69a3f170469c0ec.webp","destWidth":998,"destHeight":544,"sourceBytes":182077,"destBytes":25824,"author":"DiaundraJones","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/145837iE4569495B00F5BC6/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn75@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-56-44-387_b69a3f170469c0ec.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/145838i052BC7C08DDF12DB/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn55@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-57-08-561_7da0a0773607ad6a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401928},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Top 10 FAQs on Leveraging Teams for Government","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/top-10-faqs-on-leveraging-teams-for-government/ba-p/1273090","description":"<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">With COVID-19 continuing to impact people around the world, teams have been moving to remote work. We understand this challenge is different for every organization, however, we have compiled the top questions we are hearing from government organizations. Below are the questions — including the answers too, of course! </FONT></DIV>\n<OL>\n<LI><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">How do I get started with using Microsoft Teams? Do you have training available?</FONT></LI>\n<LI>What are best practices for governance, specifically around team creation, naming, and retention</LI>\n<LI>Can I collaborate with people outside my organization (i.e. external access/federation)? How is this different from guest access?</LI>\n<LI>What Microsoft Teams functionalities do I get if I am in a hybrid environment? Is Microsoft Teams available for on-prem environments?</LI>\n<LI>How does Microsoft Teams support accessibility (i.e. Section 508 requirements)?</LI>\n<LI>Is there a resource that will show the feature differences between the commercial and GCC versions of Teams?</LI>\n<LI>When will private channels be available in GCC?</LI>\n<LI>Are Microsoft Teams Live Events available in GCC? How do I set up a Live Event?</LI>\n<LI>How can I use audio conferencing in Microsoft Teams?</LI>\n<LI>Can I use Teams on a mobile device?&nbsp;</LI>\n</OL>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"2\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">*These questions/answers are primarily for GCC environments</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV id=\"start\">&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><FONT size=\"5\">How to Get Started / Set-up</FONT> <BR />1. </FONT></STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>How do I get started with using Microsoft Teams? Do you have training available?</STRONG> </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">During this time, we have a free 6-month <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/g1-trial-license\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office 365 G1 offer</A> to get your organization on Teams. Please reach out to your Microsoft account team or partner if you need help. If you already have a subscription, make sure that <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/user-access\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Teams is turned on</A> for everyone.&nbsp; </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">&nbsp;</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">We have many great tools for driving adoption within your organization. We have done a lot of the work already for you, so please make sure to check out the resources below.&nbsp; </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">&nbsp;</FONT></DIV>\n<UL>\n<LI><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">For rapid enablement, please visit our <A href=\"https://aka.ms/TeamsGovFastPath\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Teams FastPath PowerPoint</A> to get Teams implemented in your organization&nbsp; </FONT></LI>\n<LI><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Flip through our adoption guide at <A href=\"https://aka.ms/governmentadoption\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">https://aka.ms/governmentadoption</A> and our <A href=\"http://aka.ms/quickstartgov\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">government quickstart guide</A> to get your organzation started on Teams </FONT></LI>\n<LI><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/training-microsoft-teams-landing-page\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Teams Training videos</A> and Instructor-led training can be found here </FONT></LI>\n<LI><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">You can follow our <A href=\"https://aka.ms/TeamsGovRoadmap\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">government roadmap</A> here </FONT></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"adopt.JPG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/181473iE187D503C6676166/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"adopt.JPG\" alt=\"adopt.JPG\" /></span></P>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV id=\"create\">&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">2. What are best practices for governance, specifically around team creation, naming, and retention?&nbsp; </FONT></STRONG></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">To assure the best experience for end users, Teams provides IT organizations with a variety of governance controls. If you require strict controls on how teams are named and classified, whether guests can be added as team members, and who can create teams, you can configure each of these areas in the Groups management section of Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).&nbsp; </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">&nbsp;</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Team Creation:</STRONG> We don’t recommend limiting the ability to create teams, as this might negatively impact productivity. However, some organizations need to have strict control over every team that is created, or allow only a subset of users to create groups and teams. <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/create-groups/manage-creation-of-groups?view=o365-worldwide\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><U>Configure who can create teams using Azure Active Directory or PowerShell</U></A>.&nbsp; </FONT></DIV>\n</DIV>\n<DIV><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"2.png\" style=\"width: 667px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/181474iC1CC317DFBC096E4/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"2.png\" alt=\"2.png\" /></span></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">&nbsp;</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Team Naming:</STRONG> Administrators can choose to enforce a specific naming convention for Microsoft Teams using the Groups management interface in Azure AD. You can use prefix or suffix naming conventions which will allow to add or append fixed strings or supported user attributes to the team names. Blocked words can avoid (intentional or unintentional) misuse of teams. <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/create-groups/plan-for-groups-governance?view=o365-worldwide\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Configure naming policies using Azure Active Directory or PowerShell</A>. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">&nbsp;</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Team Channel Messages &amp; Chat Retention:</STRONG> Retention policies can be used to define a range of days after which all content will be deleted or a range of days during which content cannot be deleted – or both. Retention can be set independently for chat messages and channel messages. Channel and chat message policies can be applied globally or per team or user. Team files use the existing retention policies set for SharePoint Online and OneDrive for Business. <A href=\"https://aka.ms/teams-retention\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Configure Team retention in the Office 365 Compliance Center</A>. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture3.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/181421iF1768AAA43EDCC28/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Picture3.png\" alt=\"Picture3.png\" /></span></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Before putting all of the above controls in place, it is important to first determine your organization’s governance requirements.&nbsp; </FONT></DIV>\n<UL>\n<LI><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Ask yourself the right questions to <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/plan-teams-governance\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">determine your governance requirements</A> and how to meet them. </FONT></LI>\n<LI><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Use this <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/teams-adoption-governance-quick-start\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Governance quick-start checklist</A> as you are starting out with Microsoft Teams. </FONT></LI>\n</UL>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">&nbsp;</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV id=\"outside\">&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>3. Can I collaborate with people outside my organization (i.e. external access/federation)? How is this different from guest access?</STRONG> </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">With Teams External Access (federation), users from other domains can participate in your 1:1&nbsp; chats and calls. You can also allow external users who are still using Skype for Business to participate. To configure External Access, go to the Microsoft Teams Admin Center, select Org-wide settings &gt; External Access.&nbsp; </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">&nbsp;</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">External Access is different than Guest Access Microsoft Teams. Enabling Guest Access allows an Administrator to add individual users from outside of the organization to teams and channels in Microsoft Teams. With Guest Access, a guest can access resources, such as channel discussions and files, for a specific team, and chat with other users in the team they have been invited to. With External Access, only 1:1 federated chat and calling is allowed with external users. No access to other content, such as files, is granted. Tenant admins can choose between the two communication options depending on which level of collaboration is desirable with outside parties. Administrators can choose either approach or both, depending on their organizational needs, but we recommend enabling guest access for a fuller, more collaborative Teams experience. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">&nbsp;</FONT></DIV>\n<UL>\n<LI><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Here is a <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/let-your-teams-users-communicate-with-other-people\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">step-by-step guide</A> on how to turn on external access </FONT></LI>\n<LI><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Learn the <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/communicate-with-users-from-other-organizations#compare-external-and-guest-access\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">differences between external access and guest access</A>&nbsp; </FONT></LI>\n</UL>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><FONT size=\"2\">* Guest Access in Microsoft Teams is not yet available within or across GCC High &amp; DOD clouds.&nbsp;</FONT> </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><FONT size=\"2\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture4.png\" style=\"width: 692px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/181422iFFE7CF3684A040E8/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Picture4.png\" alt=\"Picture4.png\" /></span></FONT></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><FONT size=\"2\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture5.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/181423i3D7C1A94BC81CD2D/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Picture5.png\" alt=\"Picture5.png\" /></span></FONT></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV id=\"function\">&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\"><STRONG>4. </STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>What Microsoft Teams functionalities do I get if I am not fully on Office 365? Is Microsoft Teams available for on-premise or disconnected environments?</STRONG> </FONT></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">For the full Microsoft Teams experience, every user should be enabled for Exchange Online, SharePoint Online and OneDrive for Business. Today, Microsoft Teams is a cloud only service and therefore is not available to customers with an on-premise platform or with disconnected environments. If your organization is not fully onboard onto Office 365, you will be able to use Teams, however, you will not be able to experience the full feature functionality of Teams. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">&nbsp;</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">If your environment…&nbsp; </FONT></DIV>\n<UL>\n<LI><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">…does not have SharePoint Online enabled, users will not be able to use the Files tab in Teams and they will not have OneDrive for Business storage in Office 365. Without OneDrive for Business, users are unable to share files in Chats as well.&nbsp; </FONT></LI>\n<LI><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">…has the organization’s email hosted on Exchange On-Prem, users can use Microsoft Teams however they will have a disconnected experience with Calendaring. Users hosted on Exchange Hybrid or Exchange Online can use all the features of Teams.&nbsp; </FONT></LI>\n<LI><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">…has Skype for Business On-Prem, users will not be able to communicate with Teams users unless Skype for Business Hybrid is in place. <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/faq-journey\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Check out our top FAQ around upgrading from Skype for Business to Microsoft Teams</A>.&nbsp; </FONT></LI>\n</UL>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">&nbsp;</FONT></DIV>\n<UL>\n<LI><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">See what <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/exchange-teams-interact\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Teams functionalities are supported based on your exchange environment</A>&nbsp; </FONT></LI>\n<LI><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Learn how to <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/exchange-hybrid-organization\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">configure an Exchange hybrid organization to be able to use with Teams</A>&nbsp; </FONT></LI>\n</UL>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT>\n<DIV id=\"accessibility\">&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>5. How does Microsoft Teams support accessibility (i.e. Section 508 requirements)?</STRONG> </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Microsoft Teams is committed to inclusive design and accessibility for all. Please find additional resources below for how Teams can be leveraged to boost every user’s productivity across your organization.  </FONT></DIV>\n<UL>\n<LI><FONT size=\"4\"><A href=\"https://cloudblogs.microsoft.com/industry-blog/government/2018/09/11/accessibility-conformance-reports/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Teams Accessibility Conformance (VPATS) </FONT></A></FONT></LI>\n<LI><FONT size=\"4\"><A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/accessibility/enterprise-answer-desk\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Accessibility Support for US Gov </FONT></A></FONT></LI>\n</UL>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">&nbsp;</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV id=\"feature\">&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\"><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Feature Availability&nbsp; </FONT></STRONG></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>6. Is there a resource that will show the feature differences between the Worldwide (commercial) and GCC, GCC High and DOD versions of Microsoft Teams?</STRONG> </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">For the latest update on feature availability and roadmap, you can check out the Microsoft 365 roadmap page and filter for Teams and GCC, GCC high, DoD. Here is a <A href=\"https://aka.ms/teamsgovroadmap\" target=\"_self\">link</A> with preset filters for Teams in GCC, GCC High and DoD. For an overview of feature availability across licensing plans and cloud instances, click <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/servicedescriptions/teams-service-description\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>. </FONT></DIV>\n</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture6.png\" style=\"width: 560px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/181432i7468EEE94E38416C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Picture6.png\" alt=\"Picture6.png\" /></span></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV id=\"private\">&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>7. When will Private Channels become available in GCC?</STRONG> </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Private Channels will be available soon. Stay up to date with the <A href=\"https://aka.ms/M365Roadmap\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">M365 Roadmap</A> for more details as to when it will be available for US Government Clouds. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">&nbsp;</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV id=\"live\">&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>8. Are Microsoft Teams Live Events available in GCC? How do I set up a Live Event?</STRONG> </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Yes, Live Events are available in GCC. Live Events are an extension of Teams meetings that enable you to schedule and produce events that stream to large online audiences. Live events enable anyone to create live and on-demand events that deliver compelling communications to employees, constituents and partners. Go to <A href=\"https://aka.ms/liveevents\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">https://aka.ms/liveevents</A> to get started. Need more help? <A href=\"https://resources.techcommunity.microsoft.com/live-events/assistance/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Check out the Live Events Assistance program</A>.&nbsp; </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">&nbsp;</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV id=\"audio\">&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>9. How can I use audio conferencing in Microsoft Teams?</STRONG> </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Audio Conferencing in Office 365 lets users call in to meetings from their phones. <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/audio-conferencing-in-office-365\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Audio conferencing</A> is available in GCC and is an add-on for G1 and G3. Audio Conferencing is already available in G5.&nbsp; </FONT></DIV>\n<UL>\n<LI><FONT size=\"4\"><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">&nbsp;</FONT><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">For GCC High and DoD customers, audio conferencing is available via direct routing. Learn more <A href=\"http://o%09https:/docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/audio-conferencing-with-direct-routing-for-gcch-and-dod\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT></FONT></LI>\n</UL>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">&nbsp;</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV id=\"mobile\">&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>10. Can I use Teams on a mobile device?</STRONG>&nbsp; </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Teams mobile apps are available for Android and iOS for GCC, GCC High &amp; DOD users. To get the mobile apps, go to the 2 available mobile stores: Google Play and the Apple App Store. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">&nbsp;</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Note:</STRONG> Teams is not available for use on a<STRONG> mobile web browser</STRONG> such as the iOS Safari or Android OS Chrome browsers. All mobile and tablet users must use the app from the app store. Distribution of the mobile apps via MDM or side-loading is not supported by Microsoft. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">&nbsp;</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\"><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/get-clients\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Download the mobile app here </FONT></A></FONT></DIV>\n</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT size=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"mobile.jpg\" ":1598313401924},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"A Refreshing New Look for Teams Phones!","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/a-refreshing-new-look-for-teams-phones/ba-p/1351532","description":"<P>We are excited to announce a new and improved user interface on Microsoft Teams phones. These experiences are now available to all users as a firmware update through the Teams Admin Center today. The new look will help users navigate quickly between features and gain access to favorites, manage a variety of user settings from the Teams phones and enable auto dialing.</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">User Interface updates</FONT></STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Always available dial pad</STRONG><BR />With an always available dial pad for devices in landscape mode, customers can make calls even faster. We have also made it easier to access favorite contacts with touch-friendly icons. In the portrait layout, customers can toggle seamlessly between favorites and recent calls view.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"landscape.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/188073i7ECAD84E6882B3E7/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"landscape.png\" alt=\"Landscape mode\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Landscape mode</span></span></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"portrait2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/188074i16B6ED01719AF740/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"portrait2.png\" alt=\"Portrait mode\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Portrait mode</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Add and remove favorites</STRONG><BR />By default, all favorite contacts from the Teams desktop client and the Skype for Business client are marked as favorite contacts on Teams phones. Users can also add and remove favorites right from the phone by toggling the favorite icon (star) on the recent calls list or by accessing the more options menu on the contact card.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"1.1.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/188075i5A21800A91F4BC10/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"1.1.png\" alt=\"1.1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Group call pickup</STRONG><BR />With call sharing and group call pickup, users can share incoming calls with colleagues who can answer the calls while the user is unavailable. Group call pickup is less disruptive to recipients than other forms of call sharing (such as call forwarding or simultaneous ringing) because users can configure how they want to be notified of an incoming shared call (via audio and visual notification or visual only) and decide whether or not to answer it.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"2.2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/188204i91ED4600ABCC9821/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"2.2.png\" alt=\"2.2.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">New phones settings</FONT></STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Delegate management</STRONG><BR />Choose someone in Teams to be your delegate so they can receive and make calls on your behalf. When you add a delegate, you can customize what controls they have. This new feature is available via the settings menu on your phone.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"3.1.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/188078i18312247D38F7CCB/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"3.1.png\" alt=\"3.1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Ringtone customization</STRONG><BR />One of the more frequently asked features is ringtone customizations. Enabled users can choose custom ringtones from an available list of ringtone options and set different ringtones for incoming calls, forwarded calls, and delegated calls.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"4.4.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/188080i6D2D027844C723A5/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"4.4.png\" alt=\"4.4.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Autodial for extension dialing</STRONG><BR />Tenant admins can add dial plans for their organization with normalization rules to enable extension dialing in Teams. With this new feature release, Teams phones will auto dial in 3 seconds after an approved extension is dialed by the user.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>To take advantage of all these new features and more, check out our wide range of Teams Phones from industry leading partners including Audiocodes, Crestron, Lenovo, Poly and Yealink. If you already have a phone and do not see updates for your phone models, check with phone your manufacturer for firmware release schedules.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 01 May 2020 15:29:46 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Use Microsoft Teams Rooms as an Interactive Whiteboard Device","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/use-microsoft-teams-rooms-as-an-interactive-whiteboard-device/ba-p/1291716","description":"<P>Microsoft Teams Rooms helps to transform meeting spaces ranging from small huddle areas to large conference rooms with a rich, collaborative Teams experience that's simple to use, deploy, and manage.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The Microsoft Whiteboard is part of the native set of rich collaboration tools found within Microsoft Teams. When Microsoft Teams Rooms is part of a meeting, it can display the Microsoft Whiteboard for all attendees in the meeting room to see. But did you know the attendees can walk up to the screen and draw right on it? All you need is a touch-enabled display device.</P>\n<P align=\"center\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P align=\"center\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"whiteboard.gif\" style=\"width: 640px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/182939i289E29F421714FAF/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"whiteboard.gif\" alt=\"whiteboard.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P align=\"left\">Microsoft Teams Rooms natively supports the web version of the Microsoft Whiteboard. This version of Whiteboard allows you to interact with remote attendees of Microsoft Teams meetings and do real-time diagramming or sketching.</P>\n<P align=\"left\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P align=\"left\">To enable the interactive Whiteboard on a Microsoft Teams Rooms device, you need to meet the following requirements:</P>\n<P align=\"left\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P align=\"left\">1.) A Touch enabled display device. Microsoft does not certify touch-enabled monitors or TV’s for Microsoft Teams Rooms. However, any touch-enabled display device that is certified for Microsoft Windows will work with Microsoft Teams Rooms. The USB cable out of the monitor or TV connects to the compute unit of Microsoft Teams Rooms.</P>\n<P align=\"left\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P align=\"left\">2.) Make sure that Windows recognizes that the display device is touch enabled. On Microsoft Teams Rooms, this will require <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/rooms/rooms-operations#admin-mode-and-device-management\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">signing in to the device as a local administrator</A>.&nbsp; Once signed in as a local administrator, search for “Calibrate the screen for pen or touch input”. This will bring up the Table PC setting screen. If everything is set up correctly, you will see that your display device is properly recognized as a touch display.&nbsp; In the image below, the selected display has “Full Windows Touch Support”.</P>\n<P align=\"left\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Tablet PC Settings.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/183064i377D1F8F689F43E2/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Tablet PC Settings.png\" alt=\"Tablet PC Settings.png\" /></span></P>\n<P> </P>\n<P align=\"left\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P align=\"left\">Touch-enabled display devices will still work even if they have limited or single touch support. You can read more about the difference <A href=\"https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20141125-00/?p=43543\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P align=\"left\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P align=\"left\">If your display does not show up as touch-enabled, you may need to install display drivers from the monitor or TV manufacturer. You also may need to configure the device first for pen and touch support by clicking on the <STRONG>Setup… </STRONG> button on the Tablet PC Settings screen. Also, verify that the USB cable from the display device is properly connected to Microsoft Teams Rooms.</P>\n<P align=\"left\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P align=\"left\">3.) Make sure your Office 365 tenant has Whiteboard enabled. To check this, sign in to the <A href=\"https://admin.microsoft.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft 365 Admin Center</A>. Within the admin center, navigate to <STRONG>Settings</STRONG> and then to the <STRONG>Settings</STRONG> sub-menu. From here, scroll down until you get to Whiteboard. Click on Whiteboard and verify that <STRONG>Turn on Whiteboard for everyone in your org</STRONG> is enabled.</P>\n<P align=\"left\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Turn_On_Whiteboard.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/183065iCC2486A63CE295AF/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Turn_On_Whiteboard.png\" alt=\"Turn_On_Whiteboard.png\" /></span></P>\n<P> </P>\n<P align=\"left\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P align=\"left\">See <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/enable-microsoft-whiteboard-for-your-organization-1caaa2e2-5c18-4bdf-b878-2d98f1da4b24?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">this article</A> for more information on enabling Whiteboard.</P>\n<P align=\"left\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P align=\"left\">4.) Your Microsoft Teams Rooms device needs to be on at least version 4.0.105.0 which was released in July 2019. If you are following best practices by allowing the Microsoft Teams Rooms devices to automatically update themselves, you should be on a much more recent version of the Microsoft Teams Rooms app .</P>\n<P align=\"left\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P align=\"left\">Finally, this feature is only available when joining a Microsoft Teams meeting. There is no support for touch enabling the whiteboard when the Microsoft Teams Rooms device is in a Skype for Business or a Skype for Business Online meeting.</P>\n<P align=\"left\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P align=\"left\">By adding a touch screen to Microsoft Teams Rooms, you can easily unlock creativity and collaboration throughout your organization.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 08 Apr 2020 14:10:15 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/182939i289E29F421714FAF/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"22c6868e314acf505a1d20cc609c58fb","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn36@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-56-51-298_8e68d7b26f64e622.webp","destWidth":640,"destHeight":360,"sourceBytes":7286057,"destBytes":10043698,"author":"Michael Tressler","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/182939i289E29F421714FAF/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn36@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-56-51-298_8e68d7b26f64e622.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/183064i377D1F8F689F43E2/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn56@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-57-05-014_17d3e780b9e45ae8.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/183065iCC2486A63CE295AF/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn4@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-10-335_197ea5977179420e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401922},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Five tips for planning a successful upgrade to Teams","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/five-tips-for-planning-a-successful-upgrade-to-teams/ba-p/1445844","description":"<P>Over the past two years we’ve helped thousands of organizations transition from Skype for Business to Microsoft Teams and realize new possibilities for workplace communication and collaboration. We’ve used this experience to build upon our <A href=\"https://aka.ms/teamslivetraining\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">free Teams training</A>, and <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/upgrade-workshops-landing-page\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">planning workshops</A> for enabling successful Teams upgrades.</P>\n<P><BR />In addition to our upgrade guidance around <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/upgrade-start-here\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">technical and organizational readiness</A>, we want to share <A href=\"https://customers.microsoft.com/en-us/search?sq=%22Microsoft%20Teams%22%20%22skype%20for%20business%22&amp;ff=&amp;p=2&amp;so=story_publish_date%20desc\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">stories of customers</A> who have made the journey to Teams Only. Here are some of their recommendations for driving Teams adoption, successfully managing change, and sticking to your plan.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"tip-focus-on-teams-adoption.jpg\" style=\"width: 990px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/197048iA512190481A8D300/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"tip-focus-on-teams-adoption.jpg\" alt=\"tip-focus-on-teams-adoption.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>At <A href=\"https://www.dentsuaegisnetwork.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Dentsu Aegis Network</A>, the vastness of our user landscape relative to capability and geography required us to focus initial energy on driving Teams adoption and usage. Working closely with a Microsoft partner, we built a targeted campaign consisting of drumbeat and t-minus countdown communications, videos, posters, and user guides. We also harnessed the power of Teams to hold remote training and drop-in sessions for more tailored run-throughs. This 'change toolkit' was shared with local IT teams to facilitate their respective moves to Teams Only and received positive feedback across the board.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"tip-identify-low-hanging-fruit.jpg\" style=\"width: 990px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/197049i92F4C8BA0AB1B2D9/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"tip-identify-low-hanging-fruit.jpg\" alt=\"tip-identify-low-hanging-fruit.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>It would have been easy to be overwhelmed by the scale of the task of upgrading an organization like Dentsu Aegis Network, with our global footprint of over 45,000 users across multiple regions and markets. So we answered the question of, “Where do we begin?” by focusing on the low hanging fruit. We spent time building our understanding of our user base, identifying opportunities where engagement was high and technical complexity was low. By getting these groups over the line first, we were able to prove to the more reluctant teams that this could be done with ease. Engagement levels improved the more we delivered, and the programme team was equally buoyed by all the progress being made.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"tip-design-a-change-management-program.jpg\" style=\"width: 990px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/199237i9B27876B611CFA4F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"tip-design-a-change-management-program.jpg\" alt=\"tip-design-a-change-management-program.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>As a leading retailer in Portugal, <A href=\"https://sonaemc.com/en\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Sonae MC</A> has a diverse workforce, each team with unique needs for communications and collaboration tools. From the start, our strategy has been to get Teams in the hands of different types of users in order to approach training and awareness with a broader vision. We used focus groups and continuous feedback – technical and functional – to design a change management program easily understood by teams from Finance to Logistics to Store Management. Measuring the success of the change management program, such as teams created, mobile app usage, meetings online versus offline, and quality of service has been crucial to understand the effectiveness and impact of our efforts to drive Teams adoption and usage.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"tip-believe-in-your-end-goal.jpg\" style=\"width: 990px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/199238iD2A9AA4371D7621C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"tip-believe-in-your-end-goal.jpg\" alt=\"tip-believe-in-your-end-goal.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://www.solera.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Solera</A> has a global workforce, each with unique needs for communications and collaboration tools. For us, Teams provided a surface for not only basic collaboration via chat and phone, but also provided a user-friendly interface into SharePoint. With this in mind, and the fact that our Skype for Business implementation had challenges over the years, we decided to go all-in on Teams.</P>\n<P><BR />From an IT perspective, the killer feature was being able to ‘shutter’ Skype after go-live, but keep it running in a limited mode for any legacy meetings. In the background, we’d silently pushed Teams via SCCM &amp; InTune. This meant that on go-live, any disruption was minimized, and everyone knew what was going on. Although we’d set-up a hotline and various support channels, the issues were minimal, easily making this the most successful overnight platform migration we’ve ever done. Fast forward to today’s challenges, and Teams has been completely instrumental in allowing people to work from home, while staying productive and connected.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"tip-pull-out-all-stops-for-awareness.jpg\" style=\"width: 990px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/199239i53B44C05A1C394F9/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"tip-pull-out-all-stops-for-awareness.jpg\" alt=\"tip-pull-out-all-stops-for-awareness.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>Getting the attention of the user community has always been a challenge, and Solera’s upgrade to Teams was no different. This time around, our Messaging and Collaboration Team decided to just make a nuisance of ourselves, and really go overboard with communicating the change, nearly all via email. We had a few posters put up, and of course some t-shirts, but our entire objective was for nobody to be surprised when we did the big bang migration from Skype for Business to Teams.</P>\n<P><BR />We planned the email campaign and started sending to the entire company one month prior to go-live. In the first week it was just a teaser email, the second week had a couple more teasers and download links, and basic getting-started tips. Weeks three and four featured daily emails, with a countdown, download link and a mix of content featuring tips and new features (a big play on GIFs!). When people started complaining of getting too many emails, we knew we were on the right path.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"upgrade-planning-workshops.jpg\" style=\"width: 990px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/199240iEFBD2300B7E752DF/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"upgrade-planning-workshops.jpg\" alt=\"upgrade-planning-workshops.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>Need additional guidance planning your upgrade to Teams? Sign up for our free, interactive <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/upgrade-workshops-landing-page\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Upgrade Planning Workshops</A> where we'll share guidance, best practices and resources designed to help you plan and implement your upgrade to Teams.</P>\n<P><BR />We’re enthusiastic about the growth of Teams and are heartened that our upgrade guidance and resources have helped so many Skype for Business transition to Teams Only. We appreciate all the feedback we receive as it helps us create better processes and products. And a big thank you to Dentsu Aegis Network, Sonae MC, and Solera for sharing their experiences and recommendations with others. See you on Teams!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 17 Jun 2020 15:00:36 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/197048iA512190481A8D300/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"2fc35479b6d63c4a05fe1a0a6266b7b0","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn16@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-56-42-345_ae9a032a1c1ea72e.webp","destWidth":990,"destHeight":98,"sourceBytes":10287,"destBytes":12186,"author":"MicrosoftTeamsTeam","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/197048iA512190481A8D300/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn16@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-56-42-345_ae9a032a1c1ea72e.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/197049i92F4C8BA0AB1B2D9/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn27@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-58-08-639_7948ec17dbd818ca.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/199237i9B27876B611CFA4F/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn24@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-57-08-256_ddd921027453f374.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/199238iD2A9AA4371D7621C/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn43@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-57-10-648_6fbd378f8fdca272.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/199239i53B44C05A1C394F9/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn43@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-57-07-208_8f2565ea74c071a7.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/199240iEFBD2300B7E752DF/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn100@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-57-58-617_e43223d99705d1ee.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401920},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Create and award digital publicly verifiable badges in Teams","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/create-and-award-digital-publicly-verifiable-badges-in-teams/ba-p/1307507","description":"<P>The ability to be recognized for our achievements is universal, whether they are big or small. If you've ever played a smartphone game or consider yourself a fitness enthusiast, you may have experienced the opportunity to earn badges that symbolize your achievements and growing skills. For example, those who walk 10,000 steps are celebrated with the \"sneakers\" digital badge from their Fitbit, while those who achieve a step count of 100,000 or more are adorned a much more rare, \"Olympian Sandals\" badge.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>As <A href=\"https://www.cnet.com/news/microsofts-teams-hits-44m-daily-users-as-usage-jumps-from-coronavirus/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">more organizations adopt Microsoft Teams</A> this year, the need arises to recognize students, employees, and frontline workers for their growing portfolio of demonstrated competence and professional accomplishments.</P>\n<P>Today, we're happy to share with you a new way to recognize and award open, publicly verifiable digital badges within the Teams interface – an <U><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/samples/app-templates#open-badges-app\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Open Badges app template</A></U>! As with all <A href=\"https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/AppTemplatesPM-Dev-Design/Shared%20Documents/Open%20Badge%20Generator/aka.ms/teamsapptemplates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">app templates</A>, these are open-sourced Teams apps that are production-ready and can be deployed quickly as your organization's internal line-of-business apps.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Using the Open Badges app template in Microsoft Teams, users can create and award badges to team members conveniently within the Teams' context. Once awarded, recipients and other team members are notified about the awarded badge, and award details can be viewed by simply tagging the badge recipient within the channel conversation.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"OpenBadges1.jpeg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184386iC2101B400A8B8DE5/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"OpenBadges1.jpeg\" alt=\"OpenBadges1.jpeg\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Additionally, all team members have the option to select badges from a complete list and award recognition to one another; team owners have the unique ability to create new badges.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Open_Badges_02.jpeg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184388iFBD0C2593B46B99F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Open_Badges_02.jpeg\" alt=\"Open_Badges_02.jpeg\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The Open Badges app template has been built on top of <A href=\"https://info.badgr.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Badgr's robust achievement platform</A>, which currently supports over 20,000 organizations around the world and their valuable communities of practice. Therefore, every badge awarded through the Open Badges App is more than a digital sticker; badges awarded through this exciting app are open, publicly-verifiable, and portable.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>For example, in K-12 education – teachers may extrinsically motivate their students to excel by issuing badges within their communities in Teams for standard protocols such as classroom participation, attendance, or academic performance.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In higher education, students may showcase these digital badges as verifiable credentials to their prospective employers. Similarly, faculty or members of school administration may compile these awards into a more actionable, skill-aligned portfolio for future employers, thereby leveraging the inherent portability of digital badges and their unique ability to illustrate a granular and personalized learning journey.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In corporate settings, the opportunity for private companies to recognize and capture micro-achievements (commonly referred to as the \"skills gap\") can be addressed through the use of digital badges. For example, an employee who went over and beyond to deliver a superior customer experience can be spotted and celebrated. Or, a team member who helped their colleagues achieve more can be rewarded, sending necessary cultural signals throughout your organization.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This app template was an effort of collaboration between the Microsoft Teams Platform and the team at Badgr.&nbsp;<SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">Wayne Skipper, Founder/CEO of Concentric Sky, the makers of Badgr, remarked about this successful collaboration:</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"wayne.PNG\" style=\"width: 198px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184389i3ADD4FD0E05B987D/image-size/small?v=1.0&amp;px=200\" title=\"wayne.PNG\" alt=\"wayne.PNG\" /></span></P>\n<P>\"We really enjoyed working with Microsoft to enable organizations to embed Badgr into Microsoft Teams. Teams is the perfect canvas for collaboration and engagement, and we're excited to help connect it to the rapidly growing ecosystem of open badges and digital credentials.\"&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Give this app template a try <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/samples/app-templates#open-badges-app\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A> or check out the full catalog of app templates <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/samples/app-templates#key-benefits\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>We would love to hear your feedback!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Also read:</P>\n<P><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/icebreaker-bot-assisted-happenstance-to-strengthen-your-company/ba-p/722552\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Assisted happenstance to strengthen your team culture</A></P>\n<H1 class=\"message-subject\"><SPAN class=\"lia-message-read\">&nbsp;</SPAN></H1>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 15 Apr 2020 15:20:53 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184386iC2101B400A8B8DE5/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"cfbc937d8f0c2bec7c76129ab54cca5b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn91@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-56-42-896_4cb5f5d7544edfe0.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":562,"sourceBytes":34067,"destBytes":20766,"author":"NidhiShandilya","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184386iC2101B400A8B8DE5/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn91@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-56-42-896_4cb5f5d7544edfe0.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184388iFBD0C2593B46B99F/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn39@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-57-15-497_bd23d6d344571543.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/184389i3ADD4FD0E05B987D/image-size/small?v=1.0&px=200":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn83@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-04-899_af83d2b061dac384.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401922},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Mapping External Users’ Locations with CQD Data and PowerBI","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/mapping-external-users-locations-with-cqd-data-and-powerbi/ba-p/1277627","description":"<P>With the global crisis of COVID-19 and the impact on the global workforce, the ability to see utilization metrics from an external standpoint (for example: a user working from home) has become increasingly important for Teams IT Admins.</P>\n<P>To see network information broken down between internal/external networks and to take full advantage of the Advanced Call Quality Dashboard (CQD) data, Microsoft highly recommends that a <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/turning-on-and-using-call-quality-dashboard#building-data-file\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Building Data File</A> be created and uploaded. Out of the many reasons for uploading the data file, one key piece of information relied upon is this delineation between internal networks (deployed and managed by organization IT admin) and external networks (managed by end-users or a private entity, such as: coffee shops).&nbsp; Knowing the call volume, call quality &amp; reliability on the organization network (wired or WiFi) is important, as this is within the organizations sphere of control. Uploading a building data will expedite the organization IT admin in locating where problems occur in a specific region/site/location/building/floors of interest during call quality and reliability troubleshooting. External networks are managed by home users or private entity (such as a coffee shop owner). There is little action to occur on this front, other than providing recommended connectivity practices to the end users.</P>\n<P>In keeping with the spirit of “Empowering every person and organization on the planet to achieve more” Microsoft has undertaken an effort to help those organizations currently lacking a building data file. By leveraging a third-party ISP/IP location database in conjunction with the reflexive IP address associated with a user, an approximate location can be determined to differentiate internal and external connectivity. Do keep in mind that the published/downloadable <A href=\"https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/OfficeDocs-SkypeForBusiness/blob/live/Teams/downloads/CQD-Power-BI-query-templates.zip?raw=true\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Call Quality Power BI connector and associated Power BI templates</A> work best when building data is provided.</P>\n<P><SPAN>To visualize the locations of</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">home users in CQD</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">&nbsp;Power BI</SPAN><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">, follow the steps below. This guidance will help identify the locations and ISP providers via 3</SPAN><SPAN><SUP>rd</SUP></SPAN><SPAN>&nbsp;party Geo IP databases.&nbsp; <STRONG>This example is provided for instructional purposes.&nbsp;&nbsp;</STRONG>It is up to you to follow any laws or regulations that might apply to&nbsp;mapping locations of your users based on their IP addresses.</SPAN><SPAN><STRONG>&nbsp;</STRONG></SPAN></P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"wfh17.jpg\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/183163i9EA2AEDD124CB958/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"wfh17.jpg\" alt=\"wfh17.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\" color=\"#993366\"><STRONG>Download IP addresses from an IP address database</STRONG><SPAN data-contrast=\"none\"><STRONG>.</STRONG>&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN data-ccp-props=\"{&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559738&quot;:40,&quot;335559739&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:259}\" data-wac-het=\"1\">&nbsp;</SPAN></FONT></P>\n<P><SPAN data-contrast=\"auto\">If your organization already has a subscription to an IP Geolocation Database, this may be used if it has the required information in it. </SPAN></P>\n<P>If not, search for an IP Geolocation Database and download it. This may require signing up for an account with the third-party providing the database.</P>\n<P>One such provider is <A href=\"https://lite.ip2location.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">https://lite.ip2location.com</A><SPAN>. </SPAN><SPAN>But you could download similar data from any other database for other reasons.&nbsp; <STRONG>Note that the accuracy of your results will depend on the precision of the IP-to-location data set.</STRONG></SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN>&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN>After extracting the contents from the ZIP file, open the CSV file to see contents like the screenshot below.</SPAN></P>\n<P><SPAN><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"wfh01.jpg\" style=\"width: 975px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/181799i4AE9BF6CE5A8438D/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"wfh01.jpg\" alt=\"wfh01.jpg\" /></span></SPAN></P>\n<P><EM>Note: Query times may be optimized by filtering out extraneous data from the CSV. For example, if your organization only operates out of the United States, all other countries can be excluded.</EM></P>\n<H2><FONT size=\"5\" color=\"#993366\">IP Database Preparation</FONT></H2>\n<P>Columns A and B in the above example are the IP ranges (start and end) represented in a decimal format. These do not look like traditional IP addresses and will need to be converted to a more recognizable format.</P>\n<P>The formula to use in this instance is as follows:</P>\n<P><FONT color=\"#808080\"><EM>= CONCATENATE(INT(A1/(256*256*256)),\".\",INT(A1/(256*256))-INT(A1/(256*256*256))*256,\".\",INT(A1/(256))-INT(A1/(256*256))*256,\".0/24\")</EM></FONT></P>\n<OL>\n<LI>Copy formula from the equal sign to the end of the line.<BR />= CONCATENATE(INT(A1/(256*256*256)),\".\",INT(A1/(256*256))-INT(A1/(256*256*256))*256,\".\",INT(A1/(256))-INT(A1/(256*256))*256,\".0/24\")</LI>\n<LI>Paste the copied formula into cell G1.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"wfh02.jpg\" style=\"width: 975px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/181804i6899346D22FA890E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"wfh02.jpg\" alt=\"wfh02.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<OL start=\"3\">\n<LI>Select column G, click the “Fill” button and select “Down.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"wfh03.jpg\" style=\"width: 200px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/181831iD23D065F084A23A0/image-size/small?v=1.0&amp;px=200\" title=\"wfh03.jpg\" alt=\"wfh03.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<OL start=\"4\">\n<LI>It will then convert the values from column A to IP address ranges. A small sample is shown below.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"wfh04.jpg\" style=\"width: 200px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/181802i7A093B3754384086/image-size/small?v=1.0&amp;px=200\" title=\"wfh04.jpg\" alt=\"wfh04.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\">Save the file (IPLOCATION.CSV) to keep maintain the converted IP ranges. These columns are the foundation that will provide the best effort relative location without building data being uploaded. At this time, everything is simplified with a 24 bit mask. We will continue to improve and expand the ranges out.</SPAN></P>\n<P>The next step is to associate the IP database with the Power BI Teams Utilization Report.</P>\n<H2><FONT color=\"#993366\">Import IP Data In PowerBI</FONT></H2>\n<P>Open the Teams Utilization Power BI report.</P>\n<OL>\n<LI>Click on the “Get Data” option from the Home ribbon and select Excel.<BR /><BR /></LI>\n<LI><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"wfh05.jpg\" style=\"width: 200px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/181814iB1963FACDCB61E64/image-size/small?v=1.0&amp;px=200\" title=\"wfh05.jpg\" alt=\"wfh05.jpg\" /></span></LI>\n<LI>Browse to the directory of the IPLocations.csv file. Verify “All Files” is selected, then click Open.<BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"wfh06.jpg\" style=\"width: 200px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/181815iD1490CF51F011152/image-size/small?v=1.0&amp;px=200\" title=\"wfh06.jpg\" alt=\"wfh06.jpg\" /></span></LI>\n</OL>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\">When importing the data, the option to “Transform Data” is presented. Select this option.<BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"wfh07.jpg\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/183164i360495F0E8D41570/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"wfh07.jpg\" alt=\"wfh07.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<OL start=\"3\">\n<LI>Columns can be removed or renamed as needed. Columns 3 through 8 will be renamed in this example. &nbsp;<BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"wfh08.jpg\" style=\"width: 200px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/181817i068805E5B2E27366/image-size/small?v=1.0&amp;px=200\" title=\"wfh08.jpg\" alt=\"wfh08.jpg\" /></span><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"wfh09.jpg\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/181818iE3D58973946B260E/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"wfh09.jpg\" alt=\"wfh09.jpg\" /></span></LI>\n<LI>Click “Close &amp; Apply” on the far left of the Home ribbon.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"wfh10.jpg\" style=\"width: 200px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/181819iD67D41FF5EB7D09A/image-size/small?v=1.0&amp;px=200\" title=\"wfh10.jpg\" alt=\"wfh10.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>Accept the security warning prompt when it’s presented.</P>\n<P>The IP location data can now be found under the data model in the Teams Utilization Power BI.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"wfh12.jpg\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/181820iCEA7B0C1600A5798/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"wfh12.jpg\" alt=\"wfh12.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<H2><FONT color=\"#993366\">Joining Datasets in PowerBI</FONT></H2>\n<P>The final step in this walkthrough is to join the Direct Query and imported IPLocation datasets. In the modeling tab, select “Manage Relationships” found in the middle of the Home ribbon.</P>\n<OL>\n<LI>Create a new many to one relationship between the CQD Data Source and your newly created IP table using the Second Reflexive Local IP in the Direct Query Table and the ReflexiveEnd column from IPLocations.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"wfh13.jpg\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/181823i7FC4125569A2C4F2/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"wfh13.jpg\" alt=\"wfh13.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<OL>\n<LI>Select “New”.</LI>\n<LI>Select the columns that will have the relationship created, and make it “Many to One(*:1)”.<BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"wfh15.jpg\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/181824iF484D8C273104320/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"wfh15.jpg\" alt=\"wfh15.jpg\" /></span></LI>\n<LI>Click Ok when complete.</LI>\n<LI>Close the relationship management window.&nbsp;<BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"wfh16.jpg\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/181832iE591DEE8931C246B/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"wfh16.jpg\" alt=\"wfh16.jpg\" /></span>\n<P>The datasets are now joined and should be ready for use in Power BI visualizations.</P>\n</LI>\n</OL>\n<H2><FONT color=\"#993366\"><SPAN>Create Visualizations</SPAN></FONT></H2>\n<P>If the column names remain the same, the last tab of the Teams Utilization Power BI can be used as shown below.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>If the column names changed during the database prep and import process, then the values will need to be changed for the visuals and slicers on the tab. If preferred, net new visualizations may be created as well.</P>\n<P>By default, all information for all networks is displayed. Apply a page filter on second subnet for common home networks to visualize users at home.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-30px\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"wfh17.jpg\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img Statement</STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Excessive meetings and never-ending email threads take up a lot of time delaying arriving at a decision.</LI>\n<LI>Transparency into the decision-making process is lacking within companies.</LI>\n<LI>It can be challenging to maintain inclusivity and hear your team’s voice in the decision-making process.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><A href=\"https://www.ment.io/teams/\" target=\"_self\">Ment.io</A> on top of Microsoft Teams helps your team make faster and better decisions together by capturing real voices, letting your team see which opinions influenced the decision and enabling your team to not only share their opinions and knowledge, but also see what others on the team think. With Ment.io’s Machine Learning and AI-powered scoring mechanism, you can focus on the most supported opinion without reading through long email threads or sitting through endless meetings.<BR /><BR /></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"main.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171222i12748578E552C60B/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"main.jpg\" alt=\"main.jpg\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>App Capabilities</STRONG></P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Tabs</LI>\n<LI>Bots</LI>\n<LI>Messaging Extension</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Get to the gist of the discussion quickly with Tabs</STRONG></P>\n<P>Add the Ment.io tab to your team channel or group chat to see the bottom line in a larger discussion and top answers based on a team’s opinions and knowledge. Also, explore other features of Ment.io in a single consolidated view with reduced context switching.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI>Ask your team questions on Ment.io and open it up for their answers and comments to centralize the discussion within the tab.</LI>\n<LI>With discussion analytics and AI-powered scoring mechanism, access how you’ve been influencing discussions and track each team member’s personal growth.</LI>\n<LI>View highlights, team activities and participants active in the discussion.</LI>\n<LI>Attach files to the discussion and find similar discussions you’ve had in the past to learn from previous decisions.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"picture1.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171221iA52A690C6BF8AF06/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"picture1.jpg\" alt=\"Centralize the discussion in Channel Tab\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Centralize the discussion in Channel Tab</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Turn team opinions into decisions with Bots</STRONG></P>\n<P>Get instant notifications on discussions initiated and responses received in a channel to stay on top of important topics. With bot commands (@ment.io), search and start a new discussion without leaving Teams.<BR /><BR /></P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"picture_2a.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171219i7BEDC902BE2952E3/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"picture_2a.jpg\" alt=\"Start a new discussion with Bot commands\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Start a new discussion with Bot commands</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"pitcture_2b.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/171220i9F9CF673AEAA87B7/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"pitcture_2b.jpg\" alt=\"Get notified in a channel\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Get notified in a channel</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Share discussions for reference with your team using Messaging Extension</STRONG></P>\n<P>Find discussions based on keywords and share it in a channel to bring visibility and keep your team informed.
