07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"What’s new on Microsoft Teams phones | Ignite 2019","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/what-s-new-on-microsoft-teams-phones-ignite-2019/ba-p/1015503","description":"<P><LI-VIDEO size=\"large\" height=\"338\" width=\"600\" vid=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ms96BwVhH7g&amp;feature=youtu.be\" align=\"center\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/Ms96BwVhH7g/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Teams phones were first announced just over two years ago, and we are pleased to see the acceleration within this category. With several phones now available from our hardware partners, customers have a wide selection to choose from. We continue to work with our phone hardware partners to help customers transition to native Teams phones by having dedicated partner-led programs. Customers can contact their partner account team to learn more about the various trade-in and buy-back offers available.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Following the recent announcement highlighting the end of support for <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-Teams-Blog/Skype-for-Business-phones-3PIP-support-with-Microsoft-Teams/ba-p/789351\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Skype for Business phones</A>, customers are able to begin their device refresh to Teams phones. With a complete range of devices built for common areas and personal office spaces, customers will be able to fit any space with the right phone.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The momentum in Teams phones availability solidifies our hardware partners’ commitment to Teams and Microsoft calling services. To learn more about the phones and other devices certified for Teams, visit <A href=\"https://products.office.com/en-us/microsoft-teams/across-devices?ms.url=officecomteamsdevices&amp;rtc=1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">office.com/teamsdevices</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_0.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/157720iCC9675F5259CCB31/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_0.png\" alt=\"clipboard_image_0.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In addition, we continue to work with our partners to deliver a robust set of capabilities to enhance the experience on Microsoft Teams phones.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><U>Capabilities available this year:</U></STRONG></P>\n<OL>\n<LI><STRONG><EM>User-based account experiences</EM></STRONG> provide customized user interfaces on the phones depending on the type of account setup.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG><EM>Hot desking</EM></STRONG> allows for any user in your organization to temporarily sign into any phone enabled with this feature for convenient use of phones for their calls and meetings in hoteling scenarios.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG><EM>911 Enhancements</EM></STRONG> allow for users to dial 911 without requiring the user to unlock the phone.</LI>\n<LI><STRONG><EM>Dynamic 911 (Dynamic Emergency Calling) </EM></STRONG>allows the phone to report the user’s location to dispatch services.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P><STRONG><U>Capabilities coming in early 2020:</U></STRONG></P>\n<OL>\n<LI><STRONG><EM>Speed dial and Boss-Admin support </EM></STRONG>will allow users to designate favorite contacts on the phone to quickly dial them. Boss-Admin support will allow for delegates to answer and/or handle calls on behalf of their boss.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><EM><U>Let’s take a closer looking into each capability </U></EM></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>User-based account experiences</STRONG>: The user interface on the phone is customized based on the type of user account used to sign into the phone. User accounts provide all calling, meeting and voicemail experiences to individual users. For meeting room accounts, these can be set based on IP phone policies assigned to the user account.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><EM>PowerShell command details for user-based account settings: </EM></STRONG></P>\n<P><EM>To View all policy settings, run the following command: </EM></P>\n<P>Get-CsTeamsIPPhonePolicy</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_1.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/157722i9A7D518F0505AC7B/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_1.png\" alt=\"clipboard_image_1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><EM>To update IP Phone policy settings and assign “Sign-in Mode” for user accounts: </EM></P>\n<P>Set-CsTeamsIPPhonePolicy -Identity “Global” -SignInMode “UserSignIn or MeetingSignIn or CommonAreaPhoneSignIn”</P>\n<P>We can assign SignInMode as (Usersignin, meetingsignin,commonareaphonesignin) based on requirements. An example below.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/157723i299546820AC27E29/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_2.png\" alt=\"clipboard_image_2.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><EM>To grant the policy to a user:</EM></P>\n<P>Grant-CsTeamsIPPhonePolicy -Identity “UserName” -PolicyName “CommonAreaPhonePolicy”</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_3.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/157724iADEF9611739E2D22/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_3.png\" alt=\"clipboard_image_3.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Hot Desking</STRONG>: Users will be able to sign into a phone which has been set up as a shared device. Once users sign in, they can begin hot desking and have full access to their calendar, meetings and call log. When finished, users can sign out to end their hot desking session. This will automatically remove any call logs and history from the device.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_4.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/157725i9325370BFDED85F6/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_4.png\" alt=\"clipboard_image_4.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>911</STRONG> <STRONG>Enhancements</STRONG>: When the Microsoft Teams phone is signed in with a valid Teams license (user, Meeting room, or common area phone (CAP)), 911 will be supported. On the lock screen, we will be modifying our current 911 experience to ensure a user can dial 911 on the dial pad <STRONG>without </STRONG>requiring a user to choose the “Emergency Call” Option on the user interface.</P>\n<DIV id=\"tinyMceEditorclipboard_image_0\" class=\"mceNonEditable lia-copypaste-placeholder\">&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV id=\"tinyMceEditorclipboard_image_1\" class=\"mceNonEditable lia-copypaste-placeholder\">&nbsp;</DIV>\n<P><STRONG>Dynamic 911 (Dynamic Emergency Calling)</STRONG> enables the sharing of user’s current location to the emergency dispatch services. See <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/configure-dynamic-emergency-calling\" target=\"_self\">this</A> for more information.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_6.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/157727i75CABAFFAA268C2E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_6.png\" alt=\"clipboard_image_6.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Speed Dial and Boss-Admin support</STRONG><SPAN>: </SPAN> We are working on bringing speed dial and boss/admin delegation to the phone next year. This will allow users to pin favorites, view call history, and manage delegation from Teams phones.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_7.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/157728iCF1800ADD2055D3A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_7.png\" alt=\"clipboard_image_7.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_8.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/157729i035BF8285FB1D942/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_8.png\" alt=\"clipboard_image_8.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><U>More information on partner-led programs for Teams phones:</U></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>AudioCodes:</STRONG> IP Phone Investment Protection Plan. For more information visit, <A href=\"https://online.audiocodes.com/iprotecplan\" target=\"_self\">https://online.audiocodes.com/iprotecplan</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Crestron:</STRONG> For more information on support and other sales requirements, contact Crestron at inquiries@crestron.com</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Poly</STRONG> recently announced the CCX lineup of devices and are offering customers a trade-up opportunity. For more information visit, <A href=\"https://www.polycom.com/forms/teams-phone-tradeup-promotion.html\" target=\"_self\">https://www.polycom.com/forms/teams-phone-tradeup-promotion.html</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Yealink</STRONG> is offering trial devices for customers to use. This program covers both personal devices (phones and peripherals) and shared devices (meeting room devices). For more information email ucinfo@yealink.com.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"clipboard_image_9.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/157730i18BDBBBD9E2606F1/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"clipboard_image_9.png\" alt=\"clipboard_image_9.png\" /></span></P>\n<P style=\"box-sizing: border-box; color: #333333; font-family: &amp;quot; segoeui&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;lato&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;helvetica neue&amp;quot;,helvetica,arial,sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; margin: 0px;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"box-sizing: border-box; color: #333333; font-family: &amp;quot; segoeui&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;lato&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;helvetica neue&amp;quot;,helvetica,arial,sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; margin: 0px;\"><STRONG style=\"box-sizing: border-box; font-weight: bold;\">Give us feedback and let us know what you think,</STRONG></P>\n<P style=\"box-sizing: border-box; color: #333333; font-family: &amp;quot; segoeui&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;lato&amp;quot;,&amp;quot;helvetica neue&amp;quot;,helvetica,arial,sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; margin: 0px;\">We continue to add features, should you have any feedback or request. 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Thinking about deploying Teams? Here's what IT Admins need to know","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/thinking-about-deploying-teams-here-s-what-it-admins-need-to/ba-p/1031636","description":"<P>We just <A href=\"https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fmicrosoft-365%2Fblog%2F%3Fp%3D233660&amp;data=02%7C01%7CNydia.Cavazos%40microsoft.com%7C6fdc1849858d4fcb242908d76cfaf1f1%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C637097697402892980&amp;sdata=SgycvEHaW0bDrt6c0La5Fsx90v3ZTC5CRxRI42C%2BAgg%3D&amp;reserved=0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">announced</A> 20 million daily active users for Microsoft Teams worldwide. This a big milestone, not just because of the number of people benefiting from Teams, but because of the IT advocates that have been with us throughout this journey, marking a turning point for Teams adoption in the enterprise. There’s a good reason for this. Microsoft Teams helps bring people together with chat, meetings, calls, apps, and the security of M365 in one place. By design, Teams is built on top of a mature and secure collaboration foundation backed by SharePoint, OneDrive and Exchange Online, to deliver the hub for teamwork.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>As an IT professional, we know you care about productivity, manageability and security, and we want you to have control over how Teams is configured for your organization. This means not only meeting your security, compliance, and day-to-day operational needs, but being able to manage and customize communication preferences. As an example, you can enable or disable the use of popular giphys, or decide if guest participants can leverage screen-sharing.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Today we are launching a brand-new series on <A href=\"http://www.microsoft.com/mechanics\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Mechanics</A> called: Microsoft Teams for IT. We built this for you, the IT Admin, in order to help you navigate through the various decision points you will encounter while assessing, deploying, or scaling Teams. Our goal is to get you up to speed on the latest capabilities for manageability, security, and compliance, and to share efficient ways to accelerate user adoption while minimizing helpdesk calls.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><LI-VIDEO width=\"600\" height=\"338\" size=\"large\" vid=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MfDB7VenWuA&amp;list=PLXtHYVsvn_b_JeDjgD5XdkyHTDXdYgPGn\" align=\"center\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/MfDB7VenWuA/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>The series: Microsoft Teams for IT</STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Over the next few months, we’ll chronicle step-by-step guidance on how to implement Microsoft Teams. The first two episodes in our series offer an overview of Teams for IT admins in a Microsoft Essentials video including your configuration options and guiding you through important considerations to plan, deploy, and roll-out Teams. This is accompanied by hands-on demonstrations of our new Deployment Advisor, as well as the foundational policies for configuring Teams. The full series comprises additional Microsoft Essentials overviews and hands-on demonstrations for security and compliance, Skype for Business to Teams migration, and user adoption. You can follow the series on our playlist at <A href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MfDB7VenWuA&amp;list=PLXtHYVsvn_b_JeDjgD5XdkyHTDXdYgPGn\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">aka.ms/MicrosoftTeamsforIT,</A> and connect with us here on the tech community, or on<A href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/microsoft-mechanics\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"> LinkedIn,&nbsp;</A>and <A href=\"https://twitter.com/MSFTMechanics\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">@MSFTMechanics.</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We hope that you find the series helpful. Of course, please give us your feedback and let us know if there are any specific things that you’d like us to cover in the future.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>And, for those of you in the US, have a wonderful Thanksgiving holiday!</P>\n<P>Nydia &amp;&nbsp;<LI-USER uid=\"169555\"></LI-USER>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 27 Nov 2019 22:29:23 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"b7fce2a2e6d8bd0936a407f1b09f90a1","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Nydia Cavazos","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401926},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Four new ways to simplify your work with Microsoft Teams and Power Automate","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/four-new-ways-to-simplify-your-work-with-microsoft-teams-and/ba-p/1600483","description":"<P>Microsoft Teams can help people stay connected while working apart with capabilities like chat, meetings, and calling, but users often ask how it can help streamline the work they do. Fortunately, Teams and <A href=\"https://preview.flow.microsoft.com/en-us/connectors/shared_teams/microsoft-teams/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Power Automate</A> work seamlessly together to simplify how you and your team work – whether you’re on the Sales team, the Product team, the HR team, or just the office ping pong team.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Power Automate allows you to create low-code workflow automation for yourself and your entire team using logic-based building blocks, starting with a trigger that sets one or more actions in motion. The new <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-automate/trigger-flow-teams-message\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\"for a selected message\"</A> trigger is unlocking new ways to drive business processes, starting from a message in Teams. Below are four examples of how teams are doing this, but the possibilities are endless. Templates are now available for each of these scenarios to help you get started right away!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">1. Sales teams: Convert a chat to a Sales opportunity</FONT> </STRONG><BR /><A href=\"https://preview.flow.microsoft.com/en-us/galleries/public/templates/c0fe09ea131549f0ae6ace75605db470/create-an-opportunity-from-a-message/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\"Create an opportunity from a message\" template</A><BR />Creating a customer opportunity is a critical step in any Sales process, and often that opportunity starts with a conversation. Now Teams users can create an opportunity right from the conversation where it began.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>When you build the workflow below using the “for a selected message” trigger, anyone in your team can easily create a Sales opportunity just by clicking the “…” on the right side of a message and selecting “Create Sales Opportunity”. Simply fill out a custom form, and the information you enter is automatically sent to your CRM system.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Microsoft%20Teams/1Dynamics-gif.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">2. Project Management teams: Track project information where your team works</FONT></STRONG><BR /><A href=\"https://preview.flow.microsoft.com/en-us/galleries/public/templates/1150c96a04144909a4f12fe4d649119a/create-an-item-from-a-message/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\"Create an item from a message\" template</A><BR />A rich and open dialogue means that projects can happen faster, and nearly all projects require us to keep lists – whether that’s a project status, the plan for an event, or a list of materials to develop.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>SharePoint lists are a great way to organize information and rich file types for you and your team, and now Teams users can easily add content to their SharePoint lists directly from chat with this new Power Automate trigger. Once the flow has been created, users can add critical data to their list right from a chat – for example, when they learn that a project deliverable has been received.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Microsoft%20Teams/2-sharepoint-create.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>3. Product teams: Streamline product development</STRONG> </FONT><BR /><A href=\"https://preview.flow.microsoft.com/en-us/galleries/public/templates/8b1012f3298b4d2e8a88a395020d3d96/create-a-workitem-from-a-message/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\"Create a work item from a message\" template</A><BR />The product development process is complex and often relies on multiple teams working together. With so much collaboration and planning happening over chat, messages can be a great way to request or report new work items to your development team.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>By combining the “for selected message” trigger with the Azure DevOps “create a work item” action, you can now use the message as the starting point to create a work item. All the necessary details can be added to Azure DevOps to provide more details for the work item.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Microsoft%20Teams/3create-task.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>4. Any team: Follow-up on important conversations</STRONG></FONT><BR /><A href=\"https://preview.flow.microsoft.com/en-us/galleries/public/templates/491ee4d7bdd14783b3114e4fcdaeee4d/follow-up-on-a-message/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\"Follow-up on a message\" template</A><BR />Many of us have been there – you receive an important message right as you’re about to start a meeting or are in the flow of important work. Now it’s easy to remind yourself to follow-up on an important message from a colleague at a later time, like after your Teams meeting or once you’ve finish working on an important document.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Building a simple “follow-up” flow will allow anyone on the team to create a custom message reminder just by clicking the “…” on the right-hand side of a message and specifying when they want to be reminded. The Flow bot will send a reminder and a link to the message right in Teams.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Microsoft%20Teams/4flow-reminder.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Check out the <A href=\"https://flow.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/trigger-flows-from-any-message-in-microsoft-teams/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\"for a selected message\"</A> documentation and additional details to learn more about this new capability. Of course the examples above are just scratching the surface of what is possible for you and your team to automate, so check out the <A href=\"https://flow.microsoft.com/en-us/connectors/shared_teams/microsoft-teams/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Power Automate templates for Teams</A> and <A href=\"https://github.com/Power-Automate-in-a-day/Training-by-the-community\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">learn to build your own flows</A> to achieve even more. We’re excited to hear about what you build!</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 20 Aug 2020 20:06:59 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"f039c91847b6d6d5a64ae1072734f838","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"MicrosoftTeamsTeam","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Microsoft%20Teams/1Dynamics-gif.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn28@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-58-15-611_18502632e13c96c4.webp","https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Microsoft%20Teams/2-sharepoint-create.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn71@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-59-27-597_339613f48cd4586d.webp","https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Microsoft%20Teams/3create-task.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn99@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-57-46-463_635ddadd238c0ff9.webp","https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Microsoft%20Teams/4flow-reminder.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn4@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-59-01-724_e3d1e7ca5ff30dbf.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401917},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"IT essentials for enabling remote work with Microsoft Teams","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/it-essentials-for-enabling-remote-work-with-microsoft-teams/ba-p/1313220","description":"<P>\n Organizations across the globe are adjusting to the new reality of remote work to ensure the safety and well-being of their employees. IT departments are playing a crucial role in enabling remote collaboration with Microsoft Teams, and to help them with details on essential steps, we are sharing the following list of considerations and resources:\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<OL> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/it-essentials-for-enabling-remote-work-with-microsoft-teams/ba-p/1313220#onboard\" target=\"_self\">\n   Onboard your organization\n  </A>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/it-essentials-for-enabling-remote-work-with-microsoft-teams/ba-p/1313220#policies\" target=\"_self\">\n   Manage the experience with robust settings and policies\n  </A>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/it-essentials-for-enabling-remote-work-with-microsoft-teams/ba-p/1313220#secure\" target=\"_self\">\n   Secure company data while safeguarding privacy\n  </A>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/it-essentials-for-enabling-remote-work-with-microsoft-teams/ba-p/1313220#adoption\" target=\"_self\">\n   Drive adoption of remote work\n  </A>\n </LI> \n</OL> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<DIV id=\"onboard\">\n &nbsp;\n</DIV> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  <FONT size=\"5\">\n   Onboard your organization\n  </FONT>\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/office-365-blog/how-to-quickly-optimize-office-365-traffic-for-remote-staff-amp/ba-p/1214571\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Prepare your network for Microsoft Teams\n  </A>: It is important that all requirements are met to ensure your environment is optimized for Teams usage, including configuring your Office 365 domain, SharePoint Online, Exchange Online and OneDrive for Business. To drastically reduce the adverse effects on your internal network infrastructure when a large percentage of your users are working remotely, you can first identify the endpoints that need to be optimized and then optimize the identified endpoints.\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/user-access\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Make sure all users have access to Teams\n  </A>: you can manage access to Teams on a per-user basis using the Microsoft 365 admin center or PowerShell. If you don’t have enough licenses for everyone in your organization, you can take advantage of \n  <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/e1-trial-license\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   the 6-month Office 365 E1 Trial\n  </A> we recently made available to help customers manage the increased number of employees working from home.\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/get-clients\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Distribute the clients and devices\n  </A>: Microsoft Teams is available for desktop (Windows, Mac, and Linux), web, and mobile (Android and iOS). The desktop client can be downloaded and installed by end users directly from \n  <A href=\"https://teams.microsoft.com/downloads\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   here\n  </A> or you can use tools such as \n  <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/msi-deployment\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager for Windows\n  </A> or Jamf Pro for macOS to distribute the installation files. Additionally, having an audio and/or video device helps improve the user experience during meetings and calls. You can learn more about certified Microsoft Teams devices \n  <A href=\"https://office.com/teamsdevices\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   here\n  </A>.\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/use-advisor-teams-roll-out\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Use Advisor for Teams to plan or review your rollout\n  </A>: Advisor for Teams in the Teams admin center provides recommended plans that walk you through the deployment of your Teams workloads.\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<DIV id=\"policies\">\n &nbsp;\n</DIV> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  <FONT size=\"5\">\n   Manage the experience with robust settings and policies\n  </FONT>\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/enable-features-office-365\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Meet organizational requirements\n  </A>: Every organization is different, and it is important to ensure that settings that apply to every user meet their needs while complying with company policies. For some, the move to a virtual environment involves rethinking how to \n  <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/communicate-with-users-from-other-organizations\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   collaborate with users from other organizations\n  </A>.\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  Tailor the Teams experience for your users \n  <UL> \n   <LI>\n    <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/teams-policies\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n     Teams policies\n    </A> allow you to control what users can do in teams and channels. Some of your users may be used to having ongoing focused conversation only with specific people around sensitive topics. \n    <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/private-channels\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n     Private channels\n    </A> are a great way to replicate this in a virtual environment and you can define who in the organization can create these with Teams policies.\n   </LI> \n   <LI>\n    <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/messaging-policies-in-teams\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n     Messaging policies\n    </A> allow you to control which chat and channel messaging features are available to your users. Some of your employees may be collaborating with people from other parts of the world who speak different languages. You can allow users to \n    <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-ie/office/translate-a-message-in-teams-d8926ce9-d6a6-47df-a416-f1adb62d3194\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n     translate messages\n    </A> using this type of policy. Additionally, you can enable \n    <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Use-Immersive-Reader-in-Microsoft-Teams-a40ca6d4-01a0-449f-b189-5c169f1b0978\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n     immersive reader\n    </A> to help your users read messages and posts the way they read best.\n   </LI> \n   <LI>\n    <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/meeting-policies-in-teams\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n     Meetings policies\n    </A> allow you to control which features are available to meeting participants, including settings to control which meeting participants wait in the lobby before they are admitted to the meeting and the level of participation they are allowed in a meeting. Organizers can also leverage \n    <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/change-participant-settings-for-a-teams-meeting-53261366-dbd5-45f9-aae9-a70e6354f88e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n     meeting options\n    </A> to further customize meetings to their needs. Here are \n    <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/9-tips-for-having-the-best-online-meeting-experience-with/ba-p/1218884\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n     9 tips for having the best online meeting experience with Microsoft Teams\n    </A>.\n   </LI> \n   <LI>\n    <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-live-events/what-are-teams-live-events\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n     Live event settings\n    </A> allow you to \n    <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-live-events/plan-for-teams-live-events\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n     plan\n    </A> and \n    <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-live-events/set-up-for-teams-live-events\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n     set up\n    </A> live events in Microsoft Teams to host “broadcast-style” video presentations for large events with more than 250 participants.\n   </LI> \n   <LI>\n    <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/teams-calling-policy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n     Calling policies\n    </A> allow you to control which calling and call forwarding features your employees can use. For example, you can enable the \n    <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/share-a-phone-line-with-a-delegate-16307929-a51f-43fc-8323-3b1bf115e5a8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n     sharing of a phone line with a delegate\n    </A> for some of your staff that supports leaders and senior executives.\n   </LI> \n  </UL> \n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/manage-apps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Manage your apps from one place\n  </A>: Bring your applications into Teams to truly make it your hub for teamwork and productivity. For example, during these difficult times, you can leverage the power of the \n  <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/coordinate-crisis-communications-using-microsoft-teams-power/ba-p/1216715\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Power Platform in Teams to coordinate crisis communications\n  </A>. As an admin, you can review important apps details to help you confidently enable them. You can then use \n  <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/teams-app-permission-policies\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   app permission policies\n  </A>, \n  <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/teams-app-setup-policies\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   app setup policies\n  </A>, and \n  <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/teams-custom-app-policies-and-settings\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   custom app policies and settings\n  </A> to craft the experience for your users.\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <STRONG>\n   Monitor usage and quality of the service\n  </STRONG>: you can track the usage of Teams to ensure employees are taking full advantage of the capabilities while working remotely using the \n  <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/teams-analytics-and-reports/teams-reporting-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Microsoft Teams analytics and reporting experience\n  </A>. Additionally, you can help your users have the best experience possible during calls and meetings by monitoring call quality in Teams.\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<DIV id=\"secure\">\n &nbsp;\n</DIV> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  <FONT size=\"5\">\n   Secure company data while safeguarding privacy\n  </FONT>\n </STRONG>\n <BR />Now more than ever, people need to know that their virtual conversations are private and secure. At Microsoft, privacy and security are never an afterthought. It’s our commitment to you—not only during this challenging time, but always. \n <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2020/04/06/it-professionals-privacy-security-microsoft-teams/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Here’s how we’re working to earn your trust every day with Microsoft Teams\n </A>.\n</P> \n<DIV id=\"adoption\">\n &nbsp;\n</DIV> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  <FONT size=\"5\">\n   Drive adoption of remote work\n  </FONT>\n </STRONG>\n <BR />To empower you to support employees during this transition, we have developed guidance and resources for this topic, including \n <A href=\"https://resources.techcommunity.microsoft.com/adoption/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  adoption resources\n </A> with \n <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/driving-adoption-blog/updates-to-adoption-assets-for-microsoft-teams/ba-p/1235135\" target=\"_self\">\n  new updates to our assets\n </A>, guidance for \n <A href=\"https://products.office.com/en-us/microsoft-teams/work-remotely\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  staying productive while working remotely\n </A>, and an overview on how to \n <A href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BQ7kVacSAt0&amp;list=PLXtHYVsvn_b_JeDjgD5XdkyHTDXdYgPGn&amp;index=7\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  drive Microsoft Teams users adoption\n </A> in the latest chapter of our \n <A href=\"https://aka.ms/MicrosoftTeamsforIT\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Microsoft Teams for IT mechanics series\n </A>.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n You can learn more about enabling remote work to stay connected, productive, and secure \n <A href=\"https://aka.ms/ERW\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  here\n </A>. For the latest information about new features and updates, please keep an eye on \n <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/manage/message-center/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Message Center\n </A> and the \n <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/bg-p/MicrosoftTeamsBlog\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Microsoft Teams blog\n </A>.\n</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 16 Apr 2020 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"1db4e7a88f27815c57193c650a0b552a","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"MicrosoftTeamsTeam","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401922},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Microsoft Teams Rooms December update","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/microsoft-teams-rooms-december-update/ba-p/1069456","description":"<P>Earlier this year we released content camera support that enables you to share an analog whiteboard into your Teams Meetings to create a more inclusive experience for remote participants. We’re pleased to announce that the content camera is now also available for Surface Pro-based systems (i.e. Logitech Smartdock, Crestron SR &amp; Polycom MSR).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>In addition to this, a content camera mounting kit for mounting the Logitech Brio content camera is available for purchase. Go to <A href=\"https://products.office.com/en-us/microsoft-teams/across-devices/devices/product?deviceid=349\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Brio Content Camera Kit</A> on the <A href=\"https://office.com/teamsdevices\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office.com Teams Devices showcase</A> which includes all the accessories you need to install the camera (i.e. camera, mount, cabling, USB extenders).</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"WB.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162107iFBE74F7A89B71113/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"WB.png\" alt=\"Figure 1 Content Camera mount for intelligent capture\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 1 Content Camera mount for intelligent capture</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>To provide an easy license model for conference rooms, our Office 365 Meeting Room subscription is also now available to our government customers in Office 365 US Government Community (GCC). The Microsoft Teams Room app now supports the GCC cloud as well.<BR /><BR /></P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Microsoft Teams Rooms &amp; Intune best practices</FONT></STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Teams meeting room devices can be enrolled and managed by Intune to provide many of the device management and security capabilities available to endpoints managed by Intune. Find out more <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Intune-Customer-Success/Managing-Teams-Meeting-Rooms-with-Intune/ba-p/1069230\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Microsoft Teams Rooms store app 4.3.23.0 is now available</FONT></STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>We started releasing Microsoft Teams Room app version 4.3.21.0 earlier this week and the Store app will roll out to every Microsoft Teams Room in the next couple of weeks.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This release contains the following features:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Settings user interface refresh</H2>\n<P>We’ve refreshed our Settings UI on devices to reflect the new admin controls we’ve added for meeting room experiences. The new UI gives you a better organized view of your configuration options and adds a new About tab with useful information about device configuration.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Console.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162101iA83CFA620EB0E657/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Console.png\" alt=\"Figure 2 New Admin Settings UI\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 2 New Admin Settings UI</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>These changes have no impact on <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/room-systems/xml-config-file\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">device configuration with an XML file</A>, which will continue to work as before.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Auto-accept Proximity-based calls</H2>\n<P>You can now configure Microsoft Teams Rooms to automatically accept proximity-based meeting joins. This simplifies the join experience and gets users into meetings even faster and, of course, we give admins the option to configure this feature based on their preferences.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Auto accept.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162102i107DA4780B7C098E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Auto accept.png\" alt=\"Figure 3 Admin settings for proximity join\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 3 Admin settings for proximity join</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Get to Room Controls / OEM extension with ease</H2>\n<P>We’re bringing the Room Controls button back to the main screen of the Microsoft Teams console so that partner extensions are just one click away.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Controls.png\" style=\"width: 975px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162103iB05CA1DCE0AA3111/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Controls.png\" alt=\"Figure 4 Room Controls / OEM extension\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 4 Room Controls / OEM extension</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H1><SPAN style=\"background: white;\">Microsoft Teams Rooms and peripheral additions</SPAN></H1>\n<P>We have some great new additions for Microsoft Teams Rooms from our partners to give our customers even more choice for their conference rooms.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"New Devices.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162104i7B36B07D472D61D8/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"New Devices.png\" alt=\"Figure 5 New devices for Microsoft Teams Rooms\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 5 New devices for Microsoft Teams Rooms</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Yealink MVC300</H2>\n<P>The right fit for focus rooms and small rooms, with its auto framing camera and Yealink CP900 speakerphone, the MVC300 system delivers a broad and vivid view while making it easier for everyone to be heard.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture2.png\" style=\"width: 371px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162106i154DB12AF53B1C13/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Picture2.png\" alt=\"Figure 6 Yealink MVC300\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 6 Yealink MVC300</span></span></P>\n<H2>&nbsp;</H2>\n<H2>Poly Studio</H2>\n<P>Combining the audio and video quality you expect from Poly with the simplicity you need for everyday use, Poly Studio is the USB video bar ideal for smaller rooms and huddle spaces. Its plug-and-play functionality works with Microsoft Teams Room and fits any budget.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture3.jpg\" style=\"width: 313px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162108iFA83082D513520CD/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Picture3.jpg\" alt=\"Figure 7 Poly Studio\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 7 Poly Studio</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Yealink CP900</H2>\n<P>A premium portable USB speakerphone for personal use, in huddle rooms, and on-the-go. Wideband audio, HD voice and six-microphone beam-forming offer a premium full-duplex experience. Yealink’s distraction-free HD audio technology ensures crystal-clear sound. The CP900 speakerphone offers simple plug-and-play USB connections to Microsoft Teams Rooms.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture4.png\" style=\"width: 313px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162109i2AD1F2A9EBAA2309/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Picture4.png\" alt=\"Figure 8 Yealink CP900\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 8 Yealink CP900</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Sennheiser SP30T</H2>\n<P>A portable wireless speakerphone for today’s mobile workforce supporting both personal and small to medium sized conferencing for up to 8 people. A choice of Bluetooth or USB-C connectivity gives freedom and flexible connection options. Two long-range, noise and echo cancelling microphones and an ultra-low distortion speaker with clear voice reproduction allow a natural, conversational flow even in challenging environments.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture5.jpg\" style=\"width: 275px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162110i661B80466DD07B52/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Picture5.jpg\" alt=\"Figure 9 Sennheiser SP30T\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 9 Sennheiser SP30T</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>Yealink UVC30 Room</H2>\n<P>A premium USB camera designed for focus and small meeting rooms. Offering a sharp image and accurate color reproduction, it rewards you with a vivid face-to-face video meeting experience in ultra HD 4K resolution and high frame rates. A wide field of view ensures every participant can be seen. Based on the facial detection, it supports auto framing feature to accomplish a much more intelligent meeting experience. An included flexible clip gives many options to mount the camera.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Picture6.png\" style=\"width: 313px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162111iCF488513F4814071/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Picture6.png\" alt=\"Figure 10 Yealink UVC30 Room\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Figure 10 Yealink UVC30 Room</span></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Let</STRONG><STRONG>´</STRONG><STRONG>s get started today</STRONG> and modernize your meeting rooms and check out our certified bundles at <A href=\"https://www.office.com/teamsdevices\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">office.com/teamsdevices</A><BR /><BR /><STRONG>- Christian Schacht, Senior Product Marketing Manager, Microsoft Teams 76_97b3b960313c486a.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/162111iCF488513F4814071/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn100@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-09-833_734e3a14220325f6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401926},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Skype for Business phones (3PIP) support with Microsoft Teams","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/skype-for-business-phones-3pip-support-with-microsoft-teams/ba-p/789351","description":"<DIV>\n <EM>\n  <STRONG>\n   UPDATE:\n  </STRONG> Support for Skype for Business (3PIP) phones has been extended&nbsp;beyond 2023, so you can continue to use your existing Skype for Business phones as you move to Teams. Additionally, we will be supporting core calling features on SIP phones from Cisco, Yealink, Polycom, and others with Teams. Support for SIP phones will be available in the first half of 2021. For more information click \n  <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2020/08/03/take-communnext-level-microsoft-teams/?ref=403-redirect&quot;\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   here\n  </A>.\n </EM>\n</DIV> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n We recently \n <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-Teams-Blog/Skype-for-Business-Online-to-Be-Retired-in-2021/ba-p/777833\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  announced\n </A> that Skype for Business Online will be retired on \n <STRONG>\n  July 31, 2021\n </STRONG>, and we’re encouraging existing customers to start planning their migrations to Teams. This blog post answers questions about Teams support for Skype for Business phones, also known as 3\n <SUP>\n  rd\n </SUP> Party IP or 3PIP phones.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  <EM>\n   What does this mean for customers who have 3PIP Phones with Skype for Business Online? \n  </EM>\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<P>\n Skype for Business Online customers who move to Teams can continue using their 3PIP phones with some functionality limitations until \n <STRONG>\n  July 31st, 2023\n </STRONG>. For more details on the \n <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Skype-for-Business-Blog/Skype-for-Business-Certified-IP-Phones-with-Microsoft-Teams/ba-p/286073\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  supported feature set\n </A> see our post from last November on this topic.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n After \n <STRONG>\n  July 31st, 2023\n </STRONG>, we will no longer support 3PIP phones on Teams. To ensure business continuity, these phones should be replaced with native Teams certified phones. We are continuously working on enhancing the feature set available on Teams phones.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  <EM>\n   What are the benefits of a native Teams phone?\n  </EM>\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<P>\n Some of the key benefits customers would experience using a native Teams phone include contacts* and calendar management, one-touch join for meetings, companion* experience between the Teams phones and PC/MAC clients and voicemail transcriptions on the phones.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Along with these features, customers can now deploy and manage their native Teams phones using the Device Management portal available through Admin Center, making it easier for tenant administrators to keep all their Teams devices up to date with the right policies.\n</P> \n<P>\n <FONT size=\"2\">\n  *Features under development and will be made available soon.\n </FONT>\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  <EM>\n   What is the recommendation moving forward for customers?\n  </EM>\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<P>\n Our recommendation for customers moving to Teams is to work with our phone partners who have various programs to support a refresh schedule to native \n <A href=\"https://products.office.com/en-us/microsoft-teams/across-devices/devices/category?devicetype=34\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Teams phones or Teams Capable phones.\n </A> Customers should also consider establishing a phone refresh schedule along with a device persona evaluation which would help define the right Teams device for the right working style.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Phones Blog.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img
