\n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  <EM>\n   Are there any implications for customers who remain on Skype for Business Server? \n  </EM>\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<P>\n No, customers can continue to use and procure the 3PIP phones for use with Skype for Business Server. Note that we will no longer be adding any new Skype for Business certified devices to any product category, including phones.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  <EM>\n   What if I have bought a Skype for Business phone which is upgradeable to Teams?\n  </EM>\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<P>\n Customers who purchased upgradable Skype for Business phones (Teams Capable Phones) should plan and align their upgrade of the Teams UI on the phone to that of their scheduled Teams migration.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  <EM>\n   Are there partner led programs/offers available?\n  </EM>\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<P>\n Yes, our partners are offering programs and support to ensure that customers can move to Teams phones, current offers are:\n</P> \n<UL> \n <LI>\n  Poly - \n  <A href=\"https://www.polycom.com/forms/teams-phone-tradeup-promotion.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   Poly Trade-up Promotion\n  </A>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  <U></U>AudioCodes - \n  <A href=\"https://online.audiocodes.com/iprotecplan\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n   AudioCodes Investment Protection Plan\n  </A>\n </LI> \n <LI>\n  Yealink - Contact for personalized offer- \n  <A href=\"mailto:ucinfo@yealink.com\" target=\"_self\">\n   ucinfo@yealink.com\n  </A>\n </LI> \n</UL> \n<P>\n <STRONG>\n  <EM>\n   Where can our customers go to see the broad portfolio of Teams devices which are available?\n  </EM>\n </STRONG>\n</P> \n<P>\n Customers can visit our \n <A href=\"https://products.office.com/en-us/microsoft-teams/across-devices/devices\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Teams Devices Showcase\n </A> for devices across Personal and \n <A href=\"https://products.office.com/en-us/microsoft-teams/across-devices/spaces\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\n  Shared spaces.\n </A> Customers have the choice in manufacturer and models from AudioCodes, Crestron, and Yealink who have native Teams certified phones available in market today. Poly have also recently announced their native Teams phones which is planned to GA late this year.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n We are convinced that our portfolio of Teams devices will allow our customers to have a broader selection of purpose-built devices which offers them new and exciting features.\n</P> \n<P>\n &nbsp;\n</P> \n<P>\n Our customers have the opportunity today, to re-evaluate the way they work and communicate using devices. As customers advance forward with Teams, the opportunity to become even more productive using a Teams device is now.\n</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 05 Aug 2020 00:06:43 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/125691i963EA751F162FA20/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"42f005e1561e4de0fc81bfb6f54e00e5","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn8@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-56-42-582_896f40909d738441.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":158,"sourceBytes":67792,"destBytes":23862,"author":"Duncan Barnes","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/125691i963EA751F162FA20/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn8@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-56-42-582_896f40909d738441.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401917},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Re-imagine meeting room experiences with Teams-enabled devices for shared spaces","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/re-imagine-meeting-room-experiences-with-teams-enabled-devices/ba-p/1509170","description":"<P><LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://youtu.be/rqHWK4OxEXc\" align=\"center\" size=\"large\" width=\"600\" height=\"338\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO></P>\n<P>Over the past few months, many organizations have vaulted into an entirely new world of work. We’ve discovered some of the benefits of this new world through more than 30 research projects here at Microsoft, and by learning from our customers and partners. These benefits range from, increased fluidity between work and life activities, allowing people to move between the two more easily, to increased empathy between teammates, and several other benefits detailed in our latest <A href=\"https://aka.ms/Wtrend2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Work Trend Index Report</A>. We’ve also seen the emergence of new challenges. That same blend of work and life can be difficult to balance, home offices without distractions are rare, remote collaboration can feel more difficult than in-person, and access to reliable networks and equipment isn’t available for everyone. While distributed remote work has its rewards, there are certain advantages to in-office collaboration as well. Through these learnings it has become clear – the workplace of the future will not be one location or the other, but a fluid experience across the two.</P>\n<P><BR />To help our customers navigate this new, hybrid working environment, today we’d like to share some new and reimagined capabilities in Teams-enabled meeting rooms that offer touchless experiences, support inclusive collaboration between remote and in-person attendees, and help remind teams to practice social distancing in meeting rooms.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Touchless experiences on Microsoft Teams devices for shared spaces</STRONG></FONT><BR />Today, people in the meeting room can join a Teams meeting from their Microsoft Teams Room and collaboration bar devices, share content and collaborate using their personal PC or mobile device, all without ever having to touch the shared device display. Later this year, we’ll enable these capabilities on Surface Hub as well. Additionally, Surface Pro X users can use their pen across Surface devices, including Surface Hub 2S, further limiting the contact with the shared device display in a meeting room. As the need for additional touchless experiences grows, we’re expanding these features to allow people to control more aspects of the meeting. In the future, people will be able to choose how they want to interact with their shared space devices, using touch, controls on their own personal devices, and through voice commands.</P>\n<P><BR />Soon, in-room participants will be able to control their Teams Room and collaboration bar devices from the Teams mobile app. From the new <STRONG>room remote</STRONG> experience, users will be able to mute and unmute the room, adjust audio volume, turn cameras on and off, and exit the meeting. We’ll also enable <STRONG>wireless casting</STRONG> to any Teams Room, collaboration bar, and Surface Hub for quick ad-hoc connections that don’t require remote participation. Beginning later this year, <STRONG>voice assistance</STRONG> will be enabled for Microsoft Teams Room devices, allowing in-room participants to ask Cortana to join and leave a meeting, and add a phone number or participant from the address book to a meeting.*</P>\n<P><BR />When the meeting is over, people can simply leave the room, allowing the Teams Room or collaboration bar to <STRONG>automatically exit</STRONG> the meeting. This feature allows room administrators to designate a period of zero-activity after a meeting is scheduled to end, after which, meeting devices are automatically ejected from the meeting.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/Proximity_Join.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>Proximity join</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/Personal_Remote_App.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>Room remote</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/Casting_3.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>Wireless casting</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/Voice_Commands.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>Cortana voice assistance on Microsoft Teams Room</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Coordinated meetings with Teams Room and Surface Hub</STRONG></FONT> <BR />Teams Room is the premier solution for delivering Teams meeting room experiences with a focus on high fidelity audio, HD video, and seamless content sharing capabilities. Surface Hub delivers unmatched co-creation experiences in meetings, featuring premium pen and inking capabilities, with access to must-have Microsoft apps and Office 365 files. Soon, users will be able to leverage the power of both devices, in the same meeting, through a coordinated experience. Using proximity or one-touch join, both devices join the meeting simultaneously with Teams Rooms running audio and video, while Surface Hub is automatically muted to avoid any distracting feedback. During the meeting, users can maximize screen real estate by using the front of room display to show attendees in the meeting gallery, while the Surface Hub is used to show content or to conduct a collaborative whiteboarding session. With the whiteboard experience on Surface Hub and Microsoft Whiteboard in Teams, people can draw and ink together on the same savable canvas, no matter their location. With this new coordinated device capability, people can drive inclusive, collaborative meeting experiences between remote and in-person attendees like never before.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/Coordinated_Meetings.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>Coordinated meetings with Surface Hub and Microsoft Teams Room</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Meeting room capacity notifications</STRONG></FONT><BR />As organizations plan their transitions back to the office, many are looking to implement new in-office policies to adhere to local safety guidelines. Some of these recommendations include social distancing practices in shared spaces like meeting rooms. To aid our customers in these efforts we’ll soon enable a way for room administrators to automatically notify in-room meeting participants if a room is over capacity. Today, administrators can define meeting room capacity for the room account. Soon, we’ll enable IT to use the data from meeting room cameras with people-counting technologies to identify how many people are in a room, and alert in-room meeting participants if it is over-capacity based on the capacity data defined in the room account. The notification will be displayed as a banner that appears across the top of the screen at the front of the room. In the future, administrators will receive an alert in the Teams Admin Center, allowing them to track room usage to help inform space planning decisions.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/Room_Capacity_Notifications.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>Meeting room capacity notifications</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Helping people connect across workspaces has never been more important. With Teams meetings and Teams-enabled devices, people can engage in collaborative and inclusive meetings from anywhere.</P>\n<P><BR />View our collection of Teams certified devices at the <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/microsoft-teams/across-devices/devices/category?devicetype=20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Devices Showcase</A>. From now until 7/31/2020, use code “<STRONG>TeamsDevices20</STRONG>” to receive a discount on a variety of products at checkout. To learn more about Surface Hub, click <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/p/surface-hub-2s/8p62mw6bn9g4?activetab=pivot:overviewtab\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"2\">*Voice assistance will launch first for Microsoft 365 Enterprise users in the U.S., in English. Not all Teams Room audio devices will support Cortana voice assistance.</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 08 Jul 2020 18:00:00 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"d94d474ea7c586f3b246a8869d5da088","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"MicrosoftTeamsTeam","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/Proximity_Join.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn20@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-57-27-547_30f2c0e96775c8dd.webp","https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/Personal_Remote_App.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn96@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-57-27-668_94cf804c28376623.webp","https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/Casting_3.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn11@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-57-19-766_a64010d56331714f.webp","https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/Voice_Commands.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn88@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-57-12-567_3b704c4ffd369288.webp","https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/Coordinated_Meetings.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn35@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-57-57-148_1505af9cbcfecaff.webp","https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/Room_Capacity_Notifications.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn80@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-57-21-808_d3aad44c6b42adbc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401919},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"What’s New in Microsoft Teams: 3rd Anniversary Edition","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/what-s-new-in-microsoft-teams-3rd-anniversary-edition/ba-p/1234871","description":"<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Microsoft Teams turns 3 this week, and we’re inspired by all the stories you’ve shared of how your teams are using it to chat, call, meet and collaborate. Read on for the latest coming to Teams!</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Teams Meetings</FONT></STRONG><BR /></FONT></P>\n<P style=\"line-height: 1.71429;\"><FONT><STRONG>Great audio quality even under networks with high packet loss</STRONG>&nbsp;<BR />When joining meetings over a poor WiFi or cellular connection—whether taking a call on the go or joining a meeting from a crowded conference hotel—high data packet loss can adversely affect the audio experience. With our new algorithmic improvements in Teams, you now experience greater audio quality even under congested and lossy networks. Through a combination of smart jitter buffer logic, burst loss detection, and triggering of redundant transmissions, we can ensure smooth audio playback, even under high burst loss. Many customers are already noticing an improved audio experience, especially given the overloaded networks we are seeing today. These improvements have rolled out to Teams customers worldwide.</FONT></P>\n<P style=\"line-height: 1.71429;\"><FONT><BR /><STRONG>Keep the focus on you with Background Blur for iOS (coming soon)</STRONG><BR />Keep the focus on you and not what’s behind you! We are excited to bring this frequently utilized feature from the desktop to your iOS devices! You can expect to see this feature appear on your iPhones and iPads in the coming weeks.</FONT></P>\n<P style=\"line-height: 1.71429;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"blur ios.gif\" style=\"width: 274px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/178022iFE38628B882D306B/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"blur ios.gif\" alt=\"blur ios.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P style=\"line-height: 1.71429;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Easily conduct interviews, virtual healthcare visits, and more with the Bookings App in Teams</STRONG><BR />The Bookings app offers a simple way to schedule and conduct appointments with external participants via Microsoft Teams, such as job candidate interviews, client meetings, healthcare virtual visits, virtual financial consultations, customer service appointments in retail, and more. Customers can manage multiple departments and staff in a single scheduling experience and can simply schedule virtual appointments with external attendees. External attendees receive a customized email invite with details of the appointment and a Teams meeting link to join, with the ability to join via their web browser in one-click, or using the Teams mobile app. The Bookings app in Teams will be available in the coming weeks. Learn more about how the Bookings app is helping to empower healthcare providers and patients <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2020/03/06/empowering-care-teams-with-new-tools-in-microsoft-365/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.<BR /></FONT></P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"bookings app.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177878i76E2E44A4F4A4697/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"bookings app.png\" alt=\"bookings app.png\" /></span></FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\" style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Over the last few weeks, more people have been turning to Teams for their online meetings. So, in addition to the capabilities above that are generally available or shipping soon, we also want to share more innovation coming to Teams meetings in the next few months.</FONT></P>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><BR /><STRONG>Raise hands in Teams meetings when you have something to say</STRONG> <BR />Excuse me! The new “raise hands” feature in Teams allows meeting attendees to identify that they wish to speak, making it easier to actively participate in large meetings. Everyone will see a visual cue on the attendee’s video feed, as well as in the participant list, and can be sure to give them the room to participate in the conversation at hand. <BR /></FONT></P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"raise hand 11.jpg\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177879iC055F861DC13490F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"raise hand 11.jpg\" alt=\"raise hand 11.jpg\" /></span></FONT></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Reduce background noise in Teams meetings with noise suppression</STRONG><BR />Whether it be ambient noise from a café, noisy typing in a conference room, or construction noise outside your home office, unwanted background noise can be quite distracting in your Teams meetings. We are excited to announce real-time noise suppression, a new feature in Teams that will automatically remove unwelcome background noise during your meetings.</P>\n<P><BR />We will soon bring real-time noise suppression to Teams meetings and calls, and we are excited to announce that beginning soon, noise suppression will be&nbsp;<A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-stream-blog/now-generally-available-background-noise-suppression-mobile/ba-p/1221048\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">generally available for recorded video content in Stream</A>. Now it’s easy to eliminate distracting background noise in training videos or communications, so you can focus on the person speaking, not what’s happening around them.</P>\n<P><BR />Noise suppression works by analyzing an individual’s audio feed and uses specially trained deep neural networks to filter out noise and retain only the speech signal. While traditional noise suppression algorithms can only address simple stationary noise sources such as fan noise, our AI-based approach learns the difference between speech and noise, and is able to suppress all forms of noise including non-stationary sources that we commonly encounter in our meetings such as typing, eating chips, and road noise, just to name a few.</P>\n<P><LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=57mZhr-Tir4&amp;feature=youtu.be\" align=\"center\" size=\"medium\" width=\"400\" height=\"225\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/57mZhr-Tir4/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG style=\"font-family: inherit;\">The new Satin codec makes the Teams meeting and calling experience even better</STRONG><BR />With our new Satin codec as part of Teams, you can do more with less. Teams will soon be able to deliver crystal clear wideband audio with as little as 7 kbps! While our Wi-Fi and cellular connections are leaps and bounds faster than this, Teams can continue to deliver the best audio experiences during periods of congestion and network handoffs without having to sacrifice video or screen sharing quality. We are excited to introduce this brand new and completely developed in-house codec with our Teams users in the coming months.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Teams Calling</FONT> </STRONG><BR /><STRONG>Microsoft 365 Business Voice available in the US on April 1st</STRONG> <BR />Small and medium businesses can now make and receive phone calls from Teams with Microsoft 365 Business Voice. Back in November, Microsoft 365 Business Voice, a cloud-based phone system for small and medium businesses, was launched in the UK and Canada. Starting on April 1st, Business Voice will be available in to purchase in the U.S. Business Voice provides the ability to make and receive calls from any phone number in Microsoft Teams, and is powered by the same robust technology, reliability, and security of our industry leading Enterprise Voice solution. In addition to the enterprise-grade features included in Business Voice, we made it easy for small and medium businesses to buy and setup. Learn more <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/small-and-medium-business-blog/microsoft-365-business-voice-available-in-the-u-s-on-april-1st/ba-p/1231698\" target=\"_self\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><BR />Starting on April 1st, Business Voice will be available to purchase in the U.S. for $20/user/mo. Also, on that date Business Voice with a third-party calling plan will be available in over 70 countries.</P>\n<P><BR /><FONT size=\"5\">Teams Devices</FONT> <BR /><STRONG>RealWear headset for hands-free Teams collaboration</STRONG> <BR /><A href=\"https://www.realwear.com/\" target=\"_self\">RealWear</A>, industry leader in head-mounted, ruggedized solutions is partnering with Microsoft Teams to support digital transformation in manufacturing and other industrial environments. For many Firstline Workers in manufacturing and other industrial environments, keeping their hands free and minimizing distractions are critical factors to their safety and success. This partnership brings together RealWear devices and Microsoft Teams to empower Firstline Workers while keeping their hands free. Teams on RealWear devices will be available later this year. Learn more <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/microsoft-announces-realwear-integration-for-teams/ba-p/1233202\" target=\"_self\">here</A>.&nbsp;</P>\n<P><LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://youtu.be/3BE0Kjw7v50\" align=\"center\" size=\"medium\" width=\"400\" height=\"225\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/3BE0Kjw7v50/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO></P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>Teams Walkie Talkie on the Samsung XCover Pro</STRONG><BR />Now there is no need to carry around a cell phone and a walkie-talkie! Walkie Talkie is a new push to talk experience in Teams that enables clear voice communication over the cloud, turning employee or company-owned smart phones and tablets into a walkie talkie. The Galaxy XCover Pro with Microsoft Teams simplifies and empowers Firstline Workers and their organizations to communicate and collaborate using just one device and one platform.</P>\n<P><BR />The functionality, built natively into Teams, reduces the number of devices employees must carry, and lowers costs for IT. Unlike analog devices with unsecure networks, customers no longer have to worry about crosstalk or eavesdropping from outsiders. And since Walkie Talkie works over Wi-Fi or cellular data, it can be used across geographic locations. The capability will be available in the Teams mobile app and integrate with the newly unveiled Samsung Galaxy XCover Pro, a device built for workers on the front lines of any industry.</P>\n<P><BR />The XCover Pro will be available through Microsoft retail stores starting in mid-April, and Walkie Talkie in Teams will be available starting July. However, you can buy the phone and use the existing Teams functionality before Walkie Talkie functionality is available.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"walkie talkie.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177884i70DF90F75905C277/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"walkie talkie.png\" alt=\"walkie talkie.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Introducing Bose headsets for Teams</STRONG> <BR />We are thrilled to <STRONG>welcome Bose</STRONG> to our Teams device category. As a well known and loved consumer headphone, customers can expect that sleek stylish design. The Bose Noise Cancellation 700 UC (NC700) will be Teams certified and available for purchase later this Spring.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"bose1.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177887i520A1314CDEE6672/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"bose1.png\" alt=\"bose1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Teams collaborations bars let you transform your small spaces into collaborative workspaces!</STRONG> <BR />Collaboration bars allow you to turn your focus rooms or smaller conference areas into high-quality, collaborative meeting spaces! These affordable, simple to install and easy to manage video conferencing solutions attach to displays, TVs or touchscreens to deliver high-quality, collaborative video meetings. Using one-touch or proximity join, users can seamlessly join meetings to share content and engage in whiteboarding sessions – all while experiencing clear, high-quality audio and video.</P>\n<P><BR />The VC210 from Yealink is <A href=\"https://products.office.com/en-us/microsoft-teams/across-devices/devices/product?deviceid=430\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">now available for purchase</A>, and the Poly Studio X Series will be coming soon.</P>\n<P><BR />To learn more about collaboration bars for Microsoft Teams read our blog <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/collaboration-bar-for-microsoft-teams-now-available/ba-p/1231706\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>!</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"yealink and poly.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177899i7BE09C54338A6F0A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"yealink and poly.png\" alt=\"yealink and poly.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New Teams phones from Poly</STRONG> <BR />Meet the Poly CCX Series, a range of native Teams phones to help users to transform the way they communicate. The series offers a range models to choose from, starting with the CCX400 and up to the CCX600. You can personalize yours with a headset that suits your style or use the traditional handset. The Poly CCX series is available today.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"poly1.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177900i641E6BFBCCC0F835/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"poly1.png\" alt=\"poly1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>Device management experience in Teams admin center</STRONG> <BR />Today, administrators have the ability to manage certified Microsoft Teams phones from the Microsoft Teams admin center. Coming soon, we will extend this support for Microsoft Teams room devices and collaboration bars. This will empower admins to perform key actions such as update settings, restart devices, gather logs, review device call quality data, and more.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Teams for Firstline Workers</STRONG></FONT><BR /><STRONG>Get ahold of the right on-shift employees using targeted communications&nbsp;</STRONG><BR />Currently, with Targeted Communications in Teams, you can create tags to organize users manually based on attributes such as role or location. You can message everyone assigned to a tag in new chat or bring attention to a channel post by @mentioning the tag name. And coming soon, Teams takes the guess work out of knowing who is on-shift when needing to communicate as messages can be targeted to recipients based on their role and the shifts they are working. Users are automatically assigned to tags matching their schedule in the Shifts app in Teams, which allows for integration with major workforce management systems, including AMiON, JDA, and Kronos.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"targeted comms.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177902i53DD17D5A95F0B19/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"targeted comms.png\" alt=\"targeted comms.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Workforce management integrations and Teams</STRONG><BR />Integrate Kronos Workforce Central v.8.1 with Shifts for the following scenarios: viewing schedule, publishing and requesting open shifts, swapping shifts, requesting time off and offering shifts. Check out the technical documentation <A href=\"https://aka.ms/TeamsShiftsConnectors\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A> and the code on GitHub <A href=\"https://aka.ms/KronosShiftsConnector\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>New Capabilities in Shifts</STRONG> <BR />Teams has made major upgrades to the Shifts experience for firstline managers and firstline workers. By freeing up time, managers and team members can spend more with customers instead of being administrators.</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>Schedule filtering</STRONG> gives users the option to filter by team members or schedule groups, making it easier to manage large shift schedules.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"shifts filter.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177904i9F77460CCA9C8160/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"shifts filter.png\" alt=\"shifts filter.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Recall shared schedule</STRONG> allows managers to recall single or multiple days of a shared schedule, in order to make any necessary changes.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"recall schedule.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177905i25413C5DC4CE8CC2/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"recall schedule.png\" alt=\"recall schedule.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The <STRONG>\"Your shifts\" view</STRONG> makes it possible for team members to quickly access their shift information without needing to scroll through the entire team schedule. . This will be the new default landing page for Shifts on the web and desktop for team members only. (The default Shifts view for managers will not change)</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"your shifts.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177906iD8995C0AF872EFA5/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"your shifts.png\" alt=\"your shifts.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>And for team members using Android devices, they can easily send a chat to their coworkers who are also working at the same time from the Shifts app.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"shifts mobile.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177908i913045CEB7B2D599/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"shifts mobile.png\" alt=\"shifts mobile.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>In addition to the “…”drop down menu in the Shifts app, <STRONG>content to help end users navigate the Shifts experience</STRONG> is also available under popular topics in the Help section, titled <STRONG>‘All about Shifts’</STRONG>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Updates to Microsoft 365 Licensing for Firstline Workers&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P>We are introducing a new Firstline Worker SKU that has been designed to meet the core productivity needs and extend security and identity value to all workers. Learn more <A href=\"https://aka.ms/M365-FLW\" target=\"_self\">here</A>.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Teams Chat &amp; Collaboration</STRONG></FONT> <BR /><STRONG>Pop out Teams chats into multiple windows</STRONG> <BR />We all have those days when you have several conversations you are participating in simultaneously. Now you will be able to pop out individual Teams chat conversations into a separate window, to help you streamline your workflow and more easily move between ongoing conversations.</P>\n<DIV class=\"lia-attachment-file-details\">\n<DIV class=\"lia-attachment-file-size\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"popoutchat.gif\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/178028i32F766C190A1ACBA/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"popoutchat.gif\" alt=\"popoutchat.gif\" /></span>\n<P> </P>\n</DIV>\n</DIV>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>Access Teams even without an Internet connection</STRONG> <BR />Now you can open and access Teams even when you are on an airplane without Internet access, or on a remote work site with terrible network conditions. Teams is enhancing the user experience for offline (no Internet connection) experiences and for low-bandwidth network environments. We are happy to announce that the first phase of multi-phase rollout is complete. Teams users will now be able to open Teams even when no network is available. You will be able to create and read messages, browse previously viewed channels, and to view calendar summaries. Pinned chats, pinned channels, and recently visited chats and channels will always be available offline.</P>\n<P><BR />Teams is also now optimized to work in a low- or poor-performing network scenarios. For example, users will now be able to send messages even with sub-optimal connectivity. If conditions are too poor to send a message, Teams will notify users of this and then save the message until the user has returned to a functioning network. This functionality is coming to Teams in the next few weeks.</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>Include up to 10,000 users in an individual team </STRONG></P>\n<P>We have raised the upper limit on individual team membership from 5,000 to 10,000 users. We are excited for this increase in team membership to power collaboration and process scenarios especially for large teams and organizations that rely on firstline workers. This limit will start rolling out to customers next month.&nbsp;</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>Group chat with up to 250 people</STRONG> <BR />Sometimes you need to kick off a big project chat with a large group, or organize an ad-hoc discussion with staff at an event, but it is unnecessary to start a new team; perhaps you don’t all work together on a regular basis, or maybe you need a communication channel with a large group of people at an event. Group chats will be able to accommodate up to 250 users! This limit will start rolling out to customers soon.</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>Teams &amp; Skype Consumer chat and calling interoperability</STRONG> <BR />Teams users will soon be able to find and communicate with users on the Skype consumer service, allowing businesses using Teams to engage with customers and colleagues on the iconic communications platform, across all clients including iOS and Android.</P>\n<P><BR />This new interoperability will allow Teams and Skype consumer users to chat and make calls using Voice over IP (VoIP) initiated by either client using an email address (phone number or Skype ID searches are not supported at this time.) For safety and security, Teams users can accept or decline first-time conversations with Skype users, and may block and unblock contacts.</P>\n<P><BR />This highly anticipated feature begins rolling out in Teams by the end of March. Learn more about <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-skype-interop\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Teams and Skype interoperability</A> and how to enable this setting in the Teams admin center.</P>\n<DIV id=\"tinyMceEditorMarissa Salazar_0\" class=\"mceNonEditable lia-copypaste-placeholder\">&nbsp;</DIV>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 01 Apr
