542f03fedb31add.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177905i25413C5DC4CE8CC2/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn12@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-21-987_b24257603682ee92.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177906iD8995C0AF872EFA5/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn79@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-57-16-572_ebba21c743f3accc.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/177908i913045CEB7B2D599/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn43@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-13-248_bff55f77201acf45.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/178028i32F766C190A1ACBA/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn20@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-57-32-878_27a8f132d3d1cdd7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401924},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Yammer ‘Communities’ app now available for Microsoft Teams mobile","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/yammer-communities-app-now-available-for-microsoft-teams-mobile/ba-p/1521884","description":"<P>The landscape of work is evolving, and organizations are continuing to look for ways to keep their employees connected and informed, wherever they are and however they work. In April, Microsoft Teams added a new app called “<A href=\"https://aka.ms/YammerAppforTeams\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Communities</A>” which brings a fully interactive <A href=\"https://aka.ms/NewYammer\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">new Yammer</A> experience directly into the hub for teamwork. Today, at Microsoft Inspire, we announced that the new Communities app is now available for Teams for iOS and Teams for Android.</P>\n<H2><BR />Yammer &amp; Teams, better together</H2>\n<P>Engage your Firstline Workers and deskless employees with <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/5-ways-to-evolve-your-firstline-workforce-for-the-new-normal/ba-p/1524313\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">company-wide announcements and live events</A> that employees can access anywhere. Stay connected to what’s happening in your communities, tap into knowledge across teams and departments, and crowdsource solutions and best practices at the edges of the organization. The new Communities app helps employees share and engage with their coworkers across locations and worksites – right alongside their shifts, chats, and calendar.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/yammer%20communities%20in%20Teams%20app.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<H2>Drive culture and employee experience</H2>\n<P>Resilient organizations require engaged employees at the edges of the organization and need tools to help remote employees and address employee well-being. The Communities integration unlocks new ways to stay connected while using the Teams mobile apps, including</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Sending company-wide announcements </STRONG>and safety alerts that scale to the size of modern enterprises and reach employees across devices. Yammer announcements and featured conversations highlight important news and provide a direct line of communication and discussion with Firstline Workers.<BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"sending company wide announcments.png\" style=\"width: 398px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206481i789074DC820F5114/image-dimensions/398x803?v=1.0\" width=\"398\" height=\"803\" title=\"sending company wide announcments.png\" alt=\"sending company wide announcments.png\" /></span><BR /><BR /></LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Hosting virtual events and townhalls </STRONG>that align the workforce towards a common goal. Leaders can use <A href=\"https://aka.ms/LiveEvents\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">live events</A> to address questions and concerns and invite two-way dialogue and feedback from across the company – ensuring that everyone’s voice is heard.<BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"host virtual events and townhalls.png\" style=\"width: 397px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206482iDECF98362BDCBAB4/image-dimensions/397x712?v=1.0\" width=\"397\" height=\"712\" title=\"host virtual events and townhalls.png\" alt=\"host virtual events and townhalls.png\" /></span><BR /><BR /></LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Sharing knowledge and ideas across communities </STRONG>using community features like polls, question and best answer, and hashtags. Easily contribute ideas, locate expertise, and crowdsource solutions that create breakthrough innovations and move the business forward, no matter where they are in the world or the org chart.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>As Cai, Kjaer, CEO of&nbsp;<A href=\"https://www.swoopanalytics.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Swoop Analytics</A> states, “Together, Teams and Yammer are a formidable ally for business performance, and since most of our daily work is happening within a team, it makes a lot of sense to make Yammer available in the Teams app.”</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>How to get it</H2>\n<P>Starting today, users with the <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2020/04/20/connect-people-across-entire-organization-through-communities-microsoft-teams/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Communities app installed</A> in the Teams web or desktop clients will also see the Communities app in their mobile app. Admins pinning the app for their users will now also see the app appear in mobile.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<H2>What’s next</H2>\n<P>Soon, Communities in Teams will add integrated notifications to the activity bell within Teams and unify the search experience while in the app to make it easy to find the conversations you care about. Stay tuned! Follow the <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/bg-p/MicrosoftTeamsBlog\" target=\"_self\">Microsoft Teams</A> and <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/yammer-blog/bg-p/YammerBlog\" target=\"_self\">Yammer blogs</A> for the latest news and best practices related to teamwork and communities in Microsoft 365.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>- Ethan Li, <BR /><EM>Ethan is a PM for Yammer and the Communities app at Microsoft</EM></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 21 Jul 2020 15:00:00 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"aaaa79186f9a265cc2feeaab3c9b2452","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Ethan Li","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/yammer%20communities%20in%20Teams%20app.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn91@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-45-463_adcf56a8c0c1b00f.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206481i789074DC820F5114/image-dimensions/398x803?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn96@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-03-497_7e0232c9ab95cb7b.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206482iDECF98362BDCBAB4/image-dimensions/397x712?v=1.0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn78@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-58-18-500_44146d7f4f153178.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401918},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"New Meeting and Calling Experience in Microsoft Teams!","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/new-meeting-and-calling-experience-in-microsoft-teams/ba-p/1537581","description":"<P>You may have seen the recent announcement of new meeting features in Teams in <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2020/07/08/reimagining-virtual-collaboration-future-work-learning/ \" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Reimagining virtual collaboration for the future of work and learning</A> (if not, check it out!). Today, we’re pleased to share that we’re making several of these features available to most users of Teams over the next few days.</P>\n<P><BR />We’re gradually rolling the features out. Once you’ve got the build that has the new experience (Teams desktop app only), you’ll have the option to turn it on. Read on to learn how to turn it on, what comes with it, how to use it, and answers to some common questions. Let’s get right to it!</P>\n<P><BR /><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Turn on the new experience</STRONG></FONT><BR />You do this via a checkbox in Teams Settings. Here’s how:</P>\n<OL>\n<LI>Select your profile pic at the top of the Teams app, then <STRONG>Settings &gt; General</STRONG>. (General should be what’s showing when you open <STRONG>Settings</STRONG>, so you probably won’t have to select it.)</LI>\n<LI>Select Turn on new meeting experience.</LI>\n<LI>Restart Teams by doing the following:</LI>\n</OL>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-60px\">a. Right-click or Cmd-click the Teams icon in the Windows task bar or Mac System Tray. <BR />b. Select <STRONG>Quit</STRONG>.<BR />c. Start Teams again like you normally would.</P>\n<P><BR />You might also see a notification that announces the new experience or reminds you to turn it on. Then it’s even easier—in that notification, choose <STRONG>Turn it on now</STRONG> if you’re ready at that point, or <STRONG>Maybe later</STRONG> if you’re in the middle of something.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"1.1.png\" style=\"width: 768px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/207049iF7169DFC1F07F056/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"1.1.png\" alt=\"1.1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>What happens after you’ve turned it on</STRONG></FONT><BR />After turning on the new experience and restarting Teams, the biggest thing you’ll probably notice is that any calls and meetings will pop out into their own window, separate from the main Teams window. Like this:</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"2.1.png\" style=\"width: 985px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/207050i59FA7A953D34A8CC/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"2.1.png\" alt=\"2.1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><EM>If you’re still seeing calls and meetings in the main Teams window after turning the setting on and restarting, go to your profile pic again and select <STRONG>Check for updates</STRONG>. Once that is done, do the same quit and restart procedure per above. That should do the trick.</EM></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><BR /><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>But wait, there’s more</STRONG></FONT><BR />Here are the other new things you’ll see and can try out:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Meeting controls</STRONG> are moved to the top of the meeting screen. They’re docked there so you always have access to them (without jiggling your mouse) and they’re out of the way of the content and video that’s being shared.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"3.1.png\" style=\"width: 978px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/207051i55CE6ED745881D8B/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"3.1.png\" alt=\"3.1.png\" /></span></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Large gallery</STRONG> view lets you see up to 49 video streams at once. This view is available when there are 10 or more attendees who are sharing video. To switch to large gallery, go to <STRONG>More options (…)</STRONG> in the meeting controls <STRONG>&gt; Large gallery</STRONG>.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"4.1.png\" style=\"width: 990px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/207052i5F2EC95318FBF9B4/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"4.1.png\" alt=\"4.1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>Here’s what it looks like—pretty cool to see all those faces!</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"5.1.png\" style=\"width: 996px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/207053i344032E1FF3C2DD5/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"5.1.png\" alt=\"5.1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Together mode</STRONG> lets you feel like you’re in the same shared space with everyone in the meeting. (It might be even more fun than Large gallery.) It’s in the same menu as Large gallery, just below it. Here’s Together mode:</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"6.1.png\" style=\"width: 988px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/207055i78E3FB3AE16F05EE/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"6.1.png\" alt=\"6.1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><EM>Together mode is available when 5 or more participants are sharing video.</EM></P>\n<P><BR />Both Large gallery and Together mode are being rolled out gradually over the next few weeks. If you don’t see them right away, check again later.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Meeting notes</STRONG> are now taken directly on the meeting’s <STRONG>Meeting notes</STRONG> tab in the main Teams window. (This is one of the benefits of having the meeting in a separate window.) To access or take notes from within the meeting window, select <STRONG>More options (…) &gt; Show meeting notes</STRONG> and you’ll see the usual side pane come up. In the pane, there is a <STRONG>Take notes</STRONG> button that brings you to the <STRONG>Meeting notes</STRONG> tab.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"7.png\" style=\"width: 998px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/207056i4B8D7EDCAF132DBC/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"7.png\" alt=\"7.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Focus mode</STRONG> is available when content is being shared. If you’d like to pay close attention to content, without the distraction of seeing video feeds, <STRONG>Focus mode</STRONG> is for you. It’s available in the meeting controls under <STRONG>More options (…) &gt; Focus mode</STRONG>. Give it a whirl!</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Common questions</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Has screen sharing changed? How do I share my screen?</STRONG></LI>\n</UL>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-60px\">No big changes here. In the meeting controls at the top, select <STRONG>Share screen</STRONG>. The screen choices you have will come up from the bottom of the meeting window just like they did before.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"8.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/207057iBB08C5856158F56C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"8.png\" alt=\"8.png\" /></span></P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-60px\">To stop sharing your screen, select <STRONG>Close screen share</STRONG> in the meeting controls. It’s the icon next to the <STRONG>Leave</STRONG> button.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Why are message extensions grayed out? I like to send polls in meeting chat. </STRONG></LI>\n</UL>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-60px\">We’re working on it! For now, if you want to send a poll or use other message extensions in the meeting chat, go back to the main Teams window, select the meeting chat (either via the <STRONG>Calendar</STRONG> or the list in <STRONG>Chat</STRONG>), and do it there.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-60px\">&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>What about InVision Freehand whiteboard? </STRONG></LI>\n</UL>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-60px\">Yup, we’re working on that, too.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-60px\">&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Will live events also open in their own window? </STRONG></LI>\n</UL>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-60px\">No, not yet—that functionality is coming soon.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-60px\">&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Focus mode is nice, but what about Full screen view? </STRONG></LI>\n</UL>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-60px\">We like <STRONG>Full screen</STRONG> view, too! (It’s available currently in meetings that happen in the main Teams window.) We’re working on bringing that to the new experience as well. When we do, you’ll have both <STRONG>Focus mode</STRONG> and <STRONG>Full screen</STRONG> view to choose from.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Is this available for any license type?</STRONG></LI>\n</UL>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-60px\">The new experience isn’t available for Teams for Government or Teams free just yet. But soon.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-60px\">&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Which platforms?</STRONG></LI>\n</UL>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-60px\">The new meeting and calling experience is available for the Teams desktop client on both Windows and Mac. It’s not available for Teams on the web. (If you need to download the desktop client, go <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/microsoft-teams/download-app\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.)</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-60px\">&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>What if I don’t turn the new experience on?</STRONG></LI>\n</UL>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-60px\">We’d love for you to try it out. We’re making it available in this way partly because in the near future, we’ll turn the experience on by default. Eventually, the setting to turn it on and off will go away. At that time, the experience of meetings in separate windows, with the meeting controls at the top, will become the norm. So we want you to have ample time to get familiar with it.</P>\n<P class=\"lia-indent-padding-left-60px\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P>That’s our overview and how-to for this new meeting and calling experience. We hope you’ll try it. Remember to check for updates and restart the Teams client after you turn it on. Enjoy!&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 12 Aug 2020 15:57:09 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/207049iF7169DFC1F07F056/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"80819ce76eeb0ab71fa9ff66a0515477","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn32@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-56-43-743_05a99e292be3f714.webp","destWidth":768,"destHeight":432,"sourceBytes":83930,"destBytes":17694,"author":"Mansoor Malik","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/207049iF7169DFC1F07F056/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn32@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-56-43-743_05a99e292be3f714.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/207050i59FA7A953D34A8CC/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn67@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-19-521_4c65e285e3ac62b3.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/207051i55CE6ED745881D8B/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn32@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-12-384_59fd7a27e67bebc5.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/207052i5F2EC95318FBF9B4/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn28@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-57-25-966_4a63a7e0c3927c28.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/207053i344032E1FF3C2DD5/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn4@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-57-46-948_7adf5268af995c33.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/207055i78E3FB3AE16F05EE/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn16@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-57-14-465_abb57faa269f9274.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/207056i4B8D7EDCAF132DBC/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn60@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-57-19-482_18a2a87c3e12fa74.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/207057iBB08C5856158F56C/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn92@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-57-46-258_3ad57732913b94b1.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401917},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"4 Tips for working from home with Microsoft Teams","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/4-tips-for-working-from-home-with-microsoft-teams/ba-p/1202083","description":"<P><EM><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/user/viewprofilepage/user-id/57460\" target=\"_self\">Lola Jacobsen</A> is a Sr. Technical Writer at Microsoft and our guest blog author today. Thank you!</EM></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>There are many reasons to work remotely and Microsoft Teams is here to help you stay connected with your teammates wherever they are. IT admins, don’t miss <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/MicrosoftTeams/support-remote-work-with-teams\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Support remote workers using Teams which as recently been updated.</A></P>\n<H3>&nbsp;</H3>\n<H3>4 best practices for working from home</H3>\n<OL>\n<LI><STRONG>Make the most of meetings</STRONG>\n<UL>\n<LI>Meetings are about the people in them, not the technology. The most effective meetings have a clear purpose. Use your meeting description to detail what the meeting is for. Learn more about driving great teamwork with our <A href=\"https://aka.ms/ArtofTeamwork\" target=\"_self\">Art of Teamwork</A> materials.</LI>\n<LI>Use chat to share reminders or pre-read documents to your audience before the meeting.</LI>\n<LI><A style=\"font-family: inherit; background-color: #ffffff;\" href=\"https://support.office.com/article/record-a-meeting-in-teams-34dfbe7f-b07d-4a27-b4c6-de62f1348c24\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Record the meeting</A><SPAN style=\"font-family: inherit;\"> if that’s acceptable in your organization.&nbsp;&nbsp;<span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"recordameeting.png\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/174244iC8149E7A9C0C9489/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"recordameeting.png\" alt=\"recordameeting.png\" /></span></SPAN></LI>\n<LI>If you have one of the new <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoftteams/rooms/content-camera\" target=\"_self\">Teams Room System content-capture cameras</A> (“magic whiteboard”), you can use it to bring your physical whiteboard into the meeting.</LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n<LI><STRONG>Be inclusive and </STRONG><STRONG>use your video</STRONG>\n<UL>\n<LI>When you’ve got robust bandwidth, turn on your video Tip: Use <A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/blur-your-background-in-a-teams-meeting-f77a2381-443a-499d-825e-509a140f4780\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">background blur</A> if you don’t want your background to be a distraction. Video really amps up collaboration in meetings (but if you’ve got limited bandwidth, turn off video to maintain high-quality audio). Make sure you know how to <A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/join-a-meeting-in-teams-1613bb53-f3fa-431e-85a9-d6a91e3468c9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">join a meeting in Teams</A><SPAN> before the meeting starts.</SPAN></LI>\n<LI>Practice inclusion – ask everyone for their input. If someone’s audio is too low, or if their device is causing problems, deal with it at the start of the meeting so that person won’t be excluded.</LI>\n<LI>Don’t forget to keep track of your mute button!&nbsp;<img class=\"lia-deferred-image lia-image-emoji\" src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/html/images/emoticons/smile_40x40.gif\" alt=\":smile:\" title=\":smile:\" /></LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n</OL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"meeting.gif\" style=\"width: 400px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/174242i0CD26FB198F97507/image-size/medium?v=1.0&amp;px=400\" title=\"meeting.gif\" alt=\"meeting.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<OL start=\"3\">\n<LI><STRONG>Track notes and action items, share frequently used documents </STRONG>\n<UL>\n<LI>Take notes and share follow-ups in chat. It’s harder to get a casual recap in the hallway when there is no hallway. <A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/add-an-app-to-teams-b2217706-f7ed-4e64-8e96-c413afd02f77\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Use an app</A> like Planner, Asana, or Trello to track tasks.</LI>\n<LI>For something that you usually handle with one meeting and informal, hallway catch-ups, schedule a 15-minute follow-up meeting a few days later. Be sure to include prep work in the meeting invitation.</LI>\n<LI>In channels, <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoftteams/built-in-custom-tabs\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">create tabs</A> for important files, websites, or dashboards so the content is available to everyone on the team.<BR />\n<DIV id=\"tinyMceEditorKaruana Gatimu_1\" class=\"mceNonEditable lia-copypaste-placeholder\">&nbsp;</DIV>\n</LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n</OL>\n<OL start=\"4\">\n<LI><STRONG>Customize your virtual workspace</STRONG>\n<UL>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/hide-mute-or-pin-a-chat-in-teams-9aee02ef-713d-495b-8a73-9762d8e4b066\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Pin your favorite 1:1 or group chats</A> so they always appear on the upper left.</LI>\n<LI>Drag and drop your teams so they are in priority order, and <A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/show-hide-or-pin-a-team-or-channel-in-teams-91a37043-acea-49b0-9dfc-aec37b2e92b8?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">hide</A> teams you don’t work in often.</LI>\n<LI><A href=\"https://support.office.com/article/customize-channel-notifications-in-teams-c72b8c07-37e1-4a0b-82c9-fdfda04f15b2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Manage notifications</A> in your Profile Settings so you’re only getting them when you want to.</LI>\n<LI>Install Teams on your mobile so you can join meetings and collaborate&nbsp; – <A style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\" href=\"https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=2102168\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Android</A>. <EM>Note: If you’re in China, go here to </EM><A style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\" href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/MicrosoftTeams/get-teams-android-in-china\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><EM>Get Teams for Android in China</EM></A><EM>.</EM></LI>\n</UL>\n</LI>\n</OL>\n<P>Whether you’re new to remote work, temporarily working from home, or on an extended leave, Teams is there to help you be productive from anywhere. Learn more in one of our quick online courses or from our help content at <A href=\"https://aka.ms/TeamsHelp\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">https://aka.ms/TeamsHelp</A>. Share your tips below or online with the <A href=\"https://twitter.com/search?q=%23teamstips&amp;src=typed_query\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">#TeamsTips</A> hashtag.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sat, 07 Mar 2020 01:38:20 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/174244iC8149E7A9C0C9489/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400","linkMd5":"99829388b4c54bfac5af8d71699d654d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn8@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-56-43-188_36c459606bb351fb.webp","destWidth":400,"destHeight":350,"sourceBytes":70935,"destBytes":11482,"author":"Karuana Gatimu","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/174244iC8149E7A9C0C9489/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn8@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-56-43-188_36c459606bb351fb.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/html/images/emoticons/smile_40x40.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn72@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-56-42-735_1f78673247d1d8ed.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/174242i0CD26FB198F97507/image-size/medium?v=1.0&px=400":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn8@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-57-59-276_a39bf2c1bf1e7859.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401924},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"5 ways to evolve your Firstline Workforce for the new normal","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/5-ways-to-evolve-your-firstline-workforce-for-the-new-normal/ba-p/1524313","description":"<P>Firstline Workers are, and have always been, the backbone of the world economy. This has become even more obvious in the face of the pandemic. While some Firstline Workers are returning to work as parts of the world reopen, others have been on the job throughout the last several months. They are the essential workers who have kept hospitals up and running, staffed grocery stores’ curbside pick-up, and been out in the field keeping services up and running.</P>\n<P><BR />Take CenturyLink, a global service company whose field technicians use Microsoft Teams, Shifts and the Power Platform to deliver faster customer service on equipment that keeps entire neighborhoods connected to the internet despite COVID-related challenges. Learn more <A href=\"https://aka.ms/CenturyLink_FLW_Teams\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P><LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DreLldDB480\" align=\"center\" size=\"large\" width=\"600\" height=\"338\" uploading=\"false\" thumbnail=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/DreLldDB480/hqdefault.jpg\" external=\"url\"></LI-VIDEO></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>As organizations continue to refocus their operations to support and empower employees while maintaining business continuity, we have been working to create and improve capabilities in <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/microsoft-teams/staff-scheduling-software\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Teams</A> to support their efforts. These capabilities help you to better connect the Firstline Workforce with your corporate offices, digitize manual processes, equip them with the right devices and, accelerate their onboarding, all on a foundation of security that you expect from Microsoft 365.</P>\n<DIV style=\"position: relative; padding-bottom: 56.25%; padding-top: 30px; height: 0; overflow: hidden; min-width: 320px;\"><IFRAME src=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/videoplayer/embed/RE4Cidf?autoplay=false\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%;\" class=\"video-iframe\" your=\"\" video=\"\" title=\"”put\" here=\"\"></IFRAME></DIV>\n<P><BR /><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Connect Firstline teams wherever they are</FONT></STRONG></P>\n<P>Whether working in back-to-back shifts where hand-offs cannot occur in person, connecting with corporate employees or consulting with remote company experts - Microsoft Teams has your Firstline Workers covered.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Walkie Talkie</STRONG>, a push-to-talk experience, enables clear, instant and secure voice communication over the cloud, turning employee- or company-owned Android smartphones and tablets into a walkie-talkie. This native built-in app in Teams reduces the number of devices employees must carry and helps lower costs for IT. Customers who currently use analog radio devices would no longer need to worry about crosstalk or eavesdropping from outsiders nor the limited range of radio as Walkie Talkie works over WIFI or cellular data. And for Firstline teams not yet enabled with a push-to-talk experience, Walkie Talkie in Teams enables instant team communication with pre-configured channels set to have the right conversation with the right people.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/walkie%20talkie%201.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P><FONT size=\"2\">Availability: Walkie Talkie in Teams is now in public preview. It can be installed by using App Setup Policies. Customers interested in deploying Walkie Talkie can get started <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/get-started-with-teams-walkie-talkie-25bdc3d5-bbb2-41b7-89bf-650fae0c8e0c\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</FONT></P>\n<P><BR />As the world applauds Firstline Workers for the jobs they are doing, internal steps to engage, recognize and appreciate employees can go a long way in improving their job satisfaction and promoting a positive work culture. Coming later this summer, <STRONG>customizable Praise badges</STRONG> will open the possibility to promote your company values in celebration of every success and foster greater comradery during a time of disconnect.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Praise Custom badge1.png\" style=\"width: 973px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206463i335C9B3DDFF5094F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Praise Custom badge1.png\" alt=\"Praise Custom badge1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><FONT size=\"2\">Availability: Customizable Praise Badges will be coming later this summer. Praise badges are on-by-default and require administrator action to disable in the Office 365 admin center. Learn more about Praise <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/send-praise-to-people-50f26b47-565f-40fe-8642-5ca2a5ed261e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Digitize manual processes so your workforce can focus on what matters</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Today, managers spend hours creating schedules and manually cross checking every shift to make sure the schedule is conflict-free. Coming later this year, <STRONG>Shifts schedule assistance</STRONG> will alert managers if conflicts occur anywhere in the schedule and they will receive conflict warnings when approving schedule change requests. This alerting saves managers time, makes shift scheduling more efficient and reduces inaccuracies that lead to employees not turning up for their shift.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/Shift_ConflictManagement_complete.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P><FONT size=\"2\">Availability: Shifts schedule assistance will be coming later this summer. Learn more about Shifts <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/expand-teams-across-your-org/shifts/manage-the-shifts-app-for-your-organization-in-teams#:~:text=%20Overview%20of%20Shifts%20%201%20Managers%20create%2C,swap%20or%20offer%20a%20shift%2C%20and...%20More%20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We are also adding <STRONG>Time clock to the Teams web and desktop apps</STRONG> in addition to the existing mobile experience, so employees can clock in and out from whatever device they are using. This provides a hybrid time clock experience so Firstline Workers can start their shift from wherever their work is. And, with the geo-fencing capabilities, organizations can manage where employees can and cannot clock in and out of – to make sure everyone is in the right place.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"2\">Availability: If you already have Time Clock enabled - simply go to the Shifts App in Microsoft Teams and get started! To learn more about Time Clock and how to set it up, go <A href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/clock-in-and-out-with-shifts-ae7b676c-7666-46c7-9f68-85ff54acec8b#:~:text=%20Clock%20in%20and%20out%20with%20Shifts%20,out%20to%20start%20your%20break.%20From...%20More%20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>As the need for corporate offices to better communicate and work with their Firstline Workforce becomes top of mind,&nbsp; <STRONG>Task publishing</STRONG> lets companies create tasks at the corporate level and push those tasks to targeted teams across their Firstline Workforce. For example, leadership for a nationwide retailer can create tasks for the reopening of their stores, send that list to only the affected store locations, and then track progress against the assigned tasks. Store managers can easily assign tasks to individual employees, while Firstline Workers can see a simple prioritized list of those tasks on their personal or company-issued mobile device.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Tasks Publishing.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206412iDCB38CE7B3C39DAB/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Tasks Publishing.png\" alt=\"Tasks Publishing.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><FONT size=\"2\">Availability: If you’re interested in getting the private preview of Tasks Publishing for your organization please fill out this <A href=\"https://aka.ms/teamspublishingpreview?\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">form</A> to nominate your company.</FONT></P>\n<P><BR /><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Equip your team with the right devices</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Through an integration between <STRONG>Teams and RealWear head-mounted devices</STRONG>, field workers can remain 100% hands-free using a voice-controlled user interface while maintaining situational awareness in loud and hazardous environments. Firstline Workers using RealWear HMT-1 and HMT-1Z1 devices can collaborate with a remote expert using video calling in Teams. Users can access chats, remote assist capabilities, and other resources using only voice commands, as well as conduct calls and field operations completely hands-free. By showing what they see in real-time, field workers can accelerate the time to resolve issues and reduce the risk of an expensive downtime.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Realwear 2.png\" style=\"width: 977px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206464i0550D280A37B6D71/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Realwear 2.png\" alt=\"Realwear 2.png\" /></span><BR />Availability: The Teams app for the RealWear HMT-1 series of head-mounted wearable computers is now available in public preview – and can be downloaded directly from the <A href=\"https://www.realwear.com/solutions/microsoft-teams/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">RealWear Foresight app platform</A>.</P>\n<P><BR />Customers have a range of options to choose from for push-to-talk enabled devices that integrate with Teams Walkie Talkie. <STRONG>BlueParrott</STRONG> announced the C300-XT MS and B450-XT MS wireless headsets and <STRONG>Klein Electronics</STRONG> has updated models of Triumph and Valor wired headsets. <STRONG>Samsung</STRONG> announced the <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/p/samsung-galaxy-xcover-pro-unlocked/8q0b05ghh7mf?activetab=pivot%3aoverviewtab\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Galaxy XCover Pro</A>, a rugged push-to-talk ready phone optimized for a variety of industries .</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"device3.png\" style=\"width: 981px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206441i65D504274E0516F4/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"device3.png\" alt=\"Devices from left to right: Klein Valor, Klein Triumph, BlueParrott B450-XT MS, BlueParrott C300-XT MS, Samsung XCover Pro\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Devices from left to right: Klein Valor, Klein Triumph, BlueParrott B450-XT MS, BlueParrott C300-XT MS, Samsung XCover Pro</span></span></P>\n<P><FONT size=\"2\">Availability: For customers interested in deploying Walkie Talkie with a device partner, you can get started by working with launch partners BlueParrott, Samsung, and Klein to select the right devices.</FONT></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Accelerate onboarding so everyone is on the same page, quickly</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<P>Training and onboarding are under heightened pressure amidst COVID-19. Everyone needs to be highly aware of new practices and conditions, and communication to your Firstline Workforce is essential. <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/yammer-communities-app-now-available-for-microsoft-teams-mobile/ba-p/1521884\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Yammer Communities in Teams mobile app</A> helps Firstline teams share knowledge across teams and departments as well as crowdsource solutions and best practices at the edges of the organization. You can also engage your Firstline Workers with company-wide announcements and live events that employees can access anywhere. With Yammer Communities, Firstline teams can stay connected to what is happening in their communities.<BR /><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/yammer%20communities%20in%20Teams%20app.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /><FONT size=\"2\">Availability: Starting today, users with the <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2020/04/20/connect-people-across-entire-organization-through-communities-microsoft-teams/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Communities app</A> installed in the Teams web or desktop clients will also see the Communities app in mobile. Admins pinning the app for their users will now also see the app appear in mobile. For info on how to install the Communities app, go <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/manage-apps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</FONT></P>\n<P><BR /><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Protect your organization while simplifying IT management for Firstline</STRONG></FONT><BR /><STRONG>Firstline Worker</STRONG> and <STRONG>Firstline Manager policy packages</STRONG> provide IT administrators with pre-defined policies and policy settings tailored for their Firstline workforce. This creates a simple, centralized, and consistent way to manage your Firstline workforce, no matter how big.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/MOPO-pkg.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P><FONT size=\"2\">Availability: These new policy packages will be available by default in the IT Admin Center and in PowerShell. Learn more about setting up and customizing the policy packages for Firstline Workforce <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/manage-policy-packages\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</FONT></P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG>Shifts audit logs</STRONG>, delivers IT admins a unified view and ability to search for Shifts activities such as clocking in or out and editing Shifts to ensure smooth compliance operations.</P>\n<P><BR />Availability: Shift Audit Logs is now generally available. To learn more about what Shifts activities are logged and how to get started, please go <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/audit-log-events#shifts-in-teams-activities\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Looking ahead</STRONG></FONT><BR />This is just the next step in our journey to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. We’ll continue to develop and innovate purpose-built Firstline Worker capabilities and experiences in collaboration with our customers, industry leaders and device partners that simplify work, reduce costs and bring people together. Please visit our <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/enterprise/firstline\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">website</A> to learn more about how Microsoft 365 can empower your Firstline Workforce.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 24 Jul 2020 06:12:37 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"23904bee94db054adb1148ac0305affe","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"MicrosoftTeamsTeam","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/walkie%20talkie%201.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn80@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-58-39-413_8022fc26848cc1e2.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206463i335C9B3DDFF5094F/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn31@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-57-08-739_b8ba1dc358fc7416.webp","https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/Shift_ConflictManagement_complete.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn28@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-07-009_36d97fa135145398.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206412iDCB38CE7B3C39DAB/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn83@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-03-358_9e04c95bea3e0e39.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206464i0550D280A37B6D71/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn68@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-05-994_8744d63e63c2e0fb.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206441i65D504274E0516F4/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn92@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-58-21-180_23887c0279b2d55d.webp","https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/yammer%20communities%20in%20Teams%20app.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn91@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-45-463_adcf56a8c0c1b00f.webp","https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/MOPO-pkg.gif":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401918},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Taking Class Attendance on Teams for Education","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/taking-class-attendance-on-teams-for-education/ba-p/1472549","description":"<P>School closures during COVID-19 led to a movement from classroom to online education, utilizing Microsoft Teams for Education as a platform to manage school learning activities. In this situation, teachers needed the capability to take attendance within Teams.</P>\n<P><BR />The Attendance app on Teams for Education allows teachers to <STRONG>take student attendance</STRONG> and <STRONG>generate simple attendance reports</STRONG> to answer frequent class attendance related questions. This app resides within the Teams environment, allowing teachers to manage attendance without needing to move to another tool.</P>\n<P><BR />Built using Power Apps within Teams, the attendance reports are generated using Power Automate. Raw data for attendance is available on SharePoint lists and can be easily surfaced by reporting and data visualization tools such as Power BI.</P>\n<P><BR />This simple-to-use app is available on <A href=\"https://github.com/OfficeDev/microsoft-teams-apps-attendance\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">GitHub</A> and can be extended/customized to meet a school’s changing needs.</P>\n<P><BR />The key features of the app are:</P>\n<OL>\n<LI>Teachers can take and save the attendance of students.</LI>\n<LI>The list of students in a class is auto populated from Office 365 groups.</LI>\n<LI>Teachers can edit attendance for up to 30 days into the past.</LI>\n<LI>Teachers can generate class attendance reports and obtain the percentage of classes that a student has or has not attended.</LI>\n<LI>Teachers can generate student specific attendance reports to get the dates that a student was present or absent for a class.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P><STRONG>Take Attendance tab</STRONG> allows teachers to take student attendance.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"1.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/199384i8C877A67336591B2/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"1.png\" alt=\"1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This screen comprises of three sections:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><U>Input fields</U>: where the teacher selects a class, enters the start and end times, and initiates a class by loading the list of students (automatically pulled through Office 365 groups).</LI>\n<LI><U>Summarized metrics</U>: shows the high-level metrics of the class for ready reference, such as total number of students, number of students present, absent, etc.</LI>\n<LI><U>Student list</U>: where the teacher marks attendance.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>The <STRONG>Historic Attendance</STRONG> tab allows teachers to generate simple attendance reports for a class of student for a desired date range. This helps answer simple questions such as the number of classes or percentage of classes attended by a student, the list of dates that a student was absent for a specific class, etc.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/199385iA75378C5E211656E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"2.png\" alt=\"2.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This screen comprises of three sections:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><U>Input fields</U>: where the teacher selects the class and the desired date range for the report.</LI>\n<LI><U>Summarized metrics</U>: shows the high-level metrics of the class for ready reference, such as total classes held.</LI>\n<LI><U>Report</U>: provides the number of classes where the student was present, absent, late, excused, and the percentage of classes attended by the student, and are exported to OneDrive.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>The steps to install this app are as follows. Detailed step-by-step instructions with screenshots are also available on <A href=\"https://github.com/OfficeDev/microsoft-teams-apps-attendance/wiki/Deployment-guide\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">GitHub</A>.</P>\n<OL>\n<LI>Create a team with staff members and make this group a security enabled group to enable sharing the app to any member added to the staff team.</LI>\n<LI>Create a SharePoint list, which has been automated using Power Automate.</LI>\n<LI>Install Attendance Power Apps and Power Automate zip, and create SharePoint, Office 365 and OneDrive connections.</LI>\n<LI>Add Power App to Teams and get started.</LI>\n</OL>\n<P>The Attendance app uses the following connectors:</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><U>SharePoint</U> to save and read data from a SharePoint list.</LI>\n<LI><U>Power Automate</U> to process student records from the SharePoint list and export the CSV file to OneDrive.</LI>\n<LI><U>Office 365 Groups</U> to read group member list.</LI>\n<LI><U>Office 365 Users</U> to read user profile information.</LI>\n<LI><U>OneDrive</U> to place export file information.</LI>\n</UL>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 18 Jun 2020 15:00:00 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/199384i8C877A67336591B2/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999","linkMd5":"82e00205802b7464c9b93d040de62067","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn24@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-56-42-440_497804f6feba62af.webp","destWidth":999,"destHeight":488,"sourceBytes":117784,"destBytes":23346,"author":"veananth","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/199384i8C877A67336591B2/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn24@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-56-42-440_497804f6feba62af.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/199385iA75378C5E211656E/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn87@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-57-03-222_618f94a0d80a19f2.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401919},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Coordinate crisis communications using Microsoft Teams + Power Platform","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/coordinate-crisis-communications-using-microsoft-teams-power/ba-p/1216715","description":"<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Whenever crises arise, questions inevitably come up about how to most effectively address them.&nbsp; Regardless of geography or industry, a common challenge all organizations face when responding to crises, is determining how best to share real-time information and provide a platform for employees to connect. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Microsoft Teams can help maintain connectivity to aid in that information sharing, even while working remotely.&nbsp; As we recently shared, there are <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/blog/2020/03/05/our-commitment-to-customers-during-covid-19/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">lots of ways to get Teams for free</A> – even if you work for a business that isn’t currently licensed for Teams.</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Additionally to augment Teams' capabilities, we have released a free “Crisis Communication” app built with Microsoft Power Apps for any customer to download, customize, and deploy to their organization.&nbsp; The app can provide users with a single portal to help ensure they are equipped with recommendations from global health authorities, topical world news, the latest information from government officials and experts, and company-specific content including relevant contacts, company news, and links to support channels.&nbsp; Additionally, users can easily share their individual work status (such as working from home or out of the office) with their teams, and even automatically send help requests to a dedicated channel in Teams.&nbsp; <BR /><BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Crisis comms app - home screen3.JPG\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/176105iE531C02BD447D31E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Crisis comms app - home screen3.JPG\" alt=\"Crisis comms app - home screen3.JPG\" /></span></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>The first step in this process is to follow the complete instructions for downloading the Power Apps app, which can be found </STRONG><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powerapps/maker/canvas-apps/sample-crisis-communication-app\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><STRONG>here</STRONG></A>.&nbsp; Video instructions for downloading this app can be found&nbsp; <A href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wykrwf9dZ-Y&amp;feature=youtu.be\" target=\"_self\">here</A>.&nbsp; In addition to existing customers, this app is available to users on the new <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/e1-trial-license\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Office 365 E1 trial</A>.</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Deploying this Crisis Communications app to Teams is a quick and easy way gain broad adoption, centralize discussions, and amplify information across the organization.&nbsp; Teams Admins, as well as end-users, can add this app to Teams, albeit with slightly different steps.&nbsp; Once you have downloaded the app following the written or video instructions linked above, the steps below walk through the process to deploy it to Teams.</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<P><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>1.</STRONG> <STRONG>Download the app from the Power Apps portal</STRONG></FONT></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">On the <A href=\"https://make.powerapps.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Power Apps home screen</A>, the Crisis Communication app will appear under “Your apps”</FONT></LI>\n<LI><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Click the “…” to the right of the app name, then select the “Add to Teams” option </FONT></LI>\n<LI><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">This will download a zip file which can be uploaded to Teams in the next step, so save the file to a location you can remember and easily access</FONT></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/Teams/1- Crisis Comms - Add to Teams.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>2. Add the app to your Teams app store</STRONG></FONT></DIV>\n<UL>\n<LI><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Once the app has been downloaded from your Power Apps portal as a zip file, open Teams and navigate to the app store.&nbsp; </FONT></LI>\n<LI><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Use the “Upload a custom app” function at the bottom-left to upload the zip file you downloaded from Power Apps in the prior step.&nbsp; </FONT></LI>\n</UL>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Teams Admins will be able to upload this for their entire tenant, whereas non-Admin users will be able to upload this file for themselves and their teams.</FONT></DIV>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/Teams/2 - Crisis Comms - upload custom app.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">3a. </FONT></FONT></STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Pin the app to your organization’s Teams app bar (Teams Admins)</STRONG><BR /></FONT>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Teams Admins have a great opportunity to drive awareness and highlight the apps that their organization should be using.&nbsp; As with any app, Teams Admins can use the <A href=\"https://admin.teams.microsoft.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Teams Admin Center</A> to pin this app to the Teams App bar for their entire tenant.</FONT></DIV>\n<UL>\n<LI><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Under “Teams apps”, select “Setup policies”, and choose which policy to update (the “Global” policy, for example).&nbsp; </FONT></LI>\n<LI><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Now select “Add apps” under the “Pinned apps” section, and select the app to pin (based on the name you gave the app in Power Apps).&nbsp; </FONT></LI>\n<LI><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Shortly, all users in this policy will see this app appear on their Teams app bar.<BR /></FONT></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/Teams/3A - Crisis Comms - Admin pinning.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">3b.&nbsp;</FONT></STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Pin the app to your personal Teams app bar (any Teams user)</STRONG><BR />Even if your Teams Admin has not taken steps to add this app to the Teams app bar for your tenant, any user can add this app their personal app bar.&nbsp; </FONT></P>\n<UL>\n<LI><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Simply open the app and once the app icon appears on your app bar, right click the icon and select “pin”.&nbsp; The app icon will remain on your app bar to provide you easy access, even after you navigate away from the app.<BR /></FONT></LI>\n</UL>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/videos/Teams/3B - Crisis Comms - user pinning.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Moving forward</STRONG><BR />The release of this app is the first step in this journey, and we will continue to add more capabilities over the coming days.&nbsp; Please share app feedback and suggestions with the <A href=\"https://powerusers.microsoft.com/t5/Power-Apps-Community/ct-p/PowerApps1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Power Apps Community</A></FONT><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><STRONG>UPDATE (March 19th):</STRONG> The Crisis Communications app has received several updates to address user feedback, and <U><STRONG>now includes a version that is&nbsp;GCC (US Government Cloud) compatible in Power Apps</STRONG></U>.</DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">For more guidance about deploying and using this or other apps that you have built as part of your crisis response, please see the <A href=\"https://aka.ms/PowerAppsTeams_whitepaper\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Teams and Power Apps whitepaper</A>.&nbsp; As the number of smaller meeting spaces continues to grow, our customers need videoconferencing solutions purpose-built for smaller meeting spaces like focus rooms, huddle spaces and conference rooms designed for one to five people. Nevertheless, they don’t want to compromise great meeting experiences. For these scenarios, we are excited to introduce collaboration bars for Microsoft Teams.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><IFRAME src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/wZvUSkXfVCo\" width=\"950\" height=\"475\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" allow=\"accelerometer; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\"></IFRAME></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><STRONG>Intuitive meeting experiences</STRONG><BR />Whether in a large boardroom or a small meeting room, employees shouldn't have to re-learn how to join and interact with an online meeting. That’s why Microsoft Teams offers consistent, intuitive meeting experiences across all our shared space devices. Scheduling a room and joining a meeting is simple - just add the room to a meeting invitation using Outlook or the calendar app in Teams. When it’s time to join the meeting, use the familiar <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/introducing-microsoft-teams-rooms-updated/ba-p/323848\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">one-touch or proximity join experience</A> to get started. The native Teams experience for collaboration bars showcases a clean, user-friendly interface that allows users to stay focused on what matters - their meeting!</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"collabbar yealink w.gif\" style=\"width: 800px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/178016i7C25DF13FC72BD3C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"collabbar yealink w.gif\" alt=\"collabbar yealink w.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><STRONG>Optimized for touch</STRONG><BR />Collaboration bars for Microsoft Teams are designed to enable interactive and engaging touch experiences. By attaching the device to a touchscreen display, users can tap the on-screen controls to join and interact with the meeting as well as participate in a collaborative whiteboarding session using the Microsoft Whiteboard app. For those without touchscreens, there are several other dedicated control options available.</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"whiteboard w.gif\" style=\"width: 800px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/178015i82E908F6A1680F32/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"whiteboard w.gif\" alt=\"whiteboard w.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><STRONG>Priced to scale</STRONG><BR />Collaboration bars have fewer cables and require minimal effort to deploy, making them a cost-effective way for organizations to equip more small spaces, while outfitting larger rooms with more robust Microsoft Teams Rooms solutions. With this complimentary approach, our customers can bring the power of Teams to more rooms across their workplaces. <BR /><BR /><STRONG>Simple to deploy and manage</STRONG> <BR />While many videoconferencing solutions are modular, requiring various individual components, collaboration bars are designed with simplicity in mind. This integrated device brings together microphones, speakers, a camera and a native Teams experience to deliver a solution that is easy to deploy and less to manage. These Android-based collaboration bars have fewer cables and can be mounted on a display within minutes. IT Admins can keep track of device inventory and remotely manage collaboration bars using the Teams Admin Center.</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\">&nbsp;</P>\n<P style=\"margin: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"collabar devcie rotation cords.gif\" style=\"width: 800px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/178000i9AD2F23D16B64F64/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"collabar devcie rotation cords.gif\" alt=\"collabar devcie rotation cords.gif\" /></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>Industry-leading hardware partners</STRONG><BR />The first two partners to debut collaboration bars for Microsoft Teams are Poly and Yealink. The Yealink VC210 is <A href=\"https://products.office.com/en-ww/microsoft-teams/across-devices/devices/product?deviceid=430\" target=\"_self\">available for purchase today</A> and we look forward to welcoming the Poly Studio X Series for Microsoft Teams, which will launch later this spring. <BR /><BR /><STRONG>Poly Studio X Series</STRONG></P>\n<P>The Poly Studio X family of collaboration bars deliver world class performance in a small package. The Poly Studio X30 and Poly Studio X50 designed for huddle and small rooms, are radically simple to use with support for Microsoft Teams built right in. Voices are crisp and clear, thanks to a beamforming microphone array and acoustic chamber design. Help meeting attendees feel like they’re in the same room with advanced camera capabilities including, a 4K sensor, 120-degree field-of-view with 4x digital zoom and automatic camera framing. Setup, management, and maintenance are all streamlined, too.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"poly1.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/178001iF868FA16C00A3070/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"poly1.png\" alt=\"poly1.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Yealink VC210</STRONG></P>\n<P>The Yealink VC210, built for huddle spaces and smaller meeting rooms, works with the Yealink speakerphone CP900 to deliver plug-and-play simplicity and premium audio and video quality. The CP900 speakerphone features HD voice and six-microphone beamforming, allowing people on both ends of the meeting to enjoy life-like communication. The VC210’s compact design includes an ultra HD 4K camera with auto-framing and 120-degree diagonal field-of-view to ensure every participant can be seen clearly during the meeting. To manage the meeting, connect an LCD touchscreen to use the on-screen touch controls or a non-touch display and use the Yealink remote control.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span that drive collaboration across the broader team.&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><LI-VIDEO vid=\"https://youtu.be/WkAVgNKn0hs\" align=\"center\" size=\"medium\" width=\"400\" height=\"225\" Gatimu","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401925},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Collaborate visually with Lucidchart and Microsoft Teams","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/collaborate-visually-with-lucidchart-and-microsoft-teams/ba-p/883600","description":"<P><SPAN style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Lucidchart app now supports messaging extensions, link unfurling, and collaborator permissions in Microsoft Teams.&nbsp;&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In today’s workplace, there are numerous applications and digital tools to share, collaborate, and innovate. While these tools are meant to help teams solve complex problems and convey information quickly in a way that comes naturally, they can sometimes create their own barriers. Switching between numerous tabs and continuously logging in to all of your accounts quickly becomes monotonous and time-consuming.&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-weight: 400;\">This is where Lucidchart’s enhancements to its Microsoft Teams app with new platform capabilities can help. Last year, </SPAN><A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Microsoft-Teams-Blog/New-Improve-collaboration-with-visuals-using-Lucidchart-for/ba-p/299180\" target=\"_blank\"><SPAN style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Lucidchart launched an app</SPAN></A><SPAN style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> that made it possible to edit and share documents without ever leaving Teams, making it easy to convey complex ideas and collaborate all in one location.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The latest enhanced capabilities from Lucidchart break down these barriers even further making it easy to grant access and edit documents in Teams. Lucidchart is a visual workspace that combines diagramming, data visualization, and collaboration to accelerate understanding and drive innovation. Users can easily create and collaborate on flowcharts, ERDs, BPMN diagrams, wireframes, mockups, network diagrams, org charts, etc. in real-time.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-weight: 400;\">With these new capabilities, you can easily reference specific documents, preview documents you share and grant appropriate editing access to documents. Check out how each new integration makes innovation effortless with Teams and Lucidchart.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Use Messaging Extension for sharing</STRONG></P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The new Messaging Extension makes it possible to reference, edit, and share documents in Teams. If you are discussing changes to a diagram, you can now share it within the chat conversation and make real-time edits to keep everyone on the same page. Improve clarity across your organization when everyone can see and track changes visually.</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Lucidchart messaging extension.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/134201i47F24A95D5F3CFA1/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Lucidchart messaging extension.png\" alt=\"Lucidchart messaging extension.png\" /></span></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Preview documents with link unfurling&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Now it’s possible to see and preview the document you share in Teams with the new link unfurling integration. When a Lucidchart link is pasted in Microsoft Teams, it unfurls automatically giving you and the person you are collaborating with a preview of the document. Never accidentally share the wrong document again. You now have clarity, knowing you are sharing the right information, and your team members know what they are opening up before clicking the link.&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"Lucidchart link unfurling.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/134203i31DF695EC38CC4A2/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Lucidchart link unfurling.png\" alt=\"Lucidchart link unfurling.png\" /></span></SPAN></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Manage collaborator permissions&nbsp;&nbsp;</STRONG></P>\n<P><STRONG><SPAN style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Using this new feature in the tab integration allows you to give the right permissions to the right people. Set collaborator permissions for different documents determining whether channel members can view only, comment, or edit the documents. Maintain consistency and clarity by managing individuals' access. </SPAN></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><SPAN style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Lucidchart collaborator access.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/134204i6D0A098A866E2F3F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Lucidchart collaborator access.png\" alt=\"Lucidchart collaborator access.png\" /></span></SPAN></STRONG></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>How to get started</STRONG></P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-weight: 400;\">If you haven’t already, install Lucidchart from </SPAN><A href=\"https://appsource.microsoft.com/en-us/product/office/WA104381935?src=Lucidchart=Overview\" target=\"_blank\"><SPAN style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Microsoft AppSource </SPAN></A><SPAN style=\"font-weight: 400;\">and connect your Lucidchart account to start diagramming as a team.&nbsp;</SPAN></P>\n<P><STRONG><SPAN style=\"font-weight: 400;\">&nbsp;</SPAN></STRONG></P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Don’t forget—Lucidchart integrates with popular Microsoft applications, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Make your documents, spreadsheets, and presentations more clear and engaging with visuals.</SPAN></P>\n<P><STRONG><SPAN style=\"font-weight: 400;\">&nbsp;</SPAN></STRONG></P>\n<P><SPAN style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Begin communicating visually with Lucidchart.</SPAN></P>\n<P><A href=\"https://appsource.microsoft.com/en-us/product/office/WA104381935?src=Lucidchart=Overview\" target=\"_blank\"><SPAN style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Install the Lucidchart app for Microsoft Teams today.</SPAN></A></P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 30 Sep 2019 21:07:05
