07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"What’s New for Calling in Microsoft Teams (Ignite 2019 Edition)","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/what-s-new-for-calling-in-microsoft-teams-ignite-2019-edition/ba-p/974935","description":"<P>It has been a great year for calling in Teams. It started with the conference at Enterprise Connect and recently Gartner noting that Microsoft is a Leader in the <A href=\"https://www.gartner.com/doc/reprints?id=1-1OF9RXYC&amp;ct=190826&amp;st=sb\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Magic Quadrant for Worldwide UCaaS</A>. We are excited to close out 2019 with new user experiences for Microsoft Teams Phone System, Powerful admin configuration options for Direct Routing, and expanding partnerships to build new capabilities on the Teams calling platform. It’s a great time to use calling in Teams. Please read on to learn about the additional value across Phone System, Direct Routing, and new Partner integrations.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\">Enhanced Calling experiences</FONT><BR />We are excited to announce that a special <STRONG>15% discount for Phone System</STRONG> will be available early next year for volume licensing customers with Software Assurance who are upgrading from Skype for Business Server to Teams and Phone System during their agreement renewal. It is the right time to begin your cloud collaboration journey. <BR /><BR />When emergency services are needed, every minute counts. <STRONG>Dynamic Emergency Calling</STRONG> enables the sharing of a user’s current location, emergency calls to be routed, and help dispatched. Available now in Calling Plans and support for Direct Routing is planned before the end of the year.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Knowing who is calling and having your delegates properly screen and route these calls is key to a productive day. Recently we made available <STRONG>Reverse Number Lookup</STRONG> to display a caller’s name based on multiple sources. This includes caller ID in history and voicemail ensuring you always know who has called. We are also <STRONG>Enhancing Delegation</STRONG>. Delegates now have further control over call settings for those whose calls they manage. They can add additional delegates or even change call forwarding settings. These 2 enhancements will ensure that the right calls reach you at the right time.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Callers on hold appreciate knowing if they are still connected. <STRONG>Music on Hold</STRONG> helps by playing music for your outside callers while they wait.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>United States Government agencies such as the Department of Defense have very stringent security needs for cloud software. Microsoft has been working to meet these high standards – and we are announcing <STRONG>Phone System</STRONG> is now available for our <STRONG>Government Community Cloud (High)</STRONG> customers and the <STRONG>Department of Defense</STRONG>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Auto Attendant and Call Queues</STRONG> has many new enhancements including extension dialing support from Auto Attendant, shared voicemail, call analytics, longest-idle Call Queue routing, add and order Individual agents to a Call Queue, and improvements to call answering latency. This builds on the previously released improvements such as Hybrid Number Support, Multinumber assign, and Round Robin routing options in Call Queue.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>When you need to troubleshoot a call, having quick access to the latest data is key to closing that support ticket. The latest enhancements to <STRONG>Call Quality Dashboard</STRONG> has many new features including near real-time data availability. Call data on average will be available in 30 minutes which is a great improvement from earlier versions.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Phone System administration</STRONG> is now available in the Teams admin center. Calling Plan customers will be able to search, acquire, and assign phone numbers to end-users. Admins will also be able to create and assign emergency addresses for those end-users. Additionally, customers will be able to create / test / manage custom dial plans, configure Dynamic Emergency Calling, and use the improved configuration options for Auto Attendants and Call Queues.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>And all of above features are targeted to be generally available before the end of year.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>This builds upon all of the other great work that has landed earlier this year. Key items include Phone System updates for Government Cloud Customers, Secondary Ringer, Answer from Anywhere, Voicemail settings in the Teams client, Audio Calling in Chrome, Call Park, Group Call Pickup, Shared Line Appearance, and Softbank Calling Plans for Japan.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\">New features in Direct Routing address customer needs</FONT></P>\n<P>Direct Routing continues to grow around the world. We are now seeing usage in over 80 countries. And as it grows, our customers uncover new configuration needs. Take a look at our latest developments and if you are attending Ignite – visit our calling sessions to learn more about these and other developments.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Our largest customers have complex networks and sometimes the default configuration does not match their network needs. Customers can now choose which <STRONG>Microsoft Cloud Media Processor/Relays</STRONG> they will use by default. This will improve performance for those organizations.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Direct Routing allows the routing of calls to 3rd party systems. Occasionally this would generate a “false positive” missed call in Teams. We now can <STRONG>suppress unwanted missed call messages</STRONG> which provides a better experience for calling users. Read more about the feature <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/direct-routing-call-notifications\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>SIP tester</STRONG> - PowerShell scripting is now available to test Session Border Controller (SBC) connections in Microsoft Teams. Get feedback on your configuration right away.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>The <STRONG>Ringback Bot</STRONG> helps with unexpected silence when call setup is delayed. 2 distinctive audio signals are played to the caller. The first indicates that Teams is in the process of establishing the call and the second is played after the call is established.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Direct Routing Usage Reporting</STRONG> allows administrators to see additional calling details. The information can be used for planning, investigation and troubleshooting. These reports can also be exported as an Excel file.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Survivability and Call Quality using SD-WAN</STRONG> is top of mind for customers and we could not agree more. This enables dynamic call rerouting to alternate links if the main connection is not available and also improves calls by routing new calls between links based on quality telemetry. We are working with Oracle now to enable SD-WAN solutions such as these for Phone System and Direct Routing. Expect more news early next year.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\">Partner News at Ignite</FONT><BR />Direct Routing relies on certified session border controllers to enable Microsoft and our partners to ensure a better overall calling experience and streamlined customer support. Today we are excited to announce new partnerships with Cisco, <STRONG>Ericsson</STRONG>, <STRONG>Nokia</STRONG>, and <STRONG>Metaswitch</STRONG> that expand on our base of supported systems from existing partners such as Audiocodes, Oracle, Ribbon, TE-Systems (Anynode), and Thinktel. We encourage customers to reach out to any of our SBC partners to learn more about how they can enhance Direct Routing - deploying calling in Teams has never been easier.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Building on our Direct Routing announcements, Microsoft is also working to ensure that Teams integrates seamlessly with industry leading <STRONG>cloud contact center</STRONG> providers. We’re pleased to see partners announced earlier this year such as Five9, Genesys, and NICE inContact are <STRONG>on track to deliver their solutions for broader availability in early 2020</STRONG>. We’re also excited to share that we are expanding to additional partners as part of our <STRONG>new Certified for Microsoft Teams program for connected contact center solutions</STRONG>. These connected contact center solutions will enable customers to leverage the full power of the partner offering, while making it easy for agents to seamlessly find and consult with subject matter experts who are using Teams. When combined with new experiences leveraging the Teams Platform, customers will benefit from every user in their organization being able to more collaboratively connect with customers and leverage Teams as a hub for internal and external communications.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Earlier this year we announced engagements with ASC, NICE, and Verint as initial providers for compliance recording solutions for Teams calling and meetings. Today, we’re pleased to see those partners <STRONG>on track to deliver their solutions for broader availability in early 2020</STRONG>, and we’re excited to share that we are engaging additional partners as part of our <STRONG>new Certified for Microsoft Teams program for compliance recording solutions</STRONG>. Certified for Microsoft Teams solutions for compliance recording will provide customers with secure, scalable, and automated recording capabilities for every Teams call and meeting, with flexible provisioning and administrative control.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Many of our enterprise customers are already taking advantage of Teams calling experiences. We will continue delivering innovative capabilities and expanding our partnerships to make Teams Calling a great fit for all customers. It’s the right time for customers to <A href=\"https://aka.ms/SkypeToTeams/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">upgrade</A> from their PBX to gain the benefits of cloud calling as part of their unified Teams experience.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 04 Nov 2019 14:00:01 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"07baded069a584f6acc156bbeeb2f8c1","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Paul Cannon","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401927},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Updated Adoption Assets for Microsoft Teams & Remote Work","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/updated-adoption-assets-for-microsoft-teams-amp-remote-work/ba-p/1236300","description":"<P>Our <A href=\"https://aka.ms/DriveAdoption\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Driving Adoption community</A>&nbsp;here in the Tech Community is focused on supporting organizations and employees who are using all of Office 365, but especially during these unprecedented times, Microsoft Teams.&nbsp; &nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 18 Mar 2020 20:38:14 +0000","feedId":8350,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"437b36492d3b0205fcc09ac6a09751ae","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Karuana Gatimu","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401923},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"10 ways shift workers can use Teams","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/10-ways-shift-workers-can-use-teams/ba-p/1102194","description":"<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Microsoft Teams is the only platform with tailored capabilities to connect everyone in your company, from the C-suite to the firstline, in one digital workspace. Our capabilities are built for your customer support staff, IT help desk, store associates, line workers and more. We have delivered many features that are already available in your tenant today, and coming soon, several new features will provide new ways of communication and collaboration across your entire organization. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">And it’s inspiring to see how industry leaders like are driving higher levels of employee engagement and enhancing the customer experience by putting tools like <A href=\"https://products.office.com/en-us/microsoft-teams/group-chat-software\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Teams</A> into the hands of their Firstline Workforce. IKEA is connecting everyone in the organization with familiar features like chat and video calls and digitizing firstline processes such as shift management to save time and cost.<BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<P><IFRAME src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/Rbvs5vBUcPI\" width=\"960\" height=\"540\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\"></IFRAME></P>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Continue reading to learn about the 10 ways Teams can unlock productivity for your shift workers. Of note, these capabilities will be made available to all Teams users. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">1. Connect everyone in your organization with several options for communication</FONT></STRONG> <BR />Alongside communication features such as chats, video calls and conversations organized by topic (aka channels), <STRONG>Walkie Talkie</STRONG> is a new push-to-talk experience in Teams that enables clear voice communication over the cloud, turning employee or company-owned smart phones and tablets into a walkie talkie. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">This native capability consolidates the devices and apps that Firstline Workers use daily, and reduces the need for purchasing, provisioning and managing costs for IT. Walkie Talkie already works with the teams and users that you’ve already configured, and this feature securely eliminates cross-talk or eaves-dropping from outsiders. And since Walkie Talkie functions over Wi-Fi or cellular, this capability can be used across geographic locations. Lastly, Walkie Talkie will work across all operating systems and will integrate with the newly unveiled Samsung Galaxy XCover Pro, a device built for workers on the front lines of any industry.</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Availability:</STRONG> Walkie Talkie will be available in private preview in Teams in the first half of this year. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"Samsung_XCover_Pro_with_Walkie_Talkie_forNRFBlog.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164778i2EDF7A0C64ED2EED/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"Samsung_XCover_Pro_with_Walkie_Talkie_forNRFBlog.png\" alt=\"Your Firstline Workers will be able to connect with team members across departments and locations with Walkie Talkie.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Your Firstline Workers will be able to connect with team members across departments and locations with Walkie Talkie.</span></span></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">2. Streamline task management for your firstline operations</FONT></STRONG>&nbsp; <BR />With the new Tasks experience in Teams, we are delivering several capabilities that will support new levels of team collaboration. <STRONG>Tasks targeting, publishing and reporting</STRONG> in Teams allows corporate and regional leadership to send task lists targeted to the relevant locations, such as specific retail stores, and track their progress through automatic real-time reports. Managers have tools to easily direct activities within their stores, and Firstline Workers have a simple prioritized list available via their personal or company-issued mobile device showing them exactly what to do next. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><BR /><STRONG>Availability:</STRONG> Tasks targeting, publishing &amp; reporting is coming to Teams in the first half of this year. <BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"tasks2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/165003i0C6510B5EC782674/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"tasks2.png\" alt=\"Corporate headquarters can target, assign and track tasks across locations. Firstline Workers can view tasks assigned to them and across the store via a mobile device.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Corporate headquarters can target, assign and track tasks across locations. Firstline Workers can view tasks assigned to them and across the store via a mobile device.</span></span></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n</DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><STRONG><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><FONT size=\"5\">3. Roll out Teams to your Firstline Workers with the help of new off-shift controls, and identity and access capabilities</FONT> </FONT></STRONG></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">With new <STRONG>Off-Shift Access controls</STRONG>, you can limit employee access to Teams on their personal device outside of working hours. This feature ensures employees are not involuntarily working while not on shift and helps employers comply with labor regulations. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Availability:</STRONG> Off-Shift Access controls will begin rolling out this quarter. <BR /></FONT></DIV>\n</DIV>\n<DIV><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"off shift.png\" style=\"width: 865px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164790i781EA80141D61F09/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"off shift.png\" alt=\"Display a message and/or disable access to Teams app when Firstline Workers are off shift.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Display a message and/or disable access to Teams app when Firstline Workers are off shift.</span></span></DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">With <STRONG>SMS sign-in</STRONG>, Firstline Workers are able to sign in to their Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) account using one-time SMS codes—reducing the need to remember usernames and passwords for all their Microsoft 365 and custom applications. Once enrolled, the user is prompted to enter their phone number, which generates an SMS text with a one-time password. SMS sign-in is a single sign-on (SSO) experience, enabling Firstline Workers to seamlessly access all the apps they are authorized to use. This new sign-in method can be enabled for select groups and configured at the user level in the My Staff portal—helping to reduce the burden on IT.</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Availability:</STRONG> SMS sign-in will be in public preview in the first half of this year. <BR /></FONT></DIV>\n</DIV>\n<DIV><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"sms sign in 2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164835iD9F29525D33A0515/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"sms sign in 2.png\" alt=\"One-time SMS codes on mobile devices to streamline the sign-in experience for Firstline Workers.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">One-time SMS codes on mobile devices to streamline the sign-in experience for Firstline Workers.</span></span></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Many Firstline Workers use a single tablet or mobile device that is shared between shifts. This can pose unique security challenges to the organization when different employees who have access to different types of data use the same device over the course of a day. With <STRONG>shared device sign-out</STRONG>, Firstline Workers will be able to log out of all their Microsoft 365 and custom applications and browser sessions with one click at the end of their shift—preventing their data as well as any access to customer data from being accessible to the next user of that device.</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Availability:</STRONG> Shared device sign-out for Microsoft 365 and custom applications running on Android is coming in public preview later this month.<BR /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"shared device sign out 3.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164846i4E4A9893866FC4CC/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"shared device sign out 3.png\" alt=\"With one click, Firstline Workers can sign out of a shared Android device and log out of all applications and browser sessions to prevent sensitive data being shared with another device user.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">With one click, Firstline Workers can sign out of a shared Android device and log out of all applications and browser sessions to prevent sensitive data being shared with another device user.</span></span></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Delegated user management</STRONG> enables firstline managers to approve password resets via a single customizable portal. IT can enable delegated user management for Firstline Managers, giving them access to a single portal, My Staff, to reduce the burden of identity management on IT and keep employees connected to the apps they need on the job. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Availability:</STRONG> Delegated user management will be in public preview in the first half of the year.<BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"my staff 2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164845i625B48FE8B60D433/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"my staff 2.png\" alt=\"Through the My Staff portal, delegated user management enables a Firstline manager to manage their team’s credentials and assist with password resets.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Through the My Staff portal, delegated user management enables a Firstline manager to manage their team’s credentials and assist with password resets.</span></span></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Inbound provisioning from SAP SuccessFactors to Azure AD</STRONG>—Azure AD’s user provisioning service <A href=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Azure-Active-Directory-Identity/Ring-in-the-New-Year-with-automated-user-provisioning-from-SAP/ba-p/1063603\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">now integrates with SAP SuccessFactors</A>, making it easier than ever to onboard and manage Firstline Workers’ identities at scale, across any application using Azure AD. This feature—in public preview—builds upon the ability to provision users to Azure AD from Workday, another popular human capital management (HCM) system, already generally available. Integrating with these systems of record helps IT to scale Firstline Workers’ onboarding and productivity from day one.</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"inbound provisioning 2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164844i0D2FD97F482451B8/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"inbound provisioning 2.png\" alt=\"Start the provisioning cycle and use the progress bar and provisioning logs to track the provisioning process.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Start the provisioning cycle and use the progress bar and provisioning logs to track the provisioning process.</span></span></DIV>\n</DIV>\n</DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">4. Seamlessly manage shift schedules and time &amp; attendance reporting</FONT></STRONG> <BR />With <STRONG>Shifts</STRONG>, the schedule management tool in Teams, managers can easily plan and create shift schedules, and team members can review schedules and make shift change requests from their mobile devices, all in real time. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">With <STRONG>Time Clock</STRONG> in Teams, Firstline Workers can easily clock in and out of shifts and breaks with the hold of a button. Additionally, managers can geofence a location and use GPS data to validate that a team member is at their worksite. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Availability:</STRONG> Shifts and Time Clock are available in your tenant today. <BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"shift time clock.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164822i73D064C9E57CA252/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"shift time clock.png\" alt=\"Managers can create and distribute schedules to their team and Firstline Workers can easily review their schedules directly from their mobile device. Firstline Workers can clock in and out of shifts and breaks from their mobile device.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Managers can create and distribute schedules to their team and Firstline Workers can easily review their schedules directly from their mobile device. Firstline Workers can clock in and out of shifts and breaks from their mobile device.</span></span></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>5. Customize the Teams experience based on different jobs and roles</STRONG></FONT><BR />Differences between industries means your employees use different devices, apps and modes of communication to get their jobs done. Today, we’ve made it easier for you to create experiences that cater to a specific role. Feel free to build line of business apps with Power Apps and integrate them into Teams to empower your Firstline Workforce. Use Power Automate to speed up workflows to increase productivity. Make Teams the one stop shop for your Firstline Workers to get their jobs done.&nbsp;</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"power automate apps.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164824i66F31E6359DE33CF/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"power automate apps.png\" alt=\"Add your line of business apps (left) and automate business processes with Power Automate (right) in Teams.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Add your line of business apps (left) and automate business processes with Power Automate (right) in Teams.</span></span></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">6. Control what apps are made easily available to your Firstline Workers</FONT></STRONG> <BR />From the Skype &amp; Teams Admin Center, you can apply a pre-packaged Teams experience or choose any configuration and apply it to your Firstline Workers. For example, you could apply a policy that makes your line of business apps, Shifts and Chat experiences available on the navigation bar instead of the standard Teams default modules. Now, with the app set up policies feature, you can simplify the Teams experience to cater to your employees’ needs by role.<BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"flw config and mobile apps.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164990i48EF9BC50826C71A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"flw config and mobile apps.png\" alt=\"Create a configuration policy for your Firstline Workers and customize their navigation bar with the apps they need most (left). Firstline Workers can access the apps they need to do their jobs from the overflow menu (right).\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Create a configuration policy for your Firstline Workers and customize their navigation bar with the apps they need most (left). Firstline Workers can access the apps they need to do their jobs from the overflow menu (right).</span></span></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">7. Have a workforce management system? Integrate it with Teams today.</FONT></STRONG><BR />The <STRONG>Graph API for Shifts</STRONG>, the schedule management tool in Teams, has a set of new APIs that enable organizations to integrate their existing workforce management systems with Teams. Customers using leading 3rd party workforce management systems, such as Kronos and JDA for scheduling, and time &amp; attendance can now start integrating directly with Shifts via Shifts Graph APIs and SDK.&nbsp; </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Availability:</STRONG> The JDA connector for Shifts is open sourced and available on Github <A href=\"https://github.com/OfficeDev/Microsoft-Teams-Shifts-WFM-Connectors/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>. The Kronos connector for Shifts will also be available open sourced on Github later this quarter.</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><BR /><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">8. Celebrate your employees and build community</FONT></STRONG><BR /><STRONG>Praise</STRONG>, the employee engagement tool in Teams, gives managers and employees a simple way to recognize each other, right in the Teams app where the whole team can see it. Taking steps to engage and recognize employees can go a long way to improving their satisfaction, enhancing the customer experience and reducing turnover.</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Availability:</STRONG> Praise is available in your tenant today.<BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"praise1.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164828i8008FF0E282F404E/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"praise1.png\" alt=\"Share badges to celebrate success, increase employee engagement and foster greater comradery.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Share badges to celebrate success, increase employee engagement and foster greater comradery.</span></span></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">9. Mobile features that mimic a ‘consumer app-like’ experience</FONT></STRONG> <BR />Your Firstline Workers are used to consumer apps to communicate with one another and so we’ve built the Teams mobile experience with that in mind. Firstline Workers can leverage mobile features such as a unified chat and channel experience, location sharing and the ability to record and share audio messages to listen to on demand. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Availability:</STRONG> The unified chat and channel view, location sharing and record and share audio are available in your tenant today. <BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"unified chat location share.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164829iA8EF1B1764AB34C8/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"unified chat location share.png\" alt=\"View all conversations in one place with a unified chat and channel view (left). Share your location and record and share audio messages (right).\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">View all conversations in one place with a unified chat and channel view (left). Share your location and record and share audio messages (right).</span></span></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">10. Secure your company’s data</FONT></STRONG> <BR />Teams is built upon Office 365’s enterprise grade security and compliance. In addition to security features such as data loss prevention and multifactor authentication, <STRONG>Smart Camera</STRONG> in Teams has been built to protect your company’s data and ensure that as Firstline Workers start and end employment at your organization, your data is not jeopardized. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">Built with Microsoft's Office Lens functionality, Smart Camera can interpret different image types and utilizes auto crop for easy consumption. Users can also annotate images as needed. And unlike most consumer chat apps, photos taken with Smart Camera are not stored locally on the device. Ensure that your company’s IP and customers data stays secure with features such as Smart Camera in Teams. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Availability:</STRONG> Smart Camera is available in your tenant today.<BR /></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-center\" image-alt=\"smart camera 2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164847iDE141F89293CFDD6/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"smart camera 2.png\" alt=\"Smart Camera images can be annotated and do not get saved locally on the device.\" /><span class=\"lia-inline-image-caption\" onclick=\"event.preventDefault();\">Smart Camera images can be annotated and do not get saved locally on the device.</span></span></DIV>\n<DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">This is just a snippet of the advancements we’ve made, and the team is continuing to expand Teams to meet the needs of all workers. Check out the resources below to help you get started with digital transformation for your firstline workforce. </FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Video: Empowering Firstline Workers with Microsoft Teams</STRONG><BR /><A href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b0R93vbdyfc&amp;t=4s\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Teams updates for Firstline Workers</A></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Videos: Shifts in Teams</STRONG><BR /><A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/what-is-shifts-f8efe6e4-ddb3-4d23-b81b-bb812296b821?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">What is Shifts?</A><BR /><A schedule</A><BR /><A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/manage-a-shifts-schedule-63acda7b-ea39-441a-b1c6-c404a72e79f7?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Manage a Shifts schedule</A></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Support documentation for Firstline Worker capabilities</STRONG><BR /><A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/expand-teams-across-your-org/shifts-for-teams-landing-page\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Shifts for Teams support page</A><BR /><A href=\"https://support.office.com/en-us/article/praise-50f26b47-565f-40fe-8642-5ca2a5ed261e?ui=en-US&amp;rs=en-US&amp;ad=US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Praise support page</A></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Teams template and pilot information</STRONG><BR /><A </A></FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\"><STRONG>Let us know what you think!</STRONG><BR />Try the new features and provide feedback using the feedback link in the lower left corner of Microsoft Teams. If you have suggestions on how to make Teams better, please submit your idea via <A href=\"https://microsoftteams.uservoice.com/forums/555103-public\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">User Voice</A> or vote for existing ideas to help us prioritize the requests. We read every piece of feedback that we receive to make sure that Microsoft Teams meets your needs.</FONT></DIV>\n<DIV>&nbsp;</DIV>\n<DIV><FONT style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\">—<EM>Keara James, product marketing manager Microsoft Teams</EM><BR /></FONT></DIV>\n</DIV>\n</DIV>\n</DIV>\n</DIV>\n</DIV>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Wed, 15 Jan 2020 01:11:03 James","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164778i2EDF7A0C64ED2EED/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn63@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-56-44-426_f5feeaf5226f0c00.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/165003i0C6510B5EC782674/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn40@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-05-112_93058bdc016a35f9.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164790i781EA80141D61F09/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn23@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-57-15-110_39aab42b59e585e5.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164835iD9F29525D33A0515/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn36@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-57-08-499_90b9b4841e306c51.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164846i4E4A9893866FC4CC/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn100@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-57-48-605_e6aed4d26f60640e.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164845i625B48FE8B60D433/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn51@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-19-336_124e93327b07db4c.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164844i0D2FD97F482451B8/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn40@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-57-08-628_24dcaa5271394590.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164822i73D064C9E57CA252/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn76@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-13-990_9a858fe20f3fd806.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164824i66F31E6359DE33CF/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn67@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-57-28-745_f46334c4a27e8175.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164990i48EF9BC50826C71A/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn64@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-57-14-028_cdda173c0b927969.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164828i8008FF0E282F404E/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn59@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-58-02-425_1a0827ead721419c.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164829iA8EF1B1764AB34C8/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn60@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-38-769_3e3ee53d21f4cff4.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/164847iDE141F89293CFDD6/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn19@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-57-07-517_50c1123cba5f1dbf.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401926},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"Extend meeting capabilities with Teams apps","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/extend-meeting-capabilities-with-teams-apps/ba-p/1527812","description":"<P>Today, we’re excited to announce new meetings extensibility points that will enable developers to expand the Teams meeting experience. With this new capability, developers will be able to build apps or integrate their existing ones within the meeting surface and provide a richer collaboration experiences for users across the entire meeting lifecycle – covering events and actions from before, during, and after a meeting. These new extensibility points will be available soon for developer preview over coming weeks.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Empowering developers with new meetings surfaces</STRONG></FONT><BR />Until today, developers could integrate their Teams apps within the constructs of channels, 1:1 chats, and group chats – but not meetings. Now, these new meetings extensibility points provide an opportunity to enable their apps within the scope of a meeting as tabs, in new surface areas like the app panel, through in-meeting app signals for notifications, and access to critical APIs to enable powerful app experiences. Developers will be able to enable these capabilities by configuring their Teams app to be available in meeting scope within their app manifest.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Enabling richer collaboration experiences across the meetings lifecycle</FONT></STRONG><BR />Microsoft Teams is the hub for teamwork and with these new meetings extensibility points, developers will be able to enable richer collaboration experiences across the meetings lifecycle. End users will enjoy an enhanced end-to-end meetings experience as they go from scheduling the meeting to attending the meeting to collaborate with meeting attendees after. Below are a few examples of the possibilities with these extensibilities.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>Before meeting experiences</STRONG><BR />Users will be able to add Teams apps during meeting set up. Through the “roles” API, developers will be able to configure their apps to tailor the experience based on the user’s role/persona (e.g., presenter, attendee, guest, anonymous).</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"before meeting experiences.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206467i328152010BF75156/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"before meeting experiences.png\" alt=\"before meeting experiences.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>During meeting experiences</STRONG><BR />Developers will be able to design how their Teams app uses the app panel (right pane) within a meeting. They can build experiences integrating tools such as adaptive cards, HTML, and other platform capabilities to create an engaging surface for users to interact with. Again, developers can configure how their apps will behave based on the specific roles/personas in the meeting. The apps themselves will be visible from the meeting tool bar to host tabs.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"during meeting experiences.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206468iB60DDCD98FB3B58A/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"during meeting experiences.png\" alt=\"during meeting experiences.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Another capability that developers will be able to take advantage of are through in-meeting notifications (content bubbles), where the app will be able to surface important content to the users based on their role/persona.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"during meeting experiences2.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206469iBEEBEC0E321BCCBD/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"during meeting experiences2.png\" alt=\"during meeting experiences2.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG>After meeting experience</STRONG><BR />The benefit of these new meetings extensibility points is that, like today, end users will have benefit of having their apps persist within this meetings surface to continue to use and draw back upon for further collaboration.</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"after meeting experiences.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206470iC4A5DB8DFEB5444F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"after meeting experiences.png\" alt=\"after meeting experiences.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Consistent level of administrative controls and management</STRONG></FONT><BR />While these new extensibility points provide new sets of capabilities for developers, IT administrators can remain confident and leverage their existing toolset to manage Teams apps that integrate in meetings. They’ll continue to have the same controls, tools, and policies to ensure enterprise grade security, manageability, and trust.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>Unlocking meetings scenarios together with our Partners</STRONG></FONT><BR />Meetings extensibility has been a highly requested from both our customers and partners for good reason. There are numerous scenarios across lines of business, industries, and competencies where these extensibility points will unlock opportunities to enhance collaboration and productivity. We’re excited to announce that several of our key partners, including Polly, Open Agora, Miro, iCIMS, and HireVue are integrating these new capabilities in their Teams apps at the time of our anticipated general availability launch later this year – unlocking new scenarios and experiences for Teams users to interact with their apps across the meeting lifecycle.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"polly and open agora.png\" style=\"width: 979px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206472i4841F7D2D5D7AE4C/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"polly and open agora.png\" alt=\"polly and open agora.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>Polly</STRONG> and <STRONG>Open Agora</STRONG> are apps that allow users to create and distribute polls and surveys to gather data easily for real-time insight and analysis. With the new meetings extensibility points, these partners will be able to build more integrated polling/surveying experiences directly within the scope of meetings.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"mirro.png\" style=\"width: 978px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206476i927D61B88704A4AD/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"mirro.png\" alt=\"mirro.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>Miro</STRONG> provides users a virtual whiteboard for visual brainstorming and organization. With the new meetings extensibility points, users will be able to enable these apps across the entire meetings lifecycle for whiteboarding before, during, and after meetings.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"icims and hirevue.png\" style=\"width: 979px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/206477i2034941D5B02050D/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"icims and hirevue.png\" alt=\"icims and hirevue.png\" /></span></P>\n<P><STRONG>iCIMS</STRONG> and <STRONG>HireVue</STRONG> are talent acquisition and interviewing platforms that provide organizations end-to-end recruiting, interviewing, and hiring solutions. With the new meetings extensibility points, users using these Teams apps will be able streamline and enrich the candidate hiring experience, such as entering interview feedback directly while facilitating virtual interviews.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Design, build, and expand new meeting experiences</FONT></STRONG><BR />We are excited to provide our partners and developers these new meeting extensibility points. As we roll out the developer preview over the coming weeks, we invite you to begin integrating your apps with these new extensibility capabilities and we look forward to collecting your feedback to help us improve. General availability is expected later this year.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 21 Jul 2020 15:00:00 devices","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/introducing-new-teams-certified-devices/ba-p/1345703","description":"<P>It has been an interesting and unprecedented time for all, getting to grips on this new way of remote working, socializing, and connecting with our customers. Working with our device partners we continue to bring new <A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/microsoft-teams/across-devices?ms.url=officecomteamsdevices&amp;rtc=1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Teams certified devices</A> to market. Our new range of certified personal devices are aimed to support our customers working remotely. For our meeting room experience, we continue to expand our portfolio of certified room devices to ensure Teams Rooms can scale to meet the needs of any size space.</P>\n<P><BR />As a recap, the <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/SkypeForBusiness/certification/overview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft device Certification Program</A> is designed to offer Microsoft customers confidence that third party devices will provide a compatible, high-quality experience when used with Microsoft Teams.</P>\n<P><BR /><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Certification highlights for headset and speakerphones</FONT></STRONG></P>\n<P>All the headsets listed below deliver the longstanding benefits of certification, such as great audio and integrated call control. We’d like to highlight two additional important benefits offered by many of the devices below:</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Teams button</STRONG> <BR />Available on all Teams certified headsets and speakerphones, you will have deeper integration with Teams from your device. Simply click the button to bring Teams to the forefront of your pc screen, quickly join a meeting that has started, or check your missed calls and voicemail.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Premium microphone for open office</STRONG><BR />Many of the headsets listed below offer a premium microphone optimized for use in an open office. This enhanced requirement for headsets offers the best possible performance for use in noisy environments or open offices where nearby sounds or voices are present.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Today we are pleased to announce a range of new Teams certified devices across our categories.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Teams headsets</FONT></STRONG><BR />One of the most discussed topics currently is “<A href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/microsoft-teams/work-remotely\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">remote working</A>” and how users are having to adjust to the new way of work. One critical need is a reliable and comfortable personal device to use while in calls and meetings. Detailed below are the newest additions to our range of certified peripherals from our device partners.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>EPOS</STRONG> - Part of Demant Group, has announced that its range of wired IMPACT headsets, which were previously certified for Skype for Business, now offer a firmware upgrade to be certified for Microsoft Teams. This upgrade brings richer Teams integration, with the call answer button and LED now acting like a Teams button. Users can now receive alerts and engage with Teams by pressing the button to quickly join meetings or check missed calls.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"epos 3.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187454i65E976DDBA0EB62F/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"epos 3.png\" alt=\"epos 3.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Jabra</STRONG> - introduces Evolve2, the new standard of professional headsets. A dedicated Microsoft Teams button alerts users of notifications and allows them to take quick actions. With a more visible busy light and an advanced digital chipset, concentration and communication is better than ever.</LI>\n</UL>\n<P><span class=\"lia-inline-image-display-wrapper lia-image-align-inline\" image-alt=\"jabra3.png\" style=\"width: 999px;\"><img src=\"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187355i2B3D158F710BD5E4/image-size/large?v=1.0&amp;px=999\" title=\"jabra3.png\" alt=\"jabra3.png\" /></span></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<UL>\n<LI><STRONG>Logitech -</STRONG> Zone Wireless and Zone Wired headsets are designed for busy workspaces and are certified for Microsoft Teams. mmunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187375iB976ECBFE6D76367/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn52@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-57-05-048_8666f28c3961c789.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187377i1E15B5D9FAAFEA30/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn91@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-57-17-196_a5d3befb5a9f15ab.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187378iA5AC630CDB42E10B/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn52@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-57-27-804_b220a1ba3e7e95bc.webp","https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/187379i5E0659983FF9BCC2/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn28@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-57-03-654_830ae17b813785e7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598313401922},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:56:41","title":"One place to manage all your Teams devices","link":"https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/one-place-to-manage-all-your-teams-devices/ba-p/1527766","description":"<P>As more people transition back to the office and others continue to work from home, it’s more important than ever to ensure people have the right tools to stay connected.</P>\n<P><BR />Microsoft offers a broad portfolio of devices, spanning personal and shared spaces, that enable high quality, inclusive calling and meeting experiences as people connect and collaborate no matter their location.</P>\n<P><BR />New Microsoft Teams capabilities we are announcing today will enable customers to <STRONG>manage all their Teams devices, including <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/rooms/rooms-manage\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Teams Rooms</A>, from the Teams Admin Center</STRONG>. These advancements encompass new powerful features, allowing IT admins to simplify, customize, and automate Teams device management. With these new capabilities, not only can admins now rely on Teams Admin Center to view all their Teams devices, they can also perform all of the device management tasks there, in a single location.</P>\n<P><BR />We are empowering admins by surfacing the data and controls that enable proactive device management, automating procedures, consolidating all management settings, configurations, and troubleshooting to help admins manage their devices with greater granularity and efficiency. <BR />These capabilities are starting to roll out to customers now.</P>\n<P><BR />Let us take a closer look at the new features.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Simplifying Teams device setup</FONT> </STRONG><BR />After unboxing the device, plug in the cables, and power it on. Depending on the device and its usage, users will login using either their personal corporate Teams credentials or those assigned to the device as a resource account (click to learn more on <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/rooms/rooms-configure-accounts\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">configuring Meeting Rooms</A>).</P>\n<P><BR />Once the device is signed in, people can start using it right away. Simultaneously, the device is <STRONG>automatically enrolled</STRONG> into Teams Admin Center, so administrators can begin managing it immediately. For IP phones and collaboration bars, this same process enrolls the device into Microsoft Endpoint Manager as well (with the account Intune license).</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Microsoft%20Teams/signintoteams.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><FONT size=\"5\"><STRONG>One place for granular device management</STRONG></FONT><BR /><A href=\"https://admin.teams.microsoft.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Teams Admin Center</A> is the admin’s single portal to manage all their Team devices and ensure they are always up to date and ready for use, admins can use the Teams Admin Center to <STRONG>track and manage their inventory</STRONG> for a scaled management operations.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Admins can organize their view using filters, see device details and current device health status, or view in-depth activity and call quality data, as well as take necessary actions for any device.<BR />They can also take actions like export the entire list for offline analysis, download logs, change device settings, and perform or schedule tasks as restarting a device.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>We’ve also added the ability to <STRONG>automatically update</STRONG> phones and collaboration bars, ensuring software remains up to date. Previously, when Microsoft released a certified update through the Teams Admin Center, administrators would manually push the update to devices deployed in their tenants. To make this even easier, we’ve given admins the option to allow devices to automatically receive and apply updates. You can define how an update is managed for each device individually, by adjusting its auto-update settings in the Teams Admin Center.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/admin1.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>To help admins save time and efficiently roll out a fleet of devices, they can use the Teams Admin Center to perform <STRONG>bulk actions</STRONG> like applying device settings and restarting devices.</P>\n<P><BR />Bulk tasks become more efficient with the new <STRONG>tagging</STRONG> capability, giving admins the option of adding tags to group devices by categories like department, location, or any other grouping context used in their organization. Tagging simplifies device management by granting admins the ability to filter devices by any tag or combination of tags, and complete tasks for multiple devices at once.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/admin2.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Proactively inspect device health</FONT></STRONG><BR />To ensure a meeting will run successfully we want to make sure every device is powered on and available for use. For this purpose, the Teams Admin Center provides device health status. From the device inventory view, admins can easily <STRONG>inspect the health status</STRONG> for any device and filter easily to find the devices that need attention. Additionally, for Teams Rooms, admins can also inspect if any peripheral device, like a camera or display is disconnected, right from within Teams Admin Center. Admins now have the insight they need to take proactive actions so that user productivity is not impacted.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/admin55.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Another key element to ensure a meeting will run successfully is the call quality of the meeting participants’ devices. To help identify call quality issues and resolutions, Admins can now view call quality data for the meeting. From device inventory view, click on any device to see details of the call quality for last 7 days. Admins can also drill into individual meetings where the call quality was poor by going to Activity tab in details page.</P>\n<P><IMG src=\"https://8gportalvhdsf9v440s15hrt.blob.core.windows.net/lithium/Teams/admin4.gif\" border=\"0\" width=\"990\" /></P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P><STRONG><FONT size=\"5\">Secure device management access and delegate administration to partners</FONT></STRONG><BR />Managing devices in Teams Admin Center is designed to be simple and intuitive; however, we understand some of our customers rely on outside support. For those customers, we will enable the ability to securely <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/partner-center/customers-revoke-admin-privileges\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">delegate administration</A> through Partner Center, so that partners can administer and manage the devices on the organization behalf, while ensuring secure authorized device access. Admins can ensure their devices are secure from unauthorized access from the M365 Admin Portal. By using <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/using-admin-roles\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft Teams administrator roles</A>, admins can designate which individuals can manage their Teams devices.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>Today we have already dozens of partners trained to help you manage your devices.</P>\n<P>&nbsp;</P>\n<P>As we continue to advance the device management experience in Teams Admin Center with more capabilities, we aim to continue delivering more proactive device management features, automated procedures, and provisioning options to streamline and optimize admin’s device management experience all in one portal.</P>\n<P><BR />For more information on device management in Teams Admin Center, click <A href=\"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/devices/device-management\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</A>.</P>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 23 Jul 2020
